areadata.credits: Who didn't chip in on Hogwarts?

object.name: portrait of helga hufflepuff
object.desc: A portrait of Helga Hufflepuff hangs on the wall here.

extradesc.desc: The golden frame of the portrait is rusty and grimy, but the picture inside is of good quality. A woman in a large black and yellow dress is sitting inside the canvas; she occasionally waves or wanders away to a neighbouring picture for a while. The picture is large and takes up most of the space from ceiling to floor. The paint is slightly chipped and cracked over the lightly spun canvas, but the portrait is still in a reasonable and presentable condition.

object.name: yellow armchair
object.desc: A comfy, yellow armchair sits here.

extradesc.desc: Soft and cozy, the pale yellow armchair looks perfect for sitting in while you study.

object.name: suit of armour
object.desc: A shining, silver suit of armour stands here.

extradesc.desc: The smoothly polished suit of armour is made of gleaming silver. The suit creaks only slightly when gusts of wind blow by it as students rush to their next class.

object.desc: A hufflepuff banner hangs here.

object.name: ravenclaw banner
object.desc: A ravenclaw banner hangs here.

extradesc.desc: Cool bronze colouring line the Ravenclaw crest as a soft blue scrolling banner crosses the crest. An impressive bronze raven is centered in the middle of the crest with a blue background. Fluttering slightly from the heat of the fireplace, the banner is coloured with deep blue and shiny bronze. The Ravenclaw crest is centered in the middle of the banner.

object.name: slytherin banner
object.desc: A slytherin banner hangs here.

object.name: dusty sofa
object.desc: A dusty sofa is huddled in the corner of the room.

extradesc.desc: The dark red fabric on the sofa is faded and covered in dust and mold. A few rips appear on the worn fabric and a couple of uneven legs make the sofa slightly unsteady.

object.name: rug
object.desc: A thick rug is on the floor in front of the fireplace here.

extradesc.desc: Slightly worn in a few spots, the yellow and black rug is thick and soft.

object.name: wooden bench
object.desc: A wooden bench is placed against the wall.

extradesc.desc: Made of deep red cherry wood, the bench has a slight curve to its back so that it will contour to someone's back. A plush red cushion covers the seat of the bench, making it quite comfortable.

object.name: sulkingsixthyear1
object.desc: Sulking_sixth_year_1

object.name: rusty armour
object.desc: A rusty suit of armour is leaning against the wall.

extradesc.desc: At one time this was probably a well polished suit of armour. Now, rust has eaten away at parts of the armour, leaving gouging holes throughout its metal surface. The slightest movement makes the suit creak loudly.

object.name: witch tapestry
object.desc: A tapestry of a witch is hanging on the wall here.

extradesc.desc: Woven of fine wool the tapestry is of a young witch casting a spell on a glass of milk. Sparks fly from her wand, lightly landing on the rim of the glass. The milk in the glass slowly changes colour to a deep blue and starts bubbling before wading back to a smooth white.

object.name: rock
object.desc: A grey rock is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: Smooth and slightly covered in moss, the rock makes a pretty good seat for a lesson in this classroom.

object.name: a large oak chest
object.desc: A large, oak chest sits here.

extradesc.desc: This chest is emblazoned with the word Confiscated across the top in large bold letters. A complex iron lock adorns the front of it, with small runes etched all over it. A small silver plaque below the lock reads Beware all those who seek to unlawfully retrieve that which was rightfully taken.

This chest is emblazoned across the top with the word 'Confiscated' in large bold letters. A complex, iron lock adorns the front of it with small runes etched all over it. A small, silver plaque below the lock reads: "Beware all those who seek to unlawfully retrieve that which was rightfully taken."

object.name: a large white tree
object.desc: A large, white tree stands here.

object.name: fallen tree
object.desc: A fallen tree is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Slightly rotted, the fallen tree is used by students in the classroom to sit on. A few bugs crawl across the tree and mold is starting to grow on one end.

object.name: tree stump
object.desc: A tree stump is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: Charred and splintered, the tree stump is still used by students as a bench. It seems that a woodpecker has been by recently and has picked the stump clean of bugs and insects.

object.name: tapestry of a unicorn
object.desc: A huge tapestry of a prancing unicorn hangs here.

extradesc.desc: Made of fine threads, this tapestry depicts an elegant, adult, silvery unicorn slowly prancing through a field of wild flowers. Magestic mountains rise up in the distance and a few twittering birds float though a colourful sky. The sun is slowly setting behind the greyish mountains.

object.name: portrait of wizard
object.desc: A portrait of a wizard hangs on the wall.

extradesc.desc: Standing over a bubbling, black cauldron, a young wizard in bright green and blue robes slowly stirs the yellowish contents in the cauldron. Eventually, the young wizard becomes distracted by a young, blond witch in pale pink robes as she slowly struts by him, swinging her hips. The cauldron bubbles over spilling the potion down the front of his robes. His robes turn into a pile of wild flowers as he runs from the portrait. The young witch in the background is doubled-over laughing.

object.name: blue bronze armchair
object.desc: A blue, bronze trimmed armchair sits here.

extradesc.desc: A firm chair firmly covered in heavy duty blue fabric. Bronze rope runs the length of the cushion seams giving the chair a royal touch.

object.name: soft armchair
object.desc: A soft armchair is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: Deep, cobalt blue fabric envelops the the armchair. Bronze-coloured trim lines the armchair, accenting it nicely.

object.name: oak table
object.desc: A long oak table sits here.

extradesc.desc: The long oak benches sit on each side of the table and span the entire length. Many years of use has worn down the glossy finish in all but a few spots.
Parchments and books are littered across this magnificent oak table. A large scorch mark adorns a corner, possibly from a spell gone awry.

object.name: long rectangular mirror
object.desc: A long, rectangular mirror hangs here.

extradesc.desc: The large antique mirror has many chips and scratches from centuries of abuse. A rusty iron frame runs along the border of the mirror. Latin is inscribed along the top edge of the frame with the words, "Nullum exsistat magnum ingenium sine aliqua dementia."

object.name: dippet-painting
object.desc: A large portrait of Armando Dippet hangs here.

object.name: bench
object.desc: A long, wooden bench sits here.

extradesc.desc: The bench looks old but sturdy. Its armrests and legs are made of iron, but the rest of it is made up of shaped wood.

object.name: statue
object.desc: A stone statue of Merlin stands here.

extradesc.desc: Merlin is portrayed in grey-white stone which looks aged and weathered. Swirls of white rock adorn the sides and creep up round the carved figure. A plaque on the base reads, 'Merlin - The Greatest Wizard to Bless our Kind'. Moss sneaks between eroded cracks, but the statue is tall and still looks magnificent.

object.name: bust of wendelin
object.desc: A bust of Wendelin the Weird is here.

extradesc.desc: Wendelin the Weird is portrayed as a distinctly deranged woman. The stone surrounding the bust has been sculpted into the shape of flames, which symbolise her love of burning. A metal plaque, affixed to the base, reads 'Wendelin the Weird; 1754 - 1809'. The stone is grey and aged, although some white patches remain, giving it a rather untidy look. It is, however, a positive asset to the corridor.

object.short: a bust sculpture of wendelin the weird

object.name: crest
object.desc: A large Hogwarts crest is hanging here.

extradesc.desc: The crest is emblazoned with the symbols and colours of the four houses, and enscribed with the legend 'Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry'. The motto underneath reads: "Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus."

object.name: chandelier
object.desc: A large, sparkling chandelier is hanging from the ceiling.

extradesc.desc: Soft lights dance across the large, sparkling chandelier. Hundreds of wax candles lining the chandelier shine light through spinning crystals, as the wax from the candles slowly drip to the floor.

object.name: slytherin table
object.desc: The slytherin table is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: A dark green tablecloth, highlighted with silver, rests on the Slytherin table. Golden dinnerware and flatware line the table. During meals the food is magicked to the table from the kitchen below.

object.name: gryffindor table
object.desc: The gryffindor table is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: Embroidered with gold, a scarlet tablecloth covers the Griffindor table. Golden dinnerware and flatware line the table. During meals the food is magicked to the table from the kitchen below.

object.name: ravenclaw table
object.desc: The ravenclaw table is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: Edged with bronze, the tablecloth on the Ravenclaw table is deep blue. Golden dinnerware and flatware line the table. During meals the food is magicked to the table from the kitchen below.

object.name: hufflepuff table
object.desc: The hufflepuff table is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: A vivid yellow tablecloth, trimmed in black, decorates the Hufflepuff table. Golden dinnerware and flatware line the table. During meals the food is magicked to the table from the kitchen below.

object.name: staff table
object.desc: The staff table is sitting here.

extradesc.desc: Perpendicular to the house tables, the long, staff table stands on a raised platform. A small version of the Hogwarts crest is displayed on the table. Golden dinnerware and flatware line the table. During meals the food is magicked to the table from the kitchen below.

extradesc.desc: Filled with huge red and green apples, pink peaches, red and green grapes, green pears and other succulent fruits, the painting of a bowl of fruit looks very life-like. There is one green pear that seems to stand out more than the others.

extradesc.desc: The face in the painting is clearly attached to an ethereal body within the painting that is less than satisfied with its currently cramped living conditions.

The painting on the wall is near-smothered by paper and grime tacked on by a overzealous potionmaker. In the small crack of the painting that is not obscured is visible a nodescript face, making a ludicrously overdramatized show of gasping for air.

Small pieces of tinted glass in the shape of a twelve point star are inlayed into each of the four corners of the table. A thin shelf of honey coloured wood has the four stars refleted upon it in lovely shades of brilliant red and orange.

object.desc: A gold sofa

object.name: a mirror
object.desc: A gilt framed mirror

extradesc.desc: The mirror is framed by A few thick golden vines that are arranged in a way that they twist and wrap around eachother playfully. The vine stretch and curl until they reach the top of the mirror where they arc upwards leavind a space of wall which is filled by a figure of a dragon with a long tail that curls back in to it's owner and wings which are stretched out as if it is about to fly away.

object.name: a chendelier
object.desc: A chandelier

extradesc.desc: A chandelier dangling from a long silver chain casts an icy glow on the room. Strings of crystal beads connect the 10 pearly white candels which are delicately cupped by glass holders. Every inch of the chandelier is adorned with large crystal drops which turn the light emmiting from the candels into a soft colorful glow.

object.name: a bridge
object.desc: A rickety bridge

extradesc.desc: A rickety old bridge stretches across the pass connecting the rooms to the north and south. Worn and fraying pieces of rope provide hand grips to cling to upon crossing. The mismatched planks of wood covering the bridge are cracked and covered in a thick layer of dirt. There are several pieces of wood that appear to be missing from the bridge, however, slivers of these planks can be found in the chasm below.

room.name: The Entrance Hall
room.desc: The school's massive entrance hall resides beyond the monumental, stone archway that surrounds the imposing, weather-beaten, oak doors. Resplendent with statues, figures, and sculptures, polished suits of armour stand guard around this cavernous room. Inlaid patterns, elegant masonry, and huge pieces of artwork, illuminated by burning torches, are displayed upon the stone walls. Upon the vaulted ceiling, a large chandelier, bedecked with countless candles, lavishes the hall with a healthy glow. The flagstone floor leads to a magnificent, gleaming, white marble stairway, above which is a large crest inscribed with the legend: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The wide steps lead up to the topmost floor and down into the dungeons. A door to the east opens up to a smaller staircase, while an imposing exit to the south leads to the Great Hall. To the north, a corridor leads deeper into the castle and to the west, the stone archway leads outside.

extradesc.desc: Suits of armour and ornately carved statues are placed at intervals around the sides of the hall; in between each is a door.
Ancient and worn, the carvings on the ceiling and walls still look remarkably new.
A large chandelier hangs from the beautifully carved stone ceiling.
Numerous works of art cover the walls, but not enough that the patters of carvings are covered.
The floor is made of marble and polished to a smooth shine.
The grand staircase spirals and winds towards the top of the castle.
Several torches line the walls, casting flickering shadows across the room.
Light fills the room from the candles that sit on the chandelier and the few floating though the air.
Clear and stain-glassed windows allow light from the sun and moon to fill the entrance hall.

The giant, stone arch is dominated by a thick, wooden gate. Multiple iron locks hold the gate in place. The arch looks chipped in a few places where stray spells might have bounced off of it. A couple of scorch marks highlight the wooden gate.

roomecho.desc: Students pour out of the doors and staircase on their way to their next class.
An owl swoops through the hall with a letter, in search of the addressee.
A ghost gently glides down the staircase, only to disappear through a wall on the other side of the hall.
A torch sputters and goes out. Suddenly, it re-ignites itself.
A mighty wind blows against the giant wooden doors, making them creak slightly.
Two tawny owls swoop through an open window.
Pale morning sunlight peeks in through the high windows.
A couple of students, weighed down with books, make their way from the Great Hall to their class.
Smoke pours off a sputtering and dying torch.
Gentle sunlight streams through the windows, creating colourful designs on the floor.

room.name: The Great Hall
room.desc: Four, massive, wooden tables dominate the floor space of the Great Hall. Each is adorned with a table cloth coloured for each of the different houses: Hufflepuff, Gryffindor, Ravenclaw, and Slytherin. At the top of the hall, residing upon a raised platform, sits the High Table where the staff break their bread. Along the four walls, rows of triangular banners display the house colours. The vast, curved ceiling is enchanted to mimic the conditions of the current sky. Stained glass windows filter light into the room, while hundreds of floating, burning candles add to the warmth emanating in this place. The Antechamber is to the east and to the north is the entrance hall.

extradesc.desc: A raised platform holds the staff table, allowing the staff to keep an eye on the students.
Banners from each of the houses line the walls, adding colour to the dull gray stone.
The decorative stone walls are adorn with triangular banners from each of the houses.
The massive, curved ceiling was enchanted long ago to reflect the sky outside.
The coloured glass in the long windows that line the hall fill the room with beautiful dancing colours.
Each houses' table is covered with a fine tablecloth displaying that houses' colours.
Enchanted to float high about the tables, hundreds of candles cast flickering light into the hall.
Four long tables, each decorated with a different house colour, run the length of the table. A fifth table sits perpendicular to the house tables.

roomecho.desc: Students rush about the hall grabbing a bite to eat before their next class.
Coloured light from the windows dance across the room.
A drip of wax falls from one of the candles and lands near a table.
The hundreds of floating candles flicker briefly as a draft slips through a crack in the wall.
There's a flurry of activity as hundreds of various owls swoop into the hall to deliver packages and messages.
The doors of the Great Hall creak open as students enter into the room.
A group of students sit at a nearby table to study for an upcoming exam.

room.name: Antechamber
room.desc: The room is small and gloomy. A thick mist of dust hangs in the air. Breathing is heavy and laborious. The room is lighted poorly by the few scattered torches in wall brackets. A fireplace sits on the wall ahead, but it looks ashen and dead. There is a chill making the place seem even more unwelcoming. A door to the west leads out into the Great Hall.

extradesc.desc: Dry dust drifts through the room, settling on every surface.
A few half-dead torches try to add a bit of warmth and light to the room, but they fail miserably.
Partially rusted wall brackets spaced around the room hold the dying torches.
The rough stone walls exhibit a few old, faded pictures.
The images in the pictures shift slightly in their frames as if they wish they were shown in a different room.
Once a warm, hearty fireplace, it's now dark and dirty.
The gray, stone mantelpiece is chipped and faded from years of wear and tear.
Hard and cold, the hearth of the fireplace has a few chilly ashes scattered across it.

roomecho.desc: More dust settles on the floor. Where is all this dust coming from?
One of the occupants from a picture leaves their frame to socialize with another picture.
A picture's occupant suddenly shows up in their frame looking quite pleased.
A torch flickers and dies. The dark shadows creep further into the room.
A cool draft sneaks through a few cracks in the walls picking up a bit of dust.

room.name: ** Tunnel off the Great Hall
room.desc: Though this lengthy hall has shining suits of armour standing at attention along its walls, it is otherwise warm & toasty. Bright lighting and soft colours lend a feeling of welcome and contentment. The walls are decked with several paintings. The first painting features a pudgy witch in puce robes devouring a ham hock. The second is of an austere, persnickety warlock in robes of the deepest blue dining on a four-course meal. The final painting depicts an effeminate, fastidious wizard who has donned fuchsia robes and is noshing on a piece of luscious fruit. Eastward leads to the Hufflepuff common room. The stairs going upward lead to the ground floor.

extradesc.desc: Still protraits of different types of foods hang on the walls.
Shiny suits of armour stand along the corridor. A few shift slightly.
The cozy benches are perfect for just sitting down for a rest.
The torches along the corridor give the room a warm glow.
Ornate iron brackets hold connect the torches to the wall.
The stairs lead up to the main floor of the castle and appear quite slippery.

roomecho.desc: The torches flicker warmly in the room.
A suit of armour creaks somewhere down the corridor.
Someone from a neighboring portrait visits one of the portraits of food for a bite to eat.
A group of Hufflepuff students head up the stairs for class.
Ambrosial bouquets develop from the east.

room.name: ** Bottom of Dungeon Stairwell
room.desc: Illuminated only by guttering torches, this dark passage is consumed by a foreboding gloom. A cold flagstone floor, encrusted with drying mold, lies underfoot. Thin veins of trickling water meander down the etched stone walls. All the while, an incessant dripping punctuates the groans of rusted chains, suspended and swaying from the chiselled ceiling. There are broad steps leading up to the light and warmth of the main hall and away to the east into the ever darkening dungeons.

extradesc.desc: . These ancient iron chains hang from the ceiling, lazily swaying in a light breeze.

roomecho.desc: A student brushes against the wall and grimaces as mucky water adheres to her robes.
Murky water drips onto the floor.
The chains groan in protest as they sway.

room.name: Stairway Above the Entrance Hall
room.desc: . The polished, marble floors become the steps leading away from the entrance hall. Climbing and curving along either side of the staircase, the bannisters are cut from beautiful, white marble.

roomecho.desc: A portrait of Nicholas Flammel bids a, "Welcome to Hogwarts" to passersby.

room.name: ** ** Still Life Corridor
room.desc: The torches burning in the iron brackets along this long corridor make it quite rosy. Suits of armour attend these flames and a few comfortable benches welcome all. Several still lifes adorn the passageway. These bowls of fruit are bright, pleasing, and definitely appealing. They are almost life-like ... Quite delicious. The Hufflepuff's common room is to the east. To the north is the girls' bathroom.

extradesc.desc: Shiny suits of armour stand along the corridor. A few shift slightly.
The cozy benches are perfect for just sitting down for a rest.
The torches along the corridor give the room a warm glow.
Ornate iron brackets hold connect the torches to the wall.

roomecho.desc: A torch flickers, goes out, then suddenly re-ignites itself. Must be one of those trick torches...
Sweet, fresh aromas of savory foods waft from the east.

room.name: Dim Corridor
room.desc: The dim and dark corridor is comprised of grimy stone. A few torches attempt to flicker a little light, but are barely succeeding. Cob webs are scattered throughout the passage. Still lifes hang upon the walls attempting to offer a little character to the otherwise drab and dreary hall. To the north, a door leads to the Boy's Bathroom. The door to the south leads to the Hufflepuff Common Room. The corridor continues to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: . Filled with tasty food, the portraits seem to almost scream, "Eat me!"
extradesc.keywords: portrait portraits picture pictures still life

roomecho.desc: Sweet aromas drift down the corridor from the west.
A Slytherin wanders down the corridor, obviously lost.
A couple of Hufflepuff students carefully sneak out of their common room.
A couple of hard working students make their way down the hall to their next class.

room.name: The Kitchens
room.desc: The kitchen is vast with vaulted ceilings and spotless, sparkling, silver utensils and copper pots hanging from the stone walls. Four long, wooden tables, mimicking the ones in the Great Hall's above, dominate the room. Along one wall a similar, wooden table sits beneath the High Table and an immense, brick fireplace is located upon the other end. Several massive ovens, powered by fire, are set along another wall. The rest of the wall space houses stone counters and sinks. Spigots furnish fresh water and cause damp air to blanket the room. Upon the flagstone floor sit enormous bronze, copper, and pewter cauldrons of all sizes. Mismatched pieces of crockery, pans, and cutlery are scattered throughout the room or piecemealed across the tables. The pantries are full of delicious sundries. Enormous freezers possess slabs of meat and other savory items. Cupboards display the fine sets china, gold plates and utensils, and silver tea services polished to a high sheen. The exit is through the door to the north.

extradesc.desc: The long wooden tables are positioned in rows, exactly beneath the tables in the Great Hall so the food can be magicked up to the room above.
With enormous, round eyes; long, flapping ears; and wearing whatever bits of clothing they could find, the house-elves bustle around the room preparing food.
A sweet armoma fills the air as succulent food is prepared for the upcoming meal.
Clean dishes are stacked in cabinets while dirty dishes are piled near a large wash bin.
Glittering brass pots and pans are heaped in piles along the stone walls.
The huge, red brick fireplace fills the room with overwelming heat.
Hot, sticky, and heavy, the steam rises to the high ceiling.
Different types of mismatched crockery and utensils seem to fill every available piece of floor space.
The walls are made of stone and clinging with moisture from the steam.
Long, wooden cabinets hang from the walls as a place to store clean dishes.
Soapy water bubbles over the side of the large black wash bin as house-elves clean the dirty dishes
Made of smooth pieces of granite, the floor is piled high with pots, pans, and crockery, making it hard to move through the room.

roomecho.desc: One of the house-elves trips over the misplaced crocker and slides across the floor, scattering other house-elves.
Huge amounts of food are piled on the long tables by busy elves, readying the food to be magicked up to the Great Hall for breakfast.
Different types of food are placed on the long tables as lunch approaches in the Great Hall.
As dinner approaches, the house-elves busy themselves with laying out dishes on the long tables.

room.name: Hufflepuff Common Room
room.desc: Home of the most loyal, industrious students, the Hufflepuff Common Room is as warm and bright as a sunshiny day. Yellow tapers float close to the ceiling spreading a cozy glow across the room. The Caen stone walls are adorned with tapestries of badgers woven in amber, yellow ochre, and gold on ebony backdrops. Plush, buttercup and charcoal-coloured chairs and oak tables are arranged atop the blonde, hardwood floors. By the black marble fireplace, a couple of squashy, honeyed sofas relax upon a thick, sumptuous rug. A notice board resides along one wall and large, bay windows allow a glimpse of the outdoors. The dormitories are to the south and the door to leave the common room is to the north.

extradesc.desc: Yellow and black flags hang from the walls.
Large badgers of yellow and black grace the large banners.
Carved statues of badgers and portraits of various Heads of the House or famous students are displayed on the walls.
Various portraits of some of Hufflepuff's more famous students and Heads of House are hanging from the walls.
Loyal and hardworking, the badger is the mascot for the Hufflepuff house.
Enchanted to show the landscape around Hogwarts and let in light for the plants, the windows are bordered with black.
Warm and cozy, the firplace provides a relaxing atmosphere for the studious students of the house.
Comfy, and yet not too comfy so the students fall asleep, the chairs in the room are great for working and studying.
Piled high with books, parchment, quills, bottles of ink, and various other things, the many tables are an excellent place to do homework.
The soft green plants liven up the room.
Several chairs and tables fill the room so the students can get their work done.
The notice board is full of adds for used books, new clubs starting up, various game tournaments, study groups, and the next Hogsmeade trip.

roomecho.desc: A few students are up late into the night working hard on their school work.
A couple of students get up earlier to get a start on their homework.
The fireplace crackles warmly.
Warm, soft sunlight shines from the enchanted windows.
The various plants grow slightly taller.

room.name: Hall Leading to Dormitories
room.desc: This is a narrow passage leading quickly out to two wide staircases. A thick stone wall intersects them with Hufflepuff pictures and banners plastered to it. The common room is north of here.

extradesc.desc: Two wide staircases lead the the girl's and boy's dormitories.
A narrow stone wall divides the stairs.
Black and yellow pictures and banners decorate stone walls.

roomecho.desc: Several students rush through the staircase to the common room.
A couple of students head to their dormitories and their beds.

room.name: End of the Corridor
room.desc: Lighted by a few scattered torches, the end of the corridor is dark and unused. Not many ever feel the need to venture this far down the corridor, as a result, furniture and decoration are lacking. A single rusted suit of armour has been placed at the very end of the corridor. The corridor continues off to the west, while a storage room is north of here.

extradesc.desc: Old and barely able to stay lit, the torches provide little light.
Bits of rust have started to appear in various places on the suit of armour. Dust has started to collect, dulling the shiny metal.

roomecho.desc: A torch flickers, trying desperately not to die and plunge the room into more darkness.
The suit of armour shifts slightly, creating a loud creaking sound.
A couple of ghosts, deep in conversation, pass through the wall.

room.name: Damp Hallway
room.desc: The hallway is narrow and the walls seem to press in, squashing up the floor. The floor itself looks oddly raised, as if it were built on an incline. The air carries the burden of a cold draft, which sweeps softly through it. The doors of this corridor are stained with something dark and sinister looking. The iron bolts on the doors look like they were rusted several centuries ago. The ground floor Divination classroom is off to the west, while an open courtyard is to the east. The corridor stretches to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: Slick and damp, the walls of this corridor were built close together, funneling any foot traffic from students trying to get to their class.
Seemingly built on a hill, the floor raises slightly to the north.
Made of hard wood, the doors in this part of the hallway look stained, splintered, and burnt. Iron bolts hold the door in place.
Heavy iron bolts cling to the doors, rusted in place by centuries of moisture.

roomecho.desc: A loud dripping noise originating from a line of water sneaking across the dark ceiling, pierces the mottled atmosphere.
A large group of students try to file though the corridor, getting squished together by the narrow walls.
An owl flies through the hall, its wing tips brushing against the walls.
Students pile out of the Divination classroom with a slightly forboding look on their faces.
The rusty suit of armour creeks loudly, startling anyone in the area.
A brave Gryffindor throws himself in front of a little first year to protect him from a stray hex.

room.name: Wet Corridor
room.desc: Murky water collects in the joint between the wall and the floor to form misshapen puddles. There is little light, save a couple of torches near either end of the passage. The air is cold, but soft. Small fragments of dust can be seen floating through the air. Large tapestries cover the walls to try and hold in any warm air. The corridor stretches off to the north and south, while another hall is off the the west. A door to the east opens out into a court yard.

extradesc.desc: Thick, slimy water pools around the base of the walls.
Smooth stones rippling with water make up the walls.
The puddles of murky water are dark and misshapened.
The torches look old and almost burnt out. They are starting to smolder.
Thick dust filters through the beams of light, to stick to every surface.
Smooth and slightly slippery, the floor is shining with puddles of water.

roomecho.desc: Drip, drip. Water drips off the ceiling and walls to form puddles on the floor.
A couple of students walk through the hall, careful to avoid the wet walls.
Light from the torches flicker around the room.
A couple of Ravenclaw students exchange books to read.

room.name: Dry Hallway
room.desc: A mild smell of rust lingers in the air. Cobble stones are spread unevenly and at large intervals over the stone floor. The stone walls are dry, and the bricks of which they are composed are evenly pressed. Grime resides in almost every nook and the passage gives an impression of darkness, despite the slit windows. The hallway continues to the north and south, while another corridor branches off to the east.

extradesc.desc: Made of smooth granite, the cobble stones line the floor and form the walls.
Made of smooth granite, the cobble stones line the floor and form the walls.
Dirt and grime fill the cracks and chips in the stones, walls, and floor.
The narrow windows provide hardly any light into the hall. Darkness seems to have sunk into every object in the corridor.

roomecho.desc: More grime seeps into the cracks in the stones.
The sound of students echo through the hall.
A group of first year girls gaze at a passing Quidditch player, giggling shyly to themselves.
A second year trips over a raised stone in the floor and falls, books sprawling everywhere.
A seventh year Slytherin shoves a couple of third year hufflepuffs into a wall so they could get through the corridor.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: A large, open courtyard is situated in this hollow of the castle's architecture. White flagstones are neatly paved on the ground, and are lightly marked by the daily scuffle of students which rolls over them. They form a neat square in which a finely trimmed lawn resides. Around the edges of the courtyard, flowering bushes rise out of the soil and ivy sneakily climbs the stone walls. A large clock face looks down on everything, and its large pendulum swings back and forth at the foot of it with painstaking precision. Corridors lead off in all directions, and the entrances to them are marked with white stone pillars. There are also corridors and rooms which are contained high within the walls enclosing the courtyard, their windows marking the stone at frequent intervals. Tall, pointed towers loom over the skyline in all directions. One may move along to the north, east, south, west, and north-east.

roomecho.desc: An owl swoops overhead, carrying a letter in its talons and screeching.
A distant and muffled howl just reaches the boundaries of the courtyard as it pierces the night air.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: In the centre of this section of courtyard there is, directly opposite the white pillars leading back into the castle to the south, a small, limestone, birdfeeder. It is a deep basin resting on the outstretched wings of an owl poised as about to take off. The owl's talons form the base of the feeder and do not look as though they have been moved from the white flagstone, on which they stand, for many years. On either side of the exit to the south the flowering bushes border the courtyard with mottled lilac blooms. The courtyard continues to the north, east, west, northeast and northwest, while the passage into the castle is to the south.

roomecho.desc: Some small blackbirds are squawking at each other in the bird feeder.
A student passes into the southern passage and turns east.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: The white flagstones in this section of courtyard show a well-worn path between the southern and eastern entrances into the castle. On either side of these entrances the lilac-flowering plants border the courtyard. On a window ledge, some ways up the eastern wall, a large pile of bird droppings can be seen. Towards the north a large fountain is visible, while to the west there is a bird feeder. There are exits to the south and east that lead back into the castle and north, west and northwest into other areas of the courtyard.

roomecho.desc: A bird alights onto a window ledge and dislodges some droppings. They fall into the flowering bushes.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: Taking up most of the room in this section of courtyard is a monumental fountain. The white flagstone forms a path, between the fountain and the border of shrubs, wide enough for three people to walk side-by-side. The edge of the fountain is wide enough to sit along and in the centre is a fish, resting on its tail, with water pouring up from its mouth. Visible to the southwest is a bird feeder and to the far west is a topiary obelisk. To the north and east are white pillars marking the exits back into the castle. The flagstone courtyard carries on to the south, west and southwest.

roomecho.desc: The water pouring from the fish's mouth in the fountain sputters and gurgles before returning to normal.
A Slytherin boy jumps up onto the edge of the fountain and walks a few steps before leaping off and leaving north.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: Quite a few of the white flagstones in this part of the courtyard are brighter than the others having been replaced in recent years. The north wall is hedged by lilac-flowering shrubbery either side of the exit into the castle, which is marked by two white pillars. The ivy from the surrounding walls has wound its way over the pillars and partly obscures the upper portion of the passageway. To the east, a large fountain is visible, to the south there is a bird feeder and to the west is a topiary obelisk. The flagstone heads off into the castle towards the north, and the courtyard continues to the east, south, west, southeast and southwest.

roomecho.desc: For a split-second a pale face is pressed against a window somewhere near the top of the north wall.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: In the northwest corner of this part of the courtyard there is a very tall topiary obelisk. Each side is roughly a metre wide and it grows straight up, through the flagstone. The surrounding stones are in disarray; almost as though the obelisk pushed right through them. The north and west walls are bordered by the same lilac-flowering bushes that edge along the rest of the courtyard. In the centre of each of those walls are exits that lead off into the castle. Standing tall beside each of these passageways are towering white pillars. Visible to the south is a large clock set against a western wall and to the southeast is an ornate bird feeder. The courtyard lies to the east, south, southeast and west. An entrance to the castle is north.

room.name: A Narrow Staircase
room.desc: The stones which brick the walls are dripping with damp moss clinging between widening cracks. The cracks in the walls allow drafts to sweep through the passage and the stone walls amplify the smallest of noises. Water seeping between the stones slowly slides down the walls to pool at the bottom of the stairs. Trickling water has created a slippery slime that makes it hard to ascend or descend the stairs. To the west is the entrance hall, while the stairs lead downward to the kitchens and the Hufflepuff common room.

extradesc.desc: Slick and moist, the slippery stones are covered in moss.
Moisture drips off the walls to pool on the floor.
Thick and bright green, the moss seems to be living quite happily in the wet stairwell.
Moss and water have forced their way through the cracks in the walls, widening them.
The damp, humid staircase makes it the perfect place for moss and slime to live happily.
Covered with puddles of water, the floor of the staircase can be quite slippery.
Water from the walls drip into pools and puddles.
Chartreuse green slime hangs from every stone, filling every crack, making the passage every slippery.

roomecho.desc: Water drips down the stairwell. Drip. Drip Drip.
Someone slips on the slick floor and slides down the stairs to land at the bottom with a THUMP. Ouch.
More moss squeezes through a crack and tries to brighten up this dark stairwell with a bit more greenness.
Several students in black robes with yellow trim head down the stairs.
Moss pushes at one of the blocks of stone, causing a piece to fall off and tumble down the stairs.

room.name: Humid Corridor
room.desc: A faint light is given off by the torches lining the walls. Moss invades the grooves and cracks in the walls, and curls artistically across the stone ceiling. The air is musty and seems to be heavy from the dampness of the corridor. The pebbles collecting at the sides of the floor are wet, as if picked from a sea bed. The corridor forms a T-junction, with halls leading off to the north, south, and east.

extradesc.desc: The light flickers in blurred reflections from the collected puddles of drops which have fallen from the damp walls.
Green and slightly hairy, the moss has created unique designs across the stones in the walls.
Made of dark, rough stones, the wall is covered in patches of moss.
Smooth, wet pebbles line the floor, making it a bit slick.

roomecho.desc: A distinct rebounding echo tries to find a way out.
Several students rush through the corridor on their way to another class.
Suits of armour creak eerily in the wind.
A small mouse scampers down the hall. Squeak, squeak.
An owl glides through the corridor.

room.name: Smooth Corridor
room.desc: The large grey stones that have been used to build the walls, ceiling and floor in this passage have exceptionally smooth faces. There's not a chipped piece of stone to be seen. The floor is covered with a hall runner of midnight black, bordered by green dragon scales. It starts near the west entrance and disappears in the east. Set low along the southern wall is a long rectangular mirror. It runs the full length of the corridor and has been placed in such a position as to reflect the feet of passers-by. Also along the south wall are four sturdy, simple iron candelabras standing upon the stone floor. To the north is an exit to a courtyard and the corridor continues to the east and west.

room.name: Fat-stoned Corridor
room.desc: The fat grey stones in this part of the castle frame two, pitiful, grimy windows that look over a courtyard to the north. The windows are square and hung on either side of the northern exit. Above them are rectangular air vents covered with rusty iron mesh. Running from east to west, and continuing through the doorways, is a hall runner of the deepest black, edged in vile green dragon scale. The ceiling of the corridor is tall and square and built of the same swollen stones that make up the walls and floor. Four, tall, simple, solid-looking iron candelabras are standing along the southern wall. There is an exit to a courtyard to the north and the corridor continues to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: Shadows briefly pass by the windows
A pair of laughing Hufflepuff students wander through from east to west.
Late afternoon sun filters in through the dirty windows.

room.name: Dirty Corridor
room.desc: There are small cracks in the stones low to the ground in this corridor. While they're not overly large, they are big enough allow in dirt from the outside. There are smallish piles pushed hard up against the walls and some of the dirt has been trampled into the fine hall runner that runs into the passage from the west and finishes shortly before the eastern exit. The runner is dirty black and its border is green dragon skin. Light spills onto the floor from iron candelabras placed upon the floor along the edge of the southern wall. On either side of the exit leading out to a courtyard, in the north, are tall, narrow gaps that are lined with silvery-gauze. The corridor also continues to the east and west.

room.name: Windy Corridor
room.desc: Though there are no physical indicators as to where it originated, a consistent breeze buffed a high sheen upon the stones comprising the floor and walls of the corridor. The few torches set along the breezeway are in a perpetual struggle against the wind: the wind determinedly extinguishing a torch and the flame tenaciously flickering back to life. There are two sqare portals; a begrimed one leading west and a sooty one leading north.

roomecho.desc: A bone-chilling howl emits from a blast of cold wind.

room.name: Dragon Corridor
room.desc: Beginning on the north side of the corridor a fading, Common Welsh Green Dragon is etched along the white walls. His thick, powerful tail creeps toward the south meeting his back feet and torso. His figure, revealing smooth, green skin, stretches along the south exit and commences along the opposite wall. Again at the north end, opposite his tail, his monstrous face is set at a roar. His eyes look as if they once held jewels that had long since been pried out. The entire engraving is lackluster from neglect and is chipped in several places. The dragon's mouth emits etched dull flames across the ceiling which illuminate the room in a strange, red glow. The exits are north at his mouth, south at his back feet, and along his torso to the west.

roomecho.desc: A deafening roar blasts through the corridor.

room.name: Bleak Corridor
room.desc: . The corridor is quite narrow and bleak, though strongly lighted by the number of torches that rest in brackets on the stone walls. A snake-like plant, resembling ivy, creeps up one of the walls and branches out across the ceiling. The sides of the floor are littered with small pieces of stone leaving scars upon the original stone faces. The Courtyard is visible through the few slit-windows along one side. A draft runs through the corridor carrying a distinct yet strangely unidentifyable scent in the air.

room.name: Single-windowed Corridor
room.desc: A chill courses through the length of this corridor and the torches throw shadows across the walls. The floor is strangely damp and moss is creeping across it, as it is on the walls. The air is musty, despite the single window which is letting the fresh air outside into the corridor. Small noises are greatly magnified by the strong echoes.

room.name: A Dark Corridor
room.desc: A gentle current of fresh, clean air flows through the long dim corridor. Cool clean water runs slowly down the moss-laden walls, forming small puddles as it collects on the floor. Away from the puddles, the smooth stone floor is a dark creamy colour, and covered in bits of grit and grime. An intricate pattern of spider webs cover the smooth stone ceiling. A beautiful picture on the wall depicts a phoenix bursting into flames as it is being reborn.

room.name: Marble Carving Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is quite different from most others. The floor, instead of being littered with grit, pebbles, and fallen stone, is clear of debris and very smooth. Similar to the floor, the walls are smooth and are ivory-coloured. On the ceiling resides a marble carving embedded into it which portrays a young wizard using his wand to bewitch a candle.

room.name: Breezeless Passage
room.desc: The air is musty and heated; there is no breeze. Light from several flame torches flickers lazily over the long passageway, picking out shadows made from the grooves and markings upon the stone walls. Moss creeps through some of them, and snakes across the ceiling, branching out widely. There are some slit windows at one side, and a strange looking plant is slyly making its way into one of them.

room.name: Accosting Armour Corridor
room.desc: The dank dreariness of the red sandstone floor and walls seems intensified by the mud between the floor's stones. A couple of torches light the corridor, but they appear to be laboring under the decay in the air. A lone suit of armour, rusty and corroded, stands in the passageway. When a person passes by, this acrimonious armour bellows insults: "That's right, keep walking, just ignore the oxidizing suit of armour." "Hey, jerk, don't you see me decomposing here?" "Must be nice to be able to bend your limbs!" A grimy archway leads west and a moist archway east. The door to the south leads to the Divination Classroom.

extradesc.desc: "What are you looking at?!"

roomecho.desc: 'The armour screams, "Can you spare a can of oil here, or what?"'

room.name: Muttering Monk Corridor
room.desc: The pasageway is well-lighted by a dozen torches clasped in iron brackets shaped as praying hands. A portrait of a monk hangs underneath each bracket. At first glance, the hall seems meticulously cared for. Instead, the brightness of the light tricks the casual observer from noticing the grime in the corners and between each stone comprising the floor and walls. The monks in the portraits continually mutter under their breath, "All this filth, filth I tell you." The monks walk to the other portraits whispering loudly that the muck surrounding them is indicative of the putrefaction of the outside world. The charred exit leads west, the grimy one east, and the slate exit goes to the north.

extradesc.desc: "Defilement! You're a foul, putrescent soul!"

roomecho.desc: 'A monk hollars, "Straighten your clothes, you heathen!"'

room.name: Grey Corridor
room.desc: Grey slate runs the length of the corridor: floor, walls, and ceiling. It resembles a giant chalkboard, which is its purpose. Messages are written with an invisible hand and disappear into the wall for another message to be displayed. "Homework today, play tomorrow." "No running in the hallways." "Did you remember your quills?" "Have a nice day." There is a solid oak pocket door to the east and two slate roundtop archways lead north and south.

extradesc.desc: "Shouldn't you be busy doing something other than staring at me?"

roomecho.desc: The slate board writes, "Hurry along, now."

room.name: A Classroom
room.desc: Polished flagstone lie seemlessly across the length of the room. Wooden desks are lined uniformly in two rows facing front of the room, facing a single wooden desk littered with papers and thick books. Charts and diagrams are posted all over the walls, along with portraits of various witches and wizards.

room.name: Divination Classroom
room.desc: Crisp, green grass springs up all around the floor, cushioning all who walk or sit here. Large trees litter the area, stretching their limbs towards the celestial ceiling. Rocks and stumps are scattered about, providing something for the dweller to sit upon. Earthy aromas linger lazily in the air, tingling the senses. When the lights are on, the ceiling illuminates this space by replicating sunny skies. When the lights are lowered, the heavens grow dark and stars begin to twinkle. The doors to the north and east lead out into the corridors.

extradesc.desc: The floor of the classroom is covered in soft springy moss and clumps of crisp grass.
A dark night sky full of stars stretches out across the ceiling.
Soft, yet crisp green grass grows in clumps on the classroom floor.
Filling in the classroom floor are patches of thick moss.
The leafy branches of the trees fan across the ceiling, so that the room is full of slanting shafts of soft, dappled, green light.

roomecho.desc: A cricket chirps in the corner of the room.
An owl softly hoots.
A bird tweets softly from the trees.
Soft hoof beats seem to be coming from between the trees.
A gentle breeze moves through the classroom, rustling the leaves.

room.name: White Stone Corridor
room.desc: Light is filtering in through slit windows. It pierces the heavy dust and illuminates the dry, aged bricks of the far wall. The ceiling is engraved with many pictures portraying magical scenes of splendour. The whole corridor gleams in fresh white stone, and the floor is marbled in places.

room.name: A Well Lit Corridor
room.desc: A gentle breeze blows in through the large plate glass windows artistically built into the wall. A large clock looms down from overhead, the routine ticking of its large pendulum echoes throughout the corridor. The smooth stone floor is well kept and carefully polished, save a few stray pebbles lingering in the joint where the wall meets the floor. The walls and ceiling are carefully engraved with magical scenes of beauty and splendor. Small burning torches hang from the walls at different intervals. A bonny courtyard can be seen through a stone archway to the east.

room.name: Dripping Corridor
room.desc: A cold draft blows through the corridor, sweeping dust and dirt into an ungraceful dance. Droplets collect on the ceiling, and occasionally they build up and let go to join the growing puddle on the floor. Flickering light from the bright torches dances all around and illuminates the moisture residing in corners and cracks. The air is weighted down with a musty scent, and breathing is difficult. The moss which has crept in is brown and dead, as is most of this corridor.

roomecho.desc: A drop of water splashes to the floor.

room.name: Staff Lounge
room.desc: A flat, white light fills the room, reflecting dully off the dark, panelled walls. A worn, polished, wooden table rests in the centre of the room, covered in bits of old parchment and quills. An odd assortment of dark wooden chairs are scattered throughout the room. An enormous oak desk sits in a corner with neatly stacked supplies upon it. A small fireplace, casting the only illumination in this drab room, is built into the wall opposite the entrance; an enormous cauldron emits a pleasant aroma. A myriad of cloaks hang in an uninviting wardrobe. To the north lies a dark, wooden door.

roomecho.desc: An ember pops in the fireplace.

room.name: Pixie Passageway
room.desc: Along the eastern wall grandiose casement windows exhibit the magnificent courtyard beyond. Each of the four windows has one of the House emblems engraved upon it. The floors and walls are composed of cobalt-blue stones. Shrill, little giggles seem to originate from nowhere. If, however, the ceiling is inspected, the pesky din disturbing an otherwise tranquil chamber is easily ascertained. Etched into the ceiling are the images of dozens of Cornish Pixies. Constantly moving, as if in flight, these pointed-faced creatures snigger at any human beneath them. To the east lies the courtyard. A Moorish archway leads north while the perfectly square opening leads south.

extradesc.desc: Several of the Pixies chatter to one another, pointing at you, and laughing hysterically.

roomecho.desc: Two students stride through the hall. One says, "You know, I never could dance."

room.name: Wizard English Classroom*
room.desc: With wide, clear windows opening up to the courtyard, this classroom shows a delicate dichotomy of light and darkness. The room brightens from the door to the centre of the room, then starts to recede into shadow at the far corners. Near the door, on the East wall, the windows look out into the courtyard. On the far south wall, a large chalkboard stretches the length of the wall. Across from the door on the west wall, three large shelves filled with hundreds of books line the wall. On the northern wall another blackboard stretches across the wall. In front of the wall sits a large wooden desk with a chair. In the classroom proper are rows of desks and chairs for the students. The floor is made of a hard, dark wood. The large wooden door to the east leads out into the courtyard.

extradesc.desc: Looking out the windows provides a wide view of the Hogwart's courtyard.
These large book shelves are made of a hard, light coloured wood. Currently they are covered with books.

This large blackboard fills the entire northern wall. At the top left corner is written in large letters, Wizard Grammar Book 2, and below that is written, Test this week. On the rest of the board is written many derived words such as, WIZARD - Middle English wisard : wise, wise; see wise + -ard, UNICORN - Middle English unicorne, from Old French, from Late Latin unicornis, from Latin, having one horn : unus, one; see oi-no- in Indo-European Roots + cornu, horn, and BASILISK - Middle English, from Old French basilisc, from Latin basiliscus, from Greek basiliskos, diminutive of basileus, king.

This large chalkboard fills the entire southern wall. At the top left corner is written in large letters, " Advanced Wizards English and Terminology". On the left side of the chalkboard are many words such as, Muggle, Unicorn, splinch, Hogsmeade, and Revealer. On the right side of the chalkboard are definitions such as, "A shape shifter that prefers to live in dark, confined places" and " Celtic Irish goddess of beauty, the eldest daughter of the last Druid of Ireland".
Many different and sundry books cover the book shelves. Some titles easily spotted are: The ABC Book of Spells, The Wizard Book of the English Language, and Correct Wizard Grammar.

roomecho.desc: Two ghosts float through arguing whether apples or pears taste better.
It starts snowing briefly then it stops.

room.name: A Classroom
room.desc: quit quit

room.name: Old Storage Room
room.desc: Dusty and filled with debris, this old room seems like nothing more than storage for leftover or extra furniture. A few tables are stacked against one wall. Desks and chairs are piled clumsily in a corner. A few over-stuffed chairs are set in the center of the room. A couple of old beds are placed off to one side of the room.

extradesc.desc: Dry dust settles over every surface in the room. A few dust bunnies seem to be lurking under some of the furniture.
Soft and fluffy, the dust bunnies roll around under the furniture collecting dust.
Probably from a nearby classroom or dormitory, the furniture was put here because there wasn't enough room anywhere else.
Worn, wooden tables occupy one wall of this room. These tables look older than those in the rest of the school.
The desks that are piled in the room are splattered with ink and scarred with carvings.
A few of the chairs for the desks are broken or chipped, like someone didn't bother to repair them.
Stuffing has started to fall from a few rips in the faded, over-stuffed chairs.
These beds are used when the school has more students. It seems that these haven't been used in a while judging by the layers of dust.

roomecho.desc: A dust bunnies rolls across the floor, scattering the dust.
One of the badly stacked chairs shifts and tumbles down the pile with a loud CRASH!
More dust settles on the forgotten furniture, adding to the think layers.
Some of the dust gets kicked up and sneaks its way up your nose, making you sneeze.

room.name: Boys Lavatory
room.desc: Light grey tiles cover the walls and floor of the boy's bathroom. The west side of the bathroom is divided off from the rest of the room by a thick wall. Behind the wall is a row of showers. Another wall blocks off the door to the south to give those in the room some privacy from anyone that might look through the door. The north side of the room is lined with several stalls and a couple of urinals, while on the east side a few sinks are set into the wall under a long mirror. A row of windows above the stalls allows light into the room.

extradesc.desc: Smooth grey tiles, dotted with colourful speckles, protecting the walls and floor and making for easy clean up.
Covered with tiles, a few walls have been built to divid the room and create privacy.
The floor is covered with grey tiles, making it easier to clean up.
Several bathroom stalls are lined up against the north wall.
White porcelain sinks with bronze faucets are aligned against the west wall.
The faucets on the sinks are made of smooth bronze and beautifully crafted.
Hanging on the wall above the sinks, you see yourself looking back at you in the mirror.
Partitioned off from the rest of the bathroom by a wall, the showers are in individual stalls.
Charmed to prevent prying eyes, the windows let bright sunlight light up the room.
Made of white porcelain, the urinals are against the north wall with the stalls.

roomecho.desc: Pale moonlight filters in through the windows.
Soft sunlight shines in through the windows.
It seems that someone didn't completely turn off the water in one of the sinks. Drip. Drip. Drip.
A group of Hufflepuff boys wander into the bathroom.
A girl accidentally wanders into the bathroom and quickly runs out screaming.

room.name: Girls' Lavatory*
room.desc: Pale, beige tiles cover the walls and floor of the girl's bathroom. The north side of the room is lined with several stalls, while on the west side a few sinks sit under a long mirror. The east side of the bathroom is divided from the rest of the room by a thick wall. Behind the wall is a row of showers. A security wall blocks the southern door to ensure privacy for the inhabitants of this room. A row of windows above the stalls allow a meager amount of light into the room, but a single torch upon the wall provides a bit more illumination.

extradesc.desc: Smooth beige tiles, dotted with colourful speckles, protecting the walls and floor and making for easy clean up.
Covered with tiles, a few walls have been built to divid the room and create privacy.
The floor is covered with beige tiles, making it easier to clean up.
Several bathroom stalls are lined up against the north wall.
White porcelain sinks with silver faucets are aligned against the west wall.
The faucets on the sinks are made of fine silver and beautifully crafted.
Hanging on the wall above the sinks, you see yourself looking back at you in the mirror.
Partitioned off from the rest of the bathroom by a wall, the showers are in individual stalls.
Charmed to prevent prying eyes, the windows let bright sunlight light up the room.

roomecho.desc: It seems that someone didn't completely turn off the water in one of the showers. Drip. Drip. Drip.
Soft sunlight shines in through the windows.
Pale moonlight filters in through the windows.
A group of giggling Hufflepuff girls fix their robes in front of the mirror.
A boy accidently walks into the bathroom before being quickly shooed out by the girls.
A sleepy Hufflepuff first year wanders into the bathroom.

room.name: Charred Corridor
room.desc: This is a relatively narrow, windowless passageway. Its lack of width and windows give the passage a cramped feeling. Running the length of the corridor is a series of uneven scorch marks at varying heights. In some places the marks stretch from the floor to the ceiling, while in other places they are barely visible, giving the corridor an aged look. The scorches mark all of the walls and are punctuated by four torches that line either side. The torches themselves are intact and in perfect working order. While the ceiling and floor appear to be unscathed, they are visibly worn. The floor is worn from foot traffic. To the north is an unused classroom and to the south is the Ravenclaw Tower, while a passage extends on to the east.

room.name: Shadowy Corridor
room.desc: Flickering light reflects from the moist patches on the stone walls. Occasionally, the damp builds up and a faint dripping noise can be heard where it joins the puddles at the edge of the gritty floor. Clumps of grey-green dirt hide under benches and in the corners, as well as a few dust bunnies. A faint squeaking noise accompanies the dripping; it seems there are one or two hidden rats or mice here. The corridor spreads out to the north, south, and west.

extradesc.desc: Stone walls, moist with water, surround the corridor.
A couple of slippery puddles have formed near the walls.
Smooth from wear, the floor has patches of gritty dirt seeping into the cracks.
Slimy and stick, the grey-green chunks of dirt seem to collect anything laying on the floor, such as peices of paper, hair, and grime. Dirt also fills in the cracks in the floor.
Moisture has slowly formed on the stones, dripping down to make a few puddles on the floor.
Hair, paper, and grime stick to the clumps of dirt.
Hair, paper, and grime stick to the clumps of dirt.
Hair, paper, and grime stick to the clumps of dirt.
These dust bunnies don't seem to be your average dust bunnies. Made of collected dust and dirt, they roll along the floor and under feet.

roomecho.desc: Water slowly drips down the side of one of the walls.
A fouth year student quietly sneaks through the corridor, trying to avoid being seen by a teacher or prefect.
A mouse scuttles along the wall, squeakily.

room.name: Fresco Corridor
room.desc: The floor consists of Trassic Sandstone, dark brown in colour. The walls are plastered white, which, in actuality, are closer to a dim, yellowish colour due to years of neglect. In the plaster Frescos have been painted on each of the walls, one playing off the other. On one side an enormous, slathering werewolf stares aggressively at the opposite wall. He paces back and forth, looking for a way to the wall across from him. Facing the werewolf is a frail, old wizard meekly holding his ancient wand and constantly looking for ways to escape. Three tiny, rectangular windows emit the only illumination this corridor receives and, at times, the wizard actually attempts to scramble up to the windows, as if he could escape. Two dark, narrow exits lead east and west. A dark, heavy, unadorned door leads north.

extradesc.desc: The werewolf takes a crack at lunging for you.
The old wizard pleads with you, "Please, oh please, take me with you."

roomecho.desc: Growling, "I'm going to get you old man.'
A feeble voice, "Please help me."
A howl shakes the room.

room.name: Felix the Fortunate Corridor
room.desc: The corridor is warm and inviting with mahogany panelling along the walls and red granite floors. Iron brackets hold flaming Bludger-shaped torches allowing the copper statue of Felix the Fortunate to be seen. Felix, in his Appleby Arrows robes, holds a broom in one hand and a Golden Snitch in the other. Felix, bent over in a grimace, holds his Snitched-hand across his belly. Students who haven't studied for their tests rub Felix's hand for luck. Looking at Felix will explain this odd phenomenon. The slate, roundtop archway leads south. The oval portal leads west, while the dark, narrow exit leads east.

extradesc.desc: In 1932, in a game against the Vratsa Vultures, Felix was struck off his broom by a Bludger twenty feet in the air. He fell to the ground with a resounding thud. Amazingly, in his misery, he felt a tickling at his belly. Feeling at his stomach region, he pulled out the Snitch. Felix ended the sixteen day game 'capturing' the Snitch, in what is still called to this day, "the luckiest catch in Quidditch history."

roomecho.desc: "Two students walk up and rub Felix's hand."
"A tall, lean student rubs Felix's hand and says, 'Come on, Felix, old boy, I need some luck today.'"

room.name: Snowflake Blue Passage
room.desc: Three painted portraits hang directly opposite three round windows in this large, animated corridor. The cheerful portraits depict three similar looking witches, all with brilliant blond hair and large, jolly faces. All three witches are wearing pristine white robes emblazoned with light blue, embroidered snowflakes. The portraits are hung over a smooth wall and are reflected in the highly polished glass in each of the windows. Positioned between each window is a small, shallow alcove. Each alcove holds a number of candles of the same blue shade as the snowflakes. Standing at attention directly in front of the centre window is a single, solitary suit of armour. The passage extends on to the east and the west. To the north is an old broom cupboard.

room.name: Black Candle Passage
room.desc: Two tall black pillar candles at the north end of the hall provide the only illumination. By the flickering candle light, you can make out what appears to be several pale green glass bottles next to a dusty iron cauldron. They have been left for ages on a dark wood sideboard on the eastern side. The walls are bare of decoration, but the moss growing through the cracks makes a webbed pattern of bright green. The moss adds some life to the otherwise dreary and deserted corridor. The carpet runner is threadbare, although, it appears it was gold framed with brown at some point. An archway covered with cobwebs sits on the western wall leading down a corridor. The passage extends to the north and to the south.

room.name: Corridor with a Growth
room.desc: The floor of this corridor is smooth and clean, but pebbles clutter the sides where it joins the walls. Some kind of plant snakes its way across the damp ceiling, which is producing cold droplets of musty water. The plant growing in the hallway makes the room tranquil and relaxing, making it a great place to sit and rest or study. The corridor spreads out to the east, west, and south.

extradesc.desc: The floor of the corridor has been polished to a smooth shine.
Glistening, crystal-like pebbles glitter in the corners of the hallway.
Made of smooth stone, the walls of the corridor are covered with off shoots of the plant.
The smooth, cold ceiling is covered greenery and cold drops of water.
Crisp, cool drops of moisture form on the cold, bare patches of ceiling.
Thick, dark green vines snake their way across the stones. Large, wide leaves stretch out from the vines to catch any sunlight that may be leaking into the corridor.

roomecho.desc: A breeze swiftly sweeps the passage, giving it a chilling feel and forcing the flames of the torches in brackets affixed to the walls to lean and quiver.
The leaves on the plant seem to stretch out from the vines further, almost as if they were reaching for something or someone...
A first year student gets too close the plant and a vine starts to around his arm. He quickle jumps back out of the way.
A couple of students sit down on the bench for a break.

room.name: Well Kept Hallway
room.desc: There are many flame torches lighting up this passage. They give the place a warm atmosphere. The walls, of dry white stone, are almost unmarked and obviously well kept. The floor is also smooth and even, as is the ceiling, which is host to a small number of picturesque carvings. Wide arches arc across the ceiling, supporting and stabilizing the walls. The long hall continues to the west and east, while to the north is the North Tower.

extradesc.desc: Warm and soothing torches fill the corridor with light and heat.
Made of dry, white stone, the walls are very well-kept and smooth.
The floor of the hallway is laid evenly and polished to a smooth finish.
Host to a number of odd carvings, the ceiling is a soft white with a nice finish.
Beautiful ancient carvings fill the pale ceiling. As you look at a few of them, they shift and glow with hidden magic.
Beautifully carved and elegant, the wide stone arches reach across the ceiling. The center keystone in one of the arches is slightly chipped...
Most of the keystones in the arches are in perfect condition, except one. One of the keystones is chipped and crumbling in a few places.

roomecho.desc: The light from the torches flicker, giving off a cozy wave of warmth.
A small group of Gryffindors head north to the North Tower.
The ancient carvings shift and change colour, causing sparks of magic to fall from the ceiling.

room.name: Corner Corridor
room.desc: There is little light. A musty scent hangs in the air. Icy drops of water fall from the dark ceiling. They contrast the light from the torches, as it feels unusually warm. Portraits hanging on the walls make it seem like there are more people here than there really are. Moths dance about their flames and their fluttering wings cast flickering shadows on the walls. The corridor bends to the east and south.

extradesc.desc: Crisp and clear, the icy water drips from the ceiling. Some of the water has crystalized on the ceiling.
Deep, dark shadows cross the cold ceiling. A few crystalized drops of icy water speard along the stones in the ceiling.
Flickering waves of warmth and light spill from the torches hanging on the walls.
Trying not to get burned, the moths dance near the flames of the torches.

roomecho.desc: A torch starts to smoulder and smoke, making the room grow darker.
An icy drop of water slips from the ceiling to land on the back of you neck, slowly sliding down your back... You shiver.
More crystals form on the ceiling.
A sixth year Hufflepuff girl giggles quietly as she sneaks through the corridor, closely followed by a Gryffindor boy.

room.name: The North Tower
room.desc: Dry and pleasantly cool, the air here is clear, crisp and fresh. The floor consists of large grey flagstone slabs at the base of a narrow winding staircase. The steps are large and close together, with a thin stone handrail running along one side, spiraling upward with the stairs. Large clear windows can be seen at different intervals along the staircase, allowing bright sunlight in during the day. Large torches hang between each of the windows, burning only at night. The staircase leads up to the next floor, while the corridor is to the south.

extradesc.desc: Slabs of smooth, grey flagstones support the staircase that reaches up to the next floor.
Slabs of smooth, grey flagstones support the staircase that reaches up to the next floor.
Reaching up to the next floor, the staircase spirals through the tower.
Worn from centuries of use, the stone stairs can be quite slippery if you aren't careful.
The stone handrail circles around the tower with the staircase. It's very smooth, yet chipped in a few places.
Smooth, clear windows are spaced along the staircase going up the tower.
Quite a few torches circle up the tower to light it up at night.

roomecho.desc: A couple of students make their way upstairs, wheezing slightly from the climb.
A first year slips on one of the worn steps and tumbles down a few steps before catching himself on the handrail.
The torches flare momentarily, casting odd shadows about the staircase.

room.name: Wizard Chess Room
room.desc: The floor, and the eastern, northern, and southern walls are jet-black. The western wall and ceiling are in a black-and-white checkerboard pattern. On the western wall and ceiling are human-sized Wizard Chess pieces, creating two separate games. The pieces are at various places on both boards since students, as they walk through the hall, command the pieces to move in a perpetual game. There are cushy sofas and chairs set about the room for students who would like to sit and play a game instead of just instructing a knight or pawn to move as they walk through. To the north lies a perfectly square opening, while a golden arch allows one to travel east. To the south an opening in the shape of a treble clef grants access to that area.

extradesc.desc: The black knight growls at you, "What are you looking at?"

roomecho.desc: "Bishop to King's Rook seven."
"A student high-fives the Queen after taking her opponent's Knight."

room.name: Song Hall
room.desc: This corridor is exceptionally long. It is almost half the length of the school's Quidditch Pitch. Printed in large font, and framed in attractive ebony cases, are copies of the school song translated into over two-hundred languages. These cases are hung in two even rows along each wall. The gaps between each case are wide enough to accommodate windows and candle recesses. The floor is a well-worn green-slate flagstone. In the centre of the hall, encased in thick glass, is an energetic working model of the heavens. Circling the model and spinning in opposite directions are two gleaming golden rings. South is a dead end while to the north the corridor extends past the courtyard. To the east is the Astronomy Tower staircase.

room.name: A Dead End Corridor
room.desc: Dark flagstone lies straight ahead going towards a stone wall. A cold, bone-chilling draft flows languidly through the corrior, making the light from the torches flicker against the stone walls.

room.name: Astronomy Tower Ground Level
room.desc: A wide circular room lays before you, the air is still and peaceful save for a burning sphere in the centre the size of a Snitch. It burns brightly with a violet flame casting a soft light around the windowless room. The open floor is a singular slab of smooth white and grey marble, the seemingly random patterns of grey circles and white expanses make up a detailed map of the moon. The continuous broad stone wall surrounding the room is broken up by large wooden supports, held in place with thick iron bolts. There are a number of cabinets bearing intricate globes and gyroscopes. A few musty bookshelves containing massive volumes of star charts and tattered scrolls stand nearby. Wrapped around the room, a stone stair case made of floating, unconnected steps spirals upwards and an arch opens out to the west.

extradesc.desc: The sphere looks like a miniature sun, radiating a soft purplish glow into the whole room.
The moon is extremely detailed with intricate scrollwork naming each mountain and sea.
The dusty cabinets are very old with a locked windowed door. Inside are many old, faded globes and ornate brass models of the planetary systems.

room.name: Piddling Corridor
room.desc: Short, grubby, and made from grey limestone, this corridor contains only two objects of interest: tapestries. Next to each tapestry is a diminutive torch eking the tiny bit of light available. On one wall hangs a tapestry depicting four petrified children either running from or withering in front of two fearsome trolls lumbering for them. The tapestry on the opposite wall portrays a bewitching feline leading a flustered, lost, yet grateful, wizard out of the woods. The oval exit leads west and the wide exit takes one south. The decomposing pea-green door, with a sign reading "I am watching YOU", leads to Filch's Office.

extradesc.desc: The cat looks at you and says, "If you're off course use your map."

roomecho.desc: "A low guttural grunt causes childrens' screams."

room.name: Wizened Hall
room.desc: Several oval windows, with the Hogwarts design etched into them, run along the top of the walls filtering in the outside light. Thick wax candles floating around these windows cast an orangish hue upon the oak-panelled walls. Beneath the windows, plastered to the walls, are so many portraits that it is difficult to even see the panelling. These are the pictures of past, great teachers of Hogwarts. Some of the depictions look regal, others annoyed at students running through the corridor, while a few of the professors' visages are cunning, even menacing. An oval exit leads east. A very long, slender opening leads west. A solid oak door with the Hogwarts' Crest upon it opens to the staff room.

roomecho.desc: A couple of students sprint through the hall. One of the portraits yells, "You slow down!"
A long strand of wax drips onto the floor.
The portraits are talking to one another. "I know, in my day they never behaved in such a manner." "Oh, Gladys, hush. In your day brooms were still used for sweeping."
One of the portraits snores audibly.

room.name: Bicorn Fountain Passage
room.desc: Not exactly opposite one another, about halfway along the corridor, are twin fountains set into the walls. They are small, not very impressive, and the bronze features have turned quite green with age. Both of the fountains are similar, with water pouring from the mouth of a Bicorn's head, which looms over a thick-rimmed stone reservoir. There are no windows to speak of, save for four narrow, horizontal slits, the width of four human fingers from the ceiling. Each wall has two large torches and a row of stubby candles in an iron box above each fountain. On each side of both fountains, carved into the stone wall, is a wand. Each wand is pointing upward and slightly inward towards the fountains.

room.name: Chameleon Corridor
room.desc: The corridor is wide and spacious. The floor, walls, and ceiling are covered in the same lurid wallpaper. With a mustard-yellow fleur-de-lis pattern in raised felt, the background is azure. The passageway is brightly lighted, but from an unknown source. Upon careful observation one may see a flicker in the wallpaper ... Could there be a torch set there? There is a plush, overstuffed sofa along one wall and three matching box-chairs.
