Good luck discovering these areas of rest, however, they blend perfectly with the wallpaper. The exits are East and West for those able to find them ...

roomecho.desc: "A student shrieks, 'Where in Merlin's beard did I put my book, blasted room!'"

room.name: Wide Corridor
room.desc: There are two large, roomy alcoves on each wall. These four alcoves reach from the floor to just under the ceiling. They are spaced equally apart; however, each alcove is at a diagonal from its partner on the opposing wall. The interior of each alcove is decorated with an intricate patchwork crest for each of the school's houses. Two-thirds of the way up each wall, from end to end, is a shallow channel edged in a darker stone than that of the wall. The channel follows the arch of the alcoves and is sealed shut at both ends of the corridor. Apart from a little dust, the channel is empty. The corridor is wide enough for five average-sized third years to stand side-by-side quite comfortably. The passage extends to the north and south.

room.name: Gryffindor Tower, Ground Floor
room.desc: Caen stone, creamy yellow in colour, covers the floors, walls, and ceiling of this Gryffindor room. Lamps light this smallish study room with ancient tables and spindly chairs of cherry wood. Against the east wall a fireplace crackles busily from flames that warm the room. Large, squashy armchairs are scattered in front of the fireplace, books resting at their sides, left by their classmates. A large red and gold hanging of the Gryffindor Crest hangs above the fireplace. A massive scarlet chalkboard, riddled with graffiti, hangs upon a wall with gold-coloured chalk in its tray. The scarlet door exits to the west and stone steps lead upward.

extradesc.desc: The chalkboard is riddled with graffiti. Some people have drawn pictures, quotes, signatures, etc. Written in a corner of the board a conversation follows: "Ron Weasley was here." Underneath that it says, "Obviously you were here, Ron, as you just wrote that." "Hermione, it's just something people write." "I know, Harry, but I think it's silly." "It's supposed to be silly, why don't you learn to relax?" "Fine, Ron, if you think that is a sign of relaxation then: Hermione Granger, Harry Potter, and Ron Weasley were here writing stupid things on this board." "She's never going to get it, Harry; I mean never." "Let it go, mate. Let it go."

roomecho.desc: Students bust through the door and clamber up the stairs.

room.name: Filch's Office*
room.desc: Paper, files, and envelopes are strewn across the small room. A large, oak desk rests in the centre of the room, stacked high with half-filled detention slips and a few broken quills. A large, metal, filing cabinet stands close behind it, each drawer labelled with a different letter of the alphabet. A pair of ancient shackles dangles lazily from the ceiling, sparkling from someone's meticulous care and patiently awaiting use. A small, wooden door sits in the western wall, painted a light grey in a failed attempt to blend it in with the wall.

extradesc.desc: Extending down on chains from the ceiling of the room, these shackles look to be in good condition. Well-oiled and cared for, the shackles are apparently kept in a ready to use state. Hanging far from the floor, only the tallest of adults would be able to touch their feet when strung up by these shackles.

room.name: Empty Classroom
room.desc: This empty classroom is quiet and cold. Dust inhabits everything from the old wooden floor to the small wooden desks. On the far east wall are multiple windows that are very dirty. One of them is broken and allows the wind from outside to blow in and gives dim light. Deep in the northeast corner of the room is a spiders web which covers a small hole in the wall. To the west is a bookcase with small withered plants in pots on top. The only exit is to the east.

extradesc.desc: This ordinary bookcase holds over fifty books. Some titles include, "Simple Magic for the Underage Witch or Wizard", "Magical Pets and You", and "Antidotes for the Average Infliction." Although the bookcase is covered with dust, the books are in excellent condition.

roomecho.desc: A cool strong breeze forces its way inside the room blowing about some dust.

room.name: Square-Mosaic Corridor
room.desc: The floor of this corridor is patterned with a mosaic design of interwoven squares alternating in colours from yellow to black to off-white. It is edged at the west end of the corridor by a border of thick, black granite blocks, while the pattern itself extends through the eastern doorway. The upper end of the north wall is home to a row of six lanterns. Three sides of the lanterns are made of ceramic, which has had a delicate pattern cut into it, allowing the light to spill into the room and bounce off the windows directly opposite. The fourth side of the lanterns, facing the hall, are paned with pale pink glass. Standing on either side of the exit to a courtyard, in the southern wall, are two suits of armour who's shields bear the school crest. The corridor also continues to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: Early morning sun filters in through the windows.
A male student thunders past and leaves east.
A bird lands on a window ledge outside, fluffs its feathers and takes off.
A male Slytherin heads to the east and disappears into the distance, trailing his fingers on the wall.

room.name: Pink Crystal Corridor
room.desc: Along the southern wall are two large, arched windows on either side of a door, and one, smaller, rectangular window above it. The smaller window is barred from the outside and partly obscured by dust and cobwebs. Dangling on chains, from the stone at the top of each arched window, are pink crystals. Decorating the floor is an intricate mosaic of knotted squares in subdued shades of yellows and browns and creams. The ceiling is rounded and smooth. On the north wall, quit near the ceiling, is a row of stubby candles on an iron platform and boxed in by a thick mesh. There is a door to the north, and to the south, which leads to a courtyard. The corridor continues to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: Light from the outside is reflected around the room by the pink crystals in the windows.
A shadow flickers across the room as a student, outside, runs past the windows
A loud bang rattles the glass in the windows.
An owl lands on the outside ledge of a window and hoots before taking off again.

room.name: Gloomy Classroom
room.desc: . A shadowy light flickers through a pair of small windows, tiredly illuminating the room. Leaky pipes surrounding the room have caused it to become soggy and mildewed. The cracked, grey, stone walls are slick to the touch and the cobbled floor has many puddles upon it. The room is utterly barren, apart from the few rotting tables and littered pieces of parchment that lie forgotten on the floor. The only exit is to the south.

extradesc.desc: The parchment is in almost complete ruin, but the words "Transfiguration Homework: Switching Spells" and the name "Benjamin Barkley" are still barely legible.

roomecho.desc: Water drips down and hits the floor with an echoing splash.

room.name: ** Dungeon Passageway
room.desc: Flickering torches hang in their supports along the walls, casting shadows over the dark stone. An alcove houses a bust of Salazar Slytherin, his face set in a scowl. The bust is set atop a shining column of marble, obviously cared for because of its reflective sheen. The stones on the walls have been worn smooth over time from various hands running along them between classes. The floor gently slopes downward, leading deeper into the dungeons. Hissing sounds come from a long portrait of a full-grown dragon, specifically a Hebridean Black. One may exit to the south or to the west.

extradesc.desc:
.
The granite bust of Salazar Slytherin dominates the area. His imposing gaze tracks every student that passes. He has noble, sharply defined features and a short curl of a beard. The figure is hooded and wears a vicious scowl.
extradesc.keywords: salazar bust slytherin face scowl alcove

extradesc.desc: Almost thirty feet in length, the black, coarse-scaled dragon sits up in a menacing pose. His enormous, bat-like wings spread wide. His eyes glow a luminous purple and sharp-edged points stretch along his spine. The tip of his tail holds an arrow-shaped spike.

roomecho.desc: A Slytherin student passes the bust of Salazar, winking at him as he goes. Salazar winks back.
The room is briefly bathed in an orange light as the Hebridean Black spits out large ball of flame.

room.name: Crossroads Passageway *
room.desc: The faint smell of mildew lingers in the air. Two, sputtering torches sit in rusty brackets. The trickling sound of water oozing from the dark, moist walls is present, though the hallway itself is surprisingly clean for an old, dank dungeon. The smooth ceiling reaches out into the darkness. A large, iron door sits to the east and water drips slowly down across its face. Box archways indicate exits to the north or south.

extradesc.desc: This small window looks into the darkened hallway beyond.

A large, iron door occupies the east wall. Embedded into the wall, this door reeks of decay and age. A brownish discolouration seeps down the door as rust deposits mark water lines of ages past. A large, tarnished ring is placed in the right side of the door and in the upper middle sits a small, barred window.

The bracket is made of an old, rusty metal, but the torch, on the other hand, doesn't seem to be made of any real material. You can see right through it, as it is unsubstantial, almost like a ghost torch.

roomecho.desc: The monotonous drip of water ticks like a metronome.
Faint cries of pain can be heard to the east.

room.name: South Passageway *
room.desc: The most noticeable thing about this narrow passageway is the way it appears to curve like a snake winding its way through the forest. However, upon second glance instead of coiling or bending, this corridor is straight. Thin sheets of a silk-like cloth hang over the walls, ripples flowing through them with every breeze traveling by. The ceiling casts a faint emerald hue that travels down its length, while two torches cast a dancing shadow on the walls and floor. The passage winds its way to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: This silky cloth waves and ripples as the slightest breeze slips through the halls. Upon the fabric is the emblem of House Slytherin. Casting a greenish hue, the waving cloth makes it seem like you're underwater.

Taking a closer look at the torch and bracket, it appears that the bracket is made of an old rusty metal. The torch, on the other hand, doesn't seem to be made of any solid material. You can see right through it as it is unsubstantial. Almost like a ghost torch.

roomecho.desc: The sound of running feet can be heard coming from the north.
Laughter fills the hallway as three drunk ghosts float past.

room.name: Southern Passageway *
room.desc: The walls lining this spacious corridor are composed of black, brown, and white bricks, which continually rearrange themselves into the shapes of unusual magical beasts. The two walls synchronize to always display the same image and a low, rumbling noise echoes down the hallway whenever the bricks switch positions. The floor and the ceiling are both made of polished, black marble, that reflects dark shadows of the images on the walls. Two torches cast a dancing shadow on the ceiling and walls. The only exits are to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: Looking at the torch and bracket closely, it appears that the bracket is made of an old rusty metal. The torch, on the other hand, doesn't seem to be made of any real material. You can see right through it as it is unsubstantial. Almost like a ghost torch.

roomecho.desc: With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Demiguise.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Chimaera.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Acromantula.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Kelpie.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Sphinx.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Nunda.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Basilisk.
With a rumble, the bricks rearrange themselves to create the image of a Griffin.

room.name: First Draft Dungeon Passageway
room.desc: This passage winds its way lazily ahead, the hewn stone floor patterned with moss and age. A chilling wind slips around like a silent intruder, whispering laments to the occupants of the passage. Angular walls jut out from both sides of the corridor, glimmering faintly in the light from the sparsely placed torches. Overhead, sharp rock formations cast cruel shadows along every surface. The exits are through jagged arches to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: A faint voice whispers, "It never ceases, never ceases".

room.name: ** Passageway
room.desc: Unforgiving stone floors stretch ahead into the dark, echoing the sounds of the passersby. To one side, a crudely cut archway lies - awating someone to cross its threshold. Straight ahead, dimly lit by the sparse torches on the wall, lies more lenght of passage. The slightest linger of mildew tickles the senses, while water trickles languidly down the brash, rough walls.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Brisk, splintered stone floors lie below .. marred from age and use. Lifeless, dark green moss sprinkles itself vainly over the cracks in the stone. The pungent aroma of stale, damp air waifts its way around the passage. To the right bends another unknown passage, daring the persuer to enter through its darkness. Light from sparatic torches float their way unevenly across the sides of the walls, just slightly reflecting the light from the flames.

room.name: ** ** Passageway
room.desc: . Chilling stone creates the boundaries set on either side of the passage, making the appearance cold and unforgiving. The lights from the torches that barely illuminate the passage, flicker restlessly from the draft that floats around the surrounding area.

room.name: ** ** Passageway
room.desc: The path continues to wind ahead, formed from hewn stone. The floor echoes the footsteps of the users of the passage, while the walls provide no resting space for the weary user. Light flickers listlessly from the torches placed sparatically around the walls of the passage.

room.name: ** Passageway
room.desc: Hewn stone surfaces wind their way ahead through the passage, their surfaces slightly chipped and worn from use. Torches are placed sparatically along the walls of the passage, their light barely catching on the surfaces, making the passage dark and mysterious. Rough, jagged walls linger on either side of the passage, water trickling down their edges.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Rough, unforgiving walls lie on either side of the passage, their surfaces daring the user to lean against them to their own discomfort. Cracked, aged stone floors lie beneath, mold growing between the cracks of its surface.

room.name: Crossroads Passageway*
room.desc: A cold, stone base is below your feet chipping with age and use. Gaping cragged walls hug either side, chilled water trickling the surface. The scent of mildew floats with the draft that pierces its way through the passage. Two torches cast a dancing shadow on the ceiling and walls. To the east, the smoothed edges create a stone archway stained green from age and dampness, and is set with a simple wooden door. To the west is a scabrous elliptical opening leading further into the dungeon. Darkness crawls forth across the flag stone floor to the south, blocking view from what lies ahead.

extradesc.desc: This simple, wooden door looks sturdy and fairly new. It has a iron ring for a door handle and its hinges look new and well cared for.

Looking at the torch and bracket closely, it appears that the bracket is made of an old rusty metal. The torch, on the other hand, doesn't seem to be made of any real material. You can see right through it as it is unsubstantial. Almost like a ghost torch.

roomecho.desc: A cold, evil wind blows through the passageway.
Voices can be heard through the door to the east.

room.name: Passageway *
room.desc: The passage continues to the east and west. Solid, wooden doors stand to the north and south, bathed in the light of nearby torches. The walls are a uniform grey with bits of mildew and mould growing in the angular cracks. The floor is made of smooth, dark stone and the ceiling travels in a fine, straight line.

extradesc.desc: These doors are made of solid oak. They show signs of aging with various cracks and breaks on the surface. The handle is made of black iron and shows extensive use.

Looking at the bracket closely, it appears that it is made of an old rusty metal. The torch, curiously, doesn't seem to be made of any real material. You can see right through it as it is unsubstantial; almost like a ghost torch.

roomecho.desc: A dark, musky odour wafts thru the passageway.

room.name: West Passageway SECOND DRAFT
room.desc: The hallway gets colder and damper as it extends further to the west. The flat, grey walls gleam with condensation, while an occasional drip falls from the dark ceiling above. The floors are made of tightly-packed cobblestone which is slightly wet with moisture. The torches on both walls gut and splutter as if trying to stay alight. The exits extend as hallways to the west and east.

extradesc.desc: Looking at the torch and bracket closely, the bracket seems to be made of an old, rusty metal. Unlike the bracket, however, the torch doesn't seem to be made of any real material. You can see right through it as it is unsubstantial. Almost like a ghost torch.

roomecho.desc: The sound of laughing children is heard coming down from the east passageway.

room.name: Utter Most Southern Passageway SECOND DRAFT
room.desc: Tapestries depicting scenes from important wizarding battles decorate the pebbled walls of this short, L-shaped corridor. The small portions of the walls that are visible from between tapestries are made of tiny stones, each a different shade of grey. The ceiling is dark and low, which gives the passageway a sense of closure. The passage exits east and north.

extradesc.desc: Each of the four, elegantly-designed rugs takes up about half a wall and portrays two wizards, one bearing a dark wand and dressed in green robes; and the other holding a light wand and dressed in blue robes.

This tall and mighty looking wizard has a long, noble face and bright shining eyes. He is dressed in long, flowing, green robes and has a pointed wizard's hat atop his head. In his right hand he is holding a long, dark, wand which has lightening streaking out of its tip towards the blue robed wizard.

Short and shabby, this wizard has a scabby, ugly face with a scraggly beard. His dirty, blue, robes look two sizes too big for him. His hatless head shows his balding scalp. In his left hand he is holding a light coloured wand which he has thrust out before him.

roomecho.desc: A fat ghost with an Irish Tenor floats through, singing "Danny Boy."

room.name: T-Shaped Passageway SECOND DRAFT
room.desc: This T-shaped passageway travels both west and south, and to the east is a simple, wooden door. The walls and ceiling are made of plain, hewn stone. The floor, made of clean, stone slabs, runs straight and even in all directions. A single torch and bracket sit on the north wall.

extradesc.desc: The bracket is made of an old, rusty metal. The torch gleams brightly like the midday sun. (NOTE) Make this room very bright for the light level.

roomecho.desc: Several mice run from the southern corridor towards the east.

room.name: The Hanging Room FIRST DRAFT
room.desc: Hewn stone floors flow languidly before you. Cold and unforgiving, bits of mold grow subtley from the cracks in the stone. Jagged walls lean out into the passage, water dripping relentlessly from the edges. Flames dance from torches that are scattered along the walls .. flickering in the draft that waifts through the passage.

room.name: Western Passageway SECOND DRAFT
room.desc: With a dreary and drab appearance, this passageway holds a sense of musty dampness. Crudely carved slabs of rocks, jutting out at odd angles, construct the unadorned walls. Torches, sitting in dark brackets, light the way on each wall with their flickering lights casting dancing shadows upon the smooth and polished stone floor. A single, iron door stands at the far north end of the hallway, which also extends eastward.

extradesc.desc: The dull gleam of iron reflects off the surface. From the top rivets to the bottom sheeting, this door is clad entirely in iron. The round door ring juts out of the middle right side. There appears to be no rust and the smell of fresh oil permeates the air near the door.

Seeming to be made of an old rusty metal, the bracket reflects a dull appearance in the torch light. The torch doesn't seem to be made of any real material. You can see right through it as it is unsubstantial; almost like a spirit torch.

roomecho.desc: A faint dripping sound echoes through the hallway.
A faint voice whispers, "But Tina said the room was" and trails off into silence.

room.name: Potion Master's Office *
room.desc: Candlelight flickers eagerly around the room as shadows dance on the stone walls and floors which are dank with age and use. Pictures of past potion masters are hung on the dark walls. Long, wooden shelves line the walls and a strong, oak desk sits in the middle of the room. Various beakers, bottles, urns, and pots are strewn about the room in a haphazard fashion. There is a door to the north, west, and south.

extradesc.desc: The portraits of numerous past potion masters from Alfred the Faithful to Zeibold the Weird line the walls. Unlike the majority of the paintings in the castle, these portraits aren't moving.
The various objects strewn about the room contain the equipment necessary to create different potions.
There are hundreds of glass jars sitting on each shelf, glinting with the subtle light of the room. Animal bits and pieces of plant float listlessly in the jars bathed in a spectacle of colour.

In the centre of the desk sits a heavy, stone bowl with mysterious symbols etched around the outer rim. A sliver of silver light wafts around the top of the bowl, with the insides floating like silvery-white clouds.
(object) A shallow stone basin with odd runes and symbols carved around the edge.

roomecho.desc: The sound of running feet can be heard in the hallway to the south.

room.name: Potions Master's Quarters*
room.desc: Cold, almost frigid, grey stone covers the floor, ceiling, and walls, creating a crypt-like feeling for this austere room. An iron bracket, devoid of a torch, hangs off the west wall. Against the north wall sits a bed. On the east side of the bed is a nightstand and on the west side is a simple bookshelf. A fireplace occupies the southern wall. The exit is through the heavy door on the eastern wall.

extradesc.desc: This gleaming, dark, metal bracket sits in the upper-middle of the western wall. It has no rust, scratches, or dents on it.
This simple bookshelf is rather tall and holds seven shelves full of books, scrolls, and other documents.
A black, granite fireplace, recessed into the southern wall, is barren, save for an ashen grate, two partially-burned logs, and a handful of cinders.

. This elegant table has been handcrafted by Moroccan artisans from solid wood with a single, top drawer and a storage area with one door. The nightstand features an intricate floral design and has been hand-painted in rich shades of black, blue, green, and gold.
The bed is constructed from pitch-black, wrought iron. Designed for the bed are raven-coloured, woolen bedding and a single, silk, emerald pillow.

roomecho.desc: A sickly, sweet, perfume smell wafts through the air.
A faint shout of "Peeves!" is distantly heard.

room.name: Potion Master's Potion Stores *
room.desc: This room is little larger than a walk-in closet. The floor is made of a flat, grey tile. The cold, stone walls on the east and west sides are lined with row upon row of shelves. To the north, a large, wooden cabinet rests against the wall . Four lanterns hang down from the centre of the ceiling. The exit to the chamber is to the south.

extradesc.desc: Each shelf holds every type of flagon, flask, glass, jar, and jug imaginable. Some are empty, but some hold different types of potion ingredients.
Each lantern is made of a dark metal. It hangs from a thick, metal chain from the ceiling. The light itself is very bright and clear.
The floor is made up of flat, grey tiles. You can see no signs of blemish, blots, dirt, smutch, or spots on the tile.

This large, wooden cabinet has two large, doors with three drawers beneath them. The hinges and knobs are made of cast iron, and the panels show scenes of witches and wizards in various stages of making potions. On the shelves inside the doors of the cabinet are rare and special potion ingredients. The drawers contain potions already made.

roomecho.desc: A faint, rumbling sound is heard to the east.
Very faintly, a male voice sings, "Love potion number nine".

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Potions Classroom
room.desc: Long, descending, stone steps arc side to side the entire length of the room. Elongated, ancient, wooden tables settle themselves systematically along the length of the steps - ranging forward, only stopping to give way to the east end of the room. The dark ceiling reaches overhead in a low arch. The ragged walls, an array of labeled jars and boxes lined neatly upon them, display their mysterious, powerful contents. The far end of the room boasts one, large, black cauldron with a smoking and bubbling, blue liquid shimmering in the dimly lit classroom. A dazzling, warm fire crackles below the cauldron - lighting the classroom, and making it warm and perfumed. Behind the cauldron sits some furniture. Along the west wall of the classroom is a large, wooden cabinet and at the northwestern wall is a large stone basin with a wide mouthed gargoyle sitting above it. The exit to the room is to the west.

extradesc.desc: Made of the darkest, blackest metal, this cauldron radiates powerful magic. Its exterior is covered with various runes and markings. Along the top edge of the cauldron an etching of a snake moves in a complete circle around it. Peering into the liquid, you can see glimpses of changing places and locations.
This large, wooden cabinet is closed and locked.

These old tables exude an aura of aged existence. Their dark, wooden exterior gleams with centuries of polishing. The smell of ancient forest seeps out of every crack and a vibration of powerful magic seems to radiate from their wooden exterior. Pewter cauldrons sit on each table top, awaiting use.
On each table top, pewter cauldrons made for stirring potions await the students' use.

Along the wall, various jars and boxes line the shelves. Their contents range from pickled, pixie feet to the head of a large, and rather ugly, giant. Some of the boxes contain common, potion ingredients.
. ( OBJECT ) A large, wooden desk sits here, with a solid wooden chair tucked neatly in. On the desk rest various Potions books, along with an ink pot and a quill.
(OBJECT)This stone wash basin is large enough for several students to wash at the same time. An icy jet of water comes out of the gargoyles mouth.

roomecho.desc: A dark, heavy, musty odor suddenly permeates the room then vanishes.
A large, evil - looking ghost floats in and says "HEY! What are you doing here? You don't belong here!". But then he gets a surprised look on his face and fades away.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Rock protrudes messily from either side of the walls, stone floor lying beneath your feet. Traces of water flow in a miniscule stream down the rocks, dripping to the floor below, catching in the glow of the light from the torches. A cold, bone-chilling draft weaves its way through the corridor, wrapping itself around the users of the passage.

room.name: Dungeon 2
room.desc: Mortared stone walls surround the area, seeming almost cold and mocking in their solidity. Hewn stone floors below, creating an echo with each passing step. Rusty, aged shackles and chains dangle limply from the walls, almost daring someone to draw close A bone-chilling wind waifts its way through the room.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Torches, placed sparatically along the walls glow dimly in the depths of the passage. Hewn stone floors beckon for use, chipped and colored with age. Etched, uneven rock to either side creating menacingly appearing walls. The passage winds its way out of site, curving languidly to the left.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Cold, unforgiving stone beneath your feet echoes the footsteps of its users. Jagged walls made from the stone earth jut out in various places at either side. Torches illuminate the walls vaguely, glinting off of the water that can be heard trickling down the walls. A chilling draft lingers through the passage, causing the light from the torches to flicker slightly.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Hewn slabs of marred stone below your feet, chipped and colored with age and use. Ragged, jostled walls on either side - torches dotted along their length, barely lighting the passage, flickering from the draft waifting through.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Faint glimmers of light from sporadically placed torches, sparkle off of the surface of the rocks that create the surface of the walls. A chilling draft winds its way through the area of the passage, while the unforgiving hewn stone floors resound the footsteps of their passengers. Sounds of water can be heard trickling down the cavernous walls, echoing into the empty space of the passage.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: A cold, fierce stone entry winds its way around to the right, disabling the user to see directly ahead of them. Light flickers teasingly from torches that are placed sparatically throughout the passage, just barely allowing a slight view of the mysteries that lie in the passage. Everything around you is made from stone, in chilling, unforgiving patterns made from years of wear and rough etching through thier barriers.

room.name: Well Room SECOND DRAFT
room.desc: With old, crumbling walls defining its exterior, this circular room has a low ceiling and no original light source. It's remarkable only for a large hole in the centre with a bucket floating directly above it. An iron door stands to the south.

extradesc.desc: This hole is about seven feet in diameter and extends far into the ground.
Floating above the hole is a large, wooden bucket with metal bands around it. No markings or lettering appear on it.

The dull gleam of iron reflects off the surface. From the top rivets to the bottom sheeting, this door is clad entirely in iron. The round door ring juts out of the middle left side. There appears to be no rust and the smell of fresh oil permeates the air near the door.
Old and crumbly, the stone facade of these walls is flakey and appears to be delicate to the touch.

roomecho.desc: A dank, decaying smell wafts up from the hole in the floor.
Hushed music floats delicately out of the hole in the floor.

room.name: Dungeon 1
room.desc: A vast centricular room etched from stone and marked by age and lack of use, boasts the evidence of its former uses. Iron shackles dangle lazily from the walls held there by round, steel pegs. A small window near the very top of the room shows a sliver of light, the only link to the world outside its walls.

room.name: ** Passageway
room.desc: Hewn stone drifts its way along the length of the passageway, its edges cracked with age. Jagged stone walls lie on either side of the corridor their surfaces glinting with water as it trickles off of its tips. Torches linger listlessly along the walls, their light flickering in the draft that waifts around the passage.

room.name: ** Passageway
room.desc: Cold, unforgiving stone drifts lazily around the circumference of the passage, etching its way from the smooth surface of the chipped floors, to the jagged, unrelenting surface of the walls. Water trickles down the edges of the walls as the light from the torches that are sparatically placed along the corridor twinkles subtley against the cool surface of the water.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Cold stone floor below, winding its way ahead - curving to either side at it's end, allowing its dweller to chose their way. The smell of age and lack of use drifts through the passage on a string of chilling air. Torches are placed sparatically along the walls glowing vaguely in the dark, barely allowing the passersby the ability to see clearly down its path.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Forcecul, jagged, threatening looking stone juts its way out towards the passage like fingers reaching for something in the dark. Strategically placed torches glint around the walls of the passage barely illuminating their surroundings, slightly reflecting off of the water that trickles listlessly down the walls.

room.name: Dungeon 5
room.desc: Smooth, unforgiving hewn stone encompasses the walls. Mildew rots the senses, when breathing the air. Moartared stone covers the floors, giving them a steel appearance. Rusty, aged chains dangle languidly from the walls - parched with lack of use.

room.name: Dungeon 6
room.desc: Cold, stone walls create the barrier that entombs these quarters. Moss grows lazily between the cracks and edges of the floor and walls. A chilling draft circulates its way around the dungeon, bringing with it the faintest smell of mildew and copper.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: An archway stretches over a doorway to the right leading towards a heavy, wooden door adorned with iron latches and hinges. Torches become a bit more abundant the farther one looks down this passage, their light reflecting off of the surfaces that surround. A chilling draft waifts its way through the area, with the faintest smell of mildew floating along with it.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: To the south of this corridor, the crest bearing the emblem of the House of Slytherin juts out fiercely from a large wooden door. Faint scratching noises from mice and rats scurrying down the length of the corridor can be heard from further down the hall. Cobwebbed suits of armor stand at uneven intervals along both walls, and the occasional ominous creak of rusty metal can be detected as the suits sway under the weight of years of neglect. A lone torch mounted on the north wall lights the immediate vicinity, but the light fades down the length of the corridor, and the distance holds only mysterious, blurry figures and a sense of powerful but unfriendly darkness.

room.name: Slytherin Common Room
room.desc: The Slytherin Common room is a low-ceilinged, underground affair, stretching longer than it is wide. The walls are hewn from rough, gray stone, standing thick and trapping the stagnant air inside the room. Spherical, jade-colored lamps hang from multitudes of thin, iron chains from the flat ceiling, illuminating the entire stretch in an eerie light. At the very end of the room, a large, ornate fireplace provides a warm air to the otherwise tomblike room. A verdant, detailed Slytherin banner hangs directly above it, its green tassels just touching the top of the mantlepiece. Dotted all over the room, carved mahogany chairs of every imaginable variety are spread throughout, each with its own unique design. A single, abnormally long sofa dominates the entire length of the southern wall, providing a small area of comfort towards any weary Slytherins who may come by. A flight of stairs fashioned out of smoothened stone lead upwards on the eastern side, leading away from the still, muffled atmosphere.

room.name: Dark Hallway
room.desc: This corridor has no source of light, yet a glow seems to radiate from an unknown source. The walls are plain and painted black, as are the ceiling and floor. The darkness of this hallway gives it an eerie and haunting feeling. Next to the heavy wooden door at the north end is a tall, marble statue of a wizard carrying a lance. Its eyes seem to trace the movements of those who pass through this creepy passageway.

room.name: Boys Lavatory
room.desc: Immense, sinewy stone walls create the apathetic feeling that trickles through this chilled chamber. Highly polished, steel-based torches cast ominous flickering shadows over the surroundings. Water drips from one of the basins dug into the stone sending stark, cold echoes ringing off the chamber walls. A highly polished mirror sits directly above the sinks, the weak light glinting sharply off its surface, almost begging for an on-looker. The exit lies through the door to the south.

extradesc.desc: The sinks and basins are made of dull steel. Thick mildew creeps around their seams.

roomecho.desc: A loud 'drip' echoes around the chamber.
A gurgling sound rises from one of the sinks. Thick green slime begins to pool around the plughole.

room.name: Girls Lavatory
room.desc: Polished stone covers the floor of the room. Rough, hewn walls jut out forming a barrier around the individual toilets - cutting them off as though made a pariah from their neighbors. Steel based torches scatter themselves along the walls, subtley spreading their light on the walls and floors. A long, rectangular piece of mirror stretches out across the wall opposite the stalls, gleaming in the light from the torches. Smooth, worn stone forms basins along the wall under the mirror. Spouts made from square-shaped, flattened holes bored into the walls to release water.

room.name: Storage Room*
room.desc: Reeking of a foul, putrid odour, this small room is covered with slimy liquid and encrusted with mouldy residue. The true colour of the walls is unrecognizable, as they are covered from ceiling to floor with numerous splatters and blotches. The ceiling has several spots and stains, several of which glow with a dim luminance. The floor slopes towards the middle, with a large grate in the centre of the room. The only visible exit to the room is through the door to the north.

extradesc.desc: This grate is situated in the middle of the room. Its iron bars look fairly new and are securely attached to the floor.
This material is dried or drying liquid, which ranges in every colour, shape, and hue.

roomecho.desc: The sound of somebody running can be heard out in the hallway.
A green, misty vapour rises out of the grate.

room.name: A Dusty Corridor
room.desc: The cement floor of this brightly lit corridor is cracked and chipped after years of being trodden on by the hurried footsteps of students. The air is cold and dry, as are the stone walls and ceiling. Heaps of dust, having accumulated in the corners over time, cause the place appear aged and unkept. A substantially thick layer of dust has settled itself upon the head and shoulders of a stone figure, which stands next to the wooden door on the north end of the passage way. Another wooden door leads out of the hallway on the west side, and is accompanied by a sign which reads "Caution: Do not enter."

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Unrelenting stone surfaces sidle either side of the passage, jutting profusely - almost daring the user to lean against their uncomfortable surfaces. Light lingers around faintly from the torches glimmering slightly, flickering in the draft that moves stealthily around the passage. To the East is what might be some sort of makeshift potions laboratory.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Hewn stone floors wind their way around the bottom of the passage, bits of mold growing within their cracks and edges. Meanacing walls made of stone stick their way out towards the center of the passage, cut roughly by the passage of time.

room.name: Corridor Of Lost Souls
room.desc: The air in this corridor is suddenly very still. It is so cold that it causes breath to mist. The floor, walls, and ceiling are all made of the same flat obsidian, its inky black surface reflecting no light. The only features of note are a few grim skull-shaped lanterns floating several metres off the ground.

extradesc.desc: The skulls have a menacing glare. They are leering, disturbing icons of death, the weak light spilling out of their eye sockets.
extradesc.keywords: skull skulls lantern lanterns light lights

roomecho.desc: An eerie whisper passes by echoing with half heard voices.
A small voice in one corner whispers "..we are so cold..."
Seemingly at once, voices from all corners of the room cry out in pain and then go deathly quiet again.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Cold, unforgiving stone lingers prominently within the surroundings of the passage. Light barely eminates from the torches that are placed sparatically around the area. Water can be heard trickling down the surface of the stone walls, while a cold draft winds its way around the users of the passage.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: The stench at this offshoot of the corridor is of a strange mixture of ingredients - chocolate, roses, plum pudding... - which might have smelled good individually but, combined by some well-intentioned potion maker, produce a foul, unbearable odor. A row of dirty cupboards line the wall; below this, the clutter of scientific equipment and books is so extreme that one might wonder if the corridor had been intentionally disordered.

extradesc.desc: The cupboards are spilling out with instruments and potion ingredients. The rosewood construction must once have been nice, before decades of neglect.

room.name: Stairs to the Dormitories
room.desc: Strange paintings and weirdly woven tapestries blanket the walls of a crooked and winding hallway. Some of the paintings' inhabitants stand upside down, gazing at the stone floor as if it were the ceiling. The tapestries are full of strange figures that resemble neither man nor beast. The floor slopes gently upward for a distance, then the hallway twists sharply to the east. The hallway is difficult to navigate at best and a single spiraling stairwell branches away from it, periodically shifting itself to align with another one of the doors below it. This hall is sure to confuse those with a lack of directional sense.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Jagged surfaces reach out from either side of the passageway, creating the surface of the walls, water glinting along their surfaces from the light that eminates off of the torches placed around the walls.

room.name: One-eyed witch hallway
room.desc: Torches line both sides of the hall and the flickering fires dimly lights a dirt floor and cold stone walls. An eerie grey statue of a hag in ragged robes stretches a bony, gnarled hand into the walking area. The statue has one false, pale green eye which moves despite the immobile form of the statue. The eye scans the length of the hallway and frequently fixes its shrewd stare on frightened passers by. Empty portrait frames of all shapes and sizes hang from the walls and the deserted corridor holds only empty echoes and a single, lonely statue. Rusted doors open to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: The one-eyed witch glares at maliciously with her single malicious eye. Her face is gnarled and her hunched figure is small but menacing. The few sparse strands of gray stone hair portruding from her scalp are whispy and haggard.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Moss is gathered between the rough stones and in the crevices where wall meets floor. Archways on either side are damp with water that drips from an unknown source. The cieling is low, a mere seven feet. The flagstones are chipped; some have loosened over time. Chiseled names are carved into the walls, a record of the few who have lingered here.

room.name: Passageway
room.desc: Cold, unforgiving stone winds its way around providing a path for the user. A chilling draft winds its way around the jagged surface of the walls that encompass the passageway. Light from the strategically placed torches glint off of the water that trickles down the surface of the walls.

room.name: Hogwarts Crest
room.desc: Beautiful marble floors shine up from this landing. The stairs creep downward to the entrance hall lying behind, and wind their way into two different directions ahead. To the left hangs the Hogwarts crest, crafted from iron with guilded golden edges. The lion and serpent face one another, each with their corresponding house colors in the background, sparkling with gold along their edges. The badger and raven represent their houses along the bottom of the crest, each glinting with their guilded edges. A large "H" resides in the center of al of these creatures, with all of its edges highly polished making this symbolof the school shine.

room.name: Votive Hall
room.desc: Somber gray walls are lit by ancient oil lamps suspended from the ceiling by heavy metal chains. The shadowy light illuminates a portrait on the south wall. A teenaged boy, dressed in a red and green plaid kilt, is leaning against a stone wall. His pale blue eyes are looking away, but tears are clearly running down the side of his face. Golden locks are tucked behind his ear and a lone stem of purple Heather is in his right hand. Inscribed at the bottom of the gilded gold frame are the words, "Per mere, Per terras". Directly under the painting is a small table filled with votive candles and a medallion imprinted with a thistle. The door way to the west is imprinted with faded Gaelic characters and the passage extends east.

room.name: Mosaic Room
room.desc: The upper walls in this corridor are home to a tiled mosaic. The tiles are cream in colour and bordered by a black and white chequered pattern. Zooming lazily around the mosaic, and occasionally trailing his hands through the air, is a lonely Seeker made of black tiles. There is no snitch to be seen. Lining the walls are colourful pennants representing each of the houses accomplishments on the Quidditch Pitch. Standing in pairs along the hallway are twelve great, claw-footed iron candelabras. Each has room enough for three candles. Emblazoned on the back of the door leading into this corridor is the Hogwarts school crest. The crest looks as if it has been burnt into the wood. East and west of here the passage extends on.

room.name: Glacial Corridor
room.desc: A mural on the south wall of the corridor catches the eye. It depicts a mountain stream struggling to break through the last of the winter ice. Water trickles down boulders into a small pool filled with pieces of ice that are just starting to melt away in the spring sun. The north wall is a collection of three gigantic glass windows that add light and warmth to the room. The corners of the windows have stained glass insets of bluebirds. The pale green curtains, tied back with silver cords, allow much light in during the day. Warmed by the sun, the bare stone floor radiates heat. The vaulted ceiling is almost four meters high and adds to the general airy feeling in the room. Sconces filled with fresh flowers are attached to the walls on either side of the passage. The corridor extends to the east and west.

room.name: Unicorn Passage
room.desc: Indigo velvet curtains hide both of the dark stone walls of this short, wide corridor. In one section on the north wall, the draperies have been pulled back and secured with golden tassels to reveal an ancient tapestry. The faded scarlet background is embroidered with pale purple thistles. A lone unicorn raised on its hind legs dominates the foreground. Despite the age of the work, the blue eye still sparkle with life. The white coat glistens as it romps through the tapestry. Around its neck is a fine gold chain baring a charm in the shape of crown. A single ivory votive candle is placed on a small mahogany table underneath the tapestry. The entryways to the west and north ends of the hall are draped in fine gold silk embroidered with small crosses.

room.name: Warrior's Corridor
room.desc: Water is dripping somewhere in the distance. A chill fills the long stone corridor. A deep stone archway lies at the south end. The west wall is decorated with tarnished short swords. In the center of the display is a large round shield covered with leather. Silver studs form circle and diamond patterns around the outside edge. In the center is a large silver plate engraved with ancient symbols. Behind the shield, two silver swords with richly decorated basket handles are crossed. Their ends have been sharpened to dazzling points. The eastern wall is home to a fine etching of a warrior. He holds the selfsame shield that is featured on the opposite wall. His leather armor has been pierced and blood is running from an open wound. Candles fill a dusty pewter chandelier suspended from the center of the hallway, giving shadowy light to the cobwebbed corners of the hall, which extends to the north and south.

room.name: Edgar Stroulger Corridor
room.desc: The highly polished, cherry-wood floors of this corridor are inlaid with contrasting beech and mahogany woods in small, medallion-shaped patterns. Ethereal sequences of eight yellow-paned, pewter lanterns are attached to the walls at regular intervals. On one side of the corridor are two, elongated notice boards. They take up almost the entire length of the corridor and are framed by plum-stained wood. Across the walkway, flanking a bust of Edgar Stroulger, inventor of the Sneakoscope, are two circular windows. At their widest points, they rest only centimetres above the floor and finish just as the ceiling begins. The upper half of each window is streaked with grime. A corridor begins to the east while this corridor extends to the north and south.

room.name: Cheerful hallway
room.desc: The smell from the kitchens down below wafts up through the open end of the corridor and flows down its length. An old forgotten harpsichord sits in a corner. A large, crackling fireplace on the east wall creates an atmosphere of warmth and cheeriness. The fragrant smells and flickering light seep into the corners of the corridor, and even the paintings seem to give off a happy glow. A portrait of a matronly witch in brick red robes tends to her children on the west wall, while a portly-looking man with rosy cheeks plays exploding snap with his friend in a painting above the fireplace. The chatter of the painted children and the occasional bang as the exploding snap games come to an end add cheerful luster to the welcoming hall. The exits lead to the south and west.

room.name: Golden corridor
room.desc: The walls are made of pale golden sandstone. Small triangular shaped windows allow sunlight to pour in near the top of the east wall. The center window bears a gold overlay of a falcon in flight. Symbols encased in ovals are etched into the stones under the windows. The west wall is broken in two by a column standing from floor to ceiling. It is not the Doric or ionic of the Greeks, but rather flower shaped. It has a long stem with a bud, surrounded by sepals that have not yet bloomed near the ceiling. The archways to the west and south are wider at the bottom and narrower at the top. An ancient etching of an eye hangs above the north door.

room.name: Montague Knightley Corridor
room.desc: Next to each of the two doors leading into this corridor, cast in shadows, are deep recesses set into the wall, directly opposite one another. Centred between the recesses are two pairs of smooth, towering stone pillars. The pillars are built in the same material as the walls and ceiling; a rough sandstone. The floor is made of grey and brown slate. Half-way up the walls, painted on the stone, is a border of faded red wizard chess pieces. In between two of the pillars, on one side of the corridor, is a bust of the Wizard Chess Champion, Montague Knightley, quietly mumbling away. An odd number of torches are attached to the opposite wall. Exits lay to the east and west of here.

roomecho.desc: The bust of Montague Knightley shouts "No one ever won a game by resigning!"
The bust of Montague Knightley barks "Chess is war!!"

room.name: Rural Corridor
room.desc: A deep golden runner spans the length of the hall. The corridor is brightly lit by huge brass lanterns that flicker every so often. On the north wall is a painting framed in bronze of a young woman hanging laundry on a line outside. She is dressed in a faded gray gown. In the background is a small wooden farmhouse with a large brick chimney. Small yellow chickens are pecking at the ground the woman's feet. It looks as though she is singing while she works. A large tabby cat is sunning himself near the open front door. He is plainly ignoring the two field mice scampering about the painting. The hall extends on to the west and to the east.

room.name: Festive Hall
room.desc: The short hall is decorated festively in scarlet and royal blue. Narrow stripped banners are placed in evenly spaced increments along both stone walls. A checkered runner hides cold slab flooring. In between the scarlet and royal blue banners are small oil paintings of fruits and vegetables. On the south wall, two banners have been removed to accommodate a large oil painting depicting mealtime. Servants dressed in gray are hastily setting a feast table. The settings contain only plates, wine goblets, and silver knives. The dinning room is decorated in a variety of plaid wall hangings. In the center of the oval table are several pewter pitchers and a large silver platter holding a gigantic haggis. At close look, the stomach of the sheep appears to fidget. A large set of oak doors mark the entrance to the Hospital Wing, while opposite the hall extends eastward. Perpendicularly, the hall extends to the north and south.

room.name: Lunar Passage
room.desc: Etched into the ceiling of this corridor is a shallow relief depicting the various phases of the moon. The carving of the full moon is fractured. There are five, large rectangular windows along one side of this corridor. A few of the sand-coloured stones in the window ledges are loose and a couple of them are even missing. The three, centre windows share a leadlight scene of large, lilac flowers set against a background of green and gold. On the opposite wall is a dark, pokey fireplace. The fireplace is so small that not even a house elf could stand in it and still be clearly seen. The iron grate and surrounding tiled hearth are muted against the ivory-coloured stone mantle. The passage extends to the north and to the south.

room.name: Scroll Corridor
room.desc: A thin metal trunk sits firmly against the east wall, leaving barely enough room to pass through the narrow corridor. The trunk is propped open with a large green book that has been shoved between the hinges. Hundreds of scrolls have been carelessly piled inside, to the point of overflowing onto the bare wooden floor. Above the top of the trunk is a wooden framed painting. A desk is pictured sideways and a wooden chair is pushed back, almost out of view. On top of the desk is a scroll, much like the ones on the floor. A quill rests on the scroll and a jar of ink has toppled over. The ink appears to be wet, as though someone has recently left in a hurry. There is a doorway west, opposite the trunk, and a brightly lit archway to the north. Extending north and south is a continuation of the corridor.

room.name: Starburst Ceiling Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is lit by silvery-bursts of light bobbing against the high ceiling. There are narrow veins of gold, woven into the circular patterns on the floor, glinting in the lights from above and snaking their way under the walls. On the south wall are three small portraits. They're just big enough to show the faces of three middle-aged wizards all with dark, unkempt hair and cinnamon-coloured eyes. Opening up this room, on the north wall, are two long windows placed either side of a solid oak door leading to the courtyard outside. The windows reach from the floor to the ceiling and are the width of an average adult wizard. The corridor also follows the castle to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: The wizard in the centre portrait starts to giggle quietly to himself.
A fat, brown rat scuttles through the north exit and out into the courtyard.
A group of grubby-faced Hufflepuff students pauses to catch their breath on the other side of the windows.
All three wizards in the portraits yawn loudly.

room.name: Carved Bookshelf Corridor
room.desc: The stones in the southern wall of this corridor have been carved out to resemble row upon row of books of varying heights. The titles of the books are little more than illegible, shallow indentations on the faded, painted spines. Above the highest row of books is a ceiling speckled with jagged orbs of silvery-starlight. The lights follow the deep arch of the ceiling and are most concentrated at the arch's highest point. The north wall has a door leading to the courtyard outside and five medium-sized arch windows. The doorway has been set slightly off-centre and is bordered by heavy grey stones. The corridor also continues to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: A small cloud of dust blows up as a rat squeaks along the top row of books.
A tall Gryffindor student opens the north door and pokes her head inside before turning away and closing the door.
Four Ravenclaw students pass through the corridor loudly quizzing each other from an open text book.

room.name: Leo Constellation Corridor
room.desc: Behind the gentle spheres of shining light, floating serenely inches below the ceiling, etched into the stones, is the constellation of Leo; a faint outline of the beast has been rendered over the star chart. Adding to the light given off from above are three, giant, iron hands, each holding a long, tapered red candle. The hands have been placed at regular intervals, about two-thirds the way up the south wall and are secured in place by two fat spikes through each wrist. On the opposite wall is a door leading to a courtyard. On either side of the door are four medium-sized arched windows. The floor is covered in a rich, red runner, patterned with small, white fleur-de-lis. As well as the door the north, the corridor extends into the castle towards the east and west.

roomecho.desc: The iron hand in the centre tightens its grip on the candle.
A great crowd of students from every house push their way through the north door and out, into the courtyard.
Shouting from the distance echoes down the corridor.
A chubby Ravenclaw passes by paying you no attention; their nose buried in "Magical Drafts and Potions".
Moonlight pours through the windows into pools on the floor.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: White flagstones lead out onto an open grass area. Roses bloom on bushes at the sides, their pink petals contrasting the rich green leaves. The Hogwarts crest sits high on a towering wall, looking over the rest of the courtyard. White pillars with noticeable finger marks stand at intervals along the entrances, and passageways linking different towers run above them. A large clock opposes the school crest, its large pendulum dominating the far corridor. Large parts of the castle loom in from all directions.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: The white pillars in this part of the courtyard are overshadowed by a large tree, which is planted in the northwest corner. Dug into the lawn, in a semi-circle, starting at the base of the tree, are irregular-shaped stepping stones are made of the same material as the pillars. The roses edging the courtyard continue along the northern wall, broken only by the arched entrance inset between the pillars. Towards the east can be seen a large clock and to the south, an ornate sundial. White flagstone to the north leads into the castle, while the grassy courtyard extends to the east, south, west, southeast and southwest.

roomecho.desc: Early morning mist rolls over the grounds.
A loud group of students meander from the north, passing right through and disappearing to the south.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: A large clock is sitting on the stone-work of the eastern wall in this area of the courtyard. Elegant black hands stand out in stark contrast to the ivory colour of its face. Large, brown, water-stains bleed into the wall directly below the clock and a large, green-bronze, pendulum swings heavily above the eastern exit. Both the eastern and northern exits are framed by imposing white pillars smudged with finger marks. The lawn here is very green, and compliments nicely, the colours in the rose bushes that border the northern and eastern walls. Visible to the west is a large tree and to the southwest an ornate sundial. There are white flagstones leading into the castle to the north and east, while the courtyard continues to the south, west and southwest.

roomecho.desc: In the afternoon lull the ticking of the clock can clearly be heard.
The quiet of these early hours is interrupted by a loud "thunk" as the minute hand shifts its position.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: This area of the courtyard is home to sturdy wooden benches. They are situated next to white pillars, on either side of the passageways back into the castle, and have high solid backs, so as to prevent sitting too close to the pink rose bushes that are blooming along the edge of the courtyard. The roses blend seamlessly with the creeping vines running from behind them, and around the pillars marking the eastern and southern exits. In plain sight to the east is an ornate sundial and to the northwest is a large tree. A white flagstone path leads into the castle towards the east and the south, while the courtyard continues to the north, west and northwest.

roomecho.desc: A worried looking Ravenclaw marches with his head down from the west and into the castle via the southern exit.
A light-coloured cat scampers past and disappears to the north.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: The centre of this part of the courtyard is dominated by an immense golden sundial resting upon a great slab of circular grey granite. It sits above ground, roughly two-fists high and is as wide as a small giant is tall. The roman numerals engraved around the edge of the dial are time-worn and blackened. There are small weedy flowers growing around the base of the granite slab. The hedge of pink-flowering rose bushes that line the southern wall are punctuated by dirty white pillars that stand either side of a southern exit. Visible to the north is a large tree, to the west is a pond and to the northwest is a clock face set into a towering wall. White flagstones lead into the castle towards the south and the grassy courtyard lays to the north, east, west, northeast and northwest.

roomecho.desc: A beetle scurries across the surface of the sundial.
Shadows flicker on the ground as an owl flies overhead.

room.name: Courtyard
room.desc: In the southwestern corner of this section of courtyard is a dainty pond. Behind it are rose bushes, with pink blooms, bordering the walls. They continue either side of the white pillars marking exits to the west and the south. The pond is made of small stone boulders, which grow even smaller in size as they mix in with the grass. Towards the north, sitting high on a wall, is the Hogwarts crest, to the east is a sundial and to the northeast is a large tree. White flagstone leads into the castle, past white pillars, to the west and south. The courtyard extends to the north, east and northeast.

roomecho.desc: A small group students pass by the western doorway laughing and pushing each other.
A splashing sound comes from the pond.

room.name: Smiling Couple Corridor
room.desc: This dreary, low-hung corridor is lit up by a large portrait on the north wall. It reaches from almost the floor to the ceiling and is wide enough to show a life-size witch and wizard smiling happily under an archway covered in blue flowers. The floor is patterned from east to west by a mosaic of overlapping squares in muted tones of creams, yellows and bordered at the east end by black. On the southern wall, opposite the painting is an exit leading to a courtyard. Either side of this doorway are three windows, each only just large enough to climb through. Stationed between each window is a crude torch. There is an exit to the south and the corridor stretches to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: A cool draught is coming from between the loose stones around the windows.
The wizard in the painting turns around as if he'd heard something in the background.
Laughter filters in from the courtyard outside.
A small mouse squeezes through a gap in the southern wall and disappears.
A tall Ravenclaw student drops her wand and scrambles to pick it up before disappearing east.

room.name: Muggle Artifacts Passageway
room.desc: Composed of limestone, this passageway is lighted by torches set in brackets along the walls. Varying muggle artifacts are featured in display boxes. In one display box a Muggle pen and pencil set are displayed with a sign underneath it. In another display, a gun is presented with a silver plaque explaining its purpose. Aside from the various displays along the walls, a television sits in the centre of the room. The television is described with gilted lettering. Next to it is a Muggle photograph demonstrating the differences between Muggle photography and Wizard photography. To the south is a continually revolving door, while to the west is an archway covered in blue flowers.

extradesc.desc: "Though Muggles once used quills and ink as we did, they soon decided to complicate things by inventing these complex, mechanized, writing utensils."
"This is a Muggle weapon devised as they are unable to use wands. It ejects a piece of metal that is able to maim or kill Muggles."
"As Muggles are unable to animate their photographs,, they created this box for moving pictures. It apparently captures waves from the air and generates moving illustrations."

roomecho.desc: As two students survey the gun, one shakes his head and says, "So a piece of metal can kill Muggles? Odd."

room.name: Agnes Waterhouse Hall
room.desc: Along the western wall large, pane glass windows look out upon the courtyard beyond. The ceiling, walls, and floor consist of pink brick in a Herringbone pattern. The eastern wall holds three tapestries weaved in rich colours of reds, blues, and purples. The first tapestry depicts a witch being hanged from a scaffold while a mob of people scream at her. The second tapestry portrays men carrying the lifeless witch to a cemetery, laying her down, then walking away. The third tapestry shows the witch rising with great mirth, hopping onto her broom, and flying away. Beneath the tapestries a golden plaque explains the illustrations in detail. A scarlet door to the east leads to Gryffindor Tower. Westward is a round top archway that leads to the courtyard. A box archway leads one north. A constantly revolving door leads to the south.

extradesc.desc: "In 1563, the Muggles passed the Witchcraft Bill under their leader, Queen Elizabeth I. The first witch to be 'punished' was Agnes Waterhouse. As depicted here, she was hanged for being a witch and the Muggles assumed that they had killed her. They were unaware of Waterhouse performing a Dysmorta Spell, causing her to appear to be dead. After the spell wore off, she simply retrieved her broom and flew away laughing."

roomecho.desc: People from the tapestry are yelling, "Kill her! Kill the witch!"

room.name: Spinning Circle Junction
room.desc: The square, flat ceiling in this junction has four great score marks along it's length, running from east to west. These marks have divided the stones into section and each section is a different shade of grey stone, ranging from almost black to a bright pearly-grey colour. The stones of the floor have been arranged in seven concentric circles of alternating blues and browns. These colours are reflected in the robes of the wizard in a painting on the east wall. The painting almost completely obscures the wall and shows a wizard running in circles, being chased by a bowtruckle. On either side of the painting are two free-standing candelabras. The exits lay to the north and west.

roomecho.desc: The wizard in the painting lets out a loud "Yaaa-eeeee".
The fourth circle from the centre turns ninety degrees anti-clockwise.
The sixth circle from the centre turns forty-five degrees clockwise.
The third circle spins three-hundred and sixty degrees clockwise.
A loud bang reverberates around the room as a stormy-looking Hufflepuff slams the north door and stomps through to the west.
Slowly, a transparent sphere pushes itself into the room from between two loose stones and floats across the passage way only to disappear in the opposite wall.
Shuffling through the passage, a house elf quietly passes from north to west.

room.name: Saturn Clock Corridor
room.desc: On the east wall is a large clock taking up most of the space. The face of the clock is patterned with Saturn's seal directly onto the stones and the numbers are bronze, and have been placed close to the outer bronze-ring. The hands are iron and have minor decoration at the tips. Covering the floor is an L-shaped runner, from the west to the north. The runner is dark blue and quite plain. The south wall is dominated a large, rectangular alcove, in which rests a shallow pewter basin. Inside the basin the orange flames burn brightly. Above the alcove is the head of a Hippogriff carved in the same stone as the walls. The only visible exits are to the north and to the west.

roomecho.desc: A muffled groan vibrates through the walls as the minute hand moves slowly around the clock face.
A Ravenclaw student is laughing animatedly along with a lanky Gryffindor as they pass through the corridor from north to west.
The flames die down briefly before flaring back into life.
The temperature suddenly drops a few degrees.
A translucent head pops through the clock-face somewhere near five o'clock and gives a cheeky wink before disappearing.

room.name: The Records Room
room.desc: Enormous steel filing cabinets line the stone walls of this spacious room, labeled with the names of the various students and teachers who reside in Hogwarts. A strong oak table rests in the center of the room stacked with carefully sharpened quills and blank parchment. Assorted armchairs surround the table with brightly lighted lanterns resting beside them.

room.name: Tapestried Hall
room.desc: This corridor is resplendent in the vivid tapestries that line the walls. In the narrow gaps between the tapestries on one wall are cramped little windows, only just wide enough to be windows and not just merely gaps between the stones. The tapestries themselves are crudely detailed portrayals of various Quidditch matches through the ages. There are no dates or any otherwise distinguishing marks that may give any clue as to when these matches took place. The floor of this corridor is uneven with protruding stones and the occasional shallow-dip where one has gone missing. Growing along the edge of the wall, along the floor and in amongst the jutting stones and tiny crevices, are small, plump weeds. Numbering less than ten, but more than five, around half of them are in bloom with delicate pink flowers, contrasting with their deep green stems and leaves. The hallway extends to the north and to the east.

room.name: Mossy Curtain Corridor
room.desc: Along the top of this corridor, growing over the rounded faces of the tawny stones, are long hair-like tendrils of deep sea-green moss. They are draped over the protruding walls like airy curtains. Extruding out from the moss are greening, wooden candlesticks, secured to the wall by heavy iron brackets. The darker stones of the ceiling and floor are pitted and pock-marked from years of abuse. Along the lower halves of the walls, out of reach from the plant-life, are pillars of stone about the height of two quaffles stacked on top of one another. The pillars are made from sandstone and are very smooth. They are spaced equally apart along both walls of this passage. There are exits to the north and to the south.

roomecho.desc: The mossy curtains shift gently in a faint breeze.
A scruffy looking Ravenclaw skids to a halt half-way along the corridor before running south again.

room.name: Western Corridor
room.desc: One part of this hallway swerves inward, yielding to the form of a tower at the West end of the castle. The ground here comprises hundreds of clean, smooth cobbles arranged in artistic tiling patterns. A few of the stray pebbles have been sweeped to one side, leaving behind small holes in the floor. The door in the curved Western wall is made of a thin, flexible wood, which is plying apart in places. To the South, torches line the walls above eye-level, although the path leading to the Western tower is lit only by a lantern emitting a blue ambient light.

room.name: Arithmancy Office
room.desc: The office is very lustrously lit by four torches that line the tops of the east and west walls. The merry firelight casts a warm glow over a very magnificent room. The floor is made of a caramel coloured wood and is polished to shine, but a deep gold and red oriental rug covers most of the area. A large desk and two plush armchairs swathe the eastern quarter of the room. The walls are made of the same caramel coloured wood as the floor. Shelves upon shelves of books and various Arithmancy items line the walls, and portraits of Arithmancy legends hang atop the shelves. There are two exits, one to the south and one to the west.

extradesc.desc: The shelves are made of a dark cherry wood, and are about 9' tall. The top most shelf is full of Arithmancy items such as an abacus that's balls are constantly moving, and a compass that not only makes the circles, it gives you the circumference, diameter, and radius. The lower shelves are packed with books, all of which have names like "Playing with Polynomials" and "Delving Into Degrees".

roomecho.desc: The portraits passionately discuss various Arithmancy theories with one another.

room.name: Residence
room.desc: An oriental rug in various shades of gold and red lie in the center of the room. Atop the rug is an intricate oak, four poster bed with the curtains pulled back. A worn, squashy quilt lies on the matress, looking warm and inviting. A fireplace against one of the walls crackles softly, its light casting a warm glow and creating a warm soothing aura in the room. An old trunk lies at the foot of the bed, locked.

room.name: A Supply Closet
room.desc: Small compared to one of the classrooms, a single unlit torch hangs on the wall opposite the door. Old brooms and mops have been carefully placed in racks hanging from the rough stone walls. Empty bucks and bottles of cleaning detergents lay on the floor in the back of the closet. An odd assortment of other cleaning utensils lean against the back wall.

room.name: An Unused Classroom
room.desc: Very little light filters in through the large dirt encrusted windows of this grungy classroom. The thick stone walls that encompass this room are covered with the same brownish coat of dirt as the filthy windows. Broken desks, tables and chairs take up a large portion of this room, slowly accumulating layer after layer of dirt and dust. Empty ink bottles and broken quills litter the floor along with other bits of unidentifiable rubbish. A dusty wooden door leads out into the corridor to the south.

extradesc.desc: The tall windows are filled with dirt and dusty, making them more translucent than transparent.
The dark walls have thick layers of dirt and grim built up on them.
Stacked in messy piles and leaning up against walls, the chairs, tables, and desks are broken, filthy, and falling apart.
Scatter around the room and hiding among the bits of rubbish are several broken and bent quills as well as a few empty and cracked bottles of ink.

roomecho.desc: A chunk of dirt falls from one of the windows to land on the floor with a thunk.
A chilly drafts finds a way in through one of the windows, making the dust in the air swirl.
A couple of Gryffindor students sneak into the classroom to practice their newest spells.

room.name: First Draft Storeroom
room.desc: This out-of-the-way storehouse has bare stone walls, faintly luminous with moldy slime. The floor is also made of stone, while the ceiling is fairly high up and also made of stone. Jars, and urns of various sizes, most sealed at the top with beeswax, are ranged about the room, with smaller ones stacked upon a shelf. The exit to the east is covered with a large, wooden door.

extradesc.desc: There are several large urns standing five feet in height and also several smaller urns sitting on the shelf.
The shelf contains several urns as well as several jars containg potion ingredients.
A large amount of jars litter the ground, with small ones residing on the shelf.

roomecho.desc: A chill radiates the air as several ghosts pass through the room.
A small mouse scurries through a small crack in the wall.

room.name: Ravenclaw Tower - Ground Floor
room.desc: Hewn stone encompasses the circular room as light filters through the room from the fireplace against the wall. Candles are littered strategically around the chamber. A large, thick banner in blue and bronze bearing the Ravenclaw crest adorns the wall above the fireplace. Across the room plush armchairs welcome all who enter. A long oak table, with matching benches on either side of it, rests to the side fo the room.

extradesc.desc: Solid, hewn stone form the walls of the tower, stretching from floor to ceiling.
Laid with thick red bricks, the fireplace crackles warmly by the wall, allowing light into the tower.
Thick, drippy, wax candles line the walls and are scattered about on various surfaces and furniture, providing light where it is needed.
The stone walls of the tower curve inward to form a circular room.

The room seems to be covered with bits and pieces of homework. Star charts cover long scrolls of parchment. Essays fill pieces of paper. A glow spreads from some of the objects in the room from the magic spells that were cast on them for practice.

roomecho.desc: Several Ravenclaw students wander into the tower and make themselves comfortable for a long study session.
A fifth year Ravenclaw, studying for his OWLs, accidentally knocks a bottle of ink over one of his books.
Flames flicker warmly in the fireplace.
A cold draft whistles through the tower, making the flames in the fireplace and on the candles flicker wildly.

room.name: High Voltage Lightning Room
room.desc: This room is very dark. The ceiling above is covered with clouds, and a dark grey mist. Suddenly, a great surge of lightning forms from a cloud above, and makes instant contact with a metal rod located on the hard, stone floor. The metal rod magically transfers the lightning to a light bulb that is connected to it. That magic light bulb gives life and light to an adjacent light bulb, and so on across the entire room. The lit room now reveals various pieces of artwork about weather. Every few minutes, the light source fades, and the room fades to pitch black. The energy from the clouds sends shivers throughout the room, as another lightning bolt strikes, forcing more light into the area. In the centre of the room is a relatively small glass cage. Exits are to the east, south, and west.
