extradesc.desc: Inside this glass display is a cloud that fills up most of the box. It is solid and pure white, then suddenly transforms into a stormy rain cloud, and produces gushes of rain. It then gives out lightning, and you can hear the faint sound of its thunder. Suddenly, the cloud goes back to solid, pure white, and starts over again.

One painting shows a cliff overlooking a raging sea. Dark grey clouds produce lightning as the wind blows. Another painting depicts a rainstorm falling over a small town, causing small streams through the street. The last painting is of a tornado destroying large green fields in a wide open area.

roomecho.desc: A lightning bolt strikes, lighting up the room slowly.
A crackle of thunder sounds from above.

room.name: Dim Hallway
room.desc: A crack in the ceiling above allows a sliver of light from the floor above to shine through. The tiny crack is the only source of light in the large, dusty hallway. The light dimly reveals the outlines of several rusty old suits of armour stationed on the east wall of the room as well as a few creaky old doors. The floor of the hall is smooth and bare except for a thin layer of settled dust. The walls surrounding the hall are just barely visible by the light, but the openings to corridors on the north, south and west are seen as only cavernous dark gaps in the wall.

extradesc.desc: In the dim light, the suit of armour could pass for a living soldier. It is arranged with one hand on its hip and the other on the hilt of its sword, like a knight ready to do battle. In the dim light, the growing spots of rust are barely visible.

roomecho.desc: Something creaks ominously in the darkness beyond the feeble scope of the flicker of light.

room.name: Wizard's Chess Passage
room.desc: . Flowing along both walls are stretched, pinched windows running parallel to the floor. The glass in the windows is olive green and full of tiny, trapped bubbles. The hall runner, made of heavy material in the same shade as the glass, is full of dust. The silver thread sewn into the runner along the border still sparkles though its age is obvious. A spattering of paintings hang along both walls. None of them are placed at the same height and all of them are showing a great variety of wizards in various stages of Wizard Chess. The high ceiling gives the corridor an imposing air. This is not made better by the stately candelabras protruding from the walls far above head height. The hallway extends to the north and south and a passage begins running east.

room.name: Frosty Corridor
room.desc: Icy cold air blasts through the cracked windows. A small window at the eastern end has been propped open with a small black cauldron, while a broomstick decorated with silver and green ribbon is resting against the north doorway. On the south wall is a vase filled with frost covered poppies. The vase is standing on a small table that has been painted pale blue to match the walls. It provides the illusion that the vase is suspended in mid air by the wind blowing through the corridor. Above the vase is a silver candelabrum, whose magic, black taper candles, have been snuffed by the weather repeatedly. East and west is an extention of the corridor.

room.name: Grandfather Clock Hall
room.desc: A faint ticking noise vibrates through the crisp, dry air of the hallway rhythmically. A single stately grandfather clock constructed from smooth mahogany stands alone on the north wall. The face of the clock is fairly normal, with twelve golden Roman numerals arranged at even intervals on a circle, but the body of the clock holds, instead of the customary pendulum, a strange liquid material much like that of a pensieve. A layer of glass holds the silvery liquid inside the clock and the liquid shifts itself constantly, forming vague images from the past. Looking into the chamber containing the mercurial material is like looking into a crystal ball. There are no clearly defined lines, only blurry images open to interpretation and imagination.

room.name: Mural Hallway
room.desc: A long dark rug extends down the length of the corridor, covering the stone floor. Both walls are not the customary shade of dark gray. Sprawling, magnificent murals in brilliant colors of magical paint have been painted on both the north and south walls. A large but plain chandelier hangs from the ceiling and a wide window high on the east wall illuminate the breathtaking murals. The drawings depict almost every aspect of student life at Hogwarts, set in motion through the properties of magical paint. A young, red-haired witch struggles to contain the green potion overflowing from her cauldron; several happily chatting Ravenclaws eat lunch in the Great Hall; and there is even a live quidditch game between Gryffindor and Hufflepuff taking place on the south wall.

room.name: Shadowy Corner
room.desc: Although the gray stone walls are plain and unadorned, they are in no way ordinary. Occasionally, strange shadows flicker across the walls, even when the hallway is empty. The mysterious shadows are stealthy and diverse. Sometimes they resemble a squat man with a wide-brimmed hat. Other times the show a slender young witch carrying a tray full of cookies. No one is quite sure where the shadows come from or what their purpose is on the wall, but their presence has never done anyone harm. Even when students stop to watch in amazement, the shadows continue to slide across the plain grey wall, oblivious to the living world.

roomecho.desc: The shadow of a plump matronly witch and her child flicker around the corner. The witch grasps the childs hand and marches purposefully across the wall with the child trotting obediently in her wake.

room.name: Ordinary Hallway
room.desc: A magnificent chandelier dangles from the ceiling and illuminates the smooth stone walls. There are a few furnishings and decorations in the hall, but nothing extraoridnary. A large furry rug covers the floor, and a cushioned bench stands along the west wall. A portrait hanging above the bench shows a wizard bundled in thick furs, braving a ferocious blizzard, holding his lighted wand before him. On the east wall hangs a large tapestry showing a fierce goblin rebellion and an embroided title at the top reads "The Last Stand of Murkak the Mighty". The hallway is simply as normal as a Hogwarts hallway can be.

room.name: Cross Corridor
room.desc: A lone faded tapestry covers the west wall. Near the top is a coat of arms. The embroidery, a fisted iron hand holding a cross, has long since lost is color. The names have all but disappeared from view and appear to have been written in an ancient language. The light cast by two tall pillar candles on either side of the tapestry highlights the intricate design. The rest of the hallway is shrouded in darkness. A faint shadow of light comes through a crack in the east wall where the mortar has crumbled from between the light gray stones. The corridor extends further north and south.

room.name: Curved Corner
room.desc: Instead of the normal, angular turning of the hallway, the wall smoothly makes a curved, ninety degree turn. Silver candelabras stand at three meter intervals along both walls, holding dozens of white candles. When lit, the candles emit a soft glow that bathes the hallway in warm, yellow light. A lone portrait hangs on the wall. The portrait itself is curved to fit the unique shape of the wall, much to the displeasure of its occupant. In fact, the rotund witch who occupies the portrait spends much of her time hiding behind a bookshelf, complaining that the bent shape of her portrait distorts her features. The curved hallway opens to the north and the west.

extradesc.desc: The curved portrait hugs the wall and depicts a large, spacious library. The witch within is rarely seen and spends all of her time reading books behind a bookshelf, hiding from the sight of prying visitors. However, the occasional bitter mutter of "ridiculous portrait makes me look fat" offers proof of her existence.

room.name: Spacious Hallway
room.desc: The high vaulted ceilings of the hallway give it an imposing and stately appearance. The series of statues that line both walls are not ordinary suits of armor or crude lifeless structures, their smooth gray surfaces are expertly carved to make them seem almost lifelike. A striking statue on the east wall shows a young wizard struggling to tame a rampant hippogriff, his face contorted in strain and concentration. A window mounted high on the western wall shows the state of the sky outside, giving the hallway a distinctive flexibility in atmosphere. On a bright, sunny day, the hallway is majestic and graceful, but on a stormy night, the fires lit by the house elves illuminate the figures in an eerily flickering light, giving the impression that the statues are alert and watching.

extradesc.desc: The gray stone statue of a young wizard has blank eyes, but a determined expression. His wizard's hat has fallen to the floor in the struggle. He weilds a long slender wand in his right hand but the hippogriffs clawed leg has pinned the wand hand to the floor. His left arm is raised protectively over his face, pushing the hippogriff's snapping beak away.

roomecho.desc: a soft scratching noise issues from behind one of the statues, echoing though the dark hallway

room.name: Small Corridor
room.desc: There are no doors leading into this squat little passage. Instead, its entrances slide into the adjoining corridors, blending in sneakily. The hall runner in here is very dark brown threadbare. There is a faint, chocolate brown, hounds tooth pattern on the carpet. Hovering out of reach are many stubby candles. Down one side of this corridor, carved into the floor is a shallow channel, disappearing at either end into a hole in the floor. The hole is just smaller than a galleon. On the same side as the channel is a portrait of a stately looking witch in vermilion robes. Her greying hair is pulled into an immaculate roll and she has a pewter grey owl on her shoulder. The other wall is completely bare. The corridor extends on to the east and west.

room.name: Hall of Headboys and Headgirls
room.desc: The wide, straight corridor is lined portraits of former Hogwarts headboys and headgirls on the north and south walls. The portraits date from some twenty years back when the tradition was started. Most of the paintings are of studious young men and women, chewing on the ends of their quills and contemplating the theory behind human transfiguration. However, a few social exceptions visit each other to play gobstones or toss a quaffle around. Percy Weasley's painting hangs among the others, and the freckle-faced overachiever dutifully glares at the other portraits, telling them off for making too much noise.

extradesc.desc: Percy is wearing his standard black Hogwarts robes with his headboy badge pinned carefully onto his chest. He usually sits alone in his portrait, reading the "Prefects Who Gained Power" book he bought in Diagon Alley, his browed furrowed in concentration. However, his favorite hobby is throwing scathing looks at the neighboring paintings and shushing them loudly when their activities become too rowdy.

room.name: Silk Corridor
room.desc: Decorating the ceiling is a wide strip of grey silk extending the entire length of the corridor. It curves up delicately and gathers in the centre of the passage around a circular, iron chandelier. The chandelier is severe with sharp spikes surrounding its edge and a heavy black chain disappearing up and into the silk. The silk is patterned with diamonds barely distinguishable against the grey of the material. Starting thirty centimetres from each doorway and one-third of the way up each wall, every second stone is also engraved with the outline of a diamond. To the east is a long corridor. This corridor extend to the north and south.

room.name: Cramped Hallway
room.desc: The air in the corridor is unbearably stuffy and damp, weighing heavily downward and pressing suffocatingly inward. The hallway is too warm and humid to allow suits of armour or portraits, so the bare walls are moist with a thin layer of water, and a soft green layer of mold has begun to grow on some of the stones. The hallway is windowless and lit by a single resilient flame mounted on a torch that continues to burn despite the muggy atmosphere. The unpleasant moisture and suppressingly thick air induces a stench of mildew and decay and the passage's cramped and narrow space magnifies the uncomfortably claustrophobic and restrained atmosphere.

roomecho.desc: A faint dripping noise is heard as a drop of water collected from the humid air drips off the ceiling and onto the floor.

room.name: Transfiguration Office
room.desc: A large oak desk sits in the center of the office, littered with papers and thick books on different methods of transfiguration. Three squashy armchairs sit in the room, one behind the desk and two in front, all resting on top of a circular oriental rug in beautiful shades of blue and green. A large, empty bird cage sits in the corner beside the window - remnants of different kinds of feathers resting in its bottom. Wooden bookcases line one of the walls full of thick volumes of spell books and other magical relics. Along the opposite wall sits an open, crackling fireplace, the flames within dancing across the wood, and providing the room with a faint light and warmth. Behind the desk sits a large oak door, partially open, light glimmering faintly on the other side.

roomecho.desc: A teacup hiccups from one of the shelves along the wall.

room.name: Transfiguration Residence
room.desc: A large, oak four-poster bed sits along a wall - curtains pulled back revealing a squishy quilt in various shades of blue and green. A large trunk rests at the foot of the bed atop a rug that covers a good section of the floor. A fireplace is against the wall, flames blazing within the hearth providing a comforting warmth and smell to the room. A table sits beside the bed, a thick book resting on it.

room.name: Transfiguration Classroom
room.desc: Desks form two straight, even lines heading towards the front of the classroom, each with two chairs sitting behind the table facing the front of the room. At the front of the room sits a large wooden desk, littered with papers and spell books. On one side of the room sits an enormous bird cage, various feathers from different species of birds strewn across the bottom of the cage from past classes. Paintings of past witches and wizards are lined against the walls, over-looking the classroom.

room.name: Cloudy Corridor
room.desc: Hanging just below the ceiling of the hallway is a thin, whispy layer of white clouds. Through a break in the cloud barrier, two shimmering orbs are visible. Eerily reminiscent of full moons on a cloudy night, the two glowing orbs revolve around each other, shedding soft pearly light onto the hallway. The smooth stone floor is bare and cool, bordered on the east and west by stately, gray walls. The room is empty save for a portrait of an absent-minded looking witch in patched blue robes hanging on the west wall. The hallway continues to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: The portrait's frame is delicate and silver, but intricately designed. The frazzled witch within the painting wears thick, black framed spectacles, her face framed by a mop of untame gray hair. She mutters uneasily to herself as she mixes potions ingredients in a set of crystal phials, unsure of whether or not her next move will cause a violent explosion.

roomecho.desc: The clouds shift a little, covering the two shimmering orbs and temporarily casting the room into darkness. Suddenly, a mysterious breeze blows across the ceiling, chasing away the clouds and bathing the room in light once again
A loud bang issues from the portrait, and the witch within looks quite discouraged as she stares at the ruined remains of her potion.

room.name: Quidditch Corner
room.desc: A window on the west wall overlooks the ground, providing a clear view of the quidditch pitch during the daytime. Hung on the walls are portraits of every professional team in Britain and Ireland along with some of the more notable Hogwarts players. The Chudley Cannons zoom about their painting in bright orange robes, and Oliver Wood waves happily at passing students from the Puddlemere United painting. Between the paintings are also models of famous brooms. A fake firebolt gleams proudly between the portraits of the Wimbourne Wasps and the Ballycastle Bats. On the far wall is also a complete list of Quidditch World Cup champions, dating back to 1473.

extradesc.desc: The model firebolt displayed proudly on the wall is not precision honed or aerodynamically superior, but to the untrained eye looks impressively polished and detailed. The word "firebolt" is emblazoned in gold on the handle which connects smoothly to a tail of magnificent birch twigs.

roomecho.desc: A referee's whistle sounds shrilly from the portrait of the first Quidditch World Cup. "FOUL!" cry the fans in the stands indignantly as a chaser pulls out his wand to curse the opposing beater.

room.name: Cathedral Window Corridor
room.desc: Wide polished flagstone adorns the floor ahead. Large, glowing torches flicker gently as a breeze wafts its way through the corridor, making glowing images dance across the floor. There are cathedral-style windows on either side of the hallway, allowing passersby to look out onto the grounds of the castle.

room.name: Spiked Corridor
room.desc: Set into a deep, square alcove, in the middle of the corridor, is the bust of a witch with short, curly hair and thick, bleak features. Overpowering this corridor are the tawny stones in the floors, walls and ceilings. Contrastingly, the floor has a central row of square, black stones from end to end with small gaps between them and the ceiling is identical to the floor. Four-fifths of the ways up both of the walls are great wooden spikes driven halfway in. Below the spikes, on either wall, are blue-paned lanterns on hooks supported by spindly lengths of iron. A passage begins to the south. This passage extends to the east and to the west.

room.name: Watcher's Hall
room.desc: . Great holes have been ripped into the drapes along this corridor. The drapes hang not over windows, but over solid stone. The tears in the thick, heavy cloth are restricted to the lower half and vary in size from the very, very small to great, long gashes. The stones used to build this section of castle are great hulking blocks. This entire corridor is blanketed in a soft green glow. The gentle illumination penetrates into every crack and crevice. However, it does not succeed in lighting up the murky portrait opposite the drapes. This foul-faced resident is a thin-lipped, brute of a wizard bearing down on the room. The corridor extends to the east and west.

room.name: Hospital Wing
room.desc: Along one of the white, panelled walls, great windows grant the outside light access to this achromatic room. Upon the White Carrara marbled floors, snug beds, dressed in snowy white sheets and blankets, line the walls in military fashion. Around the twin beds, starched curtains can be pulled for privacy and small, brightly polished, oak tables are positioned bedside. Lamps are sprinkled across this sterile room to lend it some warmth. Ample cabinets hold a variety of bandages, potions, herbs, and other sundries. Wide, double doors lead to the hall outside while Madam Pomfrey's office lies further west.

roomecho.desc: A bedpan coughs from the corner of the room.

room.name: Hospital Wing
room.desc: More beds line the walls, each made neatly and perfectly curtains open to reveal little tables beside each bed. Wood and glass cabinets poke out here and there, each holding various remedies and potions.

room.name: ** Hospital Wing
room.desc: Glass windows cut off a section of this area designating Madame Pomfrey's office, in which sits a desk with a chair, papers and books on Magical Maladies and Remedies. Large paintings of different healers are all over the walls, and through another door behind the desk, you can see part of a bed and hear the sounds of a fireplace crackling somewhere within the room.

room.name: Sundial Corridor
room.desc: The corridor's dirt floor is unimpressive and its stone walls are empty of any distinguishing features. At the center of the room stands its only object of interest. A giant sundial, three meters across stands mounted on a thick marble pedestal directly in the center of the hallway. A window along the south wall allows sunlight to filter into the room during the daytime, illuminating the shadow casting protrusion on the face of the sundial. At night, the house elves light the torches mounted on both walls, filling the hallway with a soft flickering light and rendering the magnificent sundial useless.

roomecho.desc: A mumbling house elf ventures cautiously into the room, checking on the state of the torches and lighting a few that have gone out.
The trample of footsteps from the floor above can be heard through the ceiling as students walk around between classes.

room.name: Ancient Corridor
room.desc: . Covered in creeping moss, the white stone walls of this short corridor seem to gleam with an irridescent shine. A sliver of light pools on the ground, rising up the leg of an ancient chair to cast a soft glow on the elaborately carved design etched into the wooden frame of the chair. Glittering suits of armour line the walls, each with a feathered plume protruding from the tips of their bejeweled helmets and a flowing ribbon billowing from their polished armour. To the east and west, the hallways of Hogwarts continue.

room.name: Mungo Bonham Memorial Corridor
room.desc: A handsome fireplace occupies one side of this airy corridor. The tiles on the hearth vary in shades from the deepest olive and warmest browns, to a buttery cream colour. There is a plant painted on some of the tiles. Above the fireplace hangs a large painting of the interior of a greenhouse and a very tall wizard standing in the foreground. The double doors that mark the main entrances to this hall are made mostly of large glass panels, reinforced with solid beech frames. Through the exits to the east and west of here, the other corridors can be seen disappearing into the distance, adding to the open atmosphere. who

room.name: Medallion Corridor
room.desc: Cold, roughly cut, white marble takes a straight path down the long hallway. Stark white walls serve as a backdrop for a variety of medallions. The medals are suspended from the wall on large silver and gold nails. The ribbons holding each medal in place are striped in the colors of the four houses. One large medal, hanging from a blue and silver gossamer ribbon, catches the eye. It is inscribed with the words "For Unprecedented Academic Achievement: Ravenclaw House of 1010." House crests adorn the walls between the hanging accolades. Gryffindor and Hufflepuff hang on the north and Slytherin and Ravenclaw on the south. A large banner striped with red, green, blue, and yellow covers the ceiling.

room.name: Atlas Hall
room.desc: Spanning the length of this corridor, set into one wall, is an immense atlas of the world. It is highly detailed with the illustrated tides ebbing and rising gently against the borders of brightly coloured continents. At the very bottom of the parchment, somewhere quite near the centre and being constantly re-written in swirly script by an animated quill is, "A Gift for the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry from the Proud Establishment of Flourish & Blotts". The opposite wall is empty, its slate-grey stones indifferent to the massive artwork. Floating serenely about a half a metre from the ceiling are six very plain glass lanterns. The passage extends to the east and to the west.

room.name: Binns's Office
room.desc: A large, oak desk sits in the center of the room, one stiff wooden chair behind it, two of the same material sitting in front. Large, thick volumes on various wars and revolutions between various civilizations sit atop the desk, each covered with a thick layer of dust. Shelf upon shelf of thick books line themselves along one of the walls, cobwebs reaching happily between the spaces. Along the opposite wall, a fireplace sits dark and cold, the remnants of a fire resting in the hearth, webs stretching in the corners. A large wooden door lurks in the back of the room, partially open.

room.name: Binns's Residence
room.desc: An old wooden bed rests against the wall, still perfectly made, curtains drawn back. The bedding itself looks old and dilapadated, having not been used in many many years. Dust layers itself thickly all over the room, covering everything within reach. An old trunk lies at the foot of the bed, sealed shut, and cobwebs connecting themselves from the trunk to the foot of the bed. Ancient paintings of revolutions and wars of various civilizations are lined neatly across the walls. A fireplace rests against one of the walls, dark and unused.

room.name: Arithmancy Classroom
room.desc: Long, wooden desks line themselves neatly throughout the length of the room. Number charts and diagrams are all over the room, along with various portraits of famous witches and wizards placed strategically against the walls. Different instruments lie lazily around the room, all used in measuring different arithmancy charts.

room.name: Music box Hall
room.desc: The golden walls, floor, and ceiling of this corridor radiate a honeyed sheen. Torches are set into golden brackets shaped like pyramids. Distributed throughout the room are dazzling sapphire-blue scarabs. Notes of music are distributed throughout the room, though there doesn't seem to be a place of origin for this tune. The tempo comes from a piano striking its keys to sound like a childhood lullaby or waltz: slow, wistful, yet joyful. The scarabs, though set into the walls, floor, and ceiling, are moving in unison with the music. They seem to almost be dancing, spinning. To the west is an hour glass-shaped portal, while a box arch leads to the east. A golden-coloured metal door leads south.

roomecho.desc: "Two first years walk though humming the tune."

room.name: Astronomy Tower
room.desc: . Polished flagstone encompasses the tower as it circles upward towards the viewing area. Cold, stone steps loom their way up as light from sparatically spaced torches glints off of their surfaces. A cool breeze waifts its way through the area, making the light flicker.

room.name: An Empty Classroom
room.desc: Large wooden desks line themselves uniformly towards a single wooden desk at the front of the classroom. Dried up inkwells and empty bookshelves indicate the lack of use of this particular room.

roomecho.desc: Peeves bobs his way in, stopping in mid-air to throw some dungbombs.

room.name: Labyrinth
room.desc: Onyx walls, stretching from the floor to the ceiling, lead to the left or to the right. Black wrought-iron torches light the passageways. The path to the right branches into another two hallways, as does the path to the left. It's a dark maze in which one path leads out of the corridor, while the others lead to dead ends. The walls whisper, "Are you sure this is the correct path?" "Are you feeling lucky today?" "Hey, idiot, don't go that way!"

roomecho.desc: "Are you sure this is the correct path?"
"Are you feeling lucky today?"
"Hey, idiot, don't go that way!"

room.name: Serenity Way
room.desc: The scent of honeysuckle caresses the air. The ceiling is cerulean blue with azure coloured clouds. Light blue tapers float in the air casting a cooling glow to its surroundings. The walls are indigo blue with cobalt blue floors. The entire room is tranquil, soothing. The sound of the ocean passes lightly through the room. There are plush, comfy sofas throughout the corridor. The diamond-shaped opening leads north. Blue French doors lead to the Muggle Studies Classroom to the west.

roomecho.desc: The sounds of waves lapping upon a beach float through the room.

room.name: Muggle Studies Classroom
room.desc: Large desks are placed unevenly around the room, with one large wooden desk sitting the the front of the room. Resting upon the top of this desk is a large, yellow rubber ducky with a big question mark in front of it. Plugs and electrical cords sit in a large box on the floor beside the desk, with "Muggle Magic" written on the box.Pictures of muggles sit frozen along the desk, a small paper reading "Notice lack of movement" underneath them. A large, glass case holds various muggle artifacts, including a doctors stethescope and a tongue depressor, a small card beside it reading "muggle healing." There is also a model airplane suspended from the top of the case, sign reading "How muggles Apparate." In the very front of the classroom, there are three charts one with a normally dressed wizard, next to it, the picture of a wizard in a dress with "What not to wear" written under the picture, and on the last, a picture of a "normally" dressed muggle.

room.name: Sunset Quidditch Corridor
room.desc: Two large, hourglass shaped, brass lamps sitting on a narrow oak sideboard light the short, wide, corridor from the south wall. On the north wall is an oil painting. The sun slowly sets behind a large, ice capped mountain, as mounted Quidditch players hunt for the snitch and pass the quaffle in the impending darkness. One player, dressed in orange, nearly misses running into the stands of cheering fans in the falling shadows. The quickly moving fliers zoom around at hypnotizing speeds, making it almost impossible to tear the eyes away. East the hallway extends onward, while to the west the hall arrives at a junction.

roomecho.desc: Mrs. Norris walks by, almost un-noticed, guarding the corridor.

room.name: Cluttered Hallway
room.desc: The hallway is completely cluttered with too many decorations of every type imaginable. A stuffed owl stands on a pedastal on the west wall of the corridor, its wings held stiffly away from its body, as if it were frozen in flight. A giant tapestry depicting the invention of the cleaning charm hangs on the wall behind the owl. Several rugs are spread across the floor haphazardly, overlapping in some places and revealing a bare stone floor in others. There are so many portraits squeezed over every available space on the wall that some hang over the indignant occupants of others. A few suits of armour are awkwardly positioned around the hallway, standing in twisted positions to avoid various statues and portraits.

room.name: Access Hall
room.desc: The corridor is comprised of ashlar floors, walls, and ceiling. Beeswax candles float in the air, casting a warm glow. Spaced intermittently throughout the passageway are six doors of varying size and colour. Not all the doors will open. The ones that do lead to the south and west.

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: Round stone room, with portraits lining their way up along with a circular staircase. Faint sounds of wings fluttering and soft hooting can be heard from this point in the stairwell of the tower.

roomecho.desc: A feather floats down softly from the top of the tower.
A loud "hoot" echos throughout the room.

room.name: A Secret Tunnel
room.desc: The walls and ceiling of this tunnel appear jungle-like from the thick vines and verdant plants covering them, producing a canopy. Light from an unknown source filters through the leaves. Water rushes along the floor, creating a cacophony of sound. The water sweeps all who enter this chamber over a waterfall and into a tranquil pool at its end. This lagoon has a sandy shore with palm trees, creating a balmy oasis. The exit is north.

roomecho.desc: "A butterfly flutters by and vanishes to the south."
"A student flops onto his belly and rides the wave over the falls."

room.name: A Secret Chamber
room.desc: A delightful meadow rolls out lush, green grass with poppies, daisies, and bluebells. The sun radiates its gentle warmth through the bright, blue sky with billowy cotton-like clouds floating blissfully along. A little grove of trees offers one shade. From this thicket a unicorn emerges. He's young, as he's silver in colour, but he does have his horn. His hooves are golden. He's extremely amicable and allows equally friendly entities the opportunity to pet him. The oval in the large chestnut tree to the north allows one to exit.

roomecho.desc: "A red robin alights on a tree singing her robin song."
"A butterfly flits by."

room.name: Secret Musical Stairwell
room.desc: The floor, stairs, walls, and ceiling are made of clear, whitish crystal. The stairwell is brilliant and enchanting. Blue crystal stars float in the air emitting a celestial beryl glow. A solid gold handrail allows one some form of safety. As each individual stair is stepped upon, it shines a different, distinct colour of the rainbow and emits a note of music. The stairs lead upward. The solid crystal door leads south.

roomecho.desc: A student hops up and down the stairs playing "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star."

room.name: Marble Staircase
room.desc: Exquisite white marble forms the staircase leading away from the entrance hall and up towards the third floor. The gently rising banisters, also marble, have tiny faces sculpted into their balusters. Some are beautiful, others are horrifying. One face is particularly alluring. She has stunning features, almost life-like. The exit is to the north and the stairs lead up or down.

extradesc.desc: The entrancing face smiles at you. She whispers, "Be careful."

roomecho.desc: Sir Cadogan runs through a portrait of some cows grazing on the left yelling, "Stand and fight you scurvy currs!!"
The Crup jumps in excited circles.
The Crup bows and pounces onto thin air.

room.name: A Sailing Way
room.desc: The floor is of blond hardwood, as is the paneling on the walls. Lanterns of stained glass light the room in varying hues, illuminating the ceiling's fresco with two different shades of blue depicting the sky and the water below. A castle sitting on a hill is in the distance. A large boat is being drawn through the water by a white horse, though this is no ordinary horse. It has antlers, wings with crimson and emerald coloured feathers, and fire escapes its nostrils. The craft carries two ladies in floor-length, ivory gowns with three men navigating. An amethyst flag, depicting an otter, waves from the mast of the vessel. Overstuffed blue chairs sit throughout the passage. Two oval portals lead north and south.

roomecho.desc: Women's voices and laughter can be heard.
A man says, "Oi, Lecil, due north, you git!"

room.name: Bulla Ball Hall
room.desc: The floors, walls, and ceiling are snow-white in appearance. In a single line along the ceiling, glass orbed-candles illuminate everything. Scattered along the walls are platforms at varying heights; they are also white. The flooring is bouncy, allowing any who walk or jump to spring up as if on a trampoline. Bubbles of purple, pink, and orange with green stripes float throughout the room. Two students lugging backpacks skip up and pop the orange and green bubbles. Several other students are playing Bulla Ball, in which one team pops the purple bubbles and the other team bursts the pink bubbles. One student hops from the floor onto one of the ledges, and then bounces off the ledge popping a purple bubble. One exit is north through the depressed arch. The oval portal exits one south.

roomecho.desc: "A student runs past you, leaps into the air, and yells in triumph."

room.name: Hieroglyphic Hallway
room.desc: The corridor appears primitive, archaic. The floor, walls, and ceiling are no better than a cave, made of sand and stone. A small pit dug into the center of the passageway contains a fire. Prehistoric images are painted onto the walls and ceiling. Depictions of birds, bugs, squiggly lines, ankhs, animals, humans, clouds, rain, spears, the sun, and the moon comprise the hieroglyphics along this hall. A few large stones allows one to sit down, if one so chooses. Arches in the stone walls lead east, south, or west.

extradesc.desc: A duck is roasting in the fire. It looks at you and winks before lying her head back down into the flames.

roomecho.desc: Sizzling sounds emit from the fire.

room.name: Ghosts' Meeting Hall
room.desc: The corridor is glacial, like an icebox, forcing one's breath to appear as tiny bits of fog. The floor, walls, and ceiling are charcoal-grey, grim. One lone torch attempts to emit a bit of light, but the darkness seems to almost swallow it. An ebony, marble table sports grey, dingy chairs around its circular form. The room possesses an air of neglect, making it hard to determine if the room is shadowy in appearance from its original colour, or from the years of inattention. If one looks closely, the walls model two dark tapestries, each weaved in varying colours of blacks and greys. One tapestry depicts Rochester Castle, in Kent, and its famous tenant. The second tapestry portrays Lowther Castle in Westmoreland and its resident, the infamous "wicked Jimmy". The exits are north, east, and west.

extradesc.desc: The White Lady, who has haunted the castle for over seven hundred years, is thought to be Lady Blanche de Warren, who was accidentally slain by her betrothed.

"Wicked Jimmy", or Sir James Lowther, was a ruthless man in an unhappy "arranged" marriage. He fell in love with a lovely, young woman, who eventually grew ill and died. He kept her body in his castle for a while, attending to her room everyday, refusing to believe she was dead. When his servants complained of the smell she was finally buried. His angst caused him to constantly walk the grounds. At his death he came back to stroll the grounds once again.
extradesc.keywords: wicked jimmy lowther westmoreland two second

roomecho.desc: "Nearly Headless Nick breezes through the hall."
"Several ghosts sit at the table in discussion."
"The Bloody Baron's presence makes two first years flutter away."

room.name: Bridget Wenlock Corridor
room.desc: Criss-crossing the ceiling of this sweeping corridor are great exposed beams made of some dark wood. Spun around the beams, and drooping down onto the torches, are silvery gossamer cobwebs. The lower half of the walls in this corridor look to be made from the same wood as the rafters, while the upper halves are made of large, square pieces of pale grey stone. Separating the wood and stone in the walls are brightly coloured pieces of thick glass arranged in a dappled, bubbly mosaic. Half-way along this corridor, sitting on an elegant black marble pedestal is the bust of Bridget Wenlock, Arithmancer. Exits can be seen to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: The bust of Bridget Welock shouts "Merlin's Beard!"

room.name: Granite-Floored Corridor
room.desc: Daunting bronze-plated snakes arch up from the brown stone walls, their forked tongues captured in mid-flicker. The ends of each tongue are curved up to form hooks, from which hang shallow basins of fire. The corridor is wide and straight and inclines gently, on either side, towards the centre. Lining the upper the walls are cramped air vents. Barely the width of two fingers, and reinforced with rusty iron mesh, the vents open on one side to the castle grounds, and on the other, into various rooms and passageways. There is nothing covering the beautiful masonry on the floor; the polished red granite reflects the lights above. There are exits to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: Far-off shouting can be heard.
The fire in the basins crackles loudly.

room.name: Ignatia Wildsmith Passageway
room.desc: The floor is comprised of a herringbone pattern of pink and grey granite that flows up the wall. The ceiling is grey granite with a silver chandelier hanging from it. Pink candles placed in the chandelier cast a cheery glow. A massive red-bricked fireplace is set into the northern wall. Above the fireplace is an enormous painting of Ignatia Wildsmith (1227-1320). She was the inventor of Floo Powder, allowing an easier and faster way to travel. Along the opposite wall sit overstuffed leather chairs and chestnut end tables. If one is not wishing to journey via the Floo, then the exits are south through the bricked doorway or through the brown archway west.

extradesc.desc: Ignatia Wildmith looks at you. "You see," she starts, "it's like this. One day I was at my friend Miranda's, and I said to her, 'Oh, my, I was to be at Daniel's for tea two minutes ago.' Then it dawned on me, 'Yes, there must be a faster way than my old, uncomfortable broom.' So, yes, now there is."

roomecho.desc: "A student strolls through the corridor. He looks at the painting and says, 'Hello, Ignatia.' 'Well, hello, Johnny,' answers Ignatia."

room.name: Yvrut-yspot
room.desc: This corridor is totally topsy-turvy. The sky is at one's feet, and the ground upon the low-hanging ceiling. Upon entering this passage, the person is immediately swooped up by a cloud which will glide that person through this hall. The sky is a radiant blue and the sun's rays are warming. The ceiling holds a charming garden. An array of flowers, such as lilies, buttercups, and morning glories, hang in splendor. In the centre of the garden is a fountain of a woman playing a saxophone with water spraying up from the bell of her instrument. The water arches and streams back into its tiny pool. It appears there may be something in the pool. Southward is an inverted V, through the red, circular opening you will head east, and to the north is a bricken doorway.

extradesc.desc: A tiny, bright yellow fish, with green veins, greets you amiably, very excited to see you. Once you move on he starts muttering under his breath, "What a bloody git. Think you're so cool since you're a lung breather."

roomecho.desc: "A tall student tiptoes on his cloud to smell one of the flowers."

room.name: Forgotten Runner
room.desc: The floor, walls, and ceiling are comprised of blue-green freestone. Oval windows, with a decagon pattern etched into them, line the walls, permitting the external light to filter in. Hanging from the ceiling are two glass chandeliers with orange candles. An extravagant rug lies upon the floor. The border is burnt orange with lavish greens and blues depicting some forgotten man. However, the rug causes all who step upon it to flip upside down, forcing them to walk off of it on their hands. A decrepit-looking archway leads to the south, while an inverted V allows access to the north.

extradesc.desc: The old man in the rug winks at you. He says, "Have a good day, now."

roomecho.desc: "A student is flipped over and begins walking on his hands. The man in the carpet says, 'Well, hello, Lewin.' 'How are things, old man?' 'Fair. Kind of you to ask.'"
'"The man in the carpet tells the candles, "Quit dripping on my face!"'

room.name: ** Stuffy Corridor
room.desc: The slumbering stone walls of this corridor are a faded dark green. Musty odours permeate the heavy air, betraying the immense age of this place. Lining the floor are the tattered remains of a thickly woven carpet. On the walls hang old tapestries depicting various herbs and shrubs. Poking out from some of the cracks in the walls are a few small green shoots and blooming flowers. The light streams in through four large octagonal windows set high above the tapestries. The corridor continues to the north and to the west.

extradesc.desc: This tapestry shows the Mugwort (Artemesia Vulgaris). One of the mentioned uses is to ward off unwelcome guests.
The tapestries hanging here show herbs and their uses. One particular tapestry looks more faded than the rest.

roomecho.desc: One of the tapestries on the east wall billows outward as if blown by a gust of air.
A drip can be heard nearby.

room.name: Herbology Office Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is quite warm, the air is very dense and moist. The floor here is covered with mud and leaves with ocassional patches of the old marble glimpsing through. Covering the walls are thick brown vines and wide, dark green leaves. There are recesses in the walls that look like they could have been windows but they are so obscured by foliage it is quite impossible to tell. There is a low wooden ceiling hanging with trailing vines. It is hard to distinguish beams from branches and it seems that the plants are doing half the work of keeping the ceiling up. There is a circular oak door to the south wreathed in tiny blossoming flowers, the words "Herbology Office" carved into it. The corridor leads away to the east and west, opening up as it goes.

extradesc.desc: Are you sure they are windows? There are vines blocking your view.
The vines are thick and muscular, occasionally moving of their own accord.

roomecho.desc: The vines slowly rearrange themselves.
A large drop of condensed water drips from the ceiling.
Some of the flowers surrounding the door give a small sneeze.

room.name: Green Grime Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is hot and humid like a greenhouse. The floor is an aged marble, slightly soiled and worn. Moss and dirt are in every seam and crack. The dull stone walls have small shoots sprouting from tiny holes and fissures covering their surface. Four high, recessed windows are set into one wall, the view partially obscured by the foliage outside. The windows are made of thick glass covered in a thin layer of greenish grime and look as though they have been neglected for decades. Above, a wooden braced ceiling slopes lower towards the east and arches high to the west. More shoots can be seen dangling from the dark beams.

extradesc.desc: The young plant darts back into its hole as you look at it, it must be shy.
They are set far to high to see out of.

roomecho.desc: A small vine reaches out and opens one of the windows, letting in a refreshingly cool breeze.

room.name: Split-Level Corridor
room.desc: The light brown stone of the floor in this corridor is heavily veined with spidery white threads. The walls are of the same light brown, but there are no threads running through these stones. The corridor is split into three levels with two steps on each side leading to a centre pit. Directly facing the pit, on one of the walls, is a large arched window. It has many panes of ordinary glass, is as almost wide as the pit itself and it stretches to just below the ceiling. Covering the floor of the pit is a circular, navy blue, mat. At its outer edge are two, thin, white, concentric circles. Mirroring this, exactly above the mat, some ways up, are two rings of long candles, bobbing gently in mid-air. Exits are visible to the east and to the west.

roomecho.desc: A school ghost drifts down the corridor.

room.name: Banshee Passage
room.desc: Painted upon one wall, a beautiful, young woman wears a long, green dress with a grey cloak. On the opposite wall a riddled, old hag is attired in a similar green dress with grey cloak. Over the exits, leading west and east, identical, horrifying spirits rise, each spirit meeting in the centre of the ceiling with their grey cloaks billowing like wings. Stringy, white hair extends straight-out from their scalps, like grotesque haloes; their flesh is sagging, wrinkled, and decayed. Their eyes glow ruby-red and their mouths are stretched into a toothless scream. Red tapered candles float in the air casting an eerie pallor to the room. One lone, spindly, red chair sits in a corner.

extradesc.desc: Her lengthy tresses are of the deepest red. Her light green eyes are sorrowful and tears drip down her pale skin and over her red lips.
She has lank, white hair and her eyes are red from crying.
The chair creaks, "I'd think twice before sitting on me. I'm not as strong as I used to be in my younger days."

roomecho.desc: An ear-splitting wail fractures the silence.

room.name: Tri Way
room.desc: The walls are paneled with a rich, deep cherry wood, as are the floor and ceiling. The sheen upon this wood is so lustrous that one can see his or her own reflection. Centred on the floor is a large triangle. Lined in gold within the triangle are three smaller equilateral triangles with the tips of their bases touching. The illusion of these points touching produces an equal triangle, lined in gold, in the centre, creating the one large triangle. Slim, floating, golden candles light this grand passageway. Plush leather chairs are placed along the walls. On the walls are four paintings representing each of the houses' mascots; look to the triangle about them. The exits are through golden triangular openings the north, south, and west.

extradesc.desc: "Gryffindor thought the triangle represented Hogwarts. Look closely at Gryffindor's lion, he's a story to tell. As well as Slytherin's snake. Hufflepuff's badger requires closer inspection. As does Ravenclaw's eagle."
"Godric Gryffindor felt that if each house were a triangle, side-by-side, yet distinct, that would make a larger, stronger, single triangle."
"Salazar Slytherin felt like the triangle in the center: cornered in and told how to feel. He was against this single triangle, preferring their own smaller versions."
"Helga Hufflepuff believed that if one of the four left, like Slytherin, then the center triangle would disappear, as if it had lost its heart."
"Rowena Ravenclaw foretold of a day when the fragmentation would end. One would bring them together, instead of welcoming division."

roomecho.desc: "Golden wax from the candles drips to the floor and trickles in a thin line to the gold in the triangles."

room.name: Black Satin Passage
room.desc: Black satin draperies hang throughout the passage. The satin ripples like ocean waves un apparent defiance of gravity. Despite the dynamic motion of the room, the air is still and heavy. A few large wooden chests sit off to one side. Marking the corners of the juntion sit two tall, floor mounted candle trees made of beonze. A passage continues on to the north and south and another, orthogonal to the other, travels east.

room.name: Firefly Hall
room.desc: Fireflies wizz through the air just out of reach. The tiny dancing lights give the room a warm glow while they act out a mesmerizing drama using the ceiling as a backdrop. Shields mounted upon plaques sparkle from the orange glow and reminisce in the glory days. The rough stone floor has a wide rut worn in the center of it from the centuries of use. Lime green moss fills in the cracks in the walls and ivy hangs from the large rafter running the length of the ceiling. The large wooden dorr to the north opens to a staircase and the stone arches to the east and west open up to more more passages.

room.name: Leprechaun Passage
room.desc: Leprechauns scurry from frame to frame of their paintings hung around the walls of the hallway, making a ruckus. All of them have bright orange beards. They are outfitted in bright green suits with top hats and have wooden pipes hanging from their mouths. A bright rainbow extrudes inward from a window and ends in a large iron pot full of gold. Two large stone archways mark the exits from this corridor to the east and the west.

room.name: Dark Hallway
room.desc: The north and south walls of the hallway slant toward each other narrowing the corridor into a cramped, dark passage. There are no windows in this hallway. The only source of light issues from the center of the north wall of the hall, where a slim black stand supports a fire of blue-green flames. The light casts an eerie, unreal glow over the series of small paintings that hang on the walls. A sneering wizard in black robes glares down his nose at passers by and across from him, a sinister-looking hag cackles over a cauldron.

room.name: Bathing Wizard Corridor
room.desc: Along one side of this ample corridor, about a meter and a half from the ground, is a row of pewter coat hooks. Across from the coat hooks, set against pallid masonry, is a great, whopping portrait of an old, wiry wizard in a pale green porcelain bath tub. His long white beard is trailing through the water and the pointy orange hat still on his head is sitting at a crooked angle. On the same wall as the painting, stationed at the far ends of the passage, are two suits of armour. Dangling from the ceiling, by heavy chains, are eight ordinary, iron lanterns. Extending to the south and west are the exits.

roomecho.desc: Loud splashing sounds can be heard coming from the direction of the painting

room.name: Warlock's Walk
room.desc: There is a faint smell of rosemary in this hallway. Lit by torches burning brightly, the floor is covered in a luscious, thick, carmine rug with a sewn, golden motif running along the edge. The high walls are made of wide, stone slabs, inlaid with a number of curious designs. The high, vaulted roof has partially collapsed on itself - the fallen beams suspended by a dozen hair-thin strands of magical, glowing thread anchored to the walls. There is a short, marble plinth on the eastern wall, holding a bust of a hooded wizard. To the west, through an arched passage, is a set of marble stairs leading down. The corridor continues to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: Quixos Wren: (1680 - 1821)
On closer inspection, it seems that the motif depicts a snake coiling endlessly around itself. It writhes as you look at at it.
This painting is completely black save for a small pair of glowing eyes in the centre. They blink occasionally.

The carved designs on the wall are quite geometric. Some depict star charts while others are a series of glyphs and runes. As you look a little longer the designs shift, the very rock altering to show new, even stranger icons.
extradesc.keywords: design designs rock rocks walls wall

extradesc.desc: Years of student graffiti is carved into the wood.
. "Snape Sucks -- MWPP" "HP&GW" "MUDBLOODS BEWARE!"

roomecho.desc: The roof creaks ominously...
One of the blue threads snaps! Hopefully a teacher will come and replace it before somthing terrible happens...

room.name: Minor Inventor Passage
room.desc: The drafty, dank corridor is covered completely in drab, grey slate. There are small, rectangle windows near the top of the walls allowing a bit of light to filter through. A few torches are lighted to throw out a morsel of light, but they mostly cast shadows. Other than the torches, the only other objects in this passage are various paintings of inventors of minor items. One painting is of Sacharissa Tugwood (1874-1966). Another picture is of Bowman Wright (1492-1560). An arched exit leads east and a wand-shaped opening leads north. The Defense Against the Dark Arts Office is to the south.

extradesc.desc: Sacharissa Tugwood discovered that bubotuber pus can help cure pimples. She was the first to design beauty potions.

It is Bowman Wright who created the Golden Snitch. Though many may argue Mr. Wright should not be considered a minor inventor, his invention, though bringing hours of delight to Quidditch fans, nonetheless has not drastically revolutionized the magical world.

roomecho.desc: "A student in Quidditch robes is talking to the portrait of Mr. Wright. Mr. Wright says, 'Honestly, kid, I don't know any special tricks to catching the Snitch.'"

room.name: The Watering Hole
room.desc: Maple covers the well-worn floor and walls. Stretching the length of one wall is a bar with a maple base and a copper top. Copper buckets of flames are interspersed throughout the room. Comical pictures on the walls enliven the passage. One depicts a man with daisies growing out of his nostrils, while another shows a boy lighting his flatulencies with his wand. Comfy poufs with short maple tables are scattered all through the room. A statue of a curvaceous woman is at one end, behind the bar. A statue of big, brute of a man holding a stein is at the other end sitting at the bar. The woman has a spigot pointing at the man's stein and fizzy water spews from the spout into his tankard. This hall is a favourite of students to relax and drink the cherry-flavoured fizzy water. The star shaped exit to the south will take you to the Astronomy Tower. The arched exits lead east or west.

extradesc.desc: "Get your own drink, shrimp."
The woman winks at you and asks, "Now, what is it you want?"
It squirts water in your face.
On the stein is written 'You must be this high to get on this ride.'

roomecho.desc: "The boy lighting his gas chases a girl through the pictures. She screams, 'Stop it! Stop it!'"

room.name: Veela Lane
room.desc: Clear glass allows one to walk through this hall, but the glass covers blue, swirling clouds underneath. The smooth walls and ceiling are painted a gorgeous light blue. Flowing, white, ribbon-like candles float in the air granting the room light. Light blue chaises litter the room. Dozens of portraits of veela inhabit the corridor. The passage is alight with beauty. The veela, with their golden-alabaster hair, clear blue eyes, and glowing pearlescent skin, dazzle the room with their shimmering auras. It's as if bliss originates in this room. The only portrait not depicting a veela is of one dark-haired, rakishly good-looking man. He seems unimpressed by the veela. They seem rather peeved that he hasn't acknowledged their stunning good looks. There are two tear-drop shaped exits leading west or east.

extradesc.desc: One of the veela smiles with her perfect lips and shows her perfect teeth. "Every man falls for me. I bring euphoria." The man from his picture hollars, "Not every man falls, honey." She suddenly transforms into a creature with scaly wings and a demonic beak-like face.

The attractive man talks to one of the female students. "Why aren't you affected by the veela?" "Have you ever tried talking to one? The only thing they talk about is their looks; they are thick as rocks. Actually, I've had better conversations with rocks."

roomecho.desc: '"A seventh year male flexes his arms for the veela. They smile appreciatively."'
"A girl walks through the passage and says, 'Oh, give it a rest.' One of the veela respond, 'You're just jealous.'"

room.name: Aqua Pura Fountain
room.desc: This corridor is tall and narrow with a gently curved ceiling. The stones used to build the ceiling are light brown and flecked with shiny black spots. These stones extend roughly one third of the way down and are separated from the dark of the walls by two shiny pipes. These pipes run the length of the corridor, vanishing abruptly at either end, up into snug holes. The floor is covered in a buttery coloured runner, almost as wide as the corridor itself. There is some discolouration of the carpeting in front of a plain greenish basin jutting a little way out from the wall. The basin is sitting in a shallow cavity, above which is inscribed in the stone, "AQUA PURA". Trailing off to the east and west are the exits.

roomecho.desc: A droplet of water falls from the lip of the basin and soaks into the carpet.
Sir Nicholas DeMimsy Porpington comes drifting through the fountain.

room.name: Aurora Borealis Room
room.desc: A long, black corridor leads you to the room. The brightness is dizzying upon entering. A duplicate of the Aurora Borealis stretches across all the walls. This dazzling phenomenon illuminates the room in shimmering greens, whites, yellows, oranges, reds, and purples. The colours eddy and wave like swirling ribbons blowing in a lazy breeze of whites and greens mixing then changing to reds and purples, perpetually rotating and morphing into varying colours. There are several lush sofas scattered about allowing the couples in Hogwarts to frequent this room. The exits are through the long, black corridors to the north and west.

roomecho.desc: A giggle can be heard from one of the sofas.
A prefect enters the room and says, "Okay, you two, cut it out." A couple runs from the room.

room.name: Rapunzel's Plight Passageway
room.desc: Cobbled grey limestone lines the floor and walls. A large peppery-coloured chandelier, holding cherry-scented candles, sheds light along the hall. Palladian windows follow along the western wall, permitting a view of the outside grounds. A painting stretches the length of the eastern wall. In it a vast castle lies upon lush green grounds. A stout, good-looking fellow sits astride a magnificent horse. He has a sheathed, golden sword and a shield with a crest of a chicken and tulip upon it. He is gazing upward to the tallest tower. In the opened window stands a lovely woman with extremely thick, golden hair. The man is beseeching her, "Rapunzel, Rapunzel, please let down your hair." She turns her head and completely ignores him. A tudor archway leads to the north while a black tunnel leads south.

extradesc.desc: He has a sheathed, golden sword and a shield with a crest of a chicken and tulip upon it.
Rapunzel looks at you. "Can you believe what a girl has to put up with these days?"
extradesc.keywords: rapunzel lovely woman golden hair thick

extradesc.desc: The man is pleading with Rapunzel to please let down her hair. Rapunzel retorts, "Why, pray tell, would I want you crawling up here and using my hair to boot?" "So that I can rescue you." "How in the world would you release me from this lair when you are up here? Don't you get it? I want down there, not you up here." "Ah, come on, Rapunzel. Have a heart." "Get a ladder, or quit pestering me!"

roomecho.desc: "A student talks to Rapunzel about the knight pestering her."
"A male voice asks, 'Will you just give me a chance?'"
"A female voice says, 'Go away!'"

room.name: Galleon Corridor
room.desc: This hallway glitters gold like a galleon, and is also ominously quiet. Even the softest footfall sends a tremendously loud echo down the hallway. The skirting boards lining the bottom of the wall are the only visibly worn area, with chips in various places. They are slightly dusty and discoloured. No windows are in this corridor, but small candles are placed up and down the pathway, giving off a small shimmer of light. The only object on the ceiling is a spider's web in the corner, which is barely visible, and a small spider is on the web. Down the hall to the left, is a rather large and empty picture frame. There are exits to the north, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: A faint voice can be heard from behind the frame, and it says to you, "I'll send for Filch if you don't move along!" One particular portrait shows an old Headmaster sitting in a chair. The label on the frame reads "Headmaster Craig". He has a peculiar evil grin. On the wall behind him is his most prized possession; a small painting of a tater tot.

roomecho.desc: A soft voice whispers to you, "You should be in bed! Now off you go..."

room.name: Plump Witch Passageway
room.desc: Multiple colorful paintings hang on the wall of the cheerily decorated corridor. A window on each wall provides ample lighting during the daylight hours, and dutiful house elves light a series of torches each evening. A plush, red carpert covers the floor of the hallway, making the environment seem more friendly and inviting. The paintings are all placed carefully in ornate golden frames and smile happily at passersby. A particularly plump witch in scarlet robes smiles rosily at any students she sees, offering helpful advice on false doors and trick staircases. On the west wall is a portrait of a kindly old lady, flicking her wand to charm her knitting needles and yarn into creating a thick, warm scarf.

room.name: The Boar Corridor
room.desc: The corridor is comprised of light red stone with torches, held in wrought-iron brackets, casting light upon the statues inhabiting the hall. On each side of the entrance, at each end of the corridor, sit sculptures of winged boars identical to the ones flanking the gates into Hogwarts. With the winged boars, a golden plaque displays a greeting. A few of these statues are of King Arthur, Vishnu, Lug, Bikyara, and Zhu. East, west, north, and south each have gothic archways that lead from this passage.

extradesc.desc: "Welcome to the Boar Corridor. The boar has been a symbolic icon since great antiquity. Some equate the boar with spiritual authority, or 'good', as it lives a solitary life in the forest. The statues exhibited here are examples of the positive role the boar have served varying cultures, as it has served us here at Hogwarts."

One of the titles of King Arthur was the Boar of Cornwell. The boar becoming associated with Arthur may have a little to do with the tale of his hunting the magical boar, Twrch Trwyth. However, the boar was a symbol of virility and fierce fighting, which the people found synonymous with Arthur.

Vishnu is one of the major Hindu gods of the Trimurti, the Hindu Triad/Trinity. He is a favorite of the Hindu believers as he is the preserver and protector of life and creation. He is the embodiment of mercy and goodness. One of his avatars (incarnations) is as a white boar who lifts the earth from the flood, thus saving humankind.
Zhu is one of the 12 animals in the Chinese Zodiac.
Lug, a Druid god, has dazzling golden hair. He was a master of all arts, skills, and crafts. He is the go of the sun and the protector of Comedians. The Romans equate him with Mercury.
Bikyara is one of the twelve protectors of the Japanese god, Yakushi Nyorai. The twelve protectors are often confused or associated with the twelve animals of the zodiac.

room.name: To Dumbledore's Office
room.desc: Amongst the flagstone that creates this hallway, torches sit on either side of a large stone gargoyle. A slight draft flickers the light from these torches casting an almost eerie glow over the statue.

room.name: Adalbert Waffling Corridor
room.desc: Seven grilled windows open out to the castle grounds from this corridor. They line one wall and are flanked by bunches of candles. On the opposite wall hangs a brightly coloured tapestry of the school's crest. The tapestry is large and slightly rectangular in shape. Holding it up by its top corners are stone fairies, with vivid pink leadlight wings. They are fluttering sleepily against the wall and grasping the tapestry tightly in their fists. On one side of the tapestry is a painting of a podgy little witch sitting in the middle of a strawberry patch. While on the other side a gentle looking wizard sits reading in a study. There are exits to the north and south.

roomecho.desc: A corner of the tapestry slips from a fairy's grasp. She swoops down to pick it back up.

room.name: Stairwell
room.desc: Polished flagstone lines itself between marble bannisters providing a lift towards the other areas of the castle. Portraits of various witches and wizards line themselves along the incline of the staircase. Torch light flickers gently against the stone surface.

room.name: Ice Window Hallway
room.desc: Instead of a window on the north wall of the corridor, a pane of solid ice offers a transluscent view of the grounds. The unmelting slate of ice is guarded on both sides by polished suits of armour. Their metallic bodies gleam magnificently in the faint light that filters through the window. The armour catches the sunlight during the day and the moonlight at night, reflecting them back into the hallway to make the corridor seem more luminous than should be possible.

roomecho.desc: A drop of water slowly slides down the ice window, plopping onto the ground.

room.name: Corridor of Creeping Vines
room.desc: The immediate fragrant breath of a flowery scent flows through the hallway. In a windowless, softly-lit corridor, intertwining thin vines creep delicately over the walls. Mysterious violet blossoms are scattered across the sleek green vines and elegant white candles hover about a meter away from the wall. The flowers are constantly in bloom and their soft, luxurious scent creates a pleasant, calming atmosphere.

room.name: History of Spells Corridor
room.desc: The entire west wall of the corridor is dominated by a single oversized wand mounted at an angle on the wall. From the wand's tip issues a constant stream of shimmering sparks. The sparks fade to nonexistence just before falling to the plain dirt floor. On the opposite wall is a collection of paintings and tapestries depicting the inventions of the most famous spells. The most notable illustrations include the portrait of an esteemed-looking witch inventing a quick-healing charm and a tapestry of Wizard Baruffio with a buffalo standing on his chest, halfway through the invention of the levitation spell.

extradesc.desc: The giant wand is carved from exquisite mahogany and polished to sleek perfection. Its tip extends diagonally toward the top-right corner of the west wall. Inscribed with flowing silver script on the handle are the words: "Ollivanders. Makers of fine wands since 382 BC"

room.name: Magical Music Corner
room.desc: A steady, soft melody constantly emanates through the corner, issuing from the old wireless set sitting inside a nook in the wall. Magical knobs and dials on the wireless are constantly whirling and twisting on their own. Posters of various renowned magical singers are plastered onto both walls, and on either side of the wireless are the latest album covers from The Weird Sisters and Celestina Warbeck. Hanging on the opposite wall is a giant scroll, displaying the lyrics to the Hogwarts school song in flowing, black script.

extradesc.desc: The antique wireless set twists its own knobs and adjusts its own dials. Instead of numbers describing the frequency on the display, a spectrum of colors ranging from deep red to bright violet spread across the machine.

room.name: Secret Musical Stairwell
room.desc: The floor, stairs, walls, and ceiling are made of clear, whitish crystal. The stairwell is brilliant and enchanting. Red crystal stars float in the air emitting a celestial cherry glow. A solid gold handrail allows one some form of safety. As each individual stair is stepped upon, it shines a different, distinct colour of the rainbow and emits a note of music. The stairs lead down or one may head north through the heart-shaped portal.

roomecho.desc: A student hops along the stairs playing "Mary Had A Little Lamb."

room.name: Hall of Divination
room.desc: Resting on a twisting black metal stand along the north wall of the windowless corridor is an eerily glowing crystal ball, filled with mysterious swirling mists. The shimmering orb casts a soft, lavender hue onto the nearby walls and ceiling. Opposite the mysterious orb on the south wall is a perpetually lit fireplace, filled with multi-colored flames. The ceiling bears a detailed illustration of the night sky, golden lines crawling along the slowly shifting heavens to mark constellations and various alignments of stars.

extradesc.desc: Instead of a normal fireplace whose smoke is concealed behind bricks, this fantastically designed fireplace features a transparent column embedded in the stone wall through which the smoke rises. A small collection of various magical herbs in clay pots sits on the fireplace. Experienced diviners can toss the herbs into the fire and read the future in the ensuing smoke patterns.

The breath-taking ceiling displays a working model of the night sky on a clear evening. Shifting thin golden lines emphasize patterns of significance to diviners such as an alignment of the inner planets of the movement of a zodiac sign to a new region of the heavens.

room.name: Old Royal Hallway
room.desc: . The walls of the once splendid hallway are aged and cracking. The grey stones, covered beneath a layer of dust and grime, are losing their shape and form. The tattered remains of a dirty brown rug, saturated with years of caked mud, struggles in vain to cover the dirt laden floor. Suits of armour lean precariously against the decaying walls, covered in a fine veneer of green mold. Once colourful and magnificent, banners dangle limply from the ceiling, their brilliant hues dulled with the passing of years. The hall was once a tribute to the splendor of royal wizarding blood, but its decrepit state indicates the lack of respect later generations have had for the old aristocracy. Upon the southern wall a brilliantly, vivid painting hangs. The exits are to the north and the east through the decomposing archways.

roomecho.desc: A crunching noise issues from a corner as a piece of the stone wall breaks off, lightly showering the dirty floor with dust and small chunks of rock.

room.name: Defence Against the Dark Arts Office
room.desc: A wooden desk sits towards the back of the office, a large squashy arm chair resting behind it. A sneak-o-scope, and various other tools used in detecting the dark arts are placed all over the office, prominently displayed to their viewer. Thick volumes on Werewolves and Vampires, along with other Dark creatures line themselves uniformly upon shelf after shelf. A wooden door looms towards the back of the office, behind the desk.

room.name: Astronomy Tower
room.desc: The great astronomy tower lays before you, its ceiling open to the sky. Smooth wide flagstones cover the entire floor, inlaid into the slabs are thousands of tiny stars made of gold with the lines and arcs of their movements laid in silver. The walls of the tower are pitted and covered in lichen from centuries of exposure to the elements. Along the parapet stand several wooden booths, each with an ornate brass telescope and tripod inside, ready to cast a ruinous eye to the heavens. The view from the tower is breathtaking, the grounds lay before you, serene yet foreboding.

roomecho.desc: A pair of shooting stars fly across the sky.

room.name: The Platonic Passageway
room.desc: The corridor resembles a cave in appearance- dark browns and blacks with a brown-stoned floor. Painted along the south wall is a mural of a female student's progression. Her development may be seen by one who looks. Along the north wall a similar mural of a male student unfolds. At both ends of the passage, images of the sun are luminous. There are several study tables with chairs scattered around the room. The western exit is through the gothic archway. To the east is a mahogany door with a golden S upon it.

extradesc.desc: A youngish girl, around 11-years-old and wearing a black robe, stands cramped in the cave. As the wall continues, the girl ages a year with each step. The cave continues to become roomier for her with each subsequent step, 7 paintings in all. At the 7th picture, age 17, she stands at the mouth of the cave, looking up into a bright sun. The sun provides illumination for this end of the passageway. The girl is still wearing black robes, but has also donned a mortarboard.

As the girl completes her journey on the opposite wall, a young, 11-year-old boy beginning his journey is painted on the opposite wall. There are also seven paintings of him, with each passing year, and his 17-year-old, mortarboard-wearing picture is opposite the original picture of the girl. Like the girl, he gazes into his sun, which illuminates this end of the corridor.

roomecho.desc: A female voice says, "Wow, it's pretty bright in here."

room.name: Luminescent Corridor
room.desc: The nooks and crannies along the edge of the floor are peppered with faintly luminescent toadstools. Their light is enough to illuminate the floor and the walls, however, the colour in the carpeting remains indiscernible in the gloom. The corridor's top half is lit by many torches and looms large out of the dank shadows that saturate its lower region. The ceiling is arched severely and the rafters cast ominous shadows on the grey stone. A decorative band of red cedar is affixed to each wall at the point where the shadows recede and the light dances off the sculpted dragons on its surface. Towards the east and west are exits.

room.name: Cyclopean Corridor
room.desc: The floor and walls are made of luminescent crystal emitting bright white light. The whole corridor is just short of blinding. The creepy feeling of being watched emanates in this hall. An observant being would allow their eyes to stray upward, to the one thing with colour in this passageway. An enormous brown eye follows any movement in its path. Bright red veins snake out from its iris. It narrows menacingly at any who linger in its passage. The exits are south and west.

extradesc.desc: The brown eye stares at you threateningly, as if casting a curse upon you.

roomecho.desc: Two students hurry through the hall. One of them mutters, "That thing creeps me out."

room.name: Fairy Passage
room.desc: Greenery mats both the north and south walls with a combination of vines, mosses, and herbs. Multi-coloured flowers resembling the size and shape of teacups sprout from the vines on the walls. Hundreds of fairies site perched upon the flowers buzzing noisily amongst one another. Hanging from the ceiling are several large wrought iron chandeliers. Each holds a dozen candles with dancing blue flames. The stone floor is strewn with flower petals giving the corridor a potpourri smell. The corridor extends west and bends to the south east of here.

room.name: Sweet Scent Passage
room.desc: A heady scent lingers heavily in the air, its sweet taste embracing all those who pass by. Light streaks through the corridor from an enchanted picture on one wall. It shows a permanent sunset and bathes everything in a hazy yellow glow. Against another wall stands a tall marble statue of two figures: a wizard in long flowing robes and hood embracing a kindly looking witch, a slim gold crown resting atop her head and a stone tablet under one arm. An old lute lies at the wizard's feet. There is a silvered inscription running around the statue's base. Hanging from the ceiling are several unused candelabra swinging soundlessly. Two heart-shaped openings lead to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: The inscription reads: "THE FOOL AND THE GUIDE" in thin silvered lettering.
The witch is beautiful beyond description. In one hand she cradles a tablet and a quill, the other is extended around the wizard.
The wizard has slim defined features and blue-grey gemstones inset for eyes. He is smiling wistfully at the witch.

roomecho.desc: A tall Slytherin boy dashes through the corridor clutching his robes to his face and coughing loudly.
A girl looks reflectively at the statues. She touches the face of the wizard and whispers, "You don't look like a fool."

room.name: Creaky Corridor
room.desc: The floor creaks quietly in this corridor, and the walls are covered with a bold moonlight blue colour. However, late at night, the walls will appear to be the deepest shade of black. The weak light from the lanterns hanging from the wall flicker suddenly, giving the hallway a more deep and ominous feeling. Further down to the left is a book shelf that is littered lightly with some dust. It holds numerous very old books, and all four shelves are full. Exits are to the west, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: These books appear to be very aged and roughly used. The titles are barely visible, but you can make out a few, including "Le guide d'avoir affaire avec un enfant de magicien." The language is unrecogniseable, and you deduce that it is French. Another book describes every Headmaster and Headmistress that Hogwarts has ever had, and is titled "The Hogwarts Heads of Old".

roomecho.desc: A chilly breeze gives you a little shiver.
A soft "creak" comes from the floor boards.

room.name: Raspberry Hall
room.desc: Dark, raspberried colour lines the walls of the short corridor. A wall hanging, embroidered with pink and purple pansies, hangs next to the south doorway. A mirror etched with birds and framed in bevel-edged oak hangs next to a wide doorway on the eastern wall. A tall slim door with a shinny brass handle occupies the western wall. The door appears to be locked. Stone floor extends northward along with the hallway.
