room.name: Ravenclaw Common Room
room.desc: The huge Ravenclaw common room resembles a vast overturned ship. Buttresses and arches criss-cross the high, vaulted ceiling in a web of dark, wooden beams. The floor is made from slabs of worn flagstone, sparsely adorned with intricately detailed blue rugs. The sturdy tables scattered throughout the chamber all have runic inscriptions carved or etched in bronze around their edges. Elegant, gothic tracery covers the tops of the lofty sandstone archways and beautiful stained-glass windows. Nestled in the walls are numerous small alcoves framed tightly with an ebony archivolt, each containing a simple desk and chair. Every inch of possible reading space is spot-lit by gently swaying naphtha lamps. An astonishingly immense bookshelf towers cliff-like against one wall, appearing to hold thousands of tomes. Several ladders stand precariously against its dominating face. Ravenclaw regalia adorns the surrounding walls, giving a strong sense of unity and focus within the sea of blue and bronze. A sturdy, oak door leads south, to the dormitories while a narrow passageway to the east leads out to the castle.

roomecho.desc: The Grey Lady drifts from the far side of the common room through the entrance, and out into the castle.

room.name: Defense Against the Dark Arts Residence
room.desc: A four-poster bed sits against one of the back walls of the room, all the curtains pulled except one. An old trunk lies at the foot of the bed, locked to keep prying eyes out of its contents. A fireplace crackles listlessly from one of the sides of the room, providing a pale light and warmth to the dark room.

room.name: To Ravenclaw Dormatories
room.desc: Flagstone stairs lead off in two different directions towards the various gender appropriate dormitories. Torches line the walls adding a guiding light to the surface of the stairs. A cold draft waifts its way down through the tower.

room.name: ** Girls Lavatory
room.desc: The granite floor and walls are moist and soiled. The room is dank and dismal. Stagnant air generates the stale, dull taste that emanates from the walls and floor. Individual stalls line up single-file against one wall. Porcelain sinks reside upon the opposite wall. One sink seems especially grim. The drab, brown door leads north.

extradesc.desc: The sinks seem as if someone has attempted to keep them clean, but from simple disuse they are a bit mucky. Etched upon the faucet of one sink are two tiny snakes. The sinks are as bleak as the rest of the facilities.

roomecho.desc: A small, quiet sob is heard from one of the stalls.
Moaning Myrtle floods the bathroom in a fit of rage.

room.name: Boys Lavatory
room.desc: Polished stone floors lie on the surface of the bathroom. Stalls line up against the north wall, while sinks line up against the south wall.

roomecho.desc: The Fat Friar drifts through one of the stalls, through a sink, and exits through a wall.

room.name: Secret Chute Finale
room.desc: Light filters into the saturated stone chute allowing the muck and crud to become completely visible. The circular stone walls are soiled with sediment and an assortment of ooze and goo. Clawing upward through the soiled, spherical, stone shaft will take one in the direction of the exit.

room.name: Secret Chute
room.desc: Though extremely dark, a tiny pinpoint of light seeps in. The stone slide is sticky with sludge, making it difficult to clamber ever upward. The only opportunity for escape is to travel up this filthy tube, though, if one wished, one can travel down the slope.

room.name: Secret Chute Begins
room.desc: Oppressingly opaque, light is but a memory. An overwhelming stench of decay lingers in the air. Scummy and mired, the stone chute winds upward. Scrambling upward leads to the distant exit.

room.name: Secret Chute Chamber
room.desc: The cold, slick stone plummets all, whom have made the critical error of entering, onto a dampened stone floor. Slimy green ooze trickles from the opening out of this murky and dismal place. The floor and walls are moist and slick causing bitter-tasting air. As light barely filters in, the whole room is drowned in an opressive darkness. The narrow stone cavity leads upward.

room.name: Herbology Office
room.desc: The room is humid and damp with vines creeping from crevices and cracks in the walls. A large, sturdy wooden desk sits in the centre, a potted plant resting along its top with papers and books on various plants and herbs. A wooden chair sits behind the desk, along with two matching chairs in front. A fireplace looms off along one of the walls, the hearth lightly covered with soot, and a fire crackling softly. Shelves line another wall, stacked with thick volumes of books on plants and their uses. An oak door lies behind the desk, in the back of the room, slightly open.

extradesc.desc: The desk is made of a single cut from a massive tree. There are many age rings on its smooth, sanded surface and the original bark remains along the edges.
The scrawny looking plant sinks a little deeper in its pot. It is obviously a little shy.
You can see some living quarters through the gap in the door.

roomecho.desc: A potted plant squeaks and wiggles in its pot.
The fireplace pops and crackles loudly.

room.name: Herbology Residence
room.desc: A four-poster bed sits in the center of the room, with a large oriental rug lying underneath it. The curtains are pulled back from the bed, revealing an old patchwork quilt. A fireplace crackles softly from its hearth, providing the room with a soft glow, and warmth. Paintings of famous witches and wizards are scattered along the walls, along with a shelf full of herbology books. An old trunk rests at the foot of the bed, the hinges slightly rusted from age. Potted plants of varying shapes and sizes are placed around the room. The only visible exit is back into the office.

extradesc.desc: It is locked.
The rug is very ornate with an intertwining pattern of vines and leaves. A large silver tree is woven into the centre.

room.name: Dumbledore's Office
room.desc: The circular stairway opens up into a glowing office, filled with book upon book of different types of magic and subjects thereof. A large, woven rug rests in the center of the room, with the Hogwarts crest laced into it. A desk is located towards the back of the office, a birds perch sitting to the side of it. Behind the desk sits a comfortable looking, chintz armchair, with two like it directly in front of the desk. A wooden cabinet sits behind the desk, where a large stone basin is slightly visible through the crack in the door. Portraits of past witches and wizards rest lazily along the walls, all watching over the office.

roomecho.desc: You get the strange feeling that somebody is watching you.
One of the wizards in a portrait on the wall opens one eye to glare senselessly at you and mumble, before losing interest and going back to sleep.
A beautiful phoenix in gold and scarlet plumage swoops down into the room, coming to rest on its perch beside the desk.

room.name: Dumbledore's Residence
room.desc: A large fireplace crackles against the east wall, bright and warm, casting its glow across the room An enormous bed sits in the center of the room, atop an oriental rug in beautiful shades of blue and green. The quilt on the bed is in different, complimentary shades of blue and green. Another bird perch sits on the side of the bed, ashes lying in the bottom of the bowl underneath the perch itself. Candles are placed strategically around the room, adding to the glow that waifts from the fireplace.

room.name: Tristram's and Isolde's Secret Meadow
room.desc: Radiant blue skies stretch as far as the eye can see. The sun shines gently and temperately. Sumptuous, lush, green grass covers the rolling hills and meadows. Wildflowers blanket the verdure with an assortment of posies, bluebells, daisies, buttercups, and orchids. A stream of sparkling blue water flows peacefully across the terrain. At one point the stream splits, circumnavigating two large trees, and unites on the other side. The trees are ancient and colossal. Though their roots originate as two different entities, if one were to look at the branches and leaves solely, it would appear as one flourishing tree. The trunks of these trees are entwined, wrapping around each other as if in a lover's embrace. The trees' leaves are of the darkest, verdant green. White and red blossoms blanket the trees so densely they appear pink from a distance. The exit lies to the south.

roomecho.desc: A warm breeze carries the scent of flowers upon it.

room.name: Arithmancy Office
room.desc: An oak desk sits centrally in the room, littered with papers and books on Arithmancy. A large, squashy arm chair sits behind it with two similar ones resting in front. Portraits of witches and wizards line themselves neatly along the walls. Various instruments for charting Arithmancy line themselves amongst various volumes of books on the subject. A wooden door sits towards the back of the room, slightly open.

room.name: Arithmancy Residence
room.desc: A four-poster bed sits along the back wall of the room, the curtains pulled back revealing a plush quilt. Against one of the walls is a crackling fireplace providing warmth and light to the room.

room.name: Secret Herb Hall
room.desc: Dusty, stale air fills this small hall. On the floor are wide flagstones encrusted with lichen and scattered with curled dead leaves. The rough stone walls bear deep scars and worn in grooves. Vines run from the ceiling and hug the surfaces. In the centre of the ceiling is a large round hole functioning as a kind of chimney. In the four corners of the room, semi circular pools of glowing water provide a dappled pale green underlight. A thin breeze stalks the room creating a chill. The only exit is west.

extradesc.desc: The radiant pools are filled with glowing liquid.

roomecho.desc: Water drips from the ceiling falling loudly on the stone floor.
A gust of wind causes the leaves on the floor to move slightly.

room.name: Short Story Classroom
room.desc: The floor and ceiling are covered with dull, unimpressive grey slate. Burning torches are set into brackets attached to the walls around the room. Windows show the outside grounds and permit the outside light to stream in. Desks are set in a circle to encourage open dialogue amongst the students and their instructor. Set onto shelves are books from famous wizard short story authors. One such title is, "The Phoenix in Me." Another is "Run, Run, Run When the Dementors Come, Come, Come." The exit is to the east through the mahogany door with a golden S etched into it.

roomecho.desc: "A student runs in muttering about leaving her story behind."

room.name: Marble Staircase
room.desc: Brilliant white marble creates the steps and banisters for this staircase. The balusters have sumptuous-looking leaves and flowers fashioned from the marble. One flower is particularly large and garish. The exit is north through the round top archway, up or down the stairs.

extradesc.desc: The flower squirts rose water in your face.

roomecho.desc: A tawny owl swoops overhead clutching a package.

room.name: In Spite of Me Corridor
room.desc: Red flagstone covers the floor and walls. A fresco on the ceiling depicts a serene sky of blue with fluffy white clouds. A wizard and witch are swirling slowly, gently though the sky. Dark blue sofas are placed throughout the room with cherry end tables by their side. Sienna-coloured candles float above the furniture permitting its warm illumination to caress all in its path. White rose petals drift lightly from the clouds on the ceiling and, upon landing, they dissolve instantly. The soft breeze that seems to buoy the couple also touches all who enter this hall, causing them to feel giddy and smile. The exits are through the round top arch ways leading north, south, and east.

extradesc.desc: A tall raven haired wizard dressed in black dress robes swirls an emerald eyed beauty across the sky. The handsome man smiles lovingly down at her as he gently whirls her about the clouds.

roomecho.desc: A couple strolls through the room smiling. As petals dissolve in her hair, he glides his fingers through her hair to ensure they've left no residue.
A couple sits on adjoining sofas with a chessboard on the end table between them. As she takes his Rook, she winks at him.

room.name: Chequered Passage
room.desc: There is a smell of must in the air of this narrow, dark passage. The dim light of the few candles hanging from the ceiling in clusters, casts dancing shadows across the cracked, stone walls. A tiny arch window at the far end captures rays like a spotlight, illuminating the sea of chequered tiles underfoot. The passage has two exits leading east and west.

extradesc.desc: The tiny window channels light onto the gorgeous chequered floor below.

The old stone wall is covered in thin cracks that trail from door to door. Near the bottom of the wall there is a crack that is larger than the rest, it appears as if a faint glimmer is emmiting from it.

roomecho.desc: A small brown owl flutters frantically past the window, carrying a huge letter in its claws.

room.name: Snowy Corridor
room.desc: Snow falls continually throughout this wide corridor. The stone floor is hidden by a thick blanket of the fluffy white snow. A solid grey mass of snow clouds cover the ceiling. Torches of blue flame line the coarse stone walls. Even though this passage is as warm as any other, the enchanted snow does not melt. This hallway is a popular hangout for students on break, shown by the snow angels, snowmen, and snow forts constructed around the hall. Someone has enchanted several snowballs to fly around the room. There are exits to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: These snow forts seem to have been designed for a snowball fight. Walls on three sides would protect the fighter from attacks.
Someone has made a row of snow angels. The span the length of one wall.

roomecho.desc: A snowball whizzes past your ear.

room.name: Hall of Hengist of Woodcroft
room.desc: This corridor reaches enormous heights. Many candles float far above the ground, providing much light to the spacious area. The floor is tiled with white and brown stones, scuffed and dirty from years of being treaded upon. Several suits of armour gleam in the candlelight, and antlers are mounted on the wall above them. There is a large, framed picture of a tall, red-haired man on the wall between two antlers. He has a long beard and is wearing blue robes. Honey-coloured sandstone forms the smooth walls, and heavy wooden doors stand ajar to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: These tall suits of armour gleam in the candlelight. They have been well polished, and the rest of the room is reflected in them.
These huge antlers must have come from an Irish Elk. They span nearly 4 metres!
This is a painting of Hengist of Woodcroft. He was a Saxon King of Britain, and led a rebellion against King Vortigern. The kingdom of Kent was founded by him.

roomecho.desc: A suit of armour creaks.

room.name: Passage of bouncing light
room.desc: This hallway is brightly lit by huge white orbs that run down the centre of its wide, light ceiling. Magnificent gilt framed mirrors hang at intervals along both walls, bouncing the light playfully so that every detail is visible. A solitary spider's web hangs dusty in the rays but its resident is nowhere to be seen. This hall serves as a junction, with exits leading north, south and west.

extradesc.desc: The mirror (like all the others) has a lavish gilt frame and is impeccably clean.
The web is perfectly octagonal, beautifully intricate and as big as a quaffle. There is nothing living here except a few dead flies and some dust.

roomecho.desc: A sixth year boy wanders by, adjusting his hair in one of the mirrors as he goes...

room.name: The very tall passage
room.desc: The ceiling of this passage seems miles high, its chandeliers hanging on long silver chains. Intricate scrolls adorn the western, grey wall, falling down side by side in ranks. The wall opposite is barren apart from two small, square windows.

extradesc.desc: Beneath the window, close to the floor, someone has scratched "Snape wears fluffy slippers" into the wall...
The scrolls are going slightly yellow and have endless lists of names, all written in different styles and sizes.

roomecho.desc: A strong breeze passes through one of the small windows and rocks the chandeliers, gently rattling their long silver chains.

room.name: Vesica Pass
room.desc: Upon entering, one is immediately precariously rocked on a high, swinging, rickety bridge connected by cables from this opening to the one on the opposite wall. Looking up one sees the vast sky darkened with storm clouds. Harpies are flying in a vesica piscis pattern above the bridge. They glare at any who enter their domain and take turns breaking ranks from their geometric pattern to harass the intruder. At times, one of their screeches rents the air, sending a shuddering chill down one's back. Looking down, over the side of the bridge, everyone sees jagged rocks and a caliginous chasm. The wind whips at the bridge, spanking it from side to side. The bridge leads through the openings in the rock face on the north and south sides.

room.name: Hall of Crests
room.desc: The hallway's stone walls are covered with colorful drapes of rich, warm colors. Velvety material forms banners that hang down the north and south walls, bearing old crests and seals of wizarding knights and nobility. Tall suits of armor stand between the banners, as if they were standing guard over the entrance to a medieval manor. The largest banner is a flowing fabric of deep, velvety red, bearing a large Hogwarts Crest. The serpent, lion, badger and eagle on the crest are depicted in brilliant colors with lifelike realism and detail. Even the handles fixed on the doors on both sides are ornately sculptured creations. A plush red carpet runs down the length of the corridor, its edges decorated with gold colored tassles. The hallway is immaculately decorated with ample space for walking through and admiring the suits of armor and various banners.

extradesc.desc: The Hogwarts banner shows an enormous depiction of the Hogwarts Crest. The animals and colors of the four houses are intricately printed. The Gryffindor Lion's teeth and claws gleam realistically in the firelight, extending toward the brilliant green Slytherin Serpent; The serpent seems to writhe toward the noble Ravenclaw Eagle; and the eagle's sharp, predator eyes are fixated on the humble Hufflepuff Badger.

The nearest suit of armor is a tall and bulky figure of solid gray metal. Its visor is punctuated with a series of slits, beyond which is only mysterious darkness. A brilliant scarlet plume extends from the top of its helmet, and it holds over its chest, clasped in gloved hands, a long and sinisterly sharp sword.

room.name: Plain Corner Hallway
room.desc: The corner hallway has empty, bare stone walls with rough, unsanded edges. A single leafy green potted plant sits in the corner. It has broad, deep green leaves with intricately spread veins, radiating out in every direction from a thick, central stalk. At the top of its stalk is a large blood, red flower with dozens of slender petals dangling from the center of the flower like a multitude of thin ropes. A small window is situated in the corner wall, which provides the lonely plant with some sunlight during the day. The barren hall opens to the east and the south.

roomecho.desc: The plant in the corner rustles its leaves happily and emits a low, cat-like purring noise. It seems to be thoroughly enjoying basking in the sunlight streaming through the window above.

room.name: Aldous Corridor
room.desc: The floor and ceiling are comprised of Caen stone. Its creamy yellowish hue is complemented nicely by the dark panelling upon the walls. Small oval windows are spaced along the top of the walls with blue tapered candles floating around them. An elaborate painting of an opulent room with luxurious colours and furnishings and two inhabitants sits on the wall. Upon the opposite wall is a small portrait of an odious woman staring at the painting across from her. Scarlet settees and plush chairs are scattered throughout the room. Two depressed archways lead west and east.

extradesc.desc: On one side of the room a woman in a long gown is arranging flowers in a vase. On the other side of the room a table also contains an array of flowers. Beneath it, slightly hidden from view, sits a man's severed head upon a silver tray. The head speaks, "Sheila, how many times do I have to tell you? I cannot see through this vase and flowers. Will you please move it?" "Now, Aldous. I said to be patient. I'm almost finished." "If I still had my body I'd show you a thing or two." "Well, sweet Aldous, until you sprout arms and legs, hush up."
A tarnished frame possesses an old, haggard woman, missing many teeth and with stringy hair, stares hungrily at Aldous. "I'd take good care of you, Aldous."

roomecho.desc: "Foul woman, how long does that take?"
"An angry grunt emits from the painting."

room.name: Circumvolving Corridor B
room.desc: Though not a particularly unusual room, there is one major discrepancy: it is ninety degrees different than the average chamber. The floor is covered with dark cherry wood, as is the ceiling, but the floor is on the eastern wall. The "walls" are covered in blue wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print, however, these "walls" are at the feet of all who enter or where the ceiling resides. On the centre of the floor sits a cherry wood table with six chairs. A golden platter holds eight red apples. All of these items are positioned as though gravity pulls from the eastern wall. Scattered along the walls are several chairs and a couple of settees covered in sapphire-coloured cloth. A pothos plant hangs in one corner with a ficus growing underneath it; the pothos sticks out like an arm. Paintings of magisterial-looking wizards and witches are hung on the wall. They are images of some of the past heads of Ravenclaw House. The exits are north, south, west, and up

roomecho.desc: "A student steps on the painting of Professor Jepson's face. He cries out, 'Get off my mug!"
"A couple of third years walk by. One of them grabs an apple off the table."

room.name: Circumvolving Corridor C
room.desc: Though not a particularly unusual room, there is one major discrepancy: it is one hundred and eighty degrees different than the average chamber. The floor is covered with dark cherry wood, as is the ceiling, but the floor is situated upon the ceiling, and the ceiling is situated where the floor usually resides. The walls are covered in green wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print. On the centre of the upside down floor sits a cherry wood table with six chairs. A golden platter holds eight red apples. All of these items are positioned as though gravity pulls from upside down. Scattered along the walls are several upside down chairs and a couple of settees covered in emerald-coloured cloth. A pothos plant hangs in one corner with a ficus growing underneath it; the pothos sticks up from the ground like the ficus should, whereas the ficus looks like a hanging plant. Paintings of magisterial-looking wizards and witches are hung, upside down, on the wall. They are images of some of the past heads of Slytherin House. The exits are north and south.

roomecho.desc: "A couple of fourth years walk by flicking their wand at the apples. Two apples sail through the air to them."

room.name: Circumvolving Corridor D
room.desc: Though not a particularly unusual room, there is one major discrepancy: it is ninety degrees different than the average chamber. The floor is covered with dark cherry wood, as is the ceiling, but the floor is on the western wall. The "walls" are covered in yellow wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print, however, these "walls" are at the feet of all who enter or where the ceiling resides. On the centre of the floor sits a cherry wood table with six chairs. A golden platter holds eight red apples. All of these items are positioned as though gravity pulls from the western wall. Scattered along the walls are several chairs and a couple of settees covered in saffron-coloured cloth. A pothos plant hangs in one corner with a ficus growing underneath it; the pothos sticks out like an arm. Paintings of magisterial-looking wizards and witches are hung on the wall. They are images of some of the past heads of Hufflepuff House. The exits are north, east, and south.

roomecho.desc: "A couple of seventh years stroll in, inadvertently stepping upon on the painting of Professor Linwood. She shrieks, 'I've never seen such disrespect! Impudence!'"
"A couple of second years walk by. One of them grabs an apple off the table."

room.name: Avian Corridor
room.desc: . This is a short, wide passage; its polished granite walls bear the marks of centuries past. Many interestingly framed portraits hang, conversing among themselves. They give the passage the cramped feeling of a quidditch event. Covering the floor is a moth-eaten wool rug. High above, the arched ceiling is the home to many birds and bats. A small staircase spirals downward to the north. West the corridor splits in two, to the north and the south, and east it extends onward.

room.name: Bland Corridor
room.desc: Looking rather uninteresting, the rough stone walls have been painted a pale mauve with reddish trim around the thin, tall windows. The ceiling here was once the same mauve as the walls. Through ages, the paint has cracked, revealing the rough, unpolished slate that the paint had been hiding. To the north is a shimmering brass door. East and west, the warm inviting corridor extends further.

room.name: Royal Corridor
room.desc: The high ceiling curves into the sky to give this glowing hallway a majestic appearance. The walls, which are bare of anything but a solitary window to the north, and ceiling are made of gold marble which glitters as the light from the dangling chandelier in the centre of the room hits it. The floor is tiled with round, silver stones which seem to constantly radiate light, and a tall suit of armour stands to the left of the exit on the west to complete the royal brilliance of this corridor.

extradesc.desc: The chandelier is made purely of crystal, in which light appears to be suspended. It gives off a never-ending glow which illuminates every corner of this hallway.
A tall, dignified looking suit of armour stands beside the west exit. It holds a long spear from which a white plume dangles.
A tall, dignified looking suit of armour stands beside the west exit. It holds a long spear from which a white plume dangles.

roomecho.desc: A 5th year Ravenclaw student passes by, shielding her eyes from the glare of light as she walks.

room.name: Lake Corridor
room.desc: A bridge connects the two sides of this corridor. Down below is deep, murky water. The cold, unfathomable water is an inky black. A thin rope bridge with decaying wooden planks to walk on sways gently back and forth. Several grimy windows line the wall. They are quite small and let in very little light. One lone torch, in its bracket, gives off a dim light. The ceiling is lower than most in the castle. The stone walls here are smooth and dull. Two stone gargoyles flank each door. They appear to be in deep thought. Cracks have formed over the surface of the gargoyles, like veins. There are exits to the south and west.

extradesc.desc: Two stone gargoyles flank each entryway. They are made of grey stone and covered in fine cracks. Each gargoyle is in the same position, sitting with head in hand. Two stubby horns grow above the bat-like ears, and their wings are folded behind their backs. They look like they're thinking hard.
This rope bridge doesn't look very stable. It swings in the slightest breeze, and many of the wooden planks have fallen off.

roomecho.desc: A tall student walks by, his head down so that he won't hit the ceiling.
A wave laps gently against the wall.

room.name: Skylight Hall
room.desc: Both handsome marble walls of this grand hall are covered with portraits in gilded frames. The tall, arched ceiling is enchanted to look like a massive stained glass skylight providing a view of the sky outside. Fancily carved windows provide a stunning view of a lush green courtyard below where students move about. The door exiting east from this lavishly decorated corridor is made of antiquated oak and bears an inscription of the Gryffindor crest. Exits to the north and south of here lead through large wooden doors.

room.name: Obscure Hallway
room.desc: The stone marble of this particular stretch of hallway seems relatively unscathed. The surface of the smooth, grey flagstones is very uniformly polished. It would seem that few members of the Hogwarts student body ever venture through this area. The walls and ceiling here are somewhat bland, all unmarked and clean save for the ever-burning kerosene lamps that adorn the sides every few yards or so. The hallway extends north and south.

extradesc.desc: The lamps were bright and shining, as the floor. People can see clearly in this room due to these lamps. I mean, these lamps are the bomb.

roomecho.desc: The faint scent of blackberry pie wafts in from the distance.

room.name: Labyrinth Corridor
room.desc: This cathedral style hall's ceiling is supported by massive Corinthian columns. The ceiling towers 15 metres above the floor, making the corridor feel spacious and airy. The walls and ceiling are dazzling white, and the light coming through the enormous, round windows reflects off of every surface. Several tall taper candles, stark white, stand on silver candelabras placed against the walls. The floor is the most interesting aspect of the hall, though. It is done entirely in black and white tiles, and in the pattern of a labyrinth. The labyrinth is perfectly square, and on either side are tile patterns of zigzagging lines. There are exits to the north and west.

extradesc.desc: This large, square labyrinth is done in shiny, black and white tiles. It is in the shape of an octagon, with a smaller octagon in the centre.

These highly polished candelabras gleam in the light of the candles they hold. The candelabrum each have a rounded base, slender body and several sleek arms branched out in several directions. Each arm holds a tall, pale taper candle.

room.name: Calming Blue Corridor
room.desc: This long corridor gives off an aura of calm. Everything is blue, from the navy floor to the azure walls. Three tall, indigo columns, cylindrical and unadorned, hold up the ceiling. The ceiling shimmers, due to the thousands of sapphires encrusted there. They sparkle and twinkle like stars. There are no windows, but the hall is lit by many glowing, blue orbs that hover around the corridor. The orbs ripple like liquids when touched. There are exits to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: These glowing blue orbs float around the corridor. They are about the size of a fist and translucent, like liquid.

roomecho.desc: A blue orb floats gently past.

room.name: Prison Corridor
room.desc: This small, cramped hall is like a prison. The walls, floor and ceiling are made of dull grey stone. On the southern wall is one tiny, barred window. It is high up on the wall and doesn't let in much light. The walls are bare, save for a torch by the eastern exit. There is also an exit to the west. In the centre of the humdrum floor a plain oak bench is chained down. The bench is unfinished and unadorned, and the chains are covered in rust. Dirt has piled up in corners and cracks of this grimy corridor.

extradesc.desc: For some reason, this bench has been chained to the ground...

roomecho.desc: A chilled wind gusts through the hall.

room.name: Deceptive Corridor
room.desc: Arranged in a way meant to boggle the mind, this corridor is aligned with various paintings of optical illusions, slanted portraits of sinister witches, and unlit candelabras tilted in every which way. A depiction of chaos theory projects from one of the illustrations, expanding across the width of the corridor, then diminishing back into an infinitesimal space. The landscape of the floor is crude, as the carpet rises in several areas with rough protrusions to give the hallway a menacing appearance. Imprints of groaning faces appear along the walls, each with its own look of despair and anxiety. The transparent ceiling reveals the sky above, which spins like a hypnotic wheel, creating a sense of nausea and dizziness. A warm, soothing glow filters through the permeable layer, its source unknown. Mesmerising images of nebulas, stars, and planets float across the corridor, bouncing off the walls and momentarily settling into a random portrait. A broad, arched exit waits to the west, while a narrow walkway leads east.

roomecho.desc: A random portrait falls from its mount, crashes, and reappears on the wall.

room.name: Circumvolving Corridor A
room.desc: The floor is covered with dark cherry wood, as is the ceiling. One wall is covered in red wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print. Another wall is covered in blue wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print. Another wall is covered in green wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print. The last wall is covered in yellow wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print. On the centre of the floor sits a cherry wood table with six chairs. A golden platter holds eight red apples. Scattered along the walls are several chairs and a couple of settees covered in ruby, sapphire, emerald, and saffron-coloured cloth. A pothos plant hangs in one corner with a ficus growing underneath it. A small version of the Hogwarts' Crest hangs upon the walls. The exits are north, east, and south.

roomecho.desc: "A first year strolls through, grabbing an apple along the way."

room.name: Charms Classroom
room.desc: . The sides of this classroom are lined with stadium-seating desks for lectures. In the centre of the room are many small, round tables used for practical lessons. The professor's desk is in the very rear of the classroom, and behind it sits a large stack of books, presumably used for him to stand on. The room is lit by chandeliers, and there is a large scorch mark on one of the tables. The walls are made of a dark wood, and the floor dons a black rug.

roomecho.desc: A third-year Hufflepuff scurries into the room, looks around, and then quickly runs out again.

room.name: Ray Way
room.desc: "Plop." A generous amount of wax drips from the lighted orange candles floating in the air onto the sienna-coloured floor. Splatters of wax hit the grand fresco encompassing the walls in this room. The fresco is of a woman walking over a hill, her hair long and her eyes bright. She's wearing golden robes that seem to match the golden rays emanating from her. Three men and one woman, in black robes with two blue stars over their hearts, are running from the rays radiating from the woman. Gold-coloured sofas and coffee tables are scattered throughout the room. The exits are through the archways leading north and south.

extradesc.desc: The woman's rays are powerful, even affecting all who enter this domain. To those who are courageous and virtuous, her rays seem to have regenerative powers. To those who enter who are not, or straddle the fence between both worlds, her rays seem to grip the heart and squeeze it unmercifully.

roomecho.desc: Screams of "Stop, please stop. Your goodness is killing us" reverberate throughout the room.

room.name: Contradictive Corridor
room.desc: Upon entry of the corridor, an inviting scent sneaks its way across the room. The tantilizing smell is generated from the far end of the passageway. And permeates throughout the hall. Incandescent brooms line either side of the walkway, delicately levitating in the air, inches from the wall. Trifling magical bugs scurry over the wooden floor, occasionally bursting from the vibrant light of a nearby broomstick, and summarily reforming upon the surface of the ground. The steady movement of the corridor's objects present the fraudulent appearance of a mobile room, as the repetitive motion can be nauseating and discomforting. The pleasant aroma is easily offset by the infrequent, yet awkward, explosions caused by the anxious insects. Wide openings to the north, south, and west signify exits from the passageway.

room.name: Hall of Faces
room.desc: Carved along the tall, thin, polished oak walls are hundreds of faces, each of them different. Occasionally one of the faces will make a stab at conversation, but the others immediately silence it. This makes the corridor eerily silent, then deafeningly noisy. The ceiling is made of blue-green glass. Candles hovering mid-air cast ghostly shadows as their light strikes the glass ceiling. Large, white, marble pillars sit on each side of both ends of the corridor marking the exits to the east and south.

roomecho.desc: "So, what do you think of this weather we're having?" The sound of a tire losing air ensues as the faces "sh-h-h" the query.

room.name: Stone Angel Corridor
room.desc: This long, spacious hallway spreads out in brilliant white marble. Along both walls run rows of eloquently carved stone angels carrying crosses, each as different and unique as the next. Mini waterfalls cascade down both sides of a low, grey wall that runs down the length of the corridor and splits it into two narrower corridors of equal width. The doors at the west and east ends are made of glass so spotless that there doesn't even appear to be anything seperating this passageway from the ones before and after it.

room.name: Prestigious Corridor
room.desc: Seemingly flawless at first glance, this corridor depicts the perfection and essence of magic. Within its parameters exist several portraits of the most notorious and powerful wizards ever to walk the great halls of Hogwarts. Mounted in a level and successive pattern, each picture portrays eloquent depictions of its inhabitant doing various activities: war veteran Marcus Shavvy, fully clothed in thick, black robes, accented by a lengthy 15 inch wand pointed toward the nearest bystander; musical prodigy Glenda Rougan, performing a ballad from her tenth symphony; most notably, however, there hangs a spectacular, embossed portrait of Professor Albus Dumbledore, outlined in a thick, emerald frame. Soft, quilted carpet provides easy access along the floor, comforting even the most tender feet. Darting back and forth across the width of the corridor, miniscule fireflies provide sporadic flashes of light within the dimly lit walkway. Closer inspection confirms small, yet abundant cracks lining the walls on either side, adding to the vintage allure of the room. Grandiose marble archways mark exits to the north, east, and west.

extradesc.desc: A waxy, golden frame surrounds this medieval portrayal of a young maiden in her late teens. She stands in a small, circular room at the top of a tall stone tower. The room is draped in bright, happy colours, and out of the window you can see rolling hills and pastures in the early light of dawn. Elizabeth Barton, so states the golden plaque beneath the painting, is dressed in an attractive, elegant dress. Its long, thick flowing fabrics drape to the ground while the lighter, thin fabrics blow in the breeze created by the window Elizabeth stands at, peering into the distance. The plaque beneath her also clearly states that she alone saved the local village of Hornton from a rabid pack of Blast-Ended Skrewts. However, this beautiful, distinguished witch is known to swat at her dress in discomfort, and spit out of the window in distaste.

roomecho.desc: A wandering mist finds its way into the corridor, encapsulating the inhabitants for a brief moment.

room.name: Mural Corridor
room.desc: A bright stone hallway is pleasantly lit by large windows near the top of the north wall. The stones around the windows have been cut in odd shapes, as if they were leftover from the straight, even blocks of the wall. They seem to be holding the windows in place by sheer force of will. On the flat east wall is a large mural. A large flowering Hawthorne tree with bright white flowers and tiny green berries reaches out long thin limbs towards the edges. In the foreground a brook bubbles over turtle shells and rushes around large boulders. The trunk of the tree is engraved with a large H in a flowery script. Brightly colored songbirds are nestled in between the thorns on the limbs. At the end of each of the four largest limbs a gigantic bow has been tied in green, red, blue or yellow. The smaller limbs branching out off the primary boughs have twelve surnames painted at the ends in silver or gold. This corrodor comes from the west and leads to the east where another corridor crosses paths.

room.name: Circumvolving Corridor E
room.desc: The floor is covered with dark cherry wood, as is the ceiling. The walls are covered in red wallpaper with a fleur-de-lis print. On the centre of the floor sits a cherry wood table with six chairs. A golden platter holds eight red apples. Scattered along the walls are several chairs and a couple of settees covered in ruby-coloured cloth. A pothos plant hangs in one corner with a ficus growing underneath it. Paintings of magisterial-looking wizards and witches are hung on the wall. They are images of some of the past heads of Gryffindor House. The exits are south and west.

roomecho.desc: "A couple of sixth years walk by. One of them grabs an apple off the table."

room.name: Room of Hogwarts Gifts
room.desc: The ceiling is high. Roughly eight or nine feet high, but low enough so the chandeliers can be seen. Each chandelier is a different colour and design to the others, however, each is equally as grand as the last. The floor space is taken up with different suits of armour and chests, everyone showing a different trend in fashion, thus displaying the age of the room itself. There is a sign ahead. The exit is to the west.

extradesc.desc: The sign reads "Room of Hogwarts Gifts" in large golden lettering, below it a short description reveals to you "The Room of Hogwarts Gifts is where all unwanted and unnecessary gifts are sent to, after the headmaster/headmistress has deemed fit that an appropriate period of gratitude time has passed. Among famous treasures located here is the statue of Alfred the Extended sent to Albus Dumbledore from Durmstrang."

The statue is reasonably new and matches with the other suits of armour you would find around the Hogwarts castle. The one difference is the hideous length of the suit of armour's limbs and the look of complete and utter pain upon the face where the helmet has been peeled back. A placard at the base is visible reading "Alfred the Extended 1802-1895, Hogwarts student who when arriving for a years exchange in Durmstrang was mistaken for an enemy, stealing school secrets and put to the guard Trolls"

room.name: Beguiled Corridor
room.desc: The floorboard creaks with anticipation upon entrance of this corridor. The walls slant inwardly, providing a subtle imitation of a narrowed pathway. Gleaming lanterns maintain a hovering existence on either side of the corridor, running the length of the hall. At various intervals, the ceiling expands and retracts, bringing the adjacent facades to a point, further impeding the width of the room. The newly formed triangular hallway moans in agony as its body stretches in an attempt to reform its rectangular boundaries once more. In addition to the obscure shifting sequence, ominous whispers are heard echoing against the plethora of magical structures. Malevolent snickering fills the passageway. Patterns of footprints embedded in the floor reveal a well-trodden rug, as the impressions mark a crooked path toward each exit. Intricate, black archways denote outlets to the north, east and west.

room.name: Rickety Stairwell
room.desc: A narrow rickety flight of stairs leads up. The steps of moldy wood appear dilapidated, as if they are not capable of holding much weight. A handrail of rusting metal affords a trace of safety, but the whole staircase seems to have come into existence as an afterthought. Mold has germinated along the grey walls; and if one looks carefully, it forms the letters: B-E C-A-R-E-F-U-L. The exits are up or east.

extradesc.desc: I said, "Be careful."

roomecho.desc: The staircase groans and vibrates.

room.name: Marble Staircase
room.desc: The staircase and banisters are cut from elegant, pure white marble. On each end of the banisters, formed out of the marble, are two Sphinxes. Tiger eye gems are set in their almond-shaped eyes. The steps spiral upward or downward and to the north a vast chamber opens out.

roomecho.desc: A student skids to the staircase. One of the Sphinxes says, "You might want to slow down."

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: The flagstones that make up the floor are worn smooth by the feet of the students over the ages. The stone walls are well lit by a set of torches on either side of a huge painting that takes up most of the space of one of the walls. A set of high windows are set high on one wall. The corridor continues to the south where it takes a turn to the east. A set of stairs start here, winding its way up. A small sign hangs next to the entrance to the stairs.

room.name: Hall of Seasons - East Entrance
room.desc: This wide, spacious chamber has a mosaic floor depicting the Hogwarts crest in vivid colours and lustrous metal tiles. The walls are huge stone edifices, imposing yet elegant. Set high in the stone are several small alcoves with small wicked stone faces looking down from them. Adorning the walls are several iron torch holders, some holding burning torches, some empty. The roof is a mass of dark oak beams and rafters. Hanging from the centre is a giant black candelabra, its many candles casting an irregular light upon every surface. To the east is a massive black marble archway with the legend "HALL OF SEASONS" carved in an arc above it. A corridor leads away to the north and a beautiful marble stairway lays to the south.

extradesc.desc: Made of jet black iron, this ornate candelabra slowly swings in small circles. It has several twisted branches spiralling away from the centre bearing thin white candles.
The carved marble faces stare back at you, some are cherub faced while others are grim demons.
The painted tiles are the brightest hues of yellow, green, blue and red. There are also tiles made of pure silver and gold.
A large Hogwarts crest decorates the floor. Made of many tiny tiles, it shows the four crests of the houses contained in quarters of a shield with an ornate letter 'H' in the centre.

roomecho.desc: Light slowly beams through the cracks in the rafters.
One of the faces sticks its tongue out at you!
A face yawns in an alcove high above you.

room.name: Spring Hall
room.desc: . Bright rays of sunlight, coming from a sky as blue as the purest sapphire, immediately light up this passageway upon entrance. Occasionally a storm cloud moves in to drench unfortunate passers by with rain, but this lively corridor remains otherwise warm and sunny. The floor is covered in bright green blades of grass, from which buds of purple and white flowers dare to poke through. The cheerful chirping of birds creates a light-hearted mood, as does the soft nickering of the baby unicorn illustrated by the painting hung on the east wall. Across the portrait, a banner reading "Spring Hall" in pink, loopy script hangs suspended on two cherub-shaped hooks. This corridor continues on to the north and south.

room.name: Summer Hall
room.desc: The hot, humid summer air hangs thickly in the air in this corridor, penetrated only by the low buzz of dragonflies and other insects combined with the faint lapping of water which is coming from somewhere off in the distance. Lush grass spreads thickly across the floor, and the ceiling above depicts a blue, cloudless sky. A long tapestry portraying a group of children playing on a sandy beach extends from one end of the north wall to the other. On the wall opposite of the finely woven rug are the words "Summer Hall", written in bright red, block letters.

room.name: Autumn Hall
room.desc: . A light breeze wafts down the length of this cheerful corridor, blowing about handfuls of pale pink, deep red, and rusty orange leaves. The leaves land gracefully on the soft, dirt-covered ground; however, moments later, a gust of wind once again lifts them into colourful whirlwinds. The ceiling looks like the sky on a warm autumn afternoon - deep blue, with snowy white clouds drifting lazily in the air. Two paintings are arranged side by side on the west wall. The first is of a toddler charming a leaf to spin around his head, while the other depicts a snidget sleeping in a hole in the trunk of a large oak tree. Spread out upon the west wall are the words "Autumn Hall", painted in bronze letters.

room.name: Winter Hall
room.desc: Soft white flakes drift gently to the ground of this passageway, covering it in a thick layer of snow. Above the snow-covered ground is a bright blue sky, free of clouds. Icicles dangle from the alcoves above the two round windows on the west wall, and the faint ringing of bells can be detected somewhere in the distance. On the wall opposite of the windows hangs a portrait of two children sledding down a steep hill. Their squeals of delight echo along the hallway, giving it a fun and playful atmosphere. Above the painting, the words "Winter Hallway" are spread out in pale blue and silver. A single door lies to the north.

room.name: Devil's Snare Hallway
room.desc: Stagnant water drips down from rusted pipes along the ceiling. A strange musty odor permeates the entire way. Muddy pools of water occupy the cobblestone floor, some shallow, some depths unsure. Reflecting off the pools are sparse streaks of light that shine through cracks in the ceiling and walls. Light is so dim that it is barely visible from the north exit to the south exit. Snake-like tendrils of vines slither across the walls, ceiling, and broken pipes. The vines encase the entire room, strangling each object it comes into contact with. Splashes of water dripping into the still pools echo all around. Four hanging candelabras, tarnished black with disuse, are almost covered by the strangling vines. An interesting pile of logs lay to the right of the floor on the shallow side of a puddle. In the centre is a stone ring 1 metre high.

extradesc.desc: . Drawing closer reveals an aged white candle and a usable wick. Lighting the candle casts a soft warm glow that the Devil's Snare instantly recoils from.
Though partly damp, the logs are still usable. The wood has aged, causing large chunks to splinter and fall off.
The stones are perfectly laid out in a 1 metre high ring. No breaks or cracks are found anywhere in the wall. The floor of the ring is fine grey sand with blackened ashes mixed in.

roomecho.desc: Hissing sounds cause the clinging vines to tighten around the room.
A Familiar Voice asks the room "Did you pay attention in Herbology?"
Splash! A rock tossed by Peeves lands smack dab in the middle of a puddle.

room.name: Maze Hall
room.desc: Hedges take up this hallway from floor to ceiling. They are 6 metres high with thick, green leaves growing closer together each minute. The leaves are the size of footballs and rustle constantly. Rustling sounds grow louder and louder each minute while the leaves seem to be stretching themselves towards the middle of the hall. The enchanted ceiling only shows grey and gloomy skies, with rolling thunderhead clouds. Heavy, musty smells of rain fill up the hall. A large clang resounds in the hall and silence falls on the room. Leaves have inched their way back from the exits to the east, south, and north. In the middle lies a long, flashing sword encrusted with red rubies.

extradesc.desc: Grabbing hold a leaf seems to be very difficult in that it seems to be suddenly out of reach each time. Finally grasping one quickly enough causes a shudder to go up and down the leaf. Pulling and Pulling as hard as possible the leaf pops loudly and floats tenderly to the ground.

The sword is solid, firm, and heavy. Light bounces off the gleaming blood-red rubies. Writing in a strange language gets clearer with a light brush over the words. Staring hard, the words suddenly leap into place and read: Godric Gryffindor.

roomecho.desc: A blast ended skrewt races in from the north and back out the south
Overhead skies reflect the moon in a grey vision
Whispering sounds intensify all around growing closer and closer each second

room.name: Hedge Row Room
room.desc: High hedges form the walls of this room. The dark, green leaves are velvety to the touch and bunched so closely together that no sight or sound can get through them. Large, dark, purple pear-shaped fruit hangs from the top to bottom of the hedges. The fruit pulse and throb as if listening to inner music. A sweet, juicy fragrance fills the room inviting all senses to eat. Blades of long grass run the length of the floor and are regularly trimmed by unseen forces. Hanging here and there are small clouds of white, sparkling mists. The silence of the room presses in on all sides making its presence known. The ceiling is completely magical, appearing as if the sun shines in during the day, and moonlight at night. The throbbing fruit also light up parts of the hedges. Hedges exit on to the south, and heading north is more corridors.

extradesc.desc: Reaching forward you pull down a grapefruit sized purple pear and with a deep breath bite in. The amazing sourness of the fruit causes all senses to gag and the fruit drops to the floor.
Stepping into the mist causes a reversal of earth and sky. The floor is hanging above and the sky below. Hedges are upside down and the fruit is swinging away over the ceiling

roomecho.desc: Humming sounds seem to be coming from the fruit
A springtime breeze flows all around
Out in the sky birds fly past and swoop all around

room.name: Enchanted Fountain Corridor
room.desc: The centre of this white-marble corridor is occupied with a tall fountain in the shape of a pointed wizard's hat. It spews out crystal clear water from a spout on the pointed top, but there is no basin to catch the water. Instead, magical boundaries have been created to keep the water near the base of the pure white fountain. Drains in the tiled floor keep the water level from getting too high, and allow the water to cycle through the fountain again. Around the fountain white-marble Ionic columns support the ceiling, which towers five metres above the floor. There are exits to the south and west.

extradesc.desc: A large, white-marble fountain in the shape of a pointed wizard's hat pours forth beautiful, clear water from the top. The marble has small grey-green veins running through it.

room.name: Vampiric Corridor
room.desc: The corridor is bathed in a deep red light, the torches flaming a dark crimson. Portraits of vampires line the hall, including several vampires of modern lore, such as Lestat, Louis, and Marius. One portrait is of Odin Lovago, a Saxon neuntoter, or German vampire. Also known as the nine-killer, this type of vampire is born after it has lain in the grave for nine days. Thought to be the vampire who carried the bubonic plague to parts of England during his travels, this once revered scholar was killed as soon as he was suspected. The only way to kill a neuntoter is to place a lemon in its mouth, which may explain why Odin is constantly wearing a sour expression. Red light spills into four connected hallways from this corridor, one each to the north, east, south, and west.

roomecho.desc: The sound of bat wings reverberate throughout the hall.

room.name: Parry Passage
room.desc: A two-tiered chandelier lights the hallway, filling it with bright light. At the end of the corridor a suit of armor wielding an axe reflects the bright light. Several tables line the walls, holding various objects such as vases and statues. A large painting of a woman practicing her swordfighting hangs on the walls, the clangs and zings of metal on metal filling the hallway. The candle-light pools across the smooth stone floors, illuminating three large exits. To the south is a hallway filled with various paintings. To the north a brightly lit hall spans into the distance, and to the east extends another long hall.

room.name: Common Corner
room.desc: Polished stone paves the hallway, stretching from entrance to entrance. Potraits of various teachers from past generations line the walls. One, a portrait of an old, stooped woman, is chastising the portraits around it for staying away from their portraits too long. A bag of Fizzing Whizbees sits in the corner lost by its owner. Through the western exit, you can see a hall lined with tapestries. Another exit is to the north.

roomecho.desc: A feeble, female voice says, "Will you please get back here?"

room.name: Fading Tapestry Hall
room.desc: Faded tapestries dot the walls, each depicting a scene from the history of Hogwarts. One is maroon, with legions of soldiers marching across. Another is jade with an aged sword held in the left hand of an expert warrior. The gold one holds the picture of a woman with several necklaces around her neck; three golden chains hold a Time-Turner, a lycanthrope, and an H. The last, a dark blue tapestry, portrays a tall woman with long, wavy brown hair, a thick book held tightly in her right hand. The floor is polished stone, stretching out to the east and west to two tall archways.

roomecho.desc: A couple of male students look at the tapestry of the woman with long, brown hair. She winks at them.

room.name: Aromatic "T" Intersection
room.desc: Warm firelight emanates from the various torches mounted at random intervals along the stone walls. The corridor is neatly kept, minus the few scattered pieces of dropped homework that waft down the hall. A warm, lazy breeze smelling of roses and wisteria tickles the torches, making the flames flutter but not extinguish. Portraits of various witches and wizards line the hallway, each looking very scholarly. One wizard is Bartholomew de Pasqualigo, an Italian wizard who worked with da Vinci on several of his inventions. He frowms as Sir Cadogan pushes his way into the picture but says nothing, instead opting to go back to his book. Sir Cadogan rushes off into another portrait, his armor clanging all the while. Three exits stem from this passage: One is to the south, framed by a large archway. Another is to the east with a simple molding around the edge. A bird's nest rests atop it. The last is to the West.

roomecho.desc: A few rolls of parchment slowly float through the hallway, carried by the draft.

room.name: Magical Mishap Room
room.desc: The walls, floor, and ceiling consist of charcoal-grey slate. A pewter chandelier holds a couple dozen black candles emanating a deathly glow. Dozens of photographs and illustrations hang upon the wall. The pictures are gruesome and unnerving. One such photo depicts a young girl's calamity. Another picture displays an incident surrounding a male student. In the middle of the corridor stands a pewter box with a red button upon it. The exit to the north leads to the library. A box-archway permits one to exit east.

extradesc.desc: The pushed-button emits a voice from the pewter box. "This hall is an admonitory to any who think jokes, pranks, or other antics are for laughs and giggles. There is a ghastly side to these actions, as evidenced by these pictures."

The unlucky, young girl had been hit by a Tickling Charm from an unknown source. Unfortunately, the schoolgirl, who was at the head of the staircase leading outside, fell down the stairs laughing and into a Pampi Venesomna plant. The combination of the plant's tentacles wrapping around her, spreading its poison, and the plummet down the stairs, left her in a coma for six years.

This unfortunate student heard the word "Tarantella" before his legs went into a frenzied and furious dance. This dance caused one of his shoes to fly off his foot and hit Adam Kipfer. The shoe put Adam's eye out.

roomecho.desc: '"Why did you do this to me?"'
'"Oh, it hurts, it hurts!"'
"You stupid evil git!"

room.name: Armor Way
room.desc: Torchlight reflects off of glimmering, highly polished suits of armor. The corridor walls seem to dance with shadows cast by the armor. Magnificent red flowers bloom out from hollows carved in the walls, emitting an aromatic fragrance smelling of both roses and tulips. Indeed, these flowers must be the handiwork of Professor Sprout. To the north is an arched opening and to the south the corridor continues.

extradesc.desc: The armor quickly turns it's helmet away, looking straight ahead again
The flowers sway gently back and forth on an unfelt breeze

roomecho.desc: A suit of armor creaks quietly.
Peeves floats through the corridor seeking to perform some sort of mischief.
Flower leaves rustle gently against the wall.

room.name: Library Passage
room.desc: Huge, beautifully decorated windows that reach from the floor to the ceiling cover the right side of this vast corridor, adding a peaceful beauty of the Hogwarts landscape to the hall that only a painting could depict. Between each enormous window stands a highly polished suit of armour, shining magnificent, flickering designs on the opposite wall, courtesy the large, billowing torches above them. Light from the many torches and candles that spread through the stretch give the hall a faint golden and shimmering hue that seems to radiate a feel of magic. To the left are many smaller, glassless panes that allow students - tired of studying - to casually lean onto and gaze in wonder and serenity. The corridor feels alive as the chattering of students and books being pawed through escapes the nearby library. The passage continues both north and south, and a large archway lies to the west.

room.name: Secret Passageway
room.desc: A flight of creaking, wooden stairs lead upwards, opening up into vast sky above and open room all around. Below and to the left are the four house tables: Gryffindor, Ravenclaw, Hufflepuff and Slytherin with the staff table directly beneath. The sky is bewitched to look like the outside sky and ever changing depending on what time of day it is. Haphazardly placed, candles float all around. Lights flicker at night creating a soft glow, and sizzle out during the daylight hours. In the center of the expanse of sky is a narrow path of candles zigzagging in and out at different angles leading directly from exits placed in the east and west. Another pathway of candles leads to the south exit. All exits contain dark oak doors with large splinters and chunks of wood missing. Shiny brass knockers sparkle from the candlelight.

roomecho.desc: Loud, Laughing and cheering voices can be heard from below
Peeves Cackles as he bounces from table to table knocking over candles illuminating him.
Pitter Pattering Feet of Mrs. Norris can be heard from far below.

room.name: Emerald Corner Way
room.desc: Cobblestones line the floor of the hallway. Down the center of the path they are worn smooth, becoming bumpier with chips and small cracks in them towards the edges of the walls. The walls are hard stone too, imprinted with dazzling emerald diamond shaped designs leading in angled directions. At first the designs seem to be random but with further study there seems to be an intricate pattern of arrows and stars. The way is airy, as if a cool breeze has been flowing all through the corridor. Six torches hang from three posts all directly in the middle of the pathway. Blue white flames flicker from the torches licking upwards towards the ceiling. Emerald diamond shapes of stars reflect the torchlight lighting up the ceiling and sparkling like the night sky. Emerald shaped designs of arrows point out the pathway to the north and west.

roomecho.desc: "Starlight, Starbright First Star I see Tonight"
"I Wish I May, I Wish I Might"
"Many Dreams are Whispered into the night, Some come true in the morning light"

room.name: Cumulonimubs Room
room.desc: Cool misty breezes flow from unseen sources. The air is icy upon entering this corridor. Walls of solid, black onyx stone create a feeling of endlessness. Imbedded in the black stone are ice-blue sparkling diamonds that wink off and on all around. Enchanted skylights reflect the piercing white light of the full moon. Along the walls are tiny eight by ten pictures of multicolored hippogriffs, feathered owls, and soaring broom sticks. Floors of gigantic puffy white cumulonimbus clouds toss back and forth, often piling high on one side and then shifting around to other sides. Clouds feel soft and velvety to the touch, like a huge blanket waiting to be wrapped around, and then disappear after a moment. Stepping up on a cloud reveals it is firm. Light steps taken towards the south and east exits causes the clouds to bounce from place to place.

roomecho.desc: A hooting sound slowly grows louder as a flock of Owls swish by in every direction.
Off to the left a Hippogriff with golden feathers pops in and soars away from the full moon.

room.name: Golden Archway
room.desc: Torches of solid gold line the corridor. Bright flames light up the room and reflect and dazzle the entire way. Every spot of visible space gleams and sparkles. Walls of solid gold melt into floors of solid gold bricks. The ceiling arches upwards towards a steeple point, reflecting all light being made of solid gold bricks as well. Light bounces, soars, dances, and leaps from spot to spot. Upon entering, the sweet sensations of honey flow forth from the gold, tickling the senses. True to the understanding that gold is ageless, the sweet smell of honey causes renewed vigor and youth, almost as if time was flowing backwards. Pure gold is flexible to the touch as is obvious by the many handprints in the walls, floor, and ceiling from students passing through. Names are even scripted in cursive above the prints. Chairs of solid oak with golden seat cushions line the right side of the way. Book stands of solid oak rest next to each chair. An oak settee is placed in the upper left corner of the hall. A large gold cauldron is to the right of the settee. Golden archways form the north, east, and west exits.

extradesc.desc: A golden torch, upon closer inspection, shows intricate patterns of triangles, squares, and circles intersecting the length of the torch. Heat radiates from the tip all the way down. Touching it causes a mild burn that magically disappears after a few seconds pain.
Dark oak, solid smooth wood. Scratches and small nicks are visible in the wood defining it as a very old chair. Most of the chairs are all firmly rooted to the floor.

Upon sitting in the chair the cushion releases a 'whoosh' of air. It appears at first to be a very firm seat, but upon relaxing further a sensation of sinking deep down into the chair grows each second. The longer anyone stays in the seat the more the sense of being swallowed up by the chair becomes apparent.

The cauldron is large and made out of solid gold. Anyone reaching in and touching the sides instantly begins to feel mellow as their limbs turn golden. Gold fingers, become gold hands, which become gold arms until the weight of the limb suddenly drags down to the bottom of the cauldron. With a 'spluuuut,' limbs are tossed backwards out of the cauldron and across the room.

This too is made of solid oak wood and very heavy if picked up. The joints are extremely loose, creating a squeaky sound any time anyone reclines, or relaxes on it. While not very comfortable to sleep on, it does obstruct hallways and doors quiet nicely, if managed to be picked up (for it is a solid mass of weight).

Each stand is neatly placed next to the solid oak chairs. A fine layer of dust has gathered on top of each one. In the dust are many fingerprints of passing students as well as obscene gestures and comments obviously written during Peeves' passing.
extradesc.keywords: bookstands shelf book books stand shelves

roomecho.desc: A gusty wind blows all around the room causing the torch-lights to flicker.
A loud groaning sound comes from the direction of the settee. It seems to be moving as if an invisible person is shifting it about.
Peeves laughter fills the room as he adds newly thought up swear words into the dust of the bookshelves.

room.name: Bell Hall
room.desc: . Hanging from the low ceiling in this hall are large, differently shaped silver bells. Some are the size of pumpkins while others are the size of gourds. Made of solid silver, they reflect the light allowed in through the six windows lining the walls. The window panes are lined with silver, with silver valances and silver curtains that are swept back during the day and closed at night. A strange bottle of a dark, thick liquid is placed underneath the curtains next to a decanter of a lighter coloured fluid. Solid silver candelabras hang in-between the windows and are only lit at night. The floor is also made of solid sliver and is smooth to the touch. This silver passage sparkles and shines, reflecting the surfaces of the images around the entire hall. Underneath the windows are three solid silver tables about 1 metre high. A silver tea set sits atop one table, complete with a teapot, saucers, cups, sugar-bowl and creamer-bowl. On the second table is a silver dinner set for eight, with plates, glasses, bowls, and a tray. On the third table is resting a silver set of cutlery consisting of knives, forks, and spoons. Silver draperies line the east and west exits.

extradesc.desc: Bell Hall is named for the fact that hanging from the ceiling are large different shaped objects all resembling silver bells. Every so often Peeves bounces into this room and the bells sway and clang together. Sometimes the music is a sweet humming sound, sometimes a hideous shrieking sound and often just the simple sound of a drumming bell.

Touching the tea set immediately causes it to go into action. The silver teacups clatter onto the saucers, while the teapot bends over and begins to pour tea into each cup, splashing in its hurry. The sugar-bowl proceeds to dump three lumps of sugar into every cup and the creamer-bowl pours rich milk until the tea is a light brown color.
extradesc.keywords: tea-set teapot saucer saucers cups cup sugar-bowl creamer-bowl

extradesc.desc: As soon as the dinner set is approached food begins to fill up the beautiful silver tray. Mountains of fruit, light filling pastries and delightful chocolates pile high until food begins to fall off onto each plate and bowl, filling them up and falling onto the next one. The glasses all fill with a transparent bubbly liquid that tickles the tongue.
extradesc.keywords: dinner-set plates plate glasses glass bowl bowls tray

extradesc.desc: The table is touched and the silverware leaps into a jig. The knives flash back and forth, while the spoons clang loudly on the table and the forks leap up and down, dancing on their tines.
extradesc.keywords: knives knife forks fork spoon spoons cutlery

extradesc.desc: Buzzing sounds emit from the curtains louder and louder as if swarming with invisible bees. Suddenly a hundred fairy-sized creatures come leaping out of them. Four fists, tiny needle sharp teeth, with beetle-like wings and a body of thick black hair go hurling across the room. Doxies can be furious little creatures that like to bite if disturbed in their niches (long curtains and draperies). Squirting doxycide in the face causes them to faint to the floor.

The bottle is large with a nozzle on top to aim and spray in different directions. Inside is a thick black liquid that oozes from side to side if you tilt the bottle. A small label reads: Warning: Toxic. DO NOT SWALLOW. Directions: Aim nozzle at creatures and spray quickly in the face. Doxycide, the cure for your infestation of Doxyies any time of day.

Transparent and slim this tall decanter has a medicine dropper corking the top of it. The liquid inside is thick, but white in color and puckers the senses with lemon scents. A large label reads: Warning: DO NOT TAKE MORE THEN RECOMMENDED DOSE. Directions: Fill medicine dropper full and completely swallow liquid while holding breath. Repeat two more times. Indications: Cures all repercussions from having been bitten by a Doxy, including nausea, vomiting, headache, fever, dizziness, swollen limbs, hives, chills, and unexplained rashes. All side affects lead to gradual and eventual death if not treated within 4 hours of a Doxy Bite. Use wisely and carefully. If symptoms persist after full dosage has been taken see the nearest healer within 1 hour. If allergic to Doxy Bite seek medical attention as soon as possible. If pregnant or nursing consult healer before consuming this product. Allergic Precautions: Does Not contain nuts.

roomecho.desc: "Ding-dong, ding-dong. Ding-dong, ding-dong. Dong; dong; dong."
A loud clang echo's all around as Peeves zooms from bell to bell bashing them each with a hammer.
Cutlery is sent flying, dinner plates smash into the ground and the teapot begins to spout hot boiling tea all over the place as Peeves wrecks havoc in bell hall.

room.name: Hall of the Tina
room.desc: Entering this corridor, a sudden sensation of seclusion is felt by all. The room, plastered with a myriad of oblique colours, exposes passers-by to a rush of anxiety and perplexing sadness. Adding to the depressing nature of the hall, a dull luminosity encompasses its space, originating from one, small candlestick pressed against the corner. Floating, inanimate objects fill the dense air, supplementing the claustrophobic setting. Grim, dark shadows mimic the movements of psychotic wizards, laughing maniacally from within their mounted portraits. The floor is laced with a crimson red carpet that breaks the boundaries of the corridor, lifting itself against the walls in a vine-like fashion, while culminating at the centre of the room with a series of shifting fabric. Obscured by the lack of light, steady movement of the rug appears to have been caused by an invisible force, when in fact, a turnstile embedded under the carpet rotates a circular textile in perpetual motion. To the west, silver curtains hang delicately from the exit, while rustic, stone-framed exits lead to the north and east.

room.name: Hall of the Condemned
room.desc: Oscillating waves of light saturate this corridor's spacious walkway. A few delicate moments, and the vibrant glare dissipates with a sudden painful shriek. Once the deafening echo fades away, a broad, ancient room takes the place of the previous blinding radiance. The hall remains illuminated by sunlight filtering through immense windows on the north and east sides of the corridor, and at night by torches spread along the walls. Four noticable statues of centaurs occupy every corner of the passage, each with an eerily depressing expression on its face. As they detect movement within the corridor, the centaurs come to life, moaning in agony and delivering crude gestures with their arms, reaching out toward one another in a repetitive, monotonous sequence. Fastened to the tousled carpet beneath them, they cannot escape this seemingly perpetual suffering. A semi-arid culture fills the room, then quickly transitions to a crisp chill. Every aspect of the corridor seems to be in constant motion. Narrow exits, overshadowed by the aggressive centaurs, lead to the west and south

room.name: Fairy Forest Room
room.desc: Bushes and trees of every size and colour imaginable fill this room, emanating a sweet forest smell. Some of the bushes have flowers, while others are simply plain. Dim, eternal sunshine lights the room from an unseen source. High in the trees butterflies flutter about. Occupying the small bushes are tiny magical fairies. They twinkle like fireflies in the dark mist and fly around with the butterflies. In the far south corner of the room is a relatively small pond with frogs, rocks, and lily pads. The fairies play with the lily pads, using them to ride across pond. Exits are to the north, south, and east.

roomecho.desc: A faerie whizzes by and disappears into a nearby bush.
One of the frogs tries to catch and eat a fairy. The fairy escapes and flies away, laughing.

room.name: Silent Scarlet Carpet Corridor
room.desc: A squishy carpet coloured scarlet is covering the floor from corner to corner; this is to hide the sound of students sneaking about after bedtime. The narrow walls are made of pure mahogany wood, and lining the length of the corridor are oval-shaped portraits. It is said that these portraits are the past students of Gryffindor House. Torches are lit between every other portrait. Further down, there is a faint smell of polish coming from the display of the first Gryffindor House Cup award, and next to it is a small plaque honoring Godric Gryffindor himself. A suit of armour is located towards the middle of the pathway. There is also a hint of whispering from students. Exits are to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: The Cup reads, "Gryffindor House Cup. Awarded in honor of fantastic display of courage, bravery, and leadership."
The plaque reads, "Godric Gryffindor. One of the 4 founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Known for his courage, determination, and bravery."

roomecho.desc: A student whispers, "Where in tarnation did I leave that book?"
A strong smell of polish permeates the area.

room.name: Stone Statue Corridor
room.desc: This hall is filled with stone figures, animals, and objects. Each statue is part of the hall, sprouting from the floor or suspended from the ceiling when not moving. The statues are grouped together into little scenes. Several stone people huddle together in one corner, absorbed in their conversation. Near the centre of the corridor, some granite rabbits and other woodland creatures frolic beneath towering stone trees. A marble hawk circles above, its sharp eyes darting to and fro. While all of this is in progress, a small sandstone boy sits in the corner, watching quietly. A limestone table setting resides against the eastern wall, with a sumptuous stone feast laid out upon it. Several stone pockets protrude from the walls, each containing a flickering tongue of flame. There are exits to the east and west.

room.name: The Sickle
room.desc: This narrow area is covered, from ceiling to floor, with grey slate. The slate is painted with constantly moving pictures. The mural is of a Quidditch match with players flying across the walls, the ceiling, and the floor. Dark iron torches, shaped like scissors pointing upward with their blades apart, line the wall. A continuous flame burns from the tip of each blade. Four mahogany chairs, with long legs and dark leather cushions, face four wrought-iron mirrors along the northern wall. The same type of mirrors is along the opposite wall, displaying the back of the chairs. Before each mirror on the northern wall, a thin, mahogany shelf resides. Long, slender bottles holding varying tonics and combs lie upon the shelves. Long, straight razors, with differing fancy handles, also lie upon the shelves. The oval exit leads west, while the box archway leads east.

extradesc.desc: Three tall poles with hoops are on the eastern wall, with three identical posts and hoops on the western wall. The Snitch is hovering in the Northeast corner of the room, though none of the players have noticed it yet. One team wears dark blue and orange robes, while the other team sports robes of emerald green with yellow stars.
