roomecho.desc: A sixth-year student, sitting in one of the chairs getting his hair cut, yells to one of the blue-robed players, "Hey, git! The Snitch is up there!" As the student points to the Snitch, the Chasers from both teams fly towards it.

room.name: The Salon
room.desc: The entire room is comprised of rose-coloured flagstone. The flagstone is painted with consistently moving butterflies of varying colours. White tapered candles float in the air and burn softly. Velvety, plush pink cushions sit upon four, long-legged, white chairs facing four mirrors. The mirrors line the northern wall, along with four other mirrors hanging on the southern wall, perfectly mimicking the original four. The mirrors are made of brightly polished silver with red roses delicately etched into them. White shelves sit in front of each mirror on the northern wall. Upon the shelves vividly coloured hair gels, sprays, and perfumes rest comfortably. Four white vases atop white stands hold elaborately engraved combs and brushes. The scent of rose petals lingers in the air. The exits are through the oval openings to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: Butterflies flit everywhere. They vary in colours and patterns: red butterflies with white stars; pink butterflies with purple stripes; light blue butterflies with dark blue circles.

roomecho.desc: A third-year girl is sitting on one of the chairs. She says, "May I please have it a bit shorter?"

room.name: Sunset Room
room.desc: The last rays of light of the day shine through the dirty stained glass. Blue, red, and green panes paint the room a rainbow of colours. The two tall stone walls are turned blue, darkening the tops until you can't be sure where they end and the ceiling begins. A few feet off the ground a single painting is tinted red, turning the painted yellow daisies a fiery shade of orange. Green covers the floor like a moss carpet, hiding the grooves worn in by years of use. The light from the sunset stretches as far as it can along the rest of the corridor, until the light of torches takes over.

room.name: Fluorescent Corridor
room.desc: Flamboyant, colourful tapestries cover the walls of the corridor. Adorning a large sword, with an intricate shield at its side, an immense statue of an ancient wizarding warrior sits peacefully, yet ominously, against the southern wall. Just above the commemorative sculpture hangs a bronze, dimly lighted candelabrum, with faint words etched at the base. Scattered across the hallway, there are several, smaller, silver candelabras which sufficiently illuminate the remainder of the passage. The floor is an extension of the clothed walls, though significantly dulled by the footprints of passers-by. A wide, metallic archway provides an exit to the north, directly opposite the rustic statue. Two smaller exits lead to the east and west.

roomecho.desc: The warrior suddenly becomes animate, raising his sword to the ceiling, and praising Dumbledore with a silent salute.

room.name: Fire And Gold Hallway
room.desc: Ice blue flames flicker along both sides of this wide passageway. Although they continually burn, turning emerald green at night, they give off no heat nor light. At times, a single flame shoots out towards the high, arched ceiling, carrying a galleon along with it. The coin is deposited on the smooth, marble floor, where several piles of gleaming galleons lie. These cannot be touched by passers by, and disappear when a curious hand attempts to take one. This corridor is indeed both curious and magnificent to observe and pass through. To the east is a large archway with some inscribed letters above it though they are too faded to make out.

roomecho.desc: The flames suddenly flicker violently, then all of a sudden, turn a vivid emerald green.
A long, thin flame suddenly shoots out towards the ceiling, carrying a round, golden coin on its tip. It deposits the galleon on the floor with a clatter, then disappears.

room.name: Collapsed Tunnel (Secret)
room.desc: Large rocks are piled haphazardly on top of one another, blocking the entrance to this passageway.

room.name: Noah's Pass
room.desc: The floor, walls, and ceiling are ocean blue, which seems to cause all who enter the sensation that they are suffocating. Blue candles floating next to the walls offer some light, but are so exact in colour in contrast to the walls, they seem swallowed up. Hence, they appear like tiny flames hovering along the wall where a great ark has been painted. The ark holds animals, two of each, and a man with a condescending look upon his face. All around him people are drowning in the water, and as they call for help he just shakes his head and says, "Tsk, tsk." The archways to the north and west are the exits.

extradesc.desc: A seventh year student is talking to Noah. "Come on, you're telling me you wouldn't have taken me on your ark?" Noah answers, "No. You do not have the heart allowed upon my ark." "So you would have just let me drown? After all these years we've talked together? Mate, that's cold blooded." "Well, son, a man has to have his standards."

roomecho.desc: Shrieks of "Help me! Save me!" ricochet around the room.

room.name: Bright corridor
room.desc: This large corridor becomes wider and more luminous as one moves along it. On the left side, the torches, which light themselves at nightfall, stand quietly and unnoticeably during the mornings. The floor is lined with red, green, blue, and yellow bits of robes, fragments of crumpled parchment, bitten ends of pencils, and cat hairs. This chamber is built with a high ceiling and rather empty as a structure, which would either make the silence sound strange, or make voices echo very powerfully off the stone walls. The scent of flowers exudes from under the ledges of the great, high windows. The ceiling is arched above the occasional pillars placed in symmetric positions at the sides of the walls. There is a classroom to the west of this room and another exit to the south.

extradesc.desc: The windows look (from a considerable height) down on the grounds, giving a complete view. When the sun shines, the lake shimmers brilliantly and the walls opossite the window shiver with newfound lights. There are cat scratches underneath the window, where cats try to catch the first spring birds.
The ceiling is enriched with light blue paintings of a clear sky on which two white doves fly, their wings stretched out warmly over the students below.

The pillars, tall and very thick, are often used for hide-and-seek and they're more often than not dirty and slightly rounded at the edges. They are thicker at the bottom and have a Doric design on them.

The walls are made of solid stone and reflect sound in a way that suggests they are thicker than in general around the castle. They are well taken care of, however, and show little of their undoubtedly considerable age.

roomecho.desc: Two small first years rush past, taking cover behind everything they find appropriate enough sizewise. They are quite oblivious of any and all surroundings.
A red and white cat, swollen to the size of an impressive salami, with a great tail trailing behind, rushes through the hall chasing what seems to be either a ball of feathers or a small bird.

room.name: Classroom
room.desc: Sunlight streams through windows and gently caresses everything in this semi-circular, welcoming room. Shelves line the tan walls; each is full of books of various sizes ranging from large and chunky to as thin as a feather. Low desks have been organized into five neat, parallel lines, and each one has a white quill on top - as if everything has been prepared for the next class of students to arrive.

room.name: Entrance to the School Library
room.desc: The Hogwarts crest is inlayed with gold into the dark brown, white-veined marble floor. The walls are panelled in deep, rich mahogany. Lamps light the room while Madam Pince's desk sits in the middle. Her old, walnut desk is sturdy and immaculate, yet stark. In a corner her feather duster rests upon a stand. An unadorned quill and pot of ink sit in the opposite corner. Be careful not to disturb this peevish librarian with her vulture-like tendencies, for the consequences will be unpleasant. Rows upon rows of books lie beyond her desk. Be vigilant; Madam Pince snuffs the lamps at eight o'clock p. M. Sharp. The exits are north, east, south, west, northeast, and northwest.

roomecho.desc: An older female voice asks, "Just what do you think you're doing?"

room.name: School Library, Year One Area
room.desc: Immense windows, arching at the top, stretch along one wall allowing a view of the lake beyond. Rich hardwood floors darken the room, but lamps are lighted to cast a cheery orange glow. Oak tables, long and marred from use, and chairs rest along the paneled walls. Beside the tables, narrow rows of shelving hold thousands of books. This area caters to the Year One students, the books being simpler than the textbooks contained in the rest of the library. The dusty books are of all sorts of shapes and colours with titles like "Hexing as Easy as 1-2-3" and "The Basics for Abecedarians." Most of the primers look as if they haven't been used too much. Maybe there are too many books for beginning wizards? The exits are north, east, and west.

roomecho.desc: "So, do you really think this 'Magical Beauty Secrets' will really make me look older?"

room.name: School Library, Year Three Area
room.desc: . A seemingly infinite number of volumes occupy the scores of elevated shelving. Lamps illuminate titles such as, "Compendium of Charms" and "Why Wands Work." There are rows of tables with chairs for studying. The floors and walls are covered in matching mahogany wood. Tall domed windowpanes allow a glance of the outside world. This chamber is oriented toward academics in their third year. The exit lies to the west.

roomecho.desc: "Watch it," whispers one student to another, "Madame Pince is in a bad mood."

room.name: School Library, Year Six Area
room.desc: Rife with towering bookshelves set into manifold rows, this area has soaring arch-topped windows along one wall. Light from golden lamps bounce off the mahogany hardwood floors and mahogany paneling. There are numerous study-tables and chairs. This segment of the library supplies books, like "Codices on Bewitchments" and "Hideous Hexes and Disfigurements", for Year Six students who are nearing the end of their tenure at Hogwarts. The exits are south, west, and southwest.

roomecho.desc: "I don't know," says a male student to another, "using 'Practical Pranks on Professors' is bound to get you in all sorts of trouble."

room.name: School Library, Year Five Area
room.desc: The darkened, wooden floors and walls are dull from years of soot emitting from the lamps lighting the area. The study-tables and chairs are also grimy from years of use. Along one wall domed, magnificent windows present the life of the outer world. A myriad of books reside in colossal bookshelves lined into countless rows. There are various pictures of owls on the walls to remind the fifth-year students of their impending O. W. L. S. This section of the library accommodates the Year Five students who are cramming for their exams, though everyone is welcome to use these facilities. An ornate silver-plated book, "The History of Rebellions Against Wizarding Folk", lies open on a stand for quick reference for the students. The exits are east, south, and west.

room.name: School Library, Year Seven Area
room.desc: Though one wall encompasses sizable arching windows, the rest of the dark paneled walls are covered with tapestries of newts. These are to inspire the Seventh Year students to excel in their upcoming N.E.W.T.s. Set upon the rich, reddish-black hardwood floors are scores of bookshelves reaching lofty heights. Legions of books perch upon these shelves. Gold lamps cast light upon the sturdy study-tables and chairs. The books in this area seem fairly well-used, though there are still a few dusty tomes. Though this area is supplied for the graduating student, allowing them easy access to such books as "Managing Magic Masterfully" and "School's Almost Over and You've Still Learned Diddly", anyone is allowed admittance to this locale. The exits are east, south, and southeast.

roomecho.desc: A voice says, "She turned me into a newt. ... I got better."

room.name: School Library, Year Two Area
room.desc: Dark hardwood floors and paneled walls lend an air of prestige to this space. Of course, the thousands of varying volumes inhabiting the numerous rows of bookshelves add to the prestige. Large arched windows display the grounds outside. Smudgy golden lamps light the area exposing heavy-set tables and chairs for studying. Though accessible to anyone, this part of the library provides books primarily for those who are studying in Year Two. One tome, "Pranking Powers Professionals Possess", is falling apart from so much use, while another book, "The History of Frog Spawn on Spells", appears as though it has never been opened. The exits are north, east, and west.

roomecho.desc: A girl whispers,"I heard that Jimmy likes you." A different girl replies, "No! Really?"

room.name: School Library, Year Four Area
room.desc: Oaken tables and chairs line up against a dark paneled wall. Along another wall vaulted windows expose the grounds beyond. Atop darkened wood floors, countless writings occupy rows of altitudinous bookshelves. Rusting lamps are lighted to allow students to study books like "Juggling Jinxes, Which Work Best?" And "So Muggles Believe In Witch Burning?" This locale, though accessible to all, is outfitted to help Year Four students. The exits are north and east.

roomecho.desc: 'Muddled voices emanate from the northwest.'

room.name: School Library, Restricted Section
room.desc: This area of the library is restricted from all students unless they have obtained a signed permission note from a professor or are an upper class student studying Defense Against the Dark Arts. A blood-red velvet rope impedes access. The mahogany paneled walls and floor continue into the Restricted Section, but somehow it is dingier, and definitely grislier, here. There are still multiple rows of grand bookshelves with diverse books populating them, yet the books in this portion of the library are quite distinctive. They visually appear macabre and emit a chilling air about them. Though grimy lamps illuminate the area, the books seem to almost absorb the light, casting eerie shadows. There are tomes, slender volumes, tall ones, short ones, and some are titled in gold, while others seem to be discolored by blood. The "Flesh Eating Curses" produces a chilling rush of air when opened, whereas "Encyclopedia of Toxic Recipes" has a greenish-luminosity on its spine. An indiscernible murmuring emanates from the books. The exit is south.

roomecho.desc: 'An ear-piercing screech rips through the air.'

room.name: ** ** Librarians' Passageway
room.desc: . The hall is brightly lighted by a chandelier holding beeswax candles. The walls are paneled with oak and the floors are covered with a luxurious purple carpet. On the walls are paintings of all the former Hogwarts' librarians consisting of such characters as Rupert Smedley, Prissy Wootton, Quigley Thacker, Winnie Bloxam, and Alfred Broadbent. Rumor has it that Helga Hufflepuff thought it a shame that librarians are given so little recognition in their lifetime, that there ought to a place in Hogwarts that paid homage to their dedication to education. Ironically, their place of tribute is this hidden room. A mirror hangs on the north wall. The exit is southeast, leading back to the library.

extradesc.desc: If one wishes to see a painting, one should look to its owner.

Rupert Smedley, with eyes set close together and a pencil-thin mustache, has his facade sitting in a long, vertical, narrow, rectangular, golden frame. Along the top of the frame are etchings of various shapes and a beautiful woman's face carved into the gold. He worked at Hogwarts from 1752-1797.
An oval, golden frame fringed with lace-like gold holds a painting of Prissy Wootton. She has tight ringlets and bottle-thick spectacles. She served Hogwarts from 1798-1832.

A circular frame encompasses Quigley Thacker's corpulent visage, which appears pompous with pince-nez set upon his nose. The frame has a golden braid encircling it and cherubs are engraved into the gold. He was employed at Hogwarts from 1857-1902.

A golden square frames Winnie Bloxam's face. Flowers and vines are engraved along the whole length of the frame. Ms. Bloxam's pale hair is pulled into a tight bun, her lips in a tight line, as she glares down her nose through her lorgnette. She looks formidable. Her tenure at Hogwarts was from 1833-1856.

Alfred Broadbent seems a pleasant chap with smiling eyes and a fez atop his head. He is framed within a simple, fleury patterned, gold frame. He winks at all who look at him. He served Hogwarts before Madam Pince became librarian.

roomecho.desc: "Behave yourself!"

room.name: ** Mirror Room
room.desc: This is a breath-taking room with spotless-white silk covering the walls and sumptuous thick indigo carpeting on the floors. Silver lanterns bathe the room in light. There are four mirrors in this room. The first mirror is comprised of silver and an eighty-eight is imprinted into the top. Across from it, a second mirror is of plain, dingy wood. Along the bottom someone has carved the word "Occumugglepation." The third mirror consists of maple with elaborate engravings of male and female figures as well as the word "Sexsee". The fourth mirror is composed of pewter. "Gazethos" is etched along the top in stately letters. The exit is south.

extradesc.desc: This first mirror is made from sparkling silver. It is tall and beveled along its sides and bottom. It sits in a brushed silver floor stand. Across the top the number eighty-eight is imprinted. This mirror shows any person who looks into it what she or he will look like at the age of eighty-eight. Though it does not guarantee the person will reach this age, it allows the viewer a glimpse of their image in old age.

This second mirror is comprised of unadorned, shabby hickory. "Occumugglepation" has been scored along the bottom next to its austere stand. This mirror allows wizards an opportunity to see what occupation they would possess if they were a Muggle.

This third mirror is crafted from birds-eye maple that is rich in its yellowish hue. Detailed designs of male and female shapes are engraved around this freestanding mirror. The word "Sexsee" has been carved along both sides of the mirror. This mirror lets one see what he or she would look like as the opposite sex.

This fourth mirror sits on the ground. It is quite sizeable and made of dark, perfect pewter. In elegant lettering "Gazethos" is etched along the top. This mirror has driven some insane, and should be examined only if a person feels strong enough emotionally, or mentally. The quintessence of the observers alters their appearance. Their souls dictate the nature of their reflection.
If one wishes to see a particular mirror, one should look to the number or type.

room.name: Astronomy Tower
room.desc: Stone walls create the landing for this area, where the sky lies visible up overhead. Lines and lines of telescopes wind their way around the surface, each highly polished waiting for use.

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: Gabriel is working on this room.

room.name: Camelot's Corridor
room.desc: In place of lighting and decoration, two large murals adorn the walls. On the north side sits the round table surrounded by the Arthurian Knights. Such revered names as Lancelot, Gawaine, Galahad, and Bors can be recognized, as well as many other famous knights. Arthur enters hand in hand with Guenever, and they take their seats. Empty chairs play tribute to the many who have fallen in battle fighting for their freedom, and Arthur raises his goblet and murmurs a few words of remembrance in their honor. On the other side of the hallway Arthur leads his Knights into battle, the sound of the horses hooves echoing and mixing with the metallic clang of blade on blade. Their armor is already spattered with blood, but they gallop on as fierce as ever. The light from the murals fully illuminates the hallway, and exits to the west and south are visible through the grandeur.

room.name: Eternal Hall
room.desc: The hall is dark, only a dim glow from two far-spaced torches shed any light in this expansive space. The floors are pure white marble, no trace of any other rock in them. Walls gleam white, paying tribute to the highlight of this corridor, a large painting of the White Lady, a woman eternally doomed. Once married to a powerful count, as a widow she murdered her children to gain the favor of another man. When he refused her, she drew his own sword against him and stabbed him to death. In her imprisonment she hanged herself, and now haunts the place where she murdered the man who refused her. Two white archways, one to the east and another to the north, lead away from this location.

room.name: North Tower
room.desc: Stone lines nearly every inch of this area as it winds its way upward towards the peaks of the castle. The heavy smells of incense and perfumes float around between the walls from the Divination classroom.

room.name: Storeroom
room.desc: Dust swirls into the air as the door opens to this storage closet. Row upon row of wooden shelves line themselves against the walls. Brooms and mops and buckets are scattered lazily around the area, some with cobwebs lying lazily over their surface.

room.name: Student Tribute Hallway
room.desc: Large, golden lanterns brightly light this long hallway. The floor is carpeted and white. On the cerulean-coloured walls hang hundreds of plastic, black-framed portraits, which have been developed in a special solution to allow the persons in the picture to move. Each photograph represents a various student or group of students at Hogwarts. A silver, metal piece at the bottom of each frame reveals the names of the persons in the photo. Exits are to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: This particular picture is of four students, out on the grounds, by the Lake. To the far left a seventh-year, dark-haired girl stands smiling as if she has a secret. Her beautiful smile enhances her wildly-intelligent and honest eyes. Next to her is a tall, fifth-year boy, with blond hair and blue eyes. His arm is around her as he gazes at her attentively and smiles. Off to the right side is a small, fourth-year girl, sitting in the background. She appears very demure and her head is bent slightly towards the ground, as if to hide her face. Sitting next to her is a tall and manly fifth-year boy, who is cuddling the shy girl. As soon as the photograph is taken, chaos occurs. The seventh year girl covers her face from the camera as she kicks the boy in the shins. The boy, while growling, then proceeds to poke the younger girl in the ribs. As she runs away, holding hands with the other boy, she casts a manner of spells at him.

This photo shows a group of three, young girls in the Gryffindor Common Room. They are sitting in a circle on the floor, obviously deep in discussion while giggling and laughing with each other. One girl suddenly leans over and pretends to start biting the neck of the youngest in the group, while the middle-aged girl throws her head back and laughs hysterically. She only stops laughing when the younger girl escapes the clutches of the eldest and starts poking and tickling her.

roomecho.desc: A girl student walks by and pauses at a photograph saying, "Oh, the snow in this picture is gorgeous!"

room.name: The Corridor of Dreamers
room.desc: The walls are of a startling aquamarine but seem surprisingly bare. There is a painting on each of the walls. The north-side wall's canvas contains a dark and gloomy graveyard, whilst the southernly painting contains a solitary cloud. Three small, silver plaques adorn each wall. The plaques, on the wall which the graveyard painting sits, list names of great wizarding inventors who died in the course of their experiments. The cloud's plaques list the few wizards who successfully created objects and concepts of great use to the wizarding world. Bertie Botts' name is illuminated in multicolour on this plaque.

room.name: Classroom
room.desc: Rows of long, wooden desks line themselves across the stone floors. Books are stacked into neat piles along the top of the surface of the desks. Paitings of various witches and wizards are scattered against the surface of the walls.

room.name: Gryffindor Tower
room.desc: Large banners in red and gold align themselves against the walls leading throughout the tower. Wooden doors are scattered throughout the curving staircase, leading towards various dormitories.

room.name: Girls Baths
room.desc: Highly polished marble works its way around the floors and surface areas of this room. The heavy scent of soap and various scented shampoos linger in the air. Golden spouts and shower heads gleam from the light of the torches that line the walls, and light the room.

room.name: Boys Baths
room.desc: Polished marble floors shine from the light of the torches that dance off of their surfaces. Golden taps and spouts arrange themselves around the room, with a huge in-ground tub lying in the center of the room. Portraits of various sea creatures align themselves along the walls.

room.name: Secret Storeroom
room.desc: A large, wooden door protects the entry way into this particular area. Upon entering, extra brooms and mops lay strewn lazily against the walls. Shelves of discarded, dusty books are scattered around the room.

room.name: Gryffindor Tower
room.desc: A hewn stone staircase winds its way upward, torches lighting the area. Wooden doors are scattered along the staircase leading towards various dormitories

room.name: Gryffindor Tower
room.desc: Light from torches flicker against the hewn stone floors that make up the winding staircase towards the top of the tower. Large, gold and red banners are placed against the walls, glinting from the light of the torches.

room.name: Hogwarts Fifth Floor
room.desc: The grand, white marble staircase flows upwards and downwards. The banisters end with a noble, white stone eagle on one side and a majestic phoenix on the other. The hallway to the north leads to the fifth floor.

room.name: Musical Hallway
room.desc: This hallway is long and narrow, with plain, white walls. Painted on them in black paint are bars of music which change every few hours to accompany the song currently resonating within the corridor. The floor appears to consist entirely of a giant piano, and the keys continually move up and down to play the soothing melody illustrated by the measures on the walls. As each key shifts its position, causing for a rather tricky trip down the length of the passageway, the corresponding music note hovers faintly near the grey ceiling. Next to the north exit stands a tall, magificent stone statue of a grand-looking wizard playing a thin flute.

roomecho.desc: The song currently playing abruptly changes, and the measures of music on the walls erase themselves to be replaced with new ones.
A "thud" can be heard as a nearby Hufflepuff 4th year trips on a giant, protruding key.

room.name: Curved Corridor
room.desc: The bare floor displays a magnificent smooth swirl of black and white stones, arranged in a dizzying spiral. The giant magical pattern rotates slowly in one direction, creating a mesmerizing mobile pattern. Grey stone walls on either side of the hallway bulge outward to accomodate the circular floor pattern, widening the walking space in the centre of the hallway and narrowing again at the exits to the east and west. A large, round chandelier dangles gracefully from the ceiling. Its candles are spherical globes of wax, floating centimetres away from the circular crystals that dangle from the golden frame. The light from the chandelier falls flawlessly onto the constantly moving floor and the gracefully curved walls.

extradesc.desc: The smooth black and white stone floor spins dizzyingly in one direction. Its spiralling pattern mesmerizes passersby and makes stationary people feel as if they are being rotated around the hall.

roomecho.desc: With a grinding sound of stone shifting itself into a new position, the large spiral design on the floor slows to a stop, and gradually begins rotating in the opposite direction.

room.name: Hazy Passage
room.desc: The air in the narrow passageway is choked with a thick layer of light grey smoke. Although the atmosphere is clouded and hazy, the magical smoke pouring in from cracks in the walls does not irritate passersby. Rather, its mysterious nature and pleasantly sharp odour make the corridor an interesting and alluring location. The smoke creates a murky atmosphere that easily conceals objects and people alike. Light emanates throughout the hallway from an undefined and mysterious source, making the hazy mist glow eerily. The shadowy outline of exits to the east, west and south are vaguely visible.

roomecho.desc: The ghost of an old, haggard-looking woman floats mournfully through the haze, her translucent body capturing whisps of glowing smoke.

room.name: Red Hallway
room.desc: Every inch of the walls and floors of the corridor is covered with something red. A thick, burgundy rug carpets the floor of the hallway. Flowing from the ceiling down the walls are luxuriously plush red tapestries, depicting the plights of famous red-haired wizards. One painting, mounted in a red frame, depicts one of the Weasley's ancestors, complete with all seventeen redheaded children. A crackling red flame dances in a brick red fireplace on the south wall while a puffy ruby-red couch stands next to the north wall. Standing beneath a window with maroon curtains is a flowering plant with giant red blossoms. The hallways extends to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: A cheery middle-aged man with flaming red hair sits in the living room of his house, his arm around his red-headed wife. Their seven children gather around the fireplace, playing games and chatting happily.

The old brick fireplace is built into the south wall. A few assorted red trinkets sit on the red shelf atop the fireplace. A pair of red spectacles float mysteriously a few centimeters about the shelf as a tiny model of a quidditch player in red robes strolls the surface, its broom thrown casually over its shoulder.

roomecho.desc: A large red flower growing from the plant underneath the window sneezes loudly.
A house elf wanders in, adds more wood to the ruby-red flames in the fire place and waddles back out of the hallway

room.name: Quiet Corner
room.desc: All sounds in this quaint, cozy corner seem to deaden as they reach it. The thickly carpeted floor muffles the sound of footsteps and the stone walls block all sounds from other corridors and rooms in the castle. The portraits hanging on the wall have been quieted by a simple silencing charm. In one painting a slim, studious-looking witch peers through the latest issue of Transfiguration Today while a neighboring warlock waves his wand listlessly, creating a trail of violet sparks. Floating white candles illuminate the corner, their flames flickering softly and silently.

extradesc.desc: The witch in the portrait seems to be a young employee of the Ministry of Magic. Her dirty blonde hair is pulled back into a tight bun and her black-framed glasses make her appear studious and intelligent. She is completely immersed in her copy of Transfiguration Today, taking no notice of outside events.

room.name: Forgotten Corner
room.desc: The hallway is filled with a strange and musky scent. Dust is collected in thick layers on the tarnished suits of armour. The solitary, shabby portrait, tucked into the corner, does nothing but stare dismally at its surroundings. The corridor is rarely visited and seldom cleaned; a lone torch provides dim lighting that doesn't quite reach the corners of the hallway. The painting of a wizened, old warlock in raggedy robes hangs at a skewed angle upon the west wall. His gloomy, grey eyes peer, through a thin layer of grime, at the neglected surroundings, blinking passively and emotionlessly as they scan the hallway. The old man is silent and immobile, eerily confining himself to doing nothing but gazing listlessly at the corridor. The exits lie to the east and the south.

extradesc.desc: The old man glares blearily at you, his eyes full of malice and discontent.

room.name: Swaying Corridor
room.desc: The floor of this wide passage is liquid-like and malleable, never staying fixated in one position. It rocks violently from side to side, occasionally tilting so that the objects in the corridor slide dangerously across the smooth floor. A very chipped and disgruntled looking sculpture of a centaur stands precariously on the ground, propelled across the hall by random tosses of the floor. The walls twist and bend as the hallway sways like a flimsy wooden bridge in gusts of high wind. The torches mounted on the wall move dangerously and drop glowing embers onto the floor after particularly sudden jerks. Golden railings on both walls allow people to keep their balance as they navigate the swaying corridor. The exits are located to the north, east, south, and west.

roomecho.desc: A violent jerk of the floor sends the centaur statue careening across the hallway into the opposite wall.
A torch near the west wall gives a violent fizz and red-orange embers fly off of it into the middle of the hallway.

room.name: Charmed Hallway
room.desc: A complete sense of warmth and security floods through the hallway. The walls are covered by giant tapestries filled with whimsical designs of magnificent colors. A large golden yellow sun decorates one tapestry while a large pink heart stretches across another. A charming statue of cupid stands on a pedastal on the west wall, smiling aimlessly as it casually places an arrow in its bow. A stream of sunlight filters through the room from a skylight in the ceiling, even at night. A feeling of complete serenity permeates the corridor, from the thick, fluffy rug to the bright, welcoming skylight. The hallway smells pleasantly like warm fudge drizzled over vanilla ice cream, making all who walk through it feel welcome and at home.

roomecho.desc: The statue of cupid fires its arrow, embedding it into the opposite wall. It smiles nonchalantly as reaches into its quiver for another one
The thick, furry rug lets out a loud contented purr as the perpetual sunlight shines brightly on its body.

room.name: Menacing Hallway
room.desc: The passage is poorly lit and permeated with the odour of musk and mildew. The walls seem to narrow as the hallway progresses, instilling a sense of claustrophobia into the easily flustered. Sculptures of emaciated figures with gnarled fingers are frozen in their progress out of the walls, their clawing fingers reaching toward the centre of the hallway, inching toward unsuspecting visitors. A few flickering torches give the statues lining either side a lifelike quality, making it seem as if they are not frozen in stone, but straining, ever so slowly, toward the living beings that pass through the hallway.

extradesc.desc: Goto 1504 The sculptures' blank grey eyes stare evilly into space, their arched eyebrows contorted into an expression of pure hate and distrust. They are hairless humanoid creatures, whose ribcages are clearly visible and bony hands reach desperately towards the center of the hallway.

roomecho.desc: With an ominous creak, a statue on the north wall straightens its index finger, reaching desperately for the robes of passersby.

room.name: Blue Corner
room.desc: High above the blue carpeted floor, the corridor's ceiling is a magnificent shade of sky blue, with puffy white clouds drifting lazily across it. A cascade of flowing navy blue streamers dangle from the enchanted ceiling like torrents of smooth and unending rain. On the walls of the hallway are portraits of wizards in blue, including a painting of the latest Puddlemere United Quidditch team, seven men and women clothed in matching blue robes with crossed bulrushes emblazoned across the chest. A sculpture of the famous opera-singing witch, Carmen, stands at the corner, dressed in a gown made of sapphire blue gems, frozen in mid-song. Other colours gradually seep into the hallway from the north and east.

room.name: Ma-ku Way
room.desc: The scent of mulberries wafts down the maple-covered hall. Torches, shaped like flowers, line the hall holding a flame in their centre. Plush, Oriental red tapestries hang upon the walls, each depicting Ma-ku, a beneficent goddess/sorceress from Chinese mythology. She personified goodness in all people. In the first tapestry Ma-ku, in her first avatar, is tending to mulberry trees. In the second tapestry Ma-ku is in a different incarnation attending to her blind father. In the third tapestry Ma-ku is picking flowers in an enchanting field. The exits are through the depressed archways to the south and west.

extradesc.desc: Look to the number or its depictions to peek at each tapestry.
In this rich tapestry Ma-ku has long, dark hair and is lean and lithe. She, in this first avatar, reclaimed a large tract of land from the sea and planted mulberry trees.

This luxurious tapestry of the youthful Ma-ku tricks her merciless father into giving his slaves more rest. Her father becomes incensed forcing Ma-ku to flee from him resulting in her living like a hermit. Her father, crying in remorse, becomes blind through weeping. Ma-ku returns to comfort her father and heals his eyes with a restorative potion.
This sumptuous tapestry depicts the maiden Ma-ku, the Chinese goddess of spring, dancing in a field of wildflowers. She stops occasionally to pick these flowers and smile at some unknown secret.

room.name: Dragon Corner
room.desc: The world suddenly plunges to darkness. Sinister shadows of strange shapes play in shades of dark red and blue on the walls and the floor. The room smells musky and damp. There is complete silence here - all noises seem to be absorbed into the large rocky tiles on the ground. Without being particularly cold or windy, this passage is strangely bone chilling. The walls are damp and very old, but intact, with no trace of dust inside. The lack of imperfections in this area is disquieting. The focus of this entire chamber seems to be the sculpted dragon with outstretched wings in the corner, framed by dangling red curtains. With no torches to light the way, the only source of light is the odd reflections of coloured light from the large, sculpted guardian. It is perhaps because of the size of the bas-relief that the ceiling is very high and arched. There are luminous exits to the north and to the east.

extradesc.desc: The curtains dangle strangely even in the absence of any breeze, but their rustle is muted. They are rather long and run alongside the dragon's entire height. They are of a dark, light stealing, ruby red, depicting smaller dragons in a crouched position, which could be considered suitable either for attack or for guarded submission.

This dragon is very accurately sculpted with a terrifying amount of detail included within. Its large, reptilian beak is open slightly, revealing two rows of very sharp teeth, glittering with a strange light. The wings of the dragon are outstretched and protectively turned inwards, the cut of the membranes painfully detailed. The dragon's talons and red eyes are also spreading strange, faded light.
The dragon's teeth are yellowish and carnivorous looking, shedding a sinister light, which comes and goes, as if the dragon's breath had suddenly become luminous.
extradesc.keywords: teeth tooth fangs fang beak mouth

extradesc.desc: The dragon's eyes are fierce, but not angry, and they look directly at the passers-by from a considerable height. They are made of red crystals, which give out a faint reddish light, which makes a halo around the dragon's head.

The dragon's hind legs are stretched as if it was just ready to take flight. Its front legs are positioned for attack, one below the others. The talons on this creature are made of a black crystal which spreads a dim dark light around it.

roomecho.desc: A group of three Gryffindors walk past the dragon, pausing to admire its beautifully sculpted body.
A dark haired Slytherin student rushes through, keeping to the side of the corridor opposite the dragon.

room.name: Corridor of Jewels
room.desc: This corridor twinkles and sparkles, due to the thousands of jewels encrusted on all surfaces of the corridor. Each exquisite jewel is a small part of an outdoor scene. On the floor, a carpet of emeralds is the lush grass one would only find in the most picturesque fields and gardens. A round sapphire lake occupies the centre of the hall, and each sapphire twinkles and glitters in the light of the torches hanging along the walls, the lone providers of light. Coming up in the emerald grass are strands of peridots, with garnet, opal, and citrine petals on top, each a shining flower. The walls and ceiling are blue topaz, with diamond clouds drifting lazily overhead. Always bright and cheery, it is like summer all year round in this corridor. There are exits to the east, south, and west.

extradesc.desc: A lovely, shimmering, pink flower is in full bloom by the lake.

roomecho.desc: A red-haired student passing by stoops down to touch a glimmering pink flower.

room.name: Corridor Of Fire
room.desc: A baleful light illuminates this corridor casting stark shadows. The source is an enchanted ceiling depicting a seething mass of smoke and flame. A floor made of highly polished stone reflects the conflagration above it creating the illusion of a burning carpet. The solid stone walls are blackened, thickly lined with ash and soot. Leaning out from them are marble figures of angels, shielding their eyes from the blaze around them. The corridor extinguishes to the east and the west.

room.name: Ocean Painting Corridor
room.desc: This whole corridor feels ancient and quiet. It is one of the more unused corridors in Hogwarts and has grown very still. The walls and floor are made of intricate golden sandstone with an engraved serpent design running through the seams. The arched roof high above has thick glass windows allowing dappled light to stream through the musty air. On one wall hangs a painting of a beautiful sky over a calm ocean. Dust lines the edges and fades the colours. It is surrounded by an ornate frame, gleaming and new. The corridor stretches on to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: This huge painting shows a wide, calm ocean quietly reflecting a tumultuous yet beautiful sky. The sun streaks through billowing clouds of green and purple casting sun beams into the light haze. Years of dust mute the intense colour of the image.
It seems strange that the frame would be so highly polished in such a dusty room. On closer inspection it seems that it has light fingerprints on the edges.
The seams between the stones have carved serpents running through them. They are a slightly greener hue than the surrounding sandstone and are flecked with shards of ebony and topaz.

roomecho.desc: A faint venomous hiss ripples through the walls.

room.name: Fire Flame Room
room.desc: Smoke and darkness consume this room as one enters. The once pure-white walls have become scorched black with soot over the years. Covering the ceiling are tiny white stars that twinkle brightly. In the middle of the ceiling is a blackened area, due to char marks from a large flame of fire. This magical fire resides near the centre of the room and produces bright red sparks when anyone gets too close. Smaller blazes of fire float and roam through the area, combining to create a more powerful flame when they crash into each other. Exits are to the north and west.

roomecho.desc: The stars from above twinkle brightly.
Three small flames converge to form a larger blaze.

room.name: Side staircase
room.desc: The very warm and dry passage leads down a long flight of steps, which is in-built within the narrow corridor, as if carved inside a rocky box. The torches at the top and at the bottom of the stairs give just about enough light for one to glimpse the steps and not slip on them. In the warm, flickering light, the grey stones look nearly red, with a slight smoky tinge to make the colour colder and more distant than it should be. The low ceiling is lit awkwardly by alternating shadowy and bright beaming rays. The old walls are cracked by heat and dryness. The steps are worn to the point where their edges are rounded. The dusty silence echoes warmly and thickly off the arched ceiling. There is a painting on the archway. There are exits south and west.

extradesc.desc: The painting depicts a young wizard with wavy golden hair dressed in long blue dress robes and dragon hide boots. He is holding a wand aloft which has just shot out an "Avis!" spell. The white pigeons he has just created are portrayed in full flight around him. The painting is old, however, and while the torchlight adds significantly to the warmth of the wizard's face, one can see that bits from the boots are scattered on the floor, having fallen alongside the wall.

roomecho.desc: A torch cracks and fizzles, leaving behind a dark trail of smoke
The sounds of a class having finished above echoes with a boom through the staircase, giving the impression of a small earthquake

room.name: Dilapidated Corridor
room.desc: A short, narrow corridor links two larger passages. It is musty and a substantial layer of dust coats the floor, as though nobody has passed through recently. The rough stone walls are bare except for a large and rather unfurnished gold-framed painting. A thickset witch is depicted in the painting and is wearing violet robes, with her hat pulled down low over her forehead. The artist appears not to have bothered with painting a background, so the lonely-looking witch stands in a blank canvas. Paint has been chipped off of the wooden frame by time, and there are fancy hippogriffs carved in a pattern around the edge. Deep cracks separate the granite floor slabs, and years of filth have accumulated in these hollows. An absence of torches makes the corridor dark and unappealing. The arched ceiling reaches enormous heights, and there are exits to the north, east and west.

extradesc.desc: The canvas is bare except for a lonely, squat witch in purple robes and hat. She has a small, round nose and wide brown eyes. Her mouth is slightly puckered, as though she has just eaten something sour. Her lips are the colour of raspberries. The frame surrounding the lone painting in the corridor is painted a royal gold, but some of the paint has chipped off. Fancy hippogriffs are carved around the sides in a pattern. Whoever carved the frame was skilled, for the hippogriffs are perfectly detailed down to the last feather.

room.name: Cave Painting Corridor
room.desc: This corridor was crudely hewn out of stone. It is a short, narrow tunnel, with rough, grey onyx walls, floor, and ceiling. Several cracks run through the walls and ceiling, allowing water to leak through them. A shallow puddle has formed on the floor. Indents have been cut into the walls, and short, stubby candles dwell in them, providing a dim glow. There are no windows, so the candles are the sole providers of light. On the flatter segments of the walls cave paintings have been drawn, in varying shades of brown, red, and black. This short tunnel has exits to the north and east.

extradesc.desc: These paintings show various scenes from the daily life of a troll. Just about every one of them involves trolls clubbing things.

roomecho.desc: A drop of water falls to the floor with a splash.

room.name: Tribute Hallway
room.desc: The thin and worn grey carpet lining this hallway is very old and full of dust. The walls are a deep, dark shade of black. At alternating levels on the wall are tall white candles spreading light. In between the plethora of candles are large, white, square-framed portraits of every past Hogwarts Headmaster and Headmistress. Some are young, some are old, but most bear a kind smile. Exits are to the south and west.

extradesc.desc: The overabundance of portraits is shocking and every one is eager to say something. The faces in the frames will talk a persons ear off, if allowed, so it's best to be on your guard. One particular portrait shows an old Headmaster sitting in a chair. The silver metal piece on the frame reads "Headmaster Craig". He has a peculiar evil grin. On the wall behind him is his most prized possession. A small painting of a tater tot.

roomecho.desc: A random voice commands, "You ought to be in bed!"
A man's voice from one of the frames says vainly, "I was the best Headmaster here, you know!"

room.name: Funeral Rites Room
room.desc: A desperate shout of, "Oh, please, no! Not him! No, I'll be different now" rents the air causing dust to be shaken from the beige sandstone walls onto the matching floor. The ceiling holds a fresco of ancient Egyptian gods- a panel of divinities deciding the fate of the deceased. Anubis, the jackal-headed god of embalming, sits with Thoth, the ibis-headed god of wisdom. These proceedings are overseen by Osiris, the lord of the underworld. He has the heart of the deceased and is weighing it against a white feather, a symbol of justice. A desperate-looking old man, withered with hard, calculating eyes, is pleading with Osiris. On failing the test, a fearsome monster, part crocodile, part lion, part hippopotamus, called Ammit, devours the man. A classroom lies to the north, and the exits are through the round top archways to the west and east.

roomecho.desc: Muffled screams reverberate throughout the hall.
A female student grimaces at a male student mesmerized by the fresco. "How can you watch it? It's so gross," asks the female? "That's what makes it so cool," responds the male.

room.name: Narrow corridor
room.desc: Golden baubles, left over from the holiday season, dangle from the ceiling. They are somewhat anachronous to the otherwise drab surroundings. A noticeable change can be seen in the colour of the granite floor, from a stained muddle to clear grey. The walls barely span enough width for two students walking in opposite directions to pass one another. Hazy light filters in from the east and west, where the hallway further extends. Two pairs of burnished bronze doves overlook the door to the south, fluttering their wings and cooing softly.

extradesc.desc: The doves are cast in rich bronze, with a gleaming finish muted by centuries of aging.

roomecho.desc: A puff of dust rises from the floor.

room.name: Lavish Corridor
room.desc: This corridor has been lavishly decorated from floor to ceiling. Polished mahogany floors connect the exits to the north, east, and west. Soft red Persian carpets lie on the floor, their colour matching the crimson wallpaper above the rich mahogany panelling. Crown moulding runs the length of the wall, just below the gold-leaf ceiling. A still-life is framed against the western wall, above a mahogany side table. A refined crystal chandelier hangs from the ceiling, brightening the room. Several gold-framed mirrors hang from the wall, reflecting the light in all directions.

extradesc.desc: These full-length mirrors are in beautiful gold frames. They reflect light everywhere.
A lovely mahogany table resides against the western wall.
A still-life painting hangs against the wall above the table. It shows a bowl, with bananas, oranges, grapes, and apples in and around it.

room.name: The Manger
room.desc: This room is rather empty and large, its oak covered walls darkened by old age and dust. A silvery light glows from the ceiling, as if there was a window there permanently reflecting moonlight. There is straw upon the floor, and the little wooden things that do furnish the large empty space give it the resemblance of a poorly made barn. Upon the straw the marble statues of three people are motionless, but open and smiling. A woman, her robes blue and a matching veil upon her head, a man, dressed as a traveller, and a baby between them, are gazing at the passers-by. Although there are no creatures there, a permanent echo travels through the chamber, whispering carols. There are three doors out of the chamber: to the east, to the west and to the south.

extradesc.desc: The three sculptures represent a man, a woman and a baby. Look at each in particular to distinguish any further detail.

The baby looks at peace, covered in a white cloth. There is an aura around His tiny head, and His eyes shine, bright blue upon the otherwise white, stainless marble. His tiny right hand stands out in a symbol - His ring finger settled against the inside of His thumb, the middle finger curved inwards slightly against the pointer, so they would be at about the same height.

The woman looks also peaceful, if a little concerned. She is young, but looks very wise, nevertheless, and her arms gently cradle the baby, holding him out, as if to present him. She also sheds a faint aura around the head.

The man holds a protective arm around the woman, and his expression is one of awe. He does not dare touch the baby, but supports the woman's arm instead. He looks a simple man and is dressed in a grey travelling cloak. His entire countenance beams a fainter but warmer aura, which is not as awe-striking, but pleasant nevertheless.

roomecho.desc: The invisible voices in the walls begin singing 'God rest you merry gentlemen', strong female voices accompanied by deep male ones.

room.name: Misty Hallway
room.desc: Vision in this spacious corridor is slightly obscured by a cloud of pale pink mist that hovers in mid-air. A sickly sweet scent lingers around it, strong enough to give those who pass by a strong headache. At first glance, the walls and ceiling appear to be made of a soft, carpet-like material. On closer inspection, however, they take on the form of carved marble. A shrill chirping noise emits from each groove in the walls, causing the hallway to resonate, almost to the point of unbearably loudly, with the sound. To the west is a dull silver door, upon which a painting of an electric-blue bird hangs. More clouds of mist, light green in this case, guard the north and south exits.

extradesc.desc: The painting is elliptical in shape and depicts a vividly coloured, phoenix-like bird flying. A pale yellow plume billows out from the top of its head, fluttering behind it as it soars through a bright blue sky.
extradesc.keywords: painting portrait picture dull silver door

extradesc.desc: These clouds of mist vary in colour, one being pale pink while the others are light green. A faint glow can be seen from the very center of the cloud, but the swirling fog surrounding it dulls the shine.
extradesc.keywords: pale pink light green cloud clouds mist

roomecho.desc: The volume of the chirping in the corridor increases abruptly, causing many students strolling through to cover their ears and escape through the nearest exit.
An elderly looking ghost drifts by, unconciously moving straight through the mist in the center of the room.

room.name: Heavenly Corridor
room.desc: Slits within the ethereal wallpaper allow spots of sunlight to filter into the room. Obsidian shards decorate the floor, jutting out in an improper fashion throughout the corridor. The glossy texture reflects the tinted cerulean facades that surround the slender hallway. The walls, permeable and intangible, present a deceptive illusion for passers-by. Each of the four obstructions is transparent, yet manifests an altered image unlike the reality which lay beyond its boundary. Elongated, crystalline bulbs line the ceiling in a successive format. Powered by a magical current, the bulbs flash a brilliant emerald hue when activated during the nighttime hours. A poorly sculpted replica of some relatively famous wizard sits neatly against the western wall. The only exit is to east, marked by a stirling, metallic frame.

roomecho.desc: A putrid smell facilitates its way into the smallish corridor.

room.name: Devoid Passage
room.desc: Unlike other corridors in the castle, this passage is completely devoid of ornamentation. The walls are made of a roughly hewn stone, a dull gray in color. Footsteps echo dully on the floor, also of stone. Though discolored through centuries of use, the surface retains the same coarse texture as the walls. The hall has a definite slope downwards, with the low ceiling and closely spaced walls contributing to the subterranean feel. The air is chilly, but retains some moisture, making the atmosphere uncomfortably clammy. Odd scents jumble together in the frigid air. The smells seem to originate from the western end of the hallway and travel out through the east end.

room.name: Stone Fountain
room.desc: This place looks like the inside of a round three-way bell, with its round walls, which are slowly drawn together, finally ending in a bolted ceiling. The atmosphere is filled with a dusty, ancient scent. The walls are lined with torches, giving out a mystic, romantic sort of light. The chamber is small and would be empty if it were not for the strange fountain placed on the east wall. The three arched doors lead north, south and west.

extradesc.desc: The fountain itself is carved at about 3 foot above the floor and it consists of a large half-circle made of stone filled most of the time with water. The water comes from the mouth of a dragon which rests against the wall just above the basin. When there is nobody within a one foot radius from the basin, the dragon's eyes are closed and there is no flow of water. As soon as someone approaches, the dragon's eyes open, giving out a mystic deep green light and the water resumes its flow from its mouth.

roomecho.desc: A couple of young students burst in from the south, take in the deep smell with a huge, relieved breath, and drink some water from the dragon before they are off again.

A first year girl in Hufflepuff robes runs in from the west, looks around for a moment, then leaves south without passing by the dragon. A few seconds later, three older Slytherin students mimic her, but turn north.

room.name: Night in the Desert Corridor
room.desc: The high, arched ceiling of this room is lit by countless very small lights in the shapes of tiny stars. One can see a constellation in the shape of a Scorpion beaming amongst other weaker stars in the distant, dark blue painted sky. The last traces of sand dunes give way to small grass, which looks blue in the fading starlight. There are crickets in the grass, lingering around the small water holes, singing their quiet songs. A breeze beats lightly against this peaceful location, rustling the grass and making the water gurgle slightly. The air is very fresh and the sand sighs at each step. No footprints remain behind, however, and the sands readjust of their own will, giving this place an impression of timelessness and loneliness that is inviting and frightening at the same time. There are exits to the north, south and east, where the sands take over from the grass and the crickets' song is inaudible.

extradesc.desc: The Constellation of the Scorpion beams brightly upon the sky, the bright stars twinkling peacefully and softly against the night sky.
The sky is strewn with thousands of small candle-like stars, but the brightest amongst them are those in the Scorpion Constellation.

roomecho.desc: A cricket begins a new rhapsody and it takes a moment for the surprise of the sound to dull away into the mass of the desert's peace.
A strong breeze whooshes through and the water and grass whisper along softly.

A Gryffindor girl and a Ravenclaw boy walk in holding hands. They pause for a few minutes to acknowledge the peace and rest in the perpetual night over the desert and to steal a few minutes together. They leave only reluctantly.

room.name: Sandy Path Corridor
room.desc: A curving, shell-lined path cuts the way through this sandy corridor. Dune grass grows along the trail, emerging in random clumps in the sand. Oyster, clam, and snail shells poke up from under the ground. The walls are a pale, rough stucco. Two large, blue-tinted windows brighten the room, their wavy glass distorting the light. Three blue-flame torches on the opposite wall from the windows lend to the cheery brightness. They hang in polished bronze brackets. The path connects the exits to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: These wavy windows are huge, reaching almost to the ceiling. They are tinted an aqua-blue color.

roomecho.desc: A crab scuttles across the path and darts into the safety of the dune grass.

room.name: Ptolemy's Pass
room.desc: This corridor is overwhelmed by the large portrait on the eastern wall. This huge painting, in a gilded frame, shows a tall wizard in a green robe. He has a curly white beard, and some hair sticks out from under his red cap. He is old, his many years shown in the lines on his face. The wall on which his painting rests is made of smooth sandstone, as are the other walls and the floor. Upon the ceiling are glowing stars and planets, which brighten up the room with help from two small windows. The planets appear to be those from our solar system, though somewhat out of order. This corridor has exits to the south, west, and north.

extradesc.desc: This portrait shows a tall wizard with a red cap. Beneath the painting is a plaque: "Claudius Ptolemy, famous Greek astronomer, geographer and mathematician. Formulated the Ptolemaic System."
The ceiling shows our solar system according to the Ptolemaic System. The centre of the universe is Earth, followed by the moon, Mercury, Venus, the Sun, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn.

room.name: FIRST DRAFT Internal Passage
room.desc: Tha-thump. Tha-thump. Tha-thump. The very walls pulse with a deep booming beat. The glistening, wet room surfaces are made from a red, raw, flesh-like substance, with unusual nodes sticking out in various places. Walking on the flexible, sticky floor causes it to move unnervingly, like a waterbed. A ball of strangely translucent, red flesh is attached to the ceiling by a number of muscular tendons; it casts an eerie glow over the three-way corridor, which has exits to the east, south, and west.

roomecho.desc: A strange rumbling can be heard, and the floor shakes violently!
A rumbling fills the room, and a fissure opens in the floor, oozing a gross, dark red liquid.

room.name: FIRST DRAFT The Pocket
room.desc: This dark, dusty corridor is a cylindrical tunnel dug from the dark, moist earth, barely high enough for a man to stand in. The walls are perfectly round; it is only gravity that allows a differentiation between the roof and the floor. Just enough light escapes into this room from its entrances to allow people to see where they need to go, which is unfortunate, since the room's surfaces are not smooth and even, but bumpy and even jagged in places. A small pocket has been borrowed out in the wall to the north, but the only real exits from this oppressive hole are east and west, both of which are three-way intersections.

extradesc.desc: A small tunnel has been burrowed into the wall to the north, and while it isn't very deep, it is obscured in part by a small mound of rocks that covers most of the entrance. Behind the rocks, six large eggs lie. They are unbroken, white, and oval in shape, and a clear gooey substance sticks them together. Each egg is about a foot in length, and about a quarter of that in diameter. What manner of creature could possibly come from such a thing?

roomecho.desc: A large ant, tall enough to reach an adult's kneecap, scurries along the corridor to check on the eggs. Has someone been playing with an engorgement charm?

room.name: Two Shrines
room.desc: This chamber seems divided in two, because of the symmetry along the line that runs through the middle of the chamber from north to south. A shimmering, strangely insubstantial door is placed along this separation line, parallel to the eastern and western walls. This door is decorated on the inside with intricate models in iron and the occasional silver thread runs along the design. There is a portrait on each side of the door, centrally placed within silver frames and symmetrically arranged two thirds up the door. There are two strange Altars on the southern wall, spreading light from the orbs illuminating their patrons, a man on the western side and a woman on the eastern side. The woman's altar spreads reddish-black light, while the man's spreads a joyful orange-yellow light. There are three exits, to the north, east and west of this room.

extradesc.desc: This woman is far from beautiful, her right side being little more than a corpse's side, while her left is healthy, young and strong. She has ruffled silver hair and is very pale. Her eyes bore at any visitors, while she crouches above the rotten body of a human being, which lies next to a sleeping living child. She is dressed in Nordic attire, with furs at the hem of her robe. She occasionally brings her hands together, then spreads them in a symmetric movement, after which she brings them back together. Underneath the portrait there is a short name, written in runes and then in Roman characters. It spells Hel.

The man looks in the prime of his life and his black upswept hair does nothing to darken his countenance. He wears a smile on his lips and there are wrinkles of laughter at the corners of his eyes. He wears a simple black robe and looks at students from a quarter turned to the right position. He keeps rubbing his hands and smiling mischievously. There is another name tag underneath, and it spells in runes and then in Roman characters Loki.
There is an altar for Loki and another dedicated to Hel. Specify their names to look more closely at the altars.

Loki's statue is built from reddish wood, in the shape of a burning flame. About a foot above the flames there are two upturned hands, fingers resting against each other. The orb that hangs from the fingers is the size of a crystal ball and it sheds bright light on the right side of the room. On the upturned hands there are four Dungbombs. Since the tricks in Loki's hands replenish magically, this is where the most troublemakers come in their free time.

Hel's altar has the shape of a two faced woman, her right side being full and healthy and young - that of a beautiful woman, but her left being that of a wasted corpse. She is tall and stands proud, her hands holding a balance on an orb. The orb sheds red light from its right side and black light from its left - the red is dark and passionate, the black is void. The balance is in perfect equilibrium.

The two portraits on the door are shown looking towards the Altar on their side of the room. The paintings represent the patrons of the shrines. The woman faces the eastern side, while the man is on the back of the door, facing west. A more careful look might reveal more about them.

roomecho.desc: Hel says softly, her voice steady and low: "Life and death, death and life, they must remain in a balance. One cannot meddle with such things lightly"
A student pops in and nicks one of the Dungbombs on Loki's palm, then grins and nods in the portrait's direction. Loki nods in return, with a huge grin.
Another Dungbomb materializes in Loki's hands.
Hel's balance tips slightly to her left side, then to the right. The portrait watches the change intently.
Loki in the portrait speaks: "If you can't see the bright side of light, you need a severe beating and if you live to tell the tale, THEN you will see it."

room.name: Fashion Mirrors
room.desc: This room is circular and full of bright, differently coloured mirrors. The entire wall, except the two exits, reflects the passer-by. Every mirror shows not the image which it sees, but the same person dressed in all kinds of varying clothes and with different haircuts. It is rumoured that this is where girls come to figure out their Yule Ball clothing. A faint, romantic orange light from the ceiling bathes the chamber, but the colour is altered by the mirrors as they please. The floor is made of a very smooth surface, which reflects most of the orange light that it receives. There are two exits, to the west and to the east.

extradesc.desc: The mirrors are made of clear Venice glass and they are all very clean. There are seven mirrors on each of the southern and northern wall. The sequence of colours from the east to the west on the south side is indigo, yellow, magenta, light green, cyan, red, purple. On the north, from west to east, it is: orange, dark green, silver, royal blue, pink, fuschia and brown.

roomecho.desc: A pair of Gryffindor girls passes through, carefully looking into each mirror and giggling at each other's reflections.

A few boys pass through this corridor, looking back for any pursuers. As they make their way down the hall, one of them stops before the second mirror from the east on the north side and says: "Bloody Merlin! I never knew I looked so good in pyjamas!" They take off still laughing.

room.name: Sliding A Way
room.desc: Bright colours smack the eyes of all who enter. Vivid yellows, reds, blues, and greens - their colour so brilliant it illuminates the room. The ceiling is soft and downy, striped with the aforementioned colours. A tower, of sorts, is erected in the middle of the room, but stretches out to encompass most of the space. The tower is made of white marble, with painted platforms at varying heights and of painted slides. A trampoline is to the side of each entrance/exit. One must jump on the trampoline till s/he is high enough to hurdle her or himself upon a platform. Each platform leads to a steep slide. The yellow slide leads to the stairwell to the north, the red to the south, the blue to the classroom on the east side, and the green to the west.

extradesc.desc: This edifice is comprised of luminous white marble. It reaches for the ceiling, missing it by a couple of feet. There are slides everywhere- short ones gliding into longer ones, skinny ones into ample ones. The various slides begin at the top, and circle the apex like a candy cane. Platforms are positioned in diverse places to allow access to the sliding apparatuses. All the platforms and slides are painted vividly with yellow, red, blue, or green colours. Close to the base of the structure, four steep slides slip to the four exits in the room.

roomecho.desc: "Whee!" screams a sixth-year Ravenclaw girl as she slides into her classroom.

room.name: Decaying Corridor
room.desc: Every surface seems to be covered with dust in this old corridor. A musty, moth-eaten rug covers the otherwise bare floor, which is scuffed and marked by its use. The walls are papered with striped wallpaper that began to peel off long ago. Two enormous windows would allow a decent amount of light in, if not for the grime gathering on the panes. Faded red velvet drapes are drawn to the sides of the windows. Stubby candles flicker in sconces and pools of wax have formed beneath them on the floor. Dust floats in the air, hovering in clouds. There are exits to the north, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: Heavy red velvet drapes hang from the windows. The drapes have faded from a deep red to a pale pink colour.
Short white candles rest in sconces upon the wall. Puddles of dripped wax have formed below the sconces.

room.name: Hall of the War Cry
room.desc: Elegant suits of armor line a brightly lit corridor. Stone walls appear to have been dusted and polished to a shiny silver tone. Pink marble floors are cold and slippery. Each suit of metal is posed in a battle stance. Those on the east are holding out large swords and spears preparing to attack, while those of the left are holding up crested shields, ready to defend their wall. Colorful flags of many nations hang above the lifelike suits on the eastern wall. A single banner bearing a red lion in battle and a white cross on a blue background hangs on the west wall. The sounds of metal clashing and battle cries hang in the air. On the ceiling is a mural. Banners are waving off to the far edges, near camps with cauldrons sending off the steam of meals being cooked by women clad in worn robes. In the center armored men clash and fall, making way for those behind them to take up the fight. Near the rear of the battle are large piles of stones, ready to be placed in catapults aimed at the faraway camps. The north and south doorway of the hall are lined with blood red sandstone on the west and blue diorite, the color of defeat, on the east.

room.name: The Ball Room
room.desc: This chamber is very much like a dance salon of old. It is very large and nearly without furniture. The walls are a deep, royal blue and there are paintings on the walls. There are three, golden candelabra with red candles therein. All sounds echo in warm and powerful tones across the chamber and the small corner dedicated to the band looks comfortable. There are golden laces upon the walls at about the level of a man's chest. The candelabra burn always in tinges of red and gold, which reflect into colder colours when reaching the walls.

extradesc.desc: The pictures are of students, champions of the Triwizard tournament and their partners. The attention however is immediately drawn to the three portraits of Dumbledore, Karkaroff and Madame Maxime, with their dance partners.

Karkaroff looks dark as usual in the portrait, but much handsomer and more self-confident than in the last Triwizard Tournament. He is dressed in dark green, velvet robes, holding the arm of a beautiful girl with straw blond hair and astonishing blue eyes, dressed in a red dress. The dress is set to stress the young lady's very thin waist. The girl nods in greeting at passers-by, but she does so proudly and Karkaroff beams at her every few moments.

The Dumbledore in the painting is a young man with a very open expression and light brown hair. His glasses are oval-shaped and have golden frames, which match the red and gold dress robes he is wearing. There are small models of dragons in silver fibers engraved on his sleeves. He holds a pretty young lady, likewise very open looking, who looks very pretty as she smiles and curtseys at the passers-by. She is dressed in deep blue robes and wears diamond jewelry, a necklace and matching, long earrings. She is rather tall, but very good looking, with deep brown, melancholic eyes and light brown hair.

The portrait reveals Madame Maxime beaming in robes of silvery white silk, which catch her figure well. There is a very tall boy at her side, although he matches her only with dificulty in height. She beams to everyone, a glittering crown on her head. The boy at her side looks very French, efforlessly charming, dark hair and a darker complexion, with glittering black eyes. He wears black robes made also of silk and he smiles a half smile at the students that go past him. He seems to want to wink or laugh at the girls that come along, but does not dare to, because of the young madame Maxime at his side.

roomecho.desc: The room whispers softly with the rhythms and melody of songs past and the portraits become suddenly animated and lively.
Dumbledore in the portrait whispers something to his dance partner and she laughs softly and curtseys to him. There is a slight blush on the face of young Dumbledore.
Madame Maxime and her partner in the portrait beat a slight, but passionate rhythm with their heels and she whirls a few times, gracefully. The echoes of the music ring through the chamber.

room.name: Quiet Passage
room.desc: The torches in this passage give an odd, faint, orange, warm light upon the walls, as if the light was reflected somehow off an orange mirror. There are three steps about halfway through the hall and they and the floor are covered by the same carpet. The walls hold four portraits, two on the north side and two on the south side. The passage would allow a maximum of three students to walk side by side. The low ceiling is perfectly straight. The corridor continues east and west.

extradesc.desc: The carpet looks also orange in the strange light, but where the torches give way to darkness, it is tainted by dark and chilling dark blue, which makes the colour turn to purple. The carpet is soft, but sturdy, and the undoubtedly long years of use have not managed to coarsen it to the touch.

There are two portraits on the Northern side of the passage and two of the Southern side. The easternmost have the captions Louis the Forgiver on the South side and Hilda the Unholy on the North side. The westernmost are called Cedric Hammerfast on the South side and Lucia the Magnificent on the North Side. Look at each painting in its own turn to examine them more closely.

Louis is an elderly wizard, dressed in light blue robes. He has a high, pointed, matching hat, but light brown scaly boots. His face is certainly peaceful and kind and there is always a small smile playing on his lips. If his eyes were not open, he would look relaxed enough to be asleep. He has a medium-length, silver beard and his eyes are grey. He looks as though he was giving a lecture, gesticulating fervently, but the words are muted, as if only meant for a certain audience.

Hilda the Unholy is a witch presumably, but there is very little that remains visible of her as she sits upon a dark chair, fully robed. The focus of the portrait is Hilda herself, but her surroundings look very much like the Great Hall. Beneath her feet as she sits, it is written: "Hilda the Unholy is so called because of her half Vampiric parentage. She was Headmistress of Hogwarts and Head of Ravenclaw House between 1240 and 1255."

Cedric Hammerfast is a very broad shouldered wizard, in black robes, held together by a sash. There is a wand in his left hand and a great hammer in his right. He looks to be practising some sort of two handed combat as he whirls around in movements which hold his wand always steady and available, while his hammer strikes at invisible enemies around. He is tall and red haired, with a reddish-brown beard. Beneath his portrait, there are a few words: "Cedric Hammerfast, Champion of the Order of Odin."

Lucia the Magnificent is a beautiful, radiating witch, in bright pink robes. She has golden hair and bright blue eyes and her skin is the colour of ivory. She sits gracefully upon a silver throne and occasionally resettles her hair. Her right hand holds an ebony wand and every now and again she flicks it, making fresh flowers rain around her.

roomecho.desc: Louis the Forgiver has an occasional lapse in his muted speech and he says: "Forgiveness generously given forges a return forgiveness. So forgive and forget and you shall be forgiven and never forgotten."
Hilda the Unholy readjusts herself in her seat. Some very pale patches of skin become visible for a moment, only to be covered by black robes within seconds.
The torches smoke strongly and flicker in their stands for a moment. Then the light flickers back to its original way.

room.name: Geology room
room.desc: The room is a gallery of rocks and minerals. It is circular and innumerable reddish-brown wooden shelves cover the walls. Small, corked, oddly-shaped glass containers are filled with fine dusty substances of all colors. Two portraits hang in key positions between two sets of bookcases upon the north and south walls. A large candelabrum hangs down from the ceiling. The candles upon it covered with shades that greatly reduce the light given off.
