Exits lie to the east and the west through a tall rectangular stone frame. Drapes hang from the top of the frames and are held open by crimson ropes with matching tassels.

extradesc.desc: The glasses on the shelves are samples of soil with magical uses, especially for healing. There are a few lines written underneath each glass. However, there is an imperturbable charm on them, so it is impossible to touch anything on the shelves. As one approaches, a faint light comes from behind the glasses, so it is easier to read what is written on them.

The portrait on the North side is that of a white haired wizard with terrible, blue eyes, continuously mixing the contents of a potion within a silver cauldron. He is past his thirties and he wears black robes with a silver serpent embroidered on his sleeves. The quotation beneath the portrait reads: "Eliazar Flamekindler, Potions Professor at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry 1922-1936. He was famous for always using a silver cauldron for his potions." The portrait on the South side is that of a black haired witch, with high cheekbones and a meditative face. She is very young and smiles slightly as she stirs the contents of a clear potion with a long, golden stirrer. There is wisdom in her face and a patient but persistent inquisitiveness gleams in her eyes. She wears robes of dark blue silk, with a golden sash. The quotation underneath the portrait reads: "Athena Elizabeth Dumbledore, mother of Albus Dumbledore, inventor of Veritaserum, and the only human being known to have tamed a unicorn."
extradesc.keywords: portraits pictures paintings portrait picture painting

roomecho.desc: The wizard in the portrait on the north side of the chamber whistles softly as his potion growls menacingly.
The witch in the portrait on the South wall begins to sing a low, very soothing song.

room.name: Wooden Room
room.desc: The warm light of bright candles on three large candelabra kisses the walls of this chamber in misty, ethereal shapes, coloured reddish-brown, like wood. The scent of fresh spring rain never leaves the place, although it has no apparent reason for being there. There is a portrait on the north wall and one on the south side. They are both very large and symmetrically placed, with deep-green velvet curtains framing them. The floor is very smooth and the stonework has been covered by dark-coloured wood. There are exits to the east and to the west of this room.

extradesc.desc: The portrait on the south side represents a tall, influential man, who looks very coldly at passers-by. The portrait on the north side is of an elderly gentleman, perhaps a bit too kind in appearance, but very shrewd-looking. Focusing on either one of them might reveal more details about them.

The portrait on the south side represents a man in his early thirties. His hair is very light blonde, nearly white, and his expression is very serious and distant. He has very brightly-gleaming blue eyes and his lips are very straight and expressionless. He wears the green robes of a Slytherin, with a silver serpent embroidered on his chest. He has silver-coloured gloves on his hands and a wand is clutched in his left hand. The caption beneath the portrait says: "Salazar Black, Headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, 1756-1778, Slytherin head of House between 1745-1755. Superb in Legillimency and Occlumency, Salazar Black left his mark on the school's defences, which he improved by adding a number of Mind-Protecting charms."

The portrait of an elderly, smiling wizard, has been pinned on the north side of this chamber. He is dressed in the robes of Hufflepuff house, yellow with a small badger on them and his smile is very calm and warm. He delights in seeing students pass by and sometimes waves at them from his seated position. His eyes are twinkling in a friendly fashion, but they have nothing of Professor Dumbledore's inquisitiveness in them. There are a few words written beneath the portrait. "Armando Dippet, Headmaster of Hogwarts, 1935-1954, Head of Hufflepuff House 1910-1935. Headmaster Dippet faced an attack from within Hogwarts as the Chamber of Secrets was opened during his mandate. The culprit was soon caught and the attacks stopped, regrettably only after a student was killed. Professor Dippet wished to resign, but the parents insisted he'd stay. In his last years at Hogwarts, Professor Dippet became very interested in research and enriched the Hogwarts library with more volumes than a fifth of what it previously had."

roomecho.desc: A group of three Hufflepuffs walks through the corridor and chirp together towards the wizard portrayed on the north side: "Good morning, Professor!" He smiles and replied, with a wave: "Why, good morning!"
The man portrayed on the south side looks with a sneer at the ever-smiling wizard in the picture located on the north side.

The candles in the candelabra dim out and then relight, their brightness magically reinforced. Professor Dippet stretches a little in his seat and disappears from his portrait for a few seconds, after which he comes back.

room.name: Cheery Corridor
room.desc: Every feature of this corridor is cheerful. Bright yellow walls and the three huge windows with white shutters make the hall breezy and bright. A large painting of a sunny day at the park hangs in a plain white frame. Children frolic in the extraordinarily green grass of the park. In the centre of the corridor is a small white table, upon which sits several white candles and a small vase of daisies. Each daisy is perfectly shaped with crisp white petals. The candles are tall, white and tapered providing much light for their size. There are exits to the north, east and west.

extradesc.desc: This picture captures the joy of a bright summer day. Small children run in the emerald green grass of a beautiful park, with golden rays of sun shining down on them.
Several candles rest on the table. They are tall, white, and tapered, and are scented lightly of linen.
A small vase of daisies sits on top of the table. Each daisy has crisp white petals and a long, green stem.

room.name: Hall of the Guilty
room.desc: The walls of this chamber, faintly lit by two iron candelabra holding three torches each, are covered by purple velvet, interrupted by two tapestries. There is a light-coloured carpet on the floor, although the fading torchlight adds echoes of magenta and purple from the walls. There are four suits of armour lined against the wall, holding large axes, as if they were guarding the tapestries. The corridor continues east and west.

extradesc.desc: There is a tapestry on the north wall and another on the south wall. Please specify which one you would like to see better.

The Northern tapestry shows a courtroom. A single, chained chair is on the bottom floor and there is an entrance to the side. There are rows upon rows of wizards standing above the level of the chair. There is nobody currently being judged, but the doors are portrayed to be open and a hint of a Dementor's robe is shown to be coming through.

The Southern tapestry shows a very large, round courtroom, with four people standing up to face their judges . One is a woman, flanked by two men. All three of them stand erect before the judge, in open defiance. The fourth is a boy, who looks as if he might faint. His hair is sandy blond. The angry judge is a very severe-looking man, with eyes that seem fanatic: raging and powerful. The woman beside him clutches at his arm, her knuckles white. Moody and Dumbledore can be seen in the row of judges, their expressions disgusted within the tapestry.

roomecho.desc: 'A group of Slytherins pass and as they do they nod towards the four Death Eaters who are on trial.'

room.name: Lorannia the Mad Memorial Hallway
room.desc: The luxurious, walnut-panelled walls of this hallway do nothing to hide the fact that someone, somehow, has accidentally built it upside-down. A plush, plum-coloured carpet looks soft and cosy, plastered to the ceiling. Stiff chandeliers stick straight out of the stucco floor. Candles are installed upside-down, their flames burning into the wax. Beautiful panelling stretches to the east and west exits. A formal, old-fashioned portrait is hung the wrong way round, its sole inhabitant giggling insanely. To top it all off, a small sign is pinned to the wall, reading "Sorry for the inconvenience."

extradesc.desc: Somehow, even though they've been put in upside-down, the crystalline chandeliers hang perfectly, the epitome of elegant beauty. If one were to yank on the chain tying one to the ground, the candelabrum would simply float back up again.

A formal, detailed painting of a woman hangs in a dark, wooden frame here. She's seated on a blue velvet chair, her hair tied into two loose buns cascading down her back. The dress she wears is a rich, deep red, weighed down with precious stones; it looks highly expensive and incredibly heavy. She also appears to be giggling madly.

roomecho.desc: The woman in the painting gives a loud snigger, topples off her chair, and attempts to scramble back up.

room.name: Pools of Juniper Corridor
room.desc: The air in this corridor is thick with incense, burning fastidiously in suspended iron censers. The imposing walls are assembled from huge blocks of ashen basalt with strands of pure silver woven across the entire surface. The floor is a deep shade of iridescent juniper, throwing the reflected light into shards of incredible beauty. Collecting by the walls and along the ledges of the windows lie smooth grey pebbles, each with an inlaid figure or form. Upon casting a pebble to the floor, liquid-like ripples circle out from the point of impact, though the surface remains solid. The exit is through a large, round arch to the east or between two stout columns to the west.

extradesc.desc: The dull grey pebbles are incredibly smooth. Carved into each is a small figure of an animal or creature.

roomecho.desc: A student hurries by, swiping a pebble from a nearby ledge and tossing it to one side. As it hits the floor, the sound of a deep bell accompanies the expanding waves filling the floor.
Light and energy pulse along the floor, illuminating the room in flashes of turquoise and jade.

room.name: Nightsky Passage
room.desc: A glowing, orb-like fixture emits a hazy light that illuminates the corridor. A cloudy mist swathes the passage obscuring most vision. The floor cannot be touched or seen, leaving most with the feeling of walking on air. The walls are adorned with deep navy blue tapestries that in turn are decorated with stars and planets. Marble pillars stand on either side of the exits to the north, west, and east. A large, pentagon shaped window on the west wall has been bewitched to show the night sky at all times.

roomecho.desc: A whispering breeze sails through the mist.

room.name: Golden Chair
room.desc: This passage would be dark and spooky were it not for the low steps leading to a grand chair right in the northwestern corner of it. The chair is spotlighted by two very bright orbs shedding a brilliant light which extends as far as the steps. The rest of the corridor is quite dark with only vague random clouds of light within. There are red curtains at the sides of the chair and there is a portrait set upon this throne where a person should sit. There are exits to the south and to the east of this chamber.

extradesc.desc: The chair is made of gold mixed with dark silver. It looks much like a 17th Century French piece of art, except that the dark silver carvings follow an oriental pattern with leaves and willow branches. The chair's legs all end in ruby red cushions and there is a similar one on the seat. The portrait rests against the back of the chair, which is covered in ruby red silk and against this pillow.

There is a majestic looking wizard on this throne, with dashing, long, brilliantly silver hair dancing about him. He has his arms spread in an embrace and his deep-red, velvet robes flutter behind him, as if caught in a violent wind. The hat on the wizard's head may be recognized by students as an earlier, better looking and non-talking version of the Sorting Hat. His face is is severe, but very clever, his features very fine chiselled, not those of an old man. He wears a necklace with a red vial at the end. The wizard floats gently on the canvas and the shadow of a great gryphon begins to materialize beneath his feet only to disappear and reappear later. There is a short caption underneath the picture, which says: Godric Gryffindor, founder of Hogwarts. This chair has been made in honour of Gryffindor by Apollodor of Rome, in the year 1153. It was used for each year's sorting while Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw and Slytherin coexisted within the school.

The curtains around this chair are made of the purest of silks. There are patterns in gold of a gryphon, the mark of the Gryffindor house and they end in golden coloured thin strands. They flutter occasionally though there is no wind.

roomecho.desc: The curtains rustle softly and gently, the sound caressing to the ears
The portrait speaks: "Let the brave come to me, for we are alike!"

room.name: The Hall of 99 Fairies
room.desc: All along this deep-crimson corridor, brightly colored fairies flit about, making homes in the crevices and hovering by the ceiling like a swarm of bees. Irritated students have imprisoned some of the creatures in bubbles, now resembling floating Christmas lights. There are no light fixtures installed, but the multi-colored light generated by the cheerful fairies is enough to guide the way. Some parts of the passageway are too choked up with fairies to see through.

room.name: Alan Corridor
room.desc: This rather short corridor is made of solid, grey stone. The Muggle Studies class decorated the walls with pictures. The floor is covered by a single, long, dark-blue carpet with yellow tassels on its four corners. Posing on a pedestal on the western side of the hallway is a wolf carved from stone. The corridor is lit by a few wax candles shaped like balls; they are sitting on wrought iron stands along the edge of the corridor. To the south are multiple faeries, The Hall of 99 Faeries. To the north is Palm-trees Corridor in all its splendor.

extradesc.desc: A "soccer" team called Chelsea is seen running onto the field in high spirits in one picture.
A wolf made from stone poses here. He moves around when he gets bored.

roomecho.desc: The wolf statue howls at an imaginary moon.
The wolf statue shuffles uncomfortably on his pedestal.
A purring sound can be heard around the corner.
Light shines into the room from another corridor's window.
A faerie flies into the room from the north, bound for the Hall of 99 Faeries.

room.name: Palm-trees Corridor
room.desc: The large, squared windows allow an Oriental, faint, light inside this corridor, through branches of exotic bushes. Thick vines line the grey, stone walls in a labyrinth of intricate shapes. Palm trees stretch in the earth-covered floor, their leaves spreading in sharp-tipped fingers, which head towards the ceiling. The whole north-eastern corner of the corridor looks like a bright mass of green. However, the exotic trees only grow before the windows, in the sunlight. The rest of the corridor is thrown into semi-darkness during the day, with nearly no light at night. The roof of this room is arched protectively around the tips of the palm-trees, but flat everywhere else. There are exits to the south and to the west.

roomecho.desc: The palm-trees rustle and the vines slowly creep upwards of their own will, some covering slithering up the walls, while some using the palm tree as ladders.

A class of Herbology enters through the south and the teacher explains to them in detail that the palm-trees in this chamber are related to the ones muggles plant, but also have some magical properties. A notable one, the teacher says, is that they can be trained, like animals, to act as guardians of a particular area.

room.name: FIRST DRAFT Snakes and Ladders
room.desc: This cluttered room is very difficult to navigate, mainly because of the various ladders scattered around, and intermingled with the occasional stuffed snake's skin, hanging down from above. On closer inspection, it appears that the ladders lead to wooden platforms just above head-height, giving a two-tiered effect to the room. The snakes' skins hang from these same platforms, almost like ropes to be climbed down. The floor is formed by a tiled checkerboard pattern, with alternating squares forming a bright red and yellow pattern. A sickening, fluorescent green wallpaper covers the walls, while the ceiling is obscured from view by the rotting, wooden planks. Clambering through this obstacle course will reward the pedestrian with access to the west, where water can be heard; to the north, where one can find a stairwell; and to the east, where palm trees grow.

extradesc.desc: The ladders here are standard wooden ladders, all leading to one of a number of wooden platforms just above head-height. While they are not visibly anchored, they seem to be immovable, as though they have been magically stabilised.

A number of thick, scaly snakes' skins hang from the platform above your head. One is a reddish brown colour, with yellow circles arranged neatly along its length. Another is a lime green colour, that clashes horribly with the corridor's green walls. Yet another has banded stripes, of different shades of brown, yellow, and black. The slimy looking skins all hang still and lifeless, but with long, dangerous fangs that are nevertheless discomforting.

roomecho.desc: A snake bares its fangs and hisses, menacingly.

room.name: Gargoyle fountain
room.desc: There is a short staircase with fifteen steps leading down towards a small, sheltered area. There are torches lining the damp, dungeon-like walls, but they stop before the staircase. Their light is barely enough not to trip down the steps, and the quality of the reddish rays is uncertain, casting permanently moving shadows on the walls. The stairs lead down towards a marble fountain, guarded by four gargoyles. The low, secluded area where the fountain is placed is circular in shape and it has blue curtains along the walls. There is a similar fifteen-step staircase on the other side. The corridor runs onwards towards the east or the west.

extradesc.desc: The fountain looks like a goblet fit for a giant in size, but finely carved by an undoubtedly very skilled craftsman. There are S shaped spirals, slightly resting backwards, along the cup and the foot of the goblet is thin, with a sort of kunckle above halfway down. The four gargoyles are bent over the fountain, their eyes giving a sort of yellowish-orange light in the darkness whenever somebody is next to them.

The Gargoyles are portrayed in a crouched, wary position, wings hitched up, faces down. They are made of dark stone, the colour indistinguishable in the darkness. Their eyes are half opened and the pupils irradiate a sort of strange orange flicker on the water. Students don't generally drink from it - they say it serves only the thirst of those who guard it.

The curtains are made of thick velvet, embroidered with some simple, but rather curly, models in gold. They embrace the circular walls completely, hanging from the ceiling. The shape of a Gargoyle with outstretched wings can be made out amongst the many intricate models.

roomecho.desc: One of the Gargoyles opens its mouth and water spills in the fountain for about ten minutes. Then the Gargoyle closes its mouth.
The curtain shivers slightly and the stone gargoyles sigh deeply, the sound carried away by echoes through the whole castle.

room.name: Sprawling Spider Corridor
room.desc: Dense spider webs cover the stone walls of the corridor, obscuring the exits on the east and west sides. The tangled mess of webs also shrouds the ornate carvings of spiders that decorate the walls. Torches are placed sparingly on either side of the corridor, but the billowing spider webs quickly smother the firelight that emanates from them. The floor's wooded paneling is covered in a thin layer of dust that is punctured here and there by footmarks. An enormous granite statue of a jumping spider looms at the southern end of the passage.

extradesc.desc: The spider is easily 10' tall, yet for all its massiveness it appears quite graceful. The legs are posed to make it look as if it is in mid jump. All of its eight eyes are focused in different directions, as though searching for prey.

roomecho.desc: Spiders softly scuttle around, penetrating the quiet of the corridor.

room.name: Claustrophobic corridor
room.desc: Flickers of light from many luminescent candles illuminate bits and slivers of the walls and stone floor. Torches are mounted inside symmetric recesses of the wall. Engraved at the top of these stone alcoves are curvy patterns contributing to the antique feel of the corridor. The ground has many loose stones that cannot support heavy weight. These stones are crumbling, indicating their wear and tear from the inhabitants of Hogwarts. The walls do not show such extreme signs of age, yet there are cracks of varying lengths throughout the walls. The ceiling is low and the walls close, giving the corridor a claustrophobic feel. The potions classroom is located further down the hall and to the east.

room.name: Homage to Ravenclaw
room.desc: The corridor is lit by odd torches, burning with blue flames in their brackets. There are tapestries decorating the otherwise empty stone walls. A gold-coloured carpet is spread on the floor. The corner of this chamber is filled by a statue of a witch standing upon a golden pedestal. She looks wise and powerful, robes shown as fluttering behind. The corridor continues on both sides of the corner, to the north and to the west.

extradesc.desc: The tapestries are finely woven, showing the Ravenclaw house in various situations: in class, playing Quidditch, studying, taking their exams, and winning the Triwizard Tournament for Hogwarts.

The statue is made of marble and shows a woman. Her robes are bewitched to look deep blue. She is stern and very impressive-looking, her cheeks sunken beneath her cheekbones and her eyebrows arched gracefully above her eyes. She holds a broomstick in her left hand and a long, ebony wand in her right. There is a note on the pedestal beneath her feet, reading: "Rowena Ravenclaw, founder of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. She is the inventor of many hexes and charms and was Quidditch champion five times for England, as Chaser."

roomecho.desc: A group of Ravenclaws come in, their arms wrapped around some heavy books. They stop before the statue and read the note beneath it, beaming with pride.

A fluffy, white cat enters with a decapitated rat in its mouth. It stops by the pedestal in the corner and starts munching away. However, as soon as blood stains the carpet, blue flames erupt all around the statue, brushing the cat's fur harmlessly. The cat runs away, eager to find a more quiet place to feed.
The torches flicker softly as a breeze enters from the west side of the corridor.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT The Dancing Dots
room.desc: Shhhhhhhhrrrrrrrrrrr... The annoying sound of a constant, loud shushing fills this room, causing headaches for those who enter. Billions of tiny black and white dots completely cover the walls, floor, and ceiling of this bizarre corridor. Rather than sitting still, the dots dance around the room surfaces in some form of an insane, energetic dance. The room surfaces are perfectly smooth, like glass, and slightly slippery. They also have a harsh white light glaring through them. With all things considered, this corridor is a rather painful one to linger in. Passersby tend to rush through here to the east, to a room that honours Rowena Ravenclaw, or to the west, to a decaying corridor.

extradesc.desc: The black and white dots on the room's surfaces are tiny, and move about in a constant interplay. They are hypnotic, and at the same time that you find it hard to look away, you find that strange, grey, three-dimensional figures are forming in your mind. These figures are ghostly, and take some time to form recognisable pictures; but in the blink of an eye, they are gone.
extradesc.keywords: black white dots walls floor ceiling

roomecho.desc: The room's surfaces flicker black for a second, and a person's shape takes form, before melting back to the dotty nothingness.

room.name: Painting Gallery
room.desc: This wide corridor houses a fine collection of artwork. The walls are lined with frames, layered on top of each other, which are lit by an elegant silver chandelier. There are no windows or other means of lighting along the walls, just painting after painting. Several paintings stand out. One is of a wizard's duel. Another frame shows a portrait of possibly the ugliest wizard on earth. He is a squat man, with an expression of intense disgust on his face. He has a large mole on his right cheek and a smug mouth. Opposite him is a picture of a prancing unicorn. It is fully grown, with a shining white coat and a long horn. The unicorn is at the edge of a thick, dark forest. The green forest is dark against the sandstone walls and floor of the corridor. There are exits to the north, east, and west.

roomecho.desc: A young student passing by becomes entranced by the unicorn and stares for a few moments before passing on.

room.name: Boris the Bewildered Corridor
room.desc: The statue of Boris the Bewildered, (a lost-looking wizard with his gloves on the wrong hands,) sits in this long corridor with its back against the northern wall. There are a multitude of stained glass windows lining the walls on each side. Covering the floor is a long rug, home to a mural composed of many different colors. A giant chandelier hangs from the ceiling, casting a warm light about the room. The light makes visible a classroom to the south. There are two openings to the east and west that lead to adjoining corridors.

extradesc.desc: A fight between a dragon and a hippogriff is depicted here. The mural first shows the dragon lashing out at the hippogriff. Then the Hippogriff takes to the air and comes down on the dragon. The fight ends with the dragon impaled through a lung by the hippogriff's beak.

room.name: Circe's Corridor
room.desc: A gigantic mural covers the length of southern wall in this long corridor. The mural is divided into portions, each showing a different scene. Portion one shows a lovely island surrounded by deep blue waters. In portion two there is a closer view of the island, which has a picturesque palace in the centre. Tired looking men march up to the palace in the next scene. In the last scene there is a large group of swine in front of the palace, where the weary men once stood. Opposite the mural is a wall of black granite, empty of any windows or decorations. Several candles float overhead, faintly illuminating the hall. The floor is dirt, with some sort of scraggly weed poking up here and there. Two large exits lead to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: Each weed has a small yellow flower. They differ in height, some half a metre tall, while others are only a quarter of a metre.
This mural shows another average day on the island of Aiaia.

room.name: Oracle of Delphi
room.desc: This corridor represents the interior of a temple. The entrance is marked by two Corinthian style columns of clean and white Greek stone. There are a few stone steps leading to a circular chamber, where a statue of a man stands in focus. He is shown in a proud and cold pose, his hands crossed, gazing from far above at those who come. The inside of this stony temple is lit by a circle of torches that burn a distant red light. There is a plain altar before the statue of this god and the smoking remains of a sacrifice rise permanently up, beaten sometimes sideways by a strange breeze that seems to come as if the statue breathes. The circular temple has open column-marked exits on all four sides.

extradesc.desc: The statue in the centre of the chamber is of a young man, with curly hair and a handsome face, with regular features. He is carved in white stone and he has been dressed in a robe, in ancient Greek style. There is a lira held in one his downturned hand as he has his arms crossed and his gaze is persistent and relentless. There is a crown of laurels on his head.

The Altar is a table that stands just inches away from the statue. On all sides, a name is carved in capital Greek letters in the following order: Alpha, Pi, Omicron, Lambda, Lambda, Omega, Nu, framed by olive branches. The letters are carved into stone, but also traced with gold in the carvings. The offer on the Altar is impossible to recognize, as it is reduced to smoking ashes.

roomecho.desc: The smoke rustles through the air in a serpentine form and there is a very slight frown suddenly appearing on the statue's face

The echo of steps comes around the Altar and faint whispers echo around the chamber. The statue's gaze becomes intense and a male voice echoes through the room, although the statue's lips have not moved: "Pythia!"

For a moment the Altar clears and a clear mirror of blue mist appears. There is a man there, shown with his hands on his head, cowering to the side of a room. Although the whispers are in another language, they reverberate off the walls in English words: "He has spent a lifetime, trying to fend off the strike that will kill him". Suddenly a striking woman walks in and the man looks to her and takes his hands away. A boulder falls on him and he falls. The mirror disappears.

room.name: School Archives
room.desc: Cobwebs form thick curtains in the windows of this dusty room, letting in little light. Tacky, scuffed, pale-green linoleum peeks through from between the many, many archive boxes filling the room. The boxes themselves are all made from cardboard and coated in a thick layer of dust. It seems that they haven't been touched for decades. An unusually high tower of the boxes has been built against the southern wall; it teeters precariously, appearing extremely unstable. The only exit is to the east.

extradesc.desc: The boxes are scattered all over the room in a rather disorganised manner. The thick layer of dust can be wiped away to reveal ordinary, closed, brown, cardboard boxes. Years have also been recorded on each box, apparently marking the graduation year of the students whose records reside within. The youngest box here seems to be dated from sixty years ago.

room.name: Office
room.desc: Somewhere here, hidden beneath a colossal mess, is a professor's office. There are piles of papers everywhere. The piles seem to be parted in a pathway linking the two exits, north and east. The papers teeter like waves, arching perilously above. Bookshelves against one wall are completely filled with an assortment of boring-looking books and against another wall is a vaguely desk-shaped object; the mess and clutter obscures its surface from view.

roomecho.desc: AVALANCHE! A tower of papers topples and falls, crashing on the floor!

room.name: Residence
room.desc: This private staff member's residence has pale blue walls and carpet. It would look as though nobody lived here, if it wasn't for a single suitcase and two boxes. Beside this is a large elm wardrobe, and directly opposite that, against the southern wall, is a matching chest of drawers. An expansive, elm bed lies against the eastern wall. The only exit is to the west.

extradesc.desc: This bed looks like a normal, muggle, queen-sized bed. It's thick, soft duvet is dark-blue in colour and has a shimmery, golden pattern of stars, suns, and moons on it. The bed has been neatly made.
The large wardrobe has two mirrored doors that swing outwards, revealing a vacant hanging space and the pungent smell of mothballs.

These luggage items sit against the northern wall, and look as though they haven't been unpacked yet. One of the large, wooden boxes has the words 'Hogsmeade Station' printed on it, in bright red lettering. The suitcase is large, vomit-coloured orange, and features a nasty-looking zipper that looks more like sharks' teeth than a zipper's teeth. Fortunately, it seems to be unaware of your presence.

A small chest of drawers sits against the southern wall of the room. It's uppermost surface reveals nothing but the silhouettes of trinkets that the room's previous occupant must have had sitting on the chest. The chest itself has two deep drawers with bronze handles; both are currently empty.

room.name: Classroom
room.desc: This classroom consists of twenty old, wooden desks with stools at them. Each has a space in the desktop for an inkwell and a small ledge under the desktop to store books and parchment. A blackboard mounted at the front of the room is blank, except for a string of ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs written along its left side. Concentration is difficult in this classroom, for at regular five-minute intervals, the three windows against the northern wall all blink, and when they open again, show a different view than they had before. The only exit is south.

extradesc.desc: Each of the twenty desks in this room is wooden, and has been painted a mud-brown colour. Some of them have deep grooves engraved in them, where students have tried to carve their names, noughts and crosses boards, or merely abstract doodles. Someone has carved what appears to be a dark mark on the side of one of the back desks.

The windows along the northern wall change views at regular five-minute intervals when the windows blink. There are four views that cycle through: overlooking the village of Hogsmeade, the Forbidden Forest, the expansive lake, and, finally, the school's Quidditch pitch.

There is a narrow string of Egyptian Hieroglyphs written down the left-hand side of the blackboard. They could be translated "Thin eagle, eye, wiggly line, man with a stick, bird sitting down, wiggly line". That is *could* be translated, not *should*.

roomecho.desc: The windows blink causing momentary darkness throughout the room.

room.name: Anchor Pass
room.desc: The air in this timber-lined room chills all who enter. The floor here is made of dark beams and is covered with a fine layer of sand and algae. Large naphtha torches glow steadily on brass supports, bathing everything with a sickly amber light. A huge iron anchor, blood brown and dulled from rust, hangs proudly on the west wall. It gives an air of solid defiance and immense power. A pervading sense of the ocean carries through the sounds and smells of the room, waves crashing and salt sprays, gull cries and sodden oak. A large, hand carved plaque bolted above the anchor reads: "Beware the walls, beware the floor, keep the spirits from our door".

extradesc.desc: This huge maritime emblem is mounted over a crack in the wall. Try as one might, it will not be moved to gain access. There are faded letters along its length.
The only readable letters of the inscription are "W-CHL-I-". The obscured letters are stymied with rust and dirt. Above the word is the image of a small black dwarf.

roomecho.desc: A horrendous knocking reverberates around the room, filling every corner with a sense of dread.
One of the lamps fades to black, leaving a smokeless memory of light.
A mighty roar fills the room as some unseen wave crashes against a hidden shore.
A mighty anvil strike thunders around the room, dislodging dust and debris from the ceiling.

room.name: Hydra Corridor
room.desc: This narrow corridor is musty and claustrophobic. Out of the oppressive blackness, an ominous glow issues from four hovering spheres. Covering the floor is hard grey marble, echoing every footfall. Ornate ebony walls snake in and out creating narrow squeezes and tight turns. Running the entire length of the ceiling is a carving in deep red wood with pale white detailing. It depicts many wizards pointing their wands at a massive hydra. An unreadable inscription runs around the carving, the strange symbols picked out in ivory. The corridor curves away to the east and the west.

room.name: Secret Monumental hall
room.desc: This gargantuan chamber is filled with a colossal empty silence. Across its breathtaking expanse, the deepest black marble, as smooth as liquid, covers the floor. Thin veins of pure white line the surface giving the illusion of tides on a miniature ocean. Encasing the circular chamber are stout, pale rose Corinthian columns, dividing the walls into seven equal parts. Recessed between the columns are huge alcoves, twice the height of a man, each with an intricate fresco painted inside. The paintings are dark and foreboding, telling a great legend of wizarding past. The flickering torches mounted on the columns send weak tendrils of light out into the void, hoping to caress any object or person that may linger a while in the cold. The exit is a small corridor to the east.

room.name: Secret Library (Separate from the Secret Chamber)
Blue Tile Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is wide and spacious. The ceiling is curved in a Syrian arch, as are the tops of the windows. There are three windows lining the eastern wall, three enormous windows that let the sunlight stream through. An elegant silver chandelier hangs from the centre of the ceiling, its candles illuminating the hallway. Blue tiles decorate the walls, and other tiles form pictures of animals. There are dragons and bulls in brown and yellow. The tiles are glazed, so the walls shine in the candlelight of the chandelier. The floor is one smooth, continuous piece of sandstone. There are exits to the north and west.

extradesc.desc: These bulls are very impatient, and are constantly moving. They are large and strong, and could probably do someone considerable damage if they weren't just pictures.

These dragons are considerably larger than the bulls. They each have a pair of leathery black wings and are covered in brown scales. When they open their mouths there are rows of sharp, pointed teeth.
This beautiful chandelier illuminates the passage. There are many pale candles, their flames flickering and reflecting off the polished silver.

roomecho.desc: A bull snorts and stamps menacingly.

room.name: North Tower
room.desc: This small, round room has a single exit, to the south. Its single, barred window allows a sliver of light to fall on the golden rug, causing that small patch to glisten and sparkle spectacularly. On the left side of the window sits a low pile of straw. On the right, a small spinning wheel and a matching spinning stool, both made from polished pine.

extradesc.desc: The spinning wheel is made from polished pinewood, and is in perfect working condition. In fact, it looks as though it has rarely been used at all. A small amount of straw has been scattered about, underneath the wheel, probably blown by a draft of wind. There is a small engraving on the locking maiden bar; the thick, horizontal bar of wood that joins on to the lower end of the spoked wheel.
The small engraving on the locking maiden bar reads 'Property of Rumpelstilskin'.

An ornate, golden rug shimmers against the plain stone floor of this room. A close look reveals an intricate weaving pattern between thousands of individual golden threads. The strands feel cold and metallic to the touch, as though they were truly made from gold.
There is a small mound of freshly cut straw stacked against the wall of this round room. What purpose could it possibly have?

room.name: Student Lounge
room.desc: The fireplace crackles gleefully in this cosy room, filling it with warmth and light. Elegant panelled walls surround a luxurious, maroon carpet that furnishes the floor. A comfortable sofa hugs one corner of the room. On the other side of the room is a large study desk with chairs around it. The room's single painting, proudly displayed on the southern wall, depicts a bowl of ripe fruit. The only exit is to the north.

extradesc.desc: This painting, in a simple wooden frame, shows a wooden table with a bowl of fruit on it. The bowl contains ripe, green apples, a couple of bananas, a bunch of grapes, and an orange. One of the apples seems to have a bite taken out of it.

roomecho.desc: "Did you hear what that Ravenclaw girl did today?" A student can be heard whispering from the lounge chair.

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: The moss grown, stone steps keeps on winding downwards and upwards. Evenly spaced in the wall are small alcoves and a slim window that allows a little light in to illuminate the staircase. The stone walls are damp, in some places the stone blocks has crumbled and left indents and crevices. A flickering light that comes form the alcoves makes the shadows dance along the walls.

extradesc.desc: The steps are made of the same grey rock as the rest of the stairway. In some places the steps are worn smooth by all the feet that has walked on them.
The alcoves are evenly spaced along the stairs. Inside each is a small candle that creates a flickering light, making the shadows dance and move across the walls.
The window is more of a crack than a window, allowing a thin ray of light to enter.

roomecho.desc: A first year student passes you and continues up the stairs

room.name: Existentialism and Wizardry Classroom
room.desc: Pink brick blankets the walls and lies under the feet of all who enter. The stucco ceiling is a motley compilation of miscellaneous pinks. Fuchsia candles float midair casting rose-coloured light in this windowless room. No desks grace this classroom; instead, only a ledge, blush in tone, surrounds the room like a step. This sill provides the only respite from standing. The designer of this space concluded that pink was just rankling enough one could actually 'feel' her or his existential being. Salmon-coloured bookshelves hold many volumes of books with titles such as, 'You Can't Spell Witchcraft Without I', and 'Ennui and Enchantments'. The exit is on the south side of the classroom.

roomecho.desc: One of the books mutters, "Oh, the abyss, the abyss."

room.name: Forgotten Dance Floor
room.desc: A gleaming, marble staircase, with shining silver banisters, curves around the outside of this circular room. The walls are a pale green slate. It is a surprisingly beautiful, rock wall, with a lacy, yet natural, design imprinted on the rock's very surface. The glistening, marble floor reflects from the light the elegant, crystal chandelier delicately emits. The exits are to the south or up the stairs.

roomecho.desc: A shadowy couple gracefully descends the staircase, and then swirls out across the dance floor, fading out of view as they exit southwards.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Office
room.desc: In the centre of the smooth, wooden floor sits a large castle, composed entirely from playing cards. Aside from the castle, this professor's office has all the usual features; an airy window, an office desk and chair, and a filing cabinet. The office walls have been painted white, making the floor-length red curtains, held back by black curtain ties, all the more striking. A bronze candelabrum that hangs from the centre of the ceiling lights the room. There are exits to the south and west.

extradesc.desc: In the middle of the room towers a castle made entirely out of playing cards. While Muggles might construct houses out of cards for pleasure, they could surely construct nothing like this; Hogwarts Castle has been presented in all its intricate detail, with every floor and tower on display.

roomecho.desc: "This is not the way we deserve to be treated!" cries the Queen of Hearts haughtily, from her position at the base of the north tower.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Residence
room.desc: Mmm... the fresh scent of lemons hangs in the air of this meticulously clean room. The pale yellow walls, combined with a large window on the northern wall, make this room airy and bright. Floor-length white curtains match the thick, soft carpet. While some might avoid white for fear of stains, it is hard to imagine that this spotless carpet could ever be dirty. A large, neatly made bed rests against the western wall, and a wardrobe has been lined up directly opposite the window. Above the bed hangs a portrait of a kindly, older woman. The only exit is to an office, to the east.

extradesc.desc: This bed is far from the ornate, canopied bed you might expect to find in a medieval castle. Instead, it is a simple, pinewood bed, without unnecessary embellishment. A blue bedspread neatly covers the bed, which appears warm and inviting.
The large wardrobe has been constructed from pinewood, matching the bed. Both doors are locked, which is strange, considering that there is no visible keyhole.

"Well, hello, dear!" the woman exclaims from within her pinewood frame as she notices your attention. She is a grandmotherly figure, with grey hair that has been tied into a loose bun, with wisps of hair hanging down, gently framing her face. Her eyes sparkle over her reading glasses at you, in a way that suggests that she would never believe anything nasty about you.

roomecho.desc: "Well, good morning, dearie! Lots to do today!" The woman in the portrait exclaims heartily.
"Oh dear, don't you think it's a bit late?" The woman in the portrait asks.
"Good afternoon, dear. Come here and tell me all about your day," the woman in the portrait says.

room.name: Lady's Sitting Room
room.desc: This large sitting room seems to have been untouched by the castle's modern occupants. Rich, woven tapestries adorn the walls, and the hard, cold, stone floor is completely bare. A single arch-shaped window sits on the southern wall, with no window frame or glass pane at all. Beside the window sits an ancient chair, accompanied by a small side table. On the side table sits some form of handicraft. The eastern wall features a fireplace, in which a gentle fire burns, and on the western wall hangs a large mirror. The room's only exit is to the north.

extradesc.desc: The window gives a breathtaking view of the castle's grounds far below you.

The solid mahogany chair is heavy and dark. It has hand-carved legs and armrests, and its backrest has been delicately etched with the image of two birds: one in a cage, the other, flying free above a wild forest.

A semi-finished tatting doily sits here, its delicate, ecru-coloured thread attached to a yellowing bone shuttle. The gentle, curving loops weave evenly through the design, betraying careful workmanship.

The large, rectangular mirror is framed with an elegant bronze frame. The framework shows birds in flight in three of the four corners, but the lower right-hand corner features a caged bird. The reflection in the mirror is not yours, but instead shows a young woman in her mid-twenties, wearing a long, flowing dress gathered around her waist with a woven belt. Her long, blonde hair hangs freely around her neck and shoulders, and her deep blue eyes pierce yours. She does not speak, but a single tear is captured halfway down her cheek.

roomecho.desc: The sound of a woman sobbing overwhelms the room, and then leaves as quickly as it came.

room.name: FIRST DRAFT Secret Compartment
room.desc: This room is cramped and tight, but someone has desperately tried to make it more cosy. Shelves with sweets are built into the dusty walls, a tiny chandelier adorns the ceiling, and a large, blue armchair has been miraculously wedged into a corner. The floor is a hard, chipping cement, and the ceiling rains flakes of paint onto everything. It's easy to imagine this being a broom cupboard of some sort before being turned into a little hideaway. A thin, wooden door shows the way out west.

extradesc.desc: Thin, wooden, wall-mounted shelves host a variety of candies and sweet things to eat. From Chocolate Frogs to Pumpkin Pasties, one could spend hours deciding which sweet to take. Some of the packets have been half-opened, nibbled at, or completely licked clean.
A large, coudoroy armchair has been wedged into a corner, nicely stuffed and dented by many years' worth of sitting. Small chocolate stains mark its deep-blue surface.

roomecho.desc: A rumble of footsteps can be heard from above.
The sound of chatter can be heard outside the door.

room.name: The Claustrophobic Corridor
room.desc: Rather than a square room with doors in it, this claustrophobic passageway forms an elbow, with exits to the north and east. The walls, ceiling, and floor are all made from the same dark, oppressive rock slabs, which seem to be barely held into place. The walls rumble alarmingly, and occasionally dust and small gravel particles fall from the ceiling, causing passing students to wheeze and cough.

extradesc.desc: This narrow passageway can barely allow two students to pass each other. Its cold, dark slabs of rock crouch menacingly just out of reach.

roomecho.desc: A sudden avalanche of dust and gravel crashes down in the center of the room, causing an upheaval of dust and filth.

room.name: The Hall of Forgiveness
room.desc: The walls of this corridor radiate an intrinsic, kind light. The room is filled with a fresh scent, without sweetness or bitterness, a little like mint. There is a single, muggle portrait on the north wall. A choir-like sound of soft, gentle, yet powerful, voices reflects off the stone walls. The ceiling is arched with a spiral of laurel branches leading towards the top of the ceiling. There are exits to the south, east, and west of this chamber.

extradesc.desc: This muggle painting shows a kind-faced man with shoulder-length locks of chestnut hair speaking to a woman, who is bent before him and weeping. The man has a halo of light around his hair and his chestnut beard suits his face well. He is wearing bright ancient robes. The woman's face is barely visible under her black hair that falls in heavy waves, masking her features. She too wears ancient robes.

roomecho.desc: A group of Gryffindor girls pass by the portrait, raising their eyebrows as they go. One of them seems to find it terribly amusing that the picture does not move.

room.name: Corridor of Infancy
room.desc: This corridor appears to have been recently renovated. Its elegant white wallpaper is in pristine condition, and a simple golden motif circles the walls near the ceiling. The new carpet is thick and soft, and royal blue in colour. Small, elegant lanterns adorn the walls, filling the room with light. The only feature of interest here is a portrait of a baby that hangs on the southern wall. There are exits in all four of the cardinal directions.

extradesc.desc: The painting shows a one-year-old girl wobbling delicately on her feet. She has sparkling hazel eyes and a full head of curly, brown hair. The child looks right at you, and then takes two wobbly steps, before landing on her bottom with a bump. Nevertheless, she seems pleased with her achievement, and she chuckles and claps her hands.

roomecho.desc: The sound of a baby crying suddenly fills the otherwise silent room.

room.name: Corridor of Youth
room.desc: Slightly-faded white wallpaper, with a simple, golden motif circling the walls, adorns this room. The thick carpet is a royal-blue colour, and has track marks through the center, as though many people have walked through this way. Small, elegant lanterns around the walls fill the room with light. A portrait on the southern wall shows a young woman. There are exits to the north, east, and west.

extradesc.desc: A young woman with brown, curly hair and sparkling, hazel eyes is sitting at a desk in the Hogwarts library, busily consulting a text book and writing on a scroll in front of her. Her forehead is wrinkled in concentration, and she seems to be too busy to register your presence.
The wallpaper is a solid, slightly-faded white colour, except for a single line of what appears to be a row of golden snitches circling the room, about a foot away from the ceiling.
On closer inspection, the golden snitches that circle the room are in fact tiny, golden clocks, with delicate, golden wings. Their wings are outstretched, as though they are in flight.

room.name: Corridor of Age
room.desc: The white wallpaper is fading and tattered in this aging room, which looks as though it could do with some maintenance. Even the thick, blue carpet is fraying in patches. The corridor is shadowy, as the lanterns that light the room are getting lower, in need of fuel. A portrait on the southern wall depicts an elderly woman. Exits are to the north and east.

extradesc.desc: In this picture, an elderly woman with curly, grey hair rocks contentedly in a rocking chair as she knits what appears to be a baby's bonnet. She stops rocking as she sees you, and her hazel eyes sparkle at you through the wire-rimmed glasses that frame them. "Greetings, young one," she says. "When I think back to the many exciting challenges I have faced, I am truly grateful for the time I spent at Hogwarts."

roomecho.desc: Shadows momentarily flood the room as a sudden breeze threatens to extinguish the already weak light source.

room.name: Secret Room
room.desc: A giant, orb-shaped eye hovers here, revolving and darting around, never looking at the same place. Instead of walls, waterfalls frame the floor, pristine sheets of water rushing past at all sides.

room.name: Guest Chamber
room.desc: Glossy, sheeny pewter form this circular sanctuary forcing the walls, ceiling, and floor to reflect distorted images of all they embrace. A maple canopy bed rests in the centre of this haven with diaphanous Tussah silk draped over the top and sides, resembling a shimmering jewel. A chenille, cabernet-red coverlet spreads across the bed, concealing the bronze-coloured China silk sheets nestled within. At the foot of the bed lies an ivory chenille rug. A crystal chandelier holds translucent candles allowing delicate light to caress the room. A crystal bowl holds sweet strawberries and grapes. A pool of translucid water sparkles, inviting any who wish, into its warm waters. Delicate, tiny orange blossoms and flowers of jasmine float down from the ceiling emitting their faint scent into the air. The room allows any inhabitant to think of a tune, a song, or sound and it will begin to play softly or loudly, contingent upon the desire of the individual.

extradesc.desc: The fruit lies ripe and colourful in a crystal bowl sparkling as the light bounces off of it.
The water lies in a heart-shaped pool. The water shimmers as light brushes against its clear, blue surface.

room.name: Guest Chamber
room.desc: A large canopy bed is the focal point of this chamber, and it occupies the centre of the room with the head post to the northern wall. Four gleaming walnut posts stand at the corners of the bed, dark and rich with age. Curtains made of rich azure velvet are draped over them, and they cascade to the top of the arched feet that support the entire structure. Covering the entirety of the floor, the plush slate carpet underneath springs back after any footfall. A self-organizing wardrobe with fluid, lissom embellishments carved into its sides is set against the eastern wall. On top, potion vials in a spectrum of colours are lined up in order of size. The rightmost and largest flask lacks a stopper, and the scent of sandalwood rises from its open neck. The western wall supports a tall, oak-framed mirror. An oil painting of a stormy seascape hangs on the southern wall. To the south is the sole exit.

room.name: Celestial Guest Room
room.desc: Fluffy, white clouds hover and swirl just above the floor, giving this guest chamber a surreal feeling. The walls and ceiling are a pale sky blue, the colour you would see close to the horizon on a clear, winter's morn. No artificial light source is necessary here; the walls glow gently as though Lady Sol herself is present, but hiding from view. A gentle, yet crisp and clear, breeze circulates through the room, making the drapes of the canopied bed, which is against the northern wall, flutter and furl. The only exit is to the south.

extradesc.desc: The canopied bed here is a large, soft bed, with a dark mahogany frame. The coverlet and drapes are a deep, royal blue colour, with golden ties holding the drapes in place. The drapes flutter and furl, as though it were playing a game, chasing the breeze.

roomecho.desc: A thick patch of cloud takes on a dark grey colour, as though it were full of rain, then releases a puddle of water onto the floor.
The cloud turns a brilliant pink, almost like the clouds do at sunset or like a person does, when they are really, really embarrassed.

room.name: 2nd DRAFT Boys' Baths
room.desc: This dilapidated bathroom has seen better days. Most all of its furnishings are tinged green, like a sick lime. All of the toilet cubicles are on the east side of the room; the bolts fastening the cubicle doors are loose. On the west side of the room there are a few bathtubs and several showers, made from cold, solid, white marble. The bathtubs have delicately carved clawed feet, like those of a raven's. The dark, gold paint covering the feet is starting to flake off like a lizard shedding its skin. The shower heads are hanging loosely from the wall, covered in calcium and lime deposits. The floor is tiled with solid white marble that is slowly turning a sickly green colour to match the rest of the bathroom. Mortar holding the tiles together is missing in places, allowing for the tiles to move out of place. Dim lanterns illuminate the livid scene casting a ghost like glow over the surroundings. To the north is the door that leads into the Corridor of Infancy.

extradesc.desc: Five very old and colour tormented toilets line the eastern wall; housed by cubicles just as decrepit.
Five time worn, marble white bathtubs line the western wall. They still work, but not well...

roomecho.desc: Water suddenly sprays out of a shower head.
Water spews from a nearby toilet as it mysteriously flushes itself.
A moaning noise emanates through the room.
A giggle comes from the drain in a nearby bathtub.
A loose tile is disturbed by the flood of water coming from the toilet.
A faucet somewhere is dripping.

room.name: 2nd DRAFT Girls' Baths
room.desc: Bright, transparent vases with candles burning within their glass confines illuminate this place of bathing. On the southern wall there are cubicles made of imitation silver, hiding the toilets within them and their users from public view. Along the eastern part of the room are several bathtubs and a few sinks. The rim of each bathtub looks like a golden wedding band, while the rest is coloured off-white. Two imitation silver sinks reside next to each bathtub. A motley bunch of bottles fills the northern wall, some are filled with shampoos, others with flower petals. The room is filled with many scents and perfumes ranging from Apple Blossoms, to Essence of Spinach. The featureless western exit leads into The Hall of Forgiveness.

extradesc.desc: There are many bottles here of various sorts. This one says, "Seeds of a Sunflower."
The toilets are all coloured off-white. Each one has a plunger next to it and an extra roll of toilet paper.

roomecho.desc: The smell of freshly cut grass fills the air.
The candles in the room go out temporarily and then return to their original state.
Someone enters the room and then leaves before being seen.
A flushing sound engulfs the room.
An ghostly light comes from the hallway.

room.name: Vector's office
room.desc: A large tapestry hangs on the western wall, concealing much of the white paint behind the rich blue of the cloth. The northern wall is painted black, and many Arithmancy reference charts are attached to it. They are arranged somewhat haphazardly, a great contrast to the strict logic of the numbers and symbols written on them. To the north sits a large desk, which faces the door to the east. There is nothing on the desk save a day-to-day calendar that disintegrates a page each midnight and a modernistic wire sculpture that rearranges itself sporadically. The only other features of interest are the series of numbers run along the top and bottom of the walls, forming a continuous line around the room. The wall to the east is white, and the wall to the south is painted black, so that opposite walls are the same colour. Both are unadorned. To the east is the hall, and to the south, Professor Victoria Vector's quarters.

extradesc.desc: The background of the tapestry is a royal blue linen weighted at the bottom with a brass rod. It showcases a seemingly chaotic arrangement of numbers and Greek letters, coming in and out of focus and flying around the canvas.

roomecho.desc: With a gentle whispering sound, the front page of the calendar dissolves into the air to reveal the new date.

room.name: Vector's chamber
room.desc: A contorted sculpture of bronze ribbons and steel rods partially blocks the door to the north, allowing it to open just enough for a slender person to slide through. The furnishings are sparse but tasteful; geometric figures in shades of grey rise from the hardwood floor on an oval rug at the foot of the bed. Unlike the students' and many of the teachers', this bed lacks the requisite frilled canopy, although its head and foot are embellished with slashed designs. By the head of the bed rests a table, and a short six-sided glass column glows with a clear white light.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Classroom
room.desc: This ordinary-looking classroom has a pleasant atmosphere, with two large windows on the eastern wall providing plenty of light, and a potted bonsai, sitting on the teacher's desk, gives the room some gentle greenery. The blackboard has been cleaned in preparation for the next class, and twenty-three wooden students' desks are lined up, waiting to be occupied. This classroom would be completely boring, if it weren't for the students occasionally entering the room by sliding down a green slide from the west, and landing with a bump on a large, green cushion that has been placed where a door would normally stand. A platform to the side of the cushion allows students to climb out the only exit, to the west.

extradesc.desc: These windows capture a breathtaking view of the Hogwarts grounds, far below. From this height, passing people appear so tiny that it is impossible to tell who they are. Occasionally, an owl flies past, either headed for the owlery, or setting out with a delivery.

A tiny crab apple tree sits here in a shallow, unglazed, earth-brown pot. It's trunk is thick, and gnarled by age, regardless of its height, and its branches are weighed heavily by miniscule fruit. A small patch of tiny weeds sits around the base of the tree, and a tiny porcelain figure sits beside them.

Startled by your presence, the tiny, porcelain figure guiltily jumps up and, grabbing a nearby rake, starts attacking the weeds at the base of the tree violently. He occasionally takes a break, wiping his forehead with the sleeve of his bright red shirt, and sneaking a look up at you, almost as though he is checking to see if you are still watching him.

roomecho.desc: A boy slides into the room, misses the cushion, and yelps in pain.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Office
room.desc: A thick layer of dust fills every crevice of this small room, threatening to fly up and choke the unwary passer-by who disturbs it. A frayed, vomit-yellow carpet clashes with slightly stained, lime-green wallpaper that has thin, white, vertical stripes. The expansive antique desk in the center of the room has the tiniest amount of free space left for working; the rest is taken up by a variety of useless muggle office equipment. Someone has cunningly enchanted a light bulb to hover in mid-air, lighting the room. A rickety bookshelf against the western wall is filled with books. There are exits to the east and south.

extradesc.desc: At first glance, the appearance of a fishy screensaver seems to indicate that the computer is functional. On closer inspection, however, it can be seen that someone has cunningly transferred the computer monitor into a fish tank. A small school of clownfish swims past merrily; as their bright orange and white stripes disappear a blue angelfish swims to the front of the monitor and goggles at you. Soon, however, it is alarmed, and swims away quickly. A long, thick, orange tentacle curls slowly into view. Surely this beast is too large to be an ordinary squid! What sort of crazy aquarium is this?

This dark, cherry desk is large, heavy, and ornate, with intricate carving on the legs of the desk that forms convenient storage pockets for dust. The surface of the desk has been cluttered by a great amount of useless muggle office equipment, leaving only the tiniest amount of space for working on.

Scattered about the desk are an assortment of strange items, like an old, useless computer, a pen holder (with countless ball point pens, most of which are empty), a bundle of electrical extension cords, and some paperclips.

This rickety bookshelf wobbles precariously as it leans against the western wall. It is short and fat, with only three shelves, and made from cheap pinewood. Dust settles on its uppermost surface, but not on the books, which look to be well used.

A brightly coloured assortment of hardcover books fills the bookshelves. Some of the titles, like 'Strange Habits of Muggles', and 'A Guide to Muggle London' are essays on the daily lives of muggles, while others are actual muggle books, with strange publishers' names like Bloomsbury and Scholastic.

room.name: Residence
room.desc: A large brass chandelier, hanging from a low ceiling, bathes lightly stained wooden walls in an amber glow. The gold-carpeted floor of the hall is surprisingly springy. Tucked in the corner is a rickety looking chair. A well-worn knitted blanket with stripes of hunter, gold, crimson, and navy is carelessly tossed over the back of the chair. A small pile of books, with tattered leather covers of red and brown are gathered at the foot of the rocker. The rocker faces the east wall, which is graced by a portrait of a stately, steel haired woman cloaked in strawberry smiles down. Her brown eyes are warm and inviting. The soft gray and white cat lounging at her feet waves his tail lazily in greeting. A crimson red cherry door marks the exit to the west.

room.name: Believer's Corridor
room.desc: From the uneven marble walls hangs an assortment of rusty lanterns, casting their forlorn light on the slick, stone floor. Wavering and uneven, the light has an eerie orange glow. The ceiling here is very low and the dusty wooden rafters are adorned with cobwebs and bird nests. A deep crimson tapestry with a large eye in the middle hangs on the north wall. In the white of the eye the latin phrase, "Vide et credere", is inscribed. A corridor from the east and west filter in to this passage and lead to the massive cast iron doors guarding the southern exit.

room.name: Musical Hall
room.desc: The floor of the corridor is split into wide bands running horizontally from wall to wall. Tinted dark and light slate, they resemble a giant keyboard and shift up and down as though the fingers of a Titan were dancing across them. In a small alcove carved into the southern wall, a marble bust of Bach gazes downward. He smiles approvingly as the clear, dainty notes of a harpsichord ring out. Over and over, the tune of the Goldberg Variations tinkles through the air. The western wall showcases pages and pages of faded manuscript written in the baroque composer's own hand. A short passageway lies to the east, and a classroom to the north.

extradesc.desc: The proud visage of one of history's most revered composers is immortalized in a block of white marble. A ribbon holds back his hair, or rather the wig covering his hair. On the pedestal, the inscription reads "Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750)" and "Bring me a bowl of coffee before I turn into a goat" on the next line.

roomecho.desc: Silence. The music pauses for a moment between variations and the floor stops shifting as well.

room.name: Berry corridor
room.desc: The fresh smell of squashed berries fills this chamber with a sweet, and yet slightly acrid, smell. The walls are covered with a thin coat of green, in the shape of small branches and leaves. Low on the sides of the corridor, at the point where the vertical walls meet the ground, are fresh, small berries. Light comes in through the old, large windows on the east and south sides, and the cheerful rays change colour every now and again, as they bathe in new and unexpected tinges of red or blue. The shade of the light changes from similar changes in the glass of the windows. A slight, fresh breeze goes through this room at irregular intervals. There are exits to the north and to the west.

extradesc.desc: The windows are very large, with rounded upper margins to sweeten the sharp, otherwise square, shape of the glass. They look somewhat ethereal, as if they were solidified drops of a rainbow. Rain does not stick to them and no storm can make them rattle or tremble like it does ordinary old windows. They have no handle that would allow them to open, but most students say that on sunny days, the windows open on their own, disappearing for a while as if they'd never existed.

roomecho.desc: The windows turn a deep shade of yellow, and the starlight becomes twice as strong and secretive as it hits the berries and the mass of green surrounding them.
The chamber basks in flaming-red sunlight. The short moment of the sunrise is repeated for a long time, throwing bright fire on the stone walls.
As the light outside becomes bright and sparkling-white, a shade of smoky grey catches the windows, shielding the berries within from the tormenting gleam.
The dusk is short, but the light inside the room catches the moment through absolutely clear windows. The berries stir under a sudden fresh breeze.

room.name: West tower
room.desc: An office is located on this level of the tower, one that has fallen into disuse for quite some time. Facing the only window is a small desk with spindly legs, barely larger than that of a student. It holds nothing but a thick layer of dust, though the grime is cleared in two handprint-shaped spots. The solitary chair has the same rustic appearance, a crude assembly of assorted wooden rods and planks. Several feet away, a cardboard box wiggles and shuffles around on the top of a bookshelf - the forgotten toy of a student 100 years ago. An oval carpet that once was a rich cream covers half the floor between the desk and the staircases leading up and down, which are across the room.

extradesc.desc: The cardboard box, its creases nearly worn through, pops a few centimetres into the air before squeaking dejectedly.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Island Classroom
room.desc: Dried grass woven into a mat covers the floor of this rather unconventional classroom. The walls are made from vertical sticks of bamboo, wired tightly together, so that it looks like the inside of a hut on a tropical island. There are a couple of small, square windows on the northern side; completely unadorned, they are merely holes cut in the wall, allowing a generous sea breeze access to the room. A short, squat, three-legged stand holds a blackboard low to the ground. There are no desks here; instead, there is a pile of cushions and another pile of wooden boards. The only exit to the room is to a corridor, southwards.

extradesc.desc: A large pile of cushions is stacked against the western wall. They are in many different natural shades of greens and browns, but are all of the same size and shape; small squares, the right size for someone to kneel on them. They aren't very thick, but the padding in them is quite strong and supportive.

Instead of desks, this room seems to have an assortment of small wooden lap-boards. It seems that the students are to kneel on a cushion, and then balance one of these small rectangular boards on their lap while they write. The surfaces of the boards are at a slight angle, so that the top of the board sits higher than the lower edge, which has a small, raised ledge. The boards are all neatly stacked, and undamaged; perhaps they are not used often.

A small, portable blackboard sits on a short stand here. It is blank; but instead of the streaked look that a freshly cleaned blackboard sometimes has, it is a perfectly even, midnight black colour, as though it were either brand new or freshly repainted.

roomecho.desc: Through the window, a seagull can be heard squawking hungrily.

room.name: Spiral Stairwell
room.desc: The stairwell is placed in the centre of a circular area. It spirals upward in a wide horizontal arc to reach the upper floor. It is made of a white marble that is smooth and undamaged. A navy blue stretch of carpet rolls down the middle of the staircase, but you can still see the marble on the outer edges and banisters. The floor is made of the same material as the staircase, but it is unadorned. Two ancient suits of armour hold lanterns at the bottom of the steps. A large, domed window sits adjacent to the staircase on the east. To the west is a door that leads into a room.

roomecho.desc: The suits of armour squeak as they rearrange the lanterns in their hands.

room.name: Astronomy Tower
room.desc: This long, steep stairway in the Astronomy Tower, one of Hogwarts tallest towers, is decorated in vivid colours. The walls are a cheerful pale yellow. The wooden steps gleam in the light from the enormous windows that over look the castle grounds. Deep purple curtains, covered in twinkling stars of various colors and brightnesses, just sweep the floor and outline the massive windows. Brilliant sunshine beams in onto the exquisite lavender flowers in vases affixed along the walls of the acending stairs. The vases are crystal that swirls and ripples at the rim to mimic water. There are a couple pictures scattered along the walls. One contains a dreadfully anxious looking elderly wizard, who is pacing back and forth in a luscious forest. While in another an attractive witch with silvery blonde hair, plucks yellow roses from a large bush.

room.name: Crumbling Corridor
room.desc: Time passes by here continuously, leaving its unmistakable brand of erosion. Neither paintings nor decorations adorn the stark walls. However, they have a rather unusual texture of their own: moth-eaten, griddled with hairline cracks. At awkward intervals, large chunks of stone have crumbled away, exposing the raw, jagged face of the granite. The remaining jigsaw appears incapable of supporting the weight of the school, but somehow it stands up doggedly. The corridor stretches on to the south, but most of the wear marks fade after a few metres. To the west, it turns sharply where a section of missing stonework is particularly visible.

roomecho.desc: Two loose fragments of granite scrape against each other in a soft but dangerous rasp.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Office
room.desc: A foul stench fills the room of this otherwise tidy office, wafting through the room from a painting on the wall, and choking the innocent students who have the misfortune of wandering in. The wooden floor has a trail of muddy footprints, leading to a pair of boots left unattended. A large window, set in a lime green wall, provides ample light during the day, while a lamp on the wooden desk provides for light at night. There is also a wooden chair, and a filing cabinet. An assortment of fishing implements is lying against the wall. The eastern doorway leads to a corridor, while to the north is a professor's residence.

extradesc.desc: The painting that is attached to the wall shows a fisherman holding up his catch of the day, a huge fish. Unfortunately, the fish is rather old now, and is both looking and smelling rather foul. Its eyes bulge in shock, and its sickening yellow scales have begun to decay alarmingly, so that its actual species is difficult to determine. The fisherman's face is a rather interesting shade of green, and he seems to be torn between striking a proud pose, and dropping the fish so that he can go and be sick.
A pair of muddy fishing boots is sitting against the wall, at the end of a long trail of muddy footprints.
Along with a tackle box, a couple of different types of fishing lines, reels and nets are stacked up against the wall.

This wooden desk is clear, except for a roll of parchment that has 'Possible species in The Great Lake,' written across the top in a curly calligraphy but is otherwise blank; and a lamp, which has been used recently.
The standard grey, metal cabinet looks surprisingly modern in the castle surrounds, and is in excellent condition. It is locked, and the key is nowhere in sight.

room.name: The Dusty Stairwell
room.desc: A marble staircase culminates here, but its once gleaming surface appears dull and its silver banisters are tarnished. The room itself is saturated in a heavy layer of dust, which belches a gritty, suffocating haze when disturbed. Curious shapes, all obscured from view by an assortment of heavy, dusty blankets, border the circular room. The one window is boarded up, but a single, broken board allows a small sliver of light to land on the otherwise dark floor. The two exits are south and down.

roomecho.desc: The tinkling of a music box can be heard playing a simple melody, from beneath one of the heavy blankets, until it slows to a stop.

room.name: The Ball-Pit
room.desc: Small, brightly coloured plastic balls fill this room to around neck-height, forcing passing students to wade through it. The floor and lower-halves of the walls are hidden from view, and the upper walls feature shiny, white tiles. A single lantern hangs from the center of the roof. There are exits to the north, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: The lantern is a rectangular prism, with clear glass in three of its four sides, and a simple bronze stand and apex. One of the glass panes has been broken; presumably a ball has hit it.

The balls that fill this room are light, and hollow, and slightly larger than a tennis ball in size. While they are all the standard solid colours that a muggle ball pit would have, they also have more distinctive patterns and shades. One ball features opal swirls, and another glitters like gold. Yet another looks like clear glass, with smoky clouds drifting across its surface.

roomecho.desc: A hurried student rushes through, knocking balls around in his wake. The lantern jerks to the side, as though frightened it would be hit.
A fresh load of balls drops suddenly from the roof, causing unsuspecting students to squeal with surprise.

room.name: Calming Corridor
room.desc: This is a cozy, inviting hall. Its pale, lavender walls are host to many round windows with warped glass. Along the sky blue ceiling are many paintings of Greek gods and goddesses. Lightning bolts race across the ceiling after Aries who dodges them with ease. Zeus, who is already upset, is annoyed by fact that Aries is enjoying himself. The floor is made of smooth pale blue stone and is a nice touch to this calming hall. The east wall has a painting attached to it of a smiling old man with fiery red eyes. Large emerald drapes held back by silver ropes mark the exits to the north and the south.

room.name: Railway Passage
room.desc: This long, stone passageway runs from north to south. The stone floor is divided lengthways by a set of train tracks that run through the room. The actual composition of the ceiling is difficult to determine, as it is dirtied by a great deal of soot. The exits to the north and the south of the room are large and round, and appear to resemble entrances to a train tunnel.
