extradesc.desc: Wooden sleepers have been embedded in the stone floor here, and appear to be getting quite old. The metal rails run across them from the north end of the room to the south. They appear to be an authentic set of train tracks.

roomecho.desc: The room suddenly rattles and shakes, as though a train were about to hurtle across the tracks any second.

The loud train's whistle gives only a second's warning before a large steam train rushes along the train tracks. Seasoned students press against the walls to get out of the way, and then carry on their conversations after the train has left the room, as though nothing unusual had happened.

room.name: The Tropical Beach
room.desc: The tightly packed trunks of palm trees line the walls of this corridor, whose floor is covered with dry, yellow sand. The ceiling shows a clear, blue sky and the green fronds of the trees are high above. It is difficult to determine exactly what substance the ceiling is made of, as it is both out of reach, and appears to be real. A briny sea breeze blows in from the eastern exit. There are exits to the north, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: The floor is covered with a thick layer of dry, yellow sand. It gets inside your clothes and grits annoyingly between your toes.
The walls here are not flat and smooth as expected, but contain many cylindrical surfaces packed tightly together, that look and feel exactly as though they were the real trunks of palm trees.

roomecho.desc: A seagull swoops down from the north, emitting a high-pitched screech. It circles the room for a few moments, searching for food scraps, before flying off.

room.name: Perpetually Dark Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is dark, very dark...

room.name: Hogwarts Top 30
room.desc: This room is an archive of the most gifted students Hogwarts has ever had. A board made of grey marble covers the south wall. The portraits, names, houses, and subjects of students are listed upon it, ranked by the highest number of NEWT's they passed with Outstanding. There are some thirty names listed on the board, with golden numbers beside them. A bright light comes from the torches set one above the other at each side of the board, with about a foot's distance to separate them. The brown carpet on the floor is soft and permanently clean, as is the board. The closest any student has come to defile this room is a red beam that occasionally spells the word GIT across a portrait of Percy Weasley. There are exits to the north, west, and east of this room.

extradesc.desc: The grey board is very carefully chiseled, so that it draws the focus on the names upon it, rather than on itself. A young, dark-haired wizard holds the top spot, followed by a forbidding-looking girl. Also remarkable are three boys occupying together the third position, Marauders Forever written beside their names, house and subjects. Percy Weasley is listed just below them. Looking at each of them in turn might reveal the details of their glory.
extradesc.keywords: marble board hall of fame archive

extradesc.desc: The boy holding the first position is handsome in an ambitious, cold way. His blue eyes stare at onlookers with a stony expression on his face, and he never speaks. He glares occasionally if students speak of muggle-related subjects. He has black robes and pride exudes from his whole being. It is as if he knows he will never be surpassed by anybody as long as Hogwarts exists. His name is Tom Marvolo Riddle and he was a Slytherin. It seems he has aced, by the looks of it, all his subjects: Defence against the Dark Arts, Charms, Transfiguration, Potions, Arithmancy, Ancient Runes, Care of Magical Creatures, Astrology, and Divination.
extradesc.keywords: 1 first top one dark haired wizard

extradesc.desc: The witch in second place is very handsome and has a vivid face, but she smiles very distantly. She is very pretty in an impressive sort of way, waves of red hair falling heavily upon her silver dress robes. She is Amelia Junona Bones, of Ravenclaw House, and she had Outstanding at Charms, Muggle Studies, Defence against the Dark Arts, Arithmancy, Transfiguration, and Ancient Runes.

The three wizards in third place are recognizable to most passers-by. One was a teacher at Hogwarts for a year and known as a werewolf, the second wizard appears as a different version of Harry Potter, and the third is the well known Sirius Black, the first man to escape from Azkaban. James Potter is portrayed in red and gold Quidditch robes, his hair upswept, and his deep-brown eyes glinting while he grins at passers-by. Sirius Black is very young and extremely handsome, with dark, wavy hair framing his roguish and charming face. Dressed in magnificent, black, dress robes, he has a smile that burns in his eyes and it is not difficult to understand what girls liked in him. Remus Jarvis Lupin looks good-natured and vivid, the twinkle in his grey eyes similar to Professor Dumbledore's. He wears his Hogwarts uniform proudly and beams upwards as he looks at his two friends. They all used to be in Gryffindor House. The three have Outstanding in the same subjects: Defence Against the Dark Arts, Charms, Transfiguration, Potions, and Arithmancy.

Percy Weasley looks his usual smug self, venturing a broad smile every now and again. His Head Boy badge catches and reflects the light of the torches. The word GIT is displayed at random intervals upon his portrait. He has Outstanding in Divination, Muggle Studies, Astrology, and Potions.

roomecho.desc: The word GIT writes itself on top of Percy's face and he scowles, trying to rub it away.
A couple of sixth-year Ravenclaw girls pass by the archive and giggle, pointing at Sirius, who winks back at them.

room.name: The Room of Freedom
room.desc: The dazzling and welcoming bright light of four torches gives this chamber a feeling of profound joy. A single, marble statue stands in the middle of the room, representing a witch. Dressed in robes which seem to fly behind her, repelled by a fierce wind, she has her arms spread sideways, palms up. In her left hand, she holds a Remembrall, while in her right, there is a white dove, ready to take its leave. The soft and passionate tunes of a Celtic song reverberate off the stone walls covered in blinding white curtains. There are exits to the east and west of this chamber.

extradesc.desc: . The statue in the middle of the room represents a woman. The shape of her slender legs is barely distinguishable beneath her robes, but she is clearly dancing. She is pretty, with her eyes open and her lips parted in a smile of fierce freedom and happiness. She faces the northern wall where golden letters spell the ardent message: "Forgive, Live, and do not Forget!" The elegant signature below reads Cassiopeia Elena Dumbledore.

roomecho.desc: The wild Celtic tunes that echo around the sculpture of the dancing woman scream a passionate climax. In the flickering torchlight, the woman's eyes seem to come to life, for just a moment. The curtains on the walls rustle gently.

room.name: Ill-Fated Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is dark and gloomy. There are no windows, just a small torch on the wall. The light from this torch is reflected by a broken mirror hung at an angle on the wall. The only other thing hanging on the wall is an oil painting showing a large black dog. It has reddish eyes and a snarl on its face. The walls are made of a dark, rough stone. They are cracked and gaps have been filled in. The floor is made of the same stone laid out in an uneven number of rows, thirteen to be exact. The ceiling, also of the dark stone, has been repaired similarly as the walls, except for a small patch near the wall Underneath this patch a ladder stands. There are exits from this corridor to the north, south, and west.

extradesc.desc: This mirror has been broken into many pieces.
A painting hanging on the wall shows a huge black dog. On the frame is a plaque which says, "The Grim" By Katarina Carodonna
A ladder is standing under a part of the ceiling under construction.

roomecho.desc: A black cat slinks in and crosses the room before disappearing out the other way.

room.name: The Black Way
room.desc: This black corridor is surprisingly well lit, considering that it's, well, black. The floor is a polished, black marble, and the walls have been covered with black wallpaper. Even the plaster ceiling has been painted black. The only items of colour are the bronze candlestick holders on either side of the walls, holding wide black candles that both light the room, and cast eerie shadows to flicker and dance across the walls.

extradesc.desc: There are four bronze, candlestick holders here, attached to the walls. They are all quite broad, and hold wide, black candles. The holders themselves are in the shape of a small animal, holding up the candle. The four animals are a lion, rearing on its hind legs as though about to battle; an eagle, its wings spread in flight; a badger, its nose down and its front paws in a digging pose; and a coiled serpent, its head erect, as though ready to fight.

room.name: Pan's Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is a labyrinth of sharp, white rocks. There is no clear path visible, but just above the silhouette of a creature looms, catching the clear daylight coming through the clear, medium-sized, square windows. The shadows this sculpture casts upon the rocks are those of a horned man, holding a shepherd's crook, a pipe, and a crown of tree needles. Its legs finish not in feet, but in goat hooves. The fresh scent of pine fills this room and there is something cheerful and wild in the atmosphere. There are exits to the east and to the west of this room.

extradesc.desc: The sculpture represents a satyr, a creature that has the torso of a man and the flanks, tail, and hooves of a goat. This particular satyr looks mischievous and wild, its beard ruffled in a non-existent. Its skin is wrinkled, but its eyes are laughing. On his head there is a crown of pine needles and there are two goat horns on its otherwise human forehead. It is holding a shepherd's crook in its left hand, and its hooves rest against a particularly sharp boulder.

roomecho.desc: A class of students enters from the west. A gruff-looking teacher explains to the pupils, who are all Ravenclaws, what a satyr is. He identifies this particular satyr as Pan, the son of the Greek god Hermes and the woman Penelope, who later married Odysseus. The teacher mentions that Pan was a companion of Dionysus and is a god of fertility. A couple of female students giggle at this.

The echoes of a Greek, happy tune is heard, faint like a memory. The steady air vibrates with the richness of the sounds and even the statue of Pan looks as if listening. The music dies away in a few moments.

room.name: The Window Corridor
room.desc: This three-way intersection is pleasant and well lit, due mostly to the large window on the eastern wall, that lets in ample light. The walls and floor are made from simple stone, but the floor is covered in a cheerful, yellow rug that complements the natural light from the window. Exits are to the north, west, and south.

extradesc.desc: An unusually large window sits in the eastern wall, with a cheerful, yellow, wooden frame. No curtain embellishes the window, which lights the room with ample natural light. The view from the window is breathtaking; the vast forest spreads out before you, ancient trees appearing dwarfed because the view is from such a height.

room.name: Corridor
room.desc: A cold, shadowy corridor stretches to the north and south here. Two torches attached to the eastern wall light the way; they are strangely separated by a blank stretch of wall. Opposite this blank stretch of wall stands a moth-eaten tapestry. Exits lead north and south.

extradesc.desc: This old tapestry commemorates Barnabas the Barmy's memorable last moments, as he attempts to teach ballet to a group of trolls. Barnabas stands in the center, dressed in a black leotard, with white tights and ballet shoes. He is surrounded by a number of brutish, clumsy trolls, who seem intent on clubbing him. A pile of oversized pink tutus lies to the side, abandoned, as does a very large barre, seemingly constructed from the trunk of a pine.

room.name: Man-Sized Vase
room.desc: This room is canon :)

room.name: The Hall of the Animagi
room.desc: . This three-way corridor is rather small. The candelabrum hanging from the ceiling sheds some light on the red carpet that covers the floor. The only wall which does not open into a hallway is the southern wall. A painting, framed in silver, is hanging in the middle of this wall. On either side, there are tapestries depicting the transformation of wizards and witches into animals. There are exits to the north, east, and west of this chamber.

extradesc.desc: The picture on the south wall shows a tiny and dazed-looking wizard constantly on the move. The man is in his late sixties, dressed in a black robe, with his hat turned back to front. He wears an enlarged handkerchief instead of a sash and he's paired a dragon-hide boot with a fine 1920's style shoe. He has an unusually thin wand, which he uses to scratch his back occasionally. He keeps turning into a small sparrow and back into a human. A caption beneath the paining says: "Alexander Merlin Caesar Dolphungus, Transfiguration Professor at Hogwarts 1911-1925. Professor Dolphungus is the author of many studies on Animagi. His accident in 1925 determined his good friend Rudyard Trollope to write upon his tomb: 'Dear, often-confused friend. He only realized too late that being a sparrow in a garden full of cats might be dangerous. Rest in peace! '"
The tapestries on the southern wall are quite old and show Animagi turning into toads, cats, and wolves. These seemed to be the preferred shapes of the magic population in the Middle-Ages.

roomecho.desc: With a great whooshing sound, the wizard in the painting transforms into a tiny sparrow. A moment later, he is in human form again.

room.name: Wendolin's Hallway
room.desc: This wide hallway appears to be almost empty, as though its furniture has still to arrive. The handsome marble floor is covered in part by a single royal blue rug. An elegant golden candelabra hangs from the high ceiling. The only other source of light seems to be coming from a fire that blazes in the sole painting that hangs on the northern wall. You see exits leading to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: This painting depicts a medieval witch burning. An angry mob of peasants is yelling unintelligibly as they watch a fire flicker and crackle around a middle-aged woman who appears to be tied to a wooden stake. There is a small bronze plaque underneath the painting.
The flames, giving a horrific effect, light the woman's face fiercely. Yet the woman herself does not appear frightened, or in pain; she actually seems to be giggling!
The small, bronze plaque identifies the woman in the painting as 'Wendolin the Weird'.

roomecho.desc: The fire in the painting flares higher than normal, causing heat to radiate through the room.
A giggle is heard coming from the painting on the northern wall.
The floor vibrates suddenly as a commotion can be heard from the western passageway.

room.name: Portrait Passage
room.desc: Wide and inviting, the walls of this hall are decked with hundreds of portraits deep in conversation. Not even one of the portraits is similar in size or shape. Some of them are as large as a tapestry, while others are no bigger than Tom Riddle's diary. The deafening chatter from the portraits makes the floor rumble. Along the handsome marble floor, there are several spacious area rugs with vibrant, almost gaudy colors. Two large spiral cut shrubs stand guard on either side of this corridors two exits to the west and to the east.

room.name: Kaleidoscope Passage
room.desc: The floor is highly polished with the appearance of an oil slick. Magnificent spectra of color are displayed as the floor swirls magically. The sunlight fromt he numerous windows reflects off of the floor onto the walls displaying a very dynamic kaleidoscope of colors. A large brass chandalier spins slowly high above. Beyond the eastern window the corridor continues onward. A murmer can we heard to the west through the archway.

room.name: Dark Forest Trophy Hall
room.desc: The stone walls are adorned with many rather gruesome animals heads, mounted on plaques. Some resemble non-magical creatures, while others look like a grotesque mix of some very foul things. Along the walls, between the plaques, is a multitude of round porthole windows that cast spotlights of sun around the area. The floor is a pale white stone with spots of black mold here and there giving the floor a very dirty look. On the east and west ends of this corridor are impressive oak archways. Each archway is inscribed with the words, "The Beasts of the Dark Forest", in gothic lettering.

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Lachlan the Lanky
room.desc: Torches attached to the walls, which flicker and flare occasionally, cast shadows over this passageway. The walls and floor are made from stone, and the roof is high and vaulted, causing footsteps to reverberate around this chillingly cold corridor. The stale, mildewed air gives way to a hint of fresh air to the east, where rogue tuffs of grass can be seen poking their way into the room. To the west, a busier intersection can be heard. A tall, stone, statue stands here.

extradesc.desc: A tall stone statue of a young man stands here. Student lore identifies the man as Lachlan the Lanky, and he's certainly too tall for his girth; he looks like a teenager who's just had a growth spurt. His face, however, is handsome; his mouth looks serious, but his eyes betray a mischievous twinkle. Wearing a simple tunic, his right hand is outstretched, with wand at the ready, while over his left shoulder he carries a small bag, ready for a long journey.

roomecho.desc: Lachlan drops his bag for a moment, and rubs his left arm, before regaining his usual pose.

room.name: Overgrown Garden
room.desc: The floor of this hallway is a thick, green grass two feet high, and the walls are high, green hedges, too tall to see the top of. Floating above is a glowing sphere that fills the room with a warm, natural light. Beside the northern wall, directly opposite the corridor's southern exit, sits a gigantic mushroom, as large as a small table. There are exits to the east, west, and south, although the hedges beside the eastern exit have thick, evil-looking thorns growing out of them.

extradesc.desc: The yellow sphere is glowing so brightly that it hurts your eyes to look at it.
The mushroom is huge and looks as though it could easily be used as a table. Its cap is gently curved, and a pale fleshy-pink in colour. The underside of the cap features pale-yellow gills.

These nasty-looking thorns protruding from the hedge indicate that the room to the east might not be the friendliest of places. A small scrap of black fabric is stuck on one thorn, indicating that students should be careful with their robes when passing here.

roomecho.desc: A gigantic blue butterfly, at least a foot long, gently flits down and rests briefly on the gigantic mushroom, before flying away. Its wings create a gentle breeze.

room.name: Drip Drop Passage
room.desc: In this unwelcoming compacted hallway, there is little light to distinguish the end. What minute lighting there is, shines dimly through the large, red, stained glass windows that proceed to the end of the hall. Its dreary, isolated, and damp. The gray stone walls outline the depressing suits of armor that seem to protect the almost endless hallway. The battered red rug that runs along the stone floor is tattered and fringed. Some of its delicate red and black stitching has frayed. The ceiling has clear droplets of water dripping down. Some trickle swiftly down the wall to make insignificant puddles on the cold floor. The soothing drops are the only eerie noise audible in the hallway. A slight breeze passes though the corridor from the west entrance, and leads to a large threatening archway to the east.

room.name: Watchful Witch's Corridor
room.desc: The most striking feature of this corridor is the large statue in the centre. It depicts a tall, old witch in flowing robes. Her face is wrinkled and wise, and she wears a serene expression on her face. She has sharp grey eyes, the kind that seems to take in everything without looking. Her long grey hair hangs loosely from underneath her pointed wizard's hat. The corridor which she presides over has a floor and walls made of grey stone, the blocks stacked one on top of each other in an orderly pattern. Several torches in brackets light up this corridor. The ceiling is high, vaulted, and also made of the grey stone. There are exits to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: This statue shows a tall witch. Underneath her is an inscription, which says, 'The Watchful Witch' 'She who sees all knows all'

room.name: SECOND DRAFT Moonlit Stairwell
room.desc: Silver moonbeams, originating from a suspended orb, slip down the marble staircase, and cast an eerie, silver light over the otherwise dark room. The floor of this narrow stairwell, like the staircase itself, is a cold, white marble, and the walls are wooden panels. The room is quiet and still, except for the occasional howl that comes from the painting on the southern wall, filling the room with an evil chill. The passageway to the north is dark and shadowy, while a passage off to the west gives the glimpse of a large statue. A third exit leads down the marble stairs.

extradesc.desc: This painting, in a silver frame, depicts a moonlit scene. In the forefront, at the edge of a dense forest, a middle-aged monk kneels. His grey habit covers a rotund frame, held together at the waist by a simple, white rope belt, with three knots in it. His tonsured head is bare, and attracts the light of the full moon. The monk seems to be having a private conversation with a wolf. Behind them, a break in the trees shows a village in a clearing.

roomecho.desc: A chilling howl fills the room, originating from the painting on the southern wall.

room.name: Darkness
room.desc: This room attracts darkness, much like black holes do. While there are three pairs of torches on the eastern wall, their light does not touch the centre of the room. Instead, the faint, warm flicker shows that the darkness itself is a cylindrical whirlwind in the middle of the room. A stone path is visible near the walls. It looks to be the only safe path to be taken, in order to avoid the hurricane of darkness. The flat ceiling is low enough to give the impression of a sinister closet. There are no portraits to brighten the atmosphere s or distract one's attention. Any sounds, however distant, are drawn into the darkness that dominates the chamber. The warmth, however, is kept outside, as if it were unholy. There are exits west, south and north of this room.

extradesc.desc: The darkness in this chamber is not static. In fact, when moving close to it, one can feel the slight tug as the hurricane of Nothingness tries to absorb anything within its reach. The stone pathways around it are immune to this effect, however. At the base of the cylinder of darkness, there are a few letters written in stone, apparently meditations of a bored student: "Much like hatred, Darkness keeps growing. To be one with the Darkness is to keep growing. T. M. Riddle" A reply follows after the signature, completing a circle at the base of the Darkness. The message, in a smoother handwriting, reads: "This Darkness cannot stand warmth. It can be defeated. It grows and it shrinks back in an everlasting prison. L. Evans"

roomecho.desc: A Slytherin gang sneaks into the room from the north. They pause for a moment, assessing the situation, then take the fastest route out, to the west.

The darkness stirs and expands as if about to explode. Then it shrinks back furtively, as if awaiting a victim unaware of its powers. An inscription is visible where the darkness was a few moments before.

room.name: The Flower's Hall
room.desc: A brilliant, crystal chandelier hovers above the center of this room. Its many lit candles cast light on the elegant wooden paneling of the walls. An opulent, glittering, gold carpet flows from the north to the south, and branches off to another exit to the east. Against the west wall is the only plain object in the room, a simple wooden table. The table, however, holds a single crystal vase, that holds a single flower. Exits are found to the north, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: A small, wooden, end table stands here. Its upper surface is octagonal, and a single leg that branches into four small, curved legs about six inches from the floor supports it. The table seems quite nice and rather functional, but the most interesting thing about it seems to be the contents of the vase that it supports.

A crystal vase stands on a small wooden table. It is round, and tapers elegantly at the neck, before expanding again to the rim. It has a bubbling appearance, as though it were formed by a thousand tears solidified. It holds a single flower.

The flower standing in the crystal vase seems to be quite ordinary, but confused. One moment a bright, yellow daisy looks out at you; the next, it is a solemn, white rose. It changes again and again, to a discrete tulip, a graceful calla lily, and then a shaggy, red bottlebrush. The flower continues changing, though, stopping at each transformation for only a few seconds, seemingly never the same flower twice.

room.name: Corner Corridor
room.desc: Heavy, wooden columns support the stone walls of this dark, shadowy passage. A single candle lights the room, but has very nearly burnt itself out. The uneven stone floor is cold to the touch, and causes a loud clatter whenever anybody takes a step. A dark portrait is attached to the northern wall. There are exits to the west and south.

extradesc.desc: This portrait does not move like the other magical portraits in the castle. It depicts a man, with dark, brown hair, in his mid-thirties. His arms are folded in front of his chest, and he stares out at you without even the hint of a smile on his face. His only unusual feature is his eyes.
The man's eyes are a sinister, dark brown, and they seem to follow you wherever you go.

roomecho.desc: A faint sneeze is heard; it seems to be coming from behind the portrait on the northern wall.

room.name: Dark, Dank Corridor
room.desc: A chilled breeze blows through this dark, dank corridor. Unrecognisable shapes are formed in the shadowy darkness by the light from the three adjacent rooms. A stench wafts through the room; it smells as though a rotting corpse were nearby. Silvery graffiti glistens on the southern wall. The only exits are to the north, east, and west.

extradesc.desc: Silver graffiti can be seen on the southern wall of this corridor, glistening brightly in the otherwise dark room. At first glance it looks to be a simple act of vandalism, but a closer examination reveals that the spidery script is archaic, and impossible to decipher.

roomecho.desc: A drop of water hits the floor with a loud "Plonk!"

room.name: The Forbidden
room.desc: The faint rustle of thin curtains catches the ear as one enters this corridor. The large windows are very old, without proper wooden frames, and a permanent breeze squeezes through the space between glass and stone. During the day, this corridor is illuminated by warm sunlight, while the two torches depicted in the two paintings on the north side give out a chilling glow after sunset. The acute absence of any other furniture or sound within this corridor is stressed by the large stones lined on the floor. It looks as if even the architect was afraid of the emptiness that simply radiates from this chamber, and finished it in a hurry. There are exits to the south and to the west of the passage.

extradesc.desc: The two paintings are set next to one another on the northern wall, with only bare stone to separate them. Towards the eastern wall, the two blue torches illuminate a man, clad from head to foot in black. Some ten feet west of it, a young girl stares blankly at passers-by, her hands pressed tightly against her chest. Looking at either of them will reveal more.
extradesc.keywords: painting paintings portrait portraits picture pictures

extradesc.desc: The man in this painting is tall and shows a hint of poise, even if some sort of hidden illness seems to be consuming him. His eyes are dark and appear as if burning from within. His gaunt appearance is enhanced by the mane of black hair contrasting with his very pale skin. The fingers of his right hand shiver slightly as they grasp the neck of a small vial. His knuckles and nails look unnaturally dark, as if rotten. He shakes slightly as he fights permanently the urge to drink from the vial. Beneath this portrait there is only a small inscription, written in silver upon black: "The blood of unicorn keeps you alive, but it is a cursed life. You have slain a drop of purity, and so your own soul is claimed instead."

The slender, blond-haired, young girl in this picture is beautiful. Her dress is made in 19th-century fashion and it hugs her upper body closely, only to bloom amply as it meets her hips. The woman stares without expression at the hallway, and her eyes do not blink. There is a quiet scream in her being, while her palms press against her upper chest. Her only movements are painful, deep breaths. The small caption beneath her feet reads is written in gold upon red. It reads: "To take a life is to take your own. Whether by despair or by guilt, you suffer more than the one you have killed."

roomecho.desc: The curtain rustles softly. The man in the portrait twitches, as if to fight the urge to drink from the vial he holds in his right hand.

room.name: Greek Mural Corridor
room.desc: This corridor's walls are painted a pale white colour. The floor is of a mossy green marble, a lovely contrast to the creamy walls. The ceiling is the same shade of white as the walls, with artistic brush strokes making loops and swirls across it. Tall windows allow great amounts of light through their sparkling panes. There are two of them side by side on the south wall. On the opposite wall a mural has been painted. It depicts an ancient Greek village. One can see the agora, stadium, and temples from the overhead view this mural offers. This village must be on the coast, for there are sailing ships in the distance. This mural goes wall to wall, reaching right into the corners. There are exits to the east and west.

room.name: The Glass-Floored Room
room.desc: Clear glass forms the floor of this passageway, showing a very long drop that would make the most fearless student quiver. The walls and ceiling are made of shiny mirrors, that both reflect the drop, and anyone who occupies this room. Every surface of this room is smooth, and cool to the touch. The walls themselves glow very slightly, just enough to light the way. There are exits to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: Your reflection smiles and waves back at you, and then sticks its tongue out, completely independent of any action on your part.
extradesc.keywords: mirror mirrors wall walls ceiling reflection

extradesc.desc: The floor itself is cold, clear, and smooth. Care should be taken to not slip here. The image shown through the clear glass is that of a sheer drop; the drop is so steep, that there is no end in sight. The drop merely continues on to a stark, deep darkness.

room.name: The Blue Hall
room.desc: Blue fills this room in many shades and forms. A brilliant blue bubble floats in the air, as suspended water; it glows, lighting the room with a murky blue glow. The ceiling here glows an eerie blue and it is impossible to determine whether it is painted blue or whether it is a white ceiling that merely reflects the light from the bubble. The floor is a blue mosaic, made from thousands of tiny gems of every shade of blue imaginable. The walls here have a pale blue background, with every other shade of blue sponge painted. The shades of the walls seem to be organised efficiently, with the darkest midnight blue starting at the western exit, and the palest sky blue (the shade found closest to the horizon on a sunny day) at the eastern exit. There are three exits here to the west, east, and south.

extradesc.desc: This small bubble, of about 10 inches in diameter, hovers in the air in the centre of the room, just out of reach. It appears to be made of a watery liquid and is deep blue in colour. It occasionally rolls around on its axis, bobbing up and down a little, as though it were affected by a slight breeze. Light seems to come from an indiscernible source deep within the sphere, lighting the room.

room.name: Pendulum junction
room.desc: At the intersection of four passes, a brass pendulum swings lazily along the perimeter of the white walls forming a circular room. Upon closer examination, the polished glass ball at the end is actually a three-foot wide model of the celestial globe, with the heavenly bodies whirring in their orbits. It is attached to the vaulted ceiling by a long brass tube, and as it sweeps around the room, obsidian dominoes fall to the ground. But after a few seconds, they each rise once more, and this cycle continues for all eternity. To the north, south, east, and west, arched doorways lead to other halls.

roomecho.desc: A tumbling domino tinkles like a glass windchime as it strikes the floor.
The path of the pendulum slows as it prepares to swing in the opposite direction.

room.name: A Pleasant Corridor
room.desc: This north-south corridor is rather pleasant and homey. A fresh, natural breeze wafts through the room, bringing with it the scent of a warm Summer's day. Polished-wood floors and bright yellow wallpapered walls are illuminated merrily by candles on either side of the passage. While the floors are clean, they are also worn, as though many students have walked this way before. A painting of a pig hangs, skewed, on the western wall. There are exits to the north and south.

extradesc.desc: The painting depicts a typical, farmyard pig rolling about in mud. Rather than squealing happily, it appears morose, as though it were merely passing the time. It looks at you and sighs. "There were four of us once. My older brothers all decided to go out into the world and build their own houses, but as the runt, I was left behind. I wonder whatever happened to them?"

roomecho.desc: The pig snorts dejectedly.

room.name: Shabby Corridor
room.desc: The corridor is in need of serious repair. Crumbling columns hold up a fractured, stained ceiling. Beige paint flakes and chips off of the dented, scratched walls. The floor is bare, with dirt filling the cracks between the slabs of rough sandstone. One small window allows in a little light from the cracked, filthy panes. A rusty bracket holds a sputtering torch, which barely lights up the corridor. There is a rectangular outline on the wall of where a painting might have hung as the paint there is less faded than the surrounding shade. There are exits to the north and east.

roomecho.desc: The torch flickers and for a moment the corridor is in total darkness.

room.name: The Sock Room
room.desc: Thousands of brightly coloured, woolen socks are strewn around this corner passageway. The walls, floor, and ceiling are all completely covered by the socks, which seem to be so varied it is impossible to find a matching pair. Several mounds of odd socks have been formed against the walls, making soft cushions. There are exits to the west and south.

roomecho.desc: A house-elf pokes his head in from the south, sees the socks and gives a squeal of fright, before hastily retreating.

room.name: The Newsprint Room
room.desc: The walls here have a solid, white background, with tiny, black newsprint all over it, so that from a distance it would appear to be grey. The words are changing constantly, and while they occasionally hover in a certain configuration for a moment or two, they rarely stay still long enough for the room's occupants to make sense of their message. There are exits to the east, south, and west.

extradesc.desc: The print is the same size and font that you would find in a normal, muggle newspaper. While it has been set in the standard columned configuration, the columns are in disarray, as though they belong to different pages that have been thrown haphazardly together. The text is changing so quickly that it could easily make someone feel dizzy.

room.name: Cream-coloured room
room.desc: This cream-coloured room is bright and airy. The white, plaster ceiling has a delicate image embedded in it, and the walls have been painted a plain off-white colour. The north and west walls each have a large, open window, with white frames that let in ample air and light. The cream-coloured woolen carpet has mud tracks through the center of it, as though many careless students have trekked through here. There is a single painting on the eastern wall, beside an exit. Exits are to the east and south.

extradesc.desc: This painting shows a large, black and white cow meandering about a green meadow, happily chewing her cud. In the background an old, ramshackle shed leans precariously against an aging oak.
This window frames a view of grey, misty mountains that topple precariously above a distant village.
The Hogwarts grounds stretch out below you. The only moving objects are a couple of owls, hurtling towards the school carrying letters.

room.name: Sparkling Cave Corridor
room.desc: This corridor is made of a strange, shiny stone. The walls, floor and even ceiling are made of the rock, which has been cut into many miniscule facets, which sparkle in light. The light scattered from the floor, created by candles in nooks in the wall, illuminates small golden veins running through the dark, shining stone. The veins appeared to have run, as small pools of gold have formed on the floor. From one wall protrudes a gigantic gem. Pale pink, cloudless, and smooth, the rose coloured stone sits near the northern exit. There is another exit to the west.

room.name: Patroness Hall
room.desc: The hallway is spacious and gently slopes upward. To the north is the door leading nearer the castle's ramparts, and the painting of a noble-born woman-child hangs above. Robed in pale blue, she also bears a wizard hat in the same colour. A series of small circular openings high on the western wall allow the sunlight to pool in white-gold patches on the glossy floorboards. From them, leafy vines probe inside, their tender tips just barely visible when looking up. There is no glass in the windows, and a cool breeze blows through them during summer and winter alike. On the opposite wall, the light patterns also dance. Farther to the east, the hall is extended backwards and downwards.

extradesc.desc: The young woman paces along the balcony, loose chestnut locks contrasting dramatically with the night sky. Her features are composed and reflect the breeding of her ancestors, not her youthful age.

roomecho.desc: Gracefully, the woman inclines her head in greeting.

room.name: Passage of leaves
room.desc: Bleach white walls and slanted ceilings belie the sense of calm that emanates from this corridor. Along the western wall, round windows restore an aura of quiet stability by opening the hallway to light and air. Curling tendrils of ivy cascade from the windows. The floor, made of russet and gold wood, is cushioned by an etched pattern of oak leaves, which rustle softly despite that they are simply carvings on a board. To the north is a small door, and to the south, the same.

extradesc.desc: On the ground, the oak leaves overlap in a scattered manner, as if having fluttered from the canopy of an ancient forest.
extradesc.keywords: etched oak leaves on the floor

roomecho.desc: Underfoot, the engraved leaves glide smoothly over one another.

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: The foot of the stairs marks the start of a winding granite spiral. Each step is fairly even, although the mortar is chipped and stained between individual blocks of stone. A strip of stone protrudes from the curving wall, and it serves as a primitive railing for those dizzied by the height. Above the railings, an unidentified liquid has dripped down from the highest levels, simultaneously drying into clear streams of lava frozen in time. Darkness veils the stairs as they ascend farther up the tower. A gaping trapdoor off to the side opens to the lower levels. To the south is a plain door made of wood from Hogwart's own forests.

roomecho.desc: A faint breeze carrying an odd scent rushes through the tower.

room.name: Gryffindor Common Room
room.desc: This large, circular common room exudes a warm and cosy atmosphere. From the large hearths to the soft, thick carpeting underfoot, the whole chamber seems to envelop the occupants with a reassuring embrace. Gold and scarlet banners and throws fill the room with proud Gryffindor House colours. One particularly large banner hangs over the round entrance to honour Godric Gryffindor, the brave house founder. A glowing fire crackles by the far wall, surrounded by clusters of large, squashy, crimson armchairs. Tucked under the several small, lopsided, oak tables that cover the rest of the common room, sit a variety of well-padded, orange stools. Towards the back of the common room are two large, iron-braced oak doors leading up to the dormitories. The door to the north bears the gilded words, "Girls Only", while to the south, a small wooden sign with "Boys" daubed across it hangs from the doorknob.

roomecho.desc: The fire crackles unexpectedly from the side of the room.
There are sudden, harsh sounds of shuffling papers from the students working at the tables.

room.name: Pottery Room
room.desc: Candles along the perimeter of this hexagonal room cast warm hues. The walls are covered with elegant tapestries smothered in dust. Toward the back of the room are several, tall, wooden shelves full of clay objects. Pots, pans, cups, plates, figurines, and other clay objects line the shelves. Toward the front of the room is a large metallic oven. The oven gives off an immense amount of heat that will create beautiful pieces of artwork. When the door is opened it reveals liquid clay boiling at the bottom of the oven. Exits are to the north and the south.

extradesc.desc: Numerous clay pots lay on the checkered cobblestone floor. These pots come in all shapes and sizes. Tall, fat, textured, broken, hard, soft, yet all are masterpieces. An original Hogwarts Masterpiece.
The pottery shelves are years old. Countless cracks run through each shelf. The dark cedar wood of the shelves remains fully secure and stable.

roomecho.desc: Outside the room, voices of other students drift past.
A cheerful student sticks his textured clay bowl into the oven, smiles, and runs back over to the potting wheel to create another masterpiece.

room.name: Observation Balcony
room.desc: This is the pinnacle of the great astronomy tower, bared to the ever changing sky. Smooth, wide flagstones cover the entire floor, inlaid with thousands of tiny stars made of gold, the lines and arcs of their celestial movements inscribed in silver. The walls of the tower are pitted and covered in lichen from centuries of exposure to the elements. Along the parapet stand several weathered oak booths, each with an ornate brass telescope and tripod inside, ready to cast a ruinous eye to the heavens. The view from the tower is breathtaking, the far reaching grounds of Hogwarts lay wide below, serene yet foreboding. The only exit, for those incapable of flight, is down the broad stone stairwell.

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: This level of the tower features a small balcony jutting off the edge of the stairs. A black metal forms its flooring and railings, while wrought iron lilies adorn the corners. In the overhanging eaves, two swallows have plastered together a nest, and their sleek feathers are sparsely strewn on the balcony. Perched on the farthest edge of the wall is an enormous lantern, lit only during the coldest days of winter. The winding staircase continues upwards and downwards.

roomecho.desc: The nestling swallows open their beaks in shrill, surprisingly loud, cries as the nest sways.

room.name: West Tower
room.desc: The stairs abruptly end at a stone platform, in a small chamber with barely enough height to accomdate a tall student. A bookshelf at one end of the room is stocked with various sacks, bottles, jars, flasks, and other containers. Otherwise, there is nothing else. The air has a musty scent as there are no windows, and the thick stone walls effectively contain the heat. Next to the bookshelf, a frayed rope ladder dangles from the ceiling, where it then leads to the owlery.

roomecho.desc: Gentle hoots float into the room from the level above.

room.name: Owlery
room.desc: The owlery is an extension of the West Tower, its circular walls made of stone and broken by three gaps spanning ceiling to floor. These serve as full-length windows for the incoming and departing owls. Hundreds of them perch on weathered beams radiating inward from the walls; they are a mottled mural of grey, brown, and black, with the occasional splash of pure white. On the floor feathers, droppings, and broken rodent carcasses lie scattered in the thick straw bedding. The straw aids in concealing the sharp odour of the room, as well as provide an excuse to leave the owlery untended for several days at a time. The only exit is the trapdoor, with a rope ladder leading down to a lower level of the tower.

extradesc.desc: The owl grips its perch with long talons and glares at you before going back to sleep.

roomecho.desc: Suddenly a gust of cold wind slices through the room from the open windows, and the sleeping owls ruffle their feathers indignantly.
Opening a great orange eye, an owl flaps its wings and disappears silently outside.

room.name: Broom Cupboard
room.desc: A dark, small room, this broom cupboard holds the Cleansweep five broomsticks that Madam Hooch uses for first-year flight lessons. Although nearly always locked, it is kept perfectly clean. The brooms hang on the wall in special, plastic cases. Boxes containing broom polishers and twigs are beneath each case. Various other tools used in broomcare are placed in a large box on the eastern side of the room. There are no torches inside, and the only light source is a small opening on the north side of the room, no larger than a Bludger, carefully covered by a window. Any birds that come that way are repelled by an Imperturbable Charm. The only way out of this room is to the south.

extradesc.desc: The brooms, in their plastic cases, line the north wall, with four rows of ten brooms each. They are very well cared-for, but old. There are scratches on some of the handles, and two or three brooms appear to have the end-twigs swept off to one side.
extradesc.keywords: broomstick broomsticks broom brooms Cleansweep Cleansweeps

roomecho.desc: With a clunking noise, two or three regular brooms jump out of the toolbox on the eastern side of the room. They sweep the room in earnest for a few moments, kicking a small mouse in the process. After the room is cleaned, they jump back into their box and remain still.

room.name: Divination Residence
room.desc: Two shawl-covered lamps dimly light the large room. A medium sized bed sits on a brass bedstand in the eastern corner of the room, directly opposing a large domed window. A table is positioned in the middle of the residence, and on top of it lies a mistly glass ball. The wooden walls are covered in shelves that hold divination books and other items that are said to help unfog the future. A trunk at the end of the bed is bubbling over with shawls, beads, and cloaks in various shades of purple and blue. A fireplace on the south wall remains lit night a day but the incensed smoke that wafts from it does not let any light through.

extradesc.desc: The old, battered trunk is a family heirloom, but otherwise isn't worth much. It's only signifying feature is the rather small carving on the top that etches out an ornate 'T'. Moth eaten cloaks and shawls fill it to bursting, and on the floor surrounding it are large beaded necklaces.

roomecho.desc: The fire's stifled crackling resounds through the silence of the room.
